12.description: Off the beaten path. Tasty empanadas can be found here. A great assortment of South American beers and wines is a major plus. Support this place, it's family owned!!!

3.description: cute little deli with tasty little treats and wine

1.description: Lived in Argentina for 10 years (my second nationality) and after not visiting it for the last 3 years, I was very happy of finding this place in Chicago and all (or almost all) the goodies I liked to eat when I was there!!! This place is almost a travel back in the past, an authentic "casa de la nostalgia"! Mario is super helpful with his clients. Will be back for more empanadas :)

2.description: If you don't come here for the empanadas (and you should be) you'd probably come for the alcohol as it's the first thing you notice when you walk through the door.I came here after seeing the other reviews of the Deli and because of my love of empanadas.  They have them here in a variety of sweet and savory flavors.  The day I stopped in they had spinach, mushroom, ham & cheese, chicken, ground beef, cheese & onion, and on the sweet side quince, sweet potato, and caramel.As much as I wanted to try them all I decided to "just" go with spinach, mushroom, ham & cheese, chicken and the quince for dessert.  The crust on the savory empanadas were crispy, flaky and buttery.  All of the fillings were super flavorful.  I'm only a recent convert to mushroom-eating, and the mushroom empanada was my favorite.  I think it was the most flavorful of all of the ones I ate and I actually forgot that I was actually eating mushrooms!  The quince empanada had a little thicker/harder shell, and had a quince jelly-like filling.  It was very heavy but pretty good.  Not too sweet.At a little less than $2 a pop, they're the perfect snack.

9.description: The owner was so sweet! We made it just 3 minutes before closing, but he was eager to help me get my empanadas and was so friendly I just wanted to give him a hug. I ended up taking the ham & cheese, chicken, and ground beef. I thought the chicken was okay, but let me say the ground beef was DEELISH. And the ham and cheese? PARTY IN YOUR MOUTH!Absolutely fantastic. I can't wait to go back for more. The store is surprisingly pleasant and welcoming. It has just about everything, from empanadas to wine & liquor to bags of chips. Stop by... you won't regret it!

10.description: Great empanadas! Can't wait to go back.

13.description: An excellent little store.  Solid wine and beer selection, even better yerba mate options.  The best part, though, is the owner, who is both friendly and helpful.  Only bought yerba mate today, but definitely plan to go back and check out everything the place has to offer.

16.description: FANTASTIC. This place is amazing. All sorts of Argentinian and S. American delights. If you're a Yerba Mate fan, as we are - there are dozens of varieties, of GIANT bags of the stuff. Bombillas, gourds - accessories too. They have Argentine soccer stuff, food, EMPANADAS, groceries and . . . WINE. Delicious wine from Argentina (duh.), Chile, Uruguay and all over S. America - from around $4.99 (MY price point!) and above. The staff is v. friendly - believe it is family owned - and so enthusiastic about their Argentinian culture and country. A real GEM!

6.description: My on again-off again residence in Argentina over the last few years means that I'm often on the hunt for things one simply cannot acquire at your run of the mill "Latino" market in the States. I was rather pleased at the selection of goods available at this shop- but a little less enthused when I realized several of the items I'd purchased were well past their "best if used by" dates.Still, it's the only place I've been able to find Gancia- and for that I approve!

15.description: Great Argentinian/S. American deli. Was recently in Argentina and the empanadas and alfajores from here were as good as they were in Argentina! Great selection of mate and also have Quilmes beer (hard to find).  A good find to get your Argentine fix!

0.description: I ordered La Saltena empanada wrappers, tapas today.  They have great variety.  I am so happy they have them in stock. The are the best brand to make your empanadas perfect and flaky.  It is all in the dough!Thank you, Mario

5.description: Such a great experience!  After returning from Argentina 3 weeks ago stepping into this store was like stepping back into the little wine stores/delis in Recoleta.  Mario was a huge help in wine selection, recommending some products to assist in some Argentinian recipes... and the empanadas and alfajores were delicious!  Can't wait to come back.

11.description: I picked up a few dozen empanadas for a party last night. The spinach ones seemed to be people's favorite, and they were mine too. The mushroom ones were good too, and the ham and cheese one disappeared from the tray. I'd like to try more, but I live nowhere near this place. If I happen to be passing by, I will stop in for more empanadas and maybe try some of the other products. The price was pretty good at $21/dozen. There is no ostentation at this place. It carries a variety of authentic Argentine products from wines and mate to empanadas and desserts. The owner Mario was nice both on the phone and in person, and was eager to help.

8.description: As we're all aware, Chicago is a 'melting pot' of cultures and ethnicities.  If Buenos Aires Deli isn't proof of this, I'm not sure what is!  After living a summer abroad in Buenos Aires, Argentina I eventually ran out of my Yerba Mate and was on a mad search city-wide for my fix.  Thankfully after a lucky Yelp search I found Buenos Aires Deli in Cragin.  Even if you haven't been to Argentina, you step in the door and get a taste of the Lands of Guachos and Pampas with Argentinian Futbol games on the TV in the background.The stock:-YERBA MATE!!!  Various brands such as Rosamonte, Union, Cruz de Malta, Cachamate, La Merced, Taragui, & Nobleza.  They do sell it in tea bags for on-the-go but I recommend getting the real deal of loose-"leaf" Yerba in your very own gourd (which they do sell).  I also was introduced to a plastic thermos that is made specifically for mate without the mess.  May have to go back for one.-Argentinian Wines Galore! (Of course, Malbecs but also my favorite sweet white New Age).  For beer drinkers, they have Quilmes, the national beer of Argentina.-Alfajores (two round sweet cookies joined together by thick dulce de leche caramel rolled in shredded coconut); Nothing goes better with your favorite hot beverage of mate, coffee or tea.-Miga Sandwiches by the dozen (an ultra thin, ham sandwich with a twist and no crust--which I tear of anyway)-Meal accompaniments like EMPANADAS, Russian salad, matambre, pionono dulce and more!-Many random corner store products like chips and other snacks.Say hi to Mario for me.  I loaded him with all the questions I had and he was happy to respond with a thorough, knowledgeable yet honest response.  Che!  This is "la buena vida!"  Note to Drivers: There's a small lot to the side of the store off Barry.

4.description: Head to the rear for the deli and get some great empanadas. The owner is very polite and patient, and answered all our questions and provided recommendations as we bought some Yerba Mate for us and friends as gifts. I'll be coming back often!

14.description: Like being in Argentina all over again!  Unbelievable wine and yerba mate selection, and a wonderful owner to boot!  Don't forget to bring a few alfajores home- best dessert ever!

7.description: Well-stocked store with lots of great Argentine products that are tricky to find...this has them all in one place. They have an extensive Argentine wine selection and also stock Quilmes. The empanadas are good, Buenos Aires style with really light and airy dough. The owner is very friendly and sociable and is fun to chat with. Will definitely stop back my next time in Chicago.

3.description: Every week I try to make one trip to Cermak Produce, because the quality and prices are unbeatable. I don't care that I'm the only Caucasian in the store. The biggest navel oranges I've ever seen at .99/lb, several varieties of apples at the same price, bananas at .29-.49/lb, strawberries at 2.49 for a carton, pineapples at 2.99 each. The produce is always fresh, stocked, organized, and priced amazingly. There's always such a long line at the meat counter that I haven't gotten anything, but judging by the line it's good. They also have a good selection of mexican food for cooking, cheese, rice, tortillas and the like - but don't go there expecting to find the selection of a regular grocery store in anything else. Sometimes they have awesome sales on stuff like Tropicana or milk, but I usually just get the produce. Checkout is quick and easy, the girls at the counter don't understand complicated questions unless you speak Spanish, but can help you out with anything else. Don't forget to stock up on the cases of mangos that are occasionally on sale outside the front door!

1.description: I have been here for the 1.00/lb ground pork and bone-in Chicken breasts. Meat was fresh and although the place is small, staff was friendly and quick.

2.description: Definitely, products are always fresh and great quality no doubt! Ok. So I live in the North side area near by Evanston, but my fiancé and I usually go all the way to this store for the same reason mentioned above:) Love the fresh fruits, vegetables and meats.I love everything in this store except for the cashiers:( They are not friendly at all. They never greet you and it seems like they don't even want for you to be there. Like if they get bother because you are there. I used to be a manager for 4 years and this is not how I would treat my guests:) Something that I would recommend to this store to be 100% perfect please change personnel or train them on how to greet their guests;)

0.description: Rosa J. is obsessed to Cermak Produce, like Nicki Minaj always says "I'm obsessed to my fans." I'm totally a fan of Cermak Produce.  This is a small location catering to the neighborhood residents in Belmont Cragin.  There were some shady characters outside loitering, so be aware.This was one of my typical grocery shopping trips.  I purchased one (1) bag of cello spinach ($1.99), one (1) bag of red seedless grapes ($0.95/lb. for $1.30), red delicious apples ($0.65/lb. for $2.13), plum tomatoes ($0.65/lb. for $1.32), one (1) cantaloupe ($0.95), two (2) bags of carrots (2 for $0.95), and four (4) regular-sized avocados (2 for $0.95; $1.90).  Everything came to $10.78 after tax.  No one can say that buying groceries is expensive, if you know where to shop.  This location is on the corner of Cicero and Diversey.  The CTA bus 54A (Cicero/Skokie Blvd.) runs during AM and PM rush hours only, so the more reliable public transportation is to take the CTA bus 76 (Diversey).  If you choose not to exercise during the gorgeous spring season in Chicago, driving your own vehicle is an option as well since parking is ample.

3.description: Just bought a full size mattress set from Victor at American Mattress. I couldn't ask for better customer service! Walked me through my first large purchase when moving to Chicago for the first time, understood all my needs and pricing options. My purchase even came with some advice for a first time city-dweller from the suburbs. Thank you again Victor, can't wait for the mattress to get here!

1.description: I had the worst experience ever !!!! Went during the Labor Day weekend sale and was told multiple times of a deal of 0 finance after 6 months so I had time to pay off my icomfort mattresses before the 6 months right !!! WELL NO I THEN FOUND OUT THAT FROMTHE BEGINNING I was already paying double of the original price for my mattresses and when I called progressive the company that financed me they told me they didn't have no program of that kind that the salesperson OMAR HAD LIED TO ME  I called Omar to ask him why he had lied to me and told me that unfortunately he couldn't do anything about this that I had to deal with progressive !!! Like really my mattresses had a value of 1600 and at the and I was paying 3800 for the damn mattresses!!! THEY LIED TO ME AND IN MY WORDS STOLE FROM ME WITHOUT A GUN SO NOT TRUST THEM !!!!

2.description: Mattress selection and pricing seems fair here.  The free delivery with yelp check-in was a huge bonus!  All that aside, Victor sealed a purchase for us here.  He was very knowledgable and had a great sales pitch without being pushy. He seems like a genuinely nice guy, not a salesperson.  Nice work Victor :)  We highly recommend this store!

0.description: My friend and I had a wonderful experience here. We were looking for a cheap full size mattress as a gift for a friend. Robert was very helpful and explained pro and con of the 2 selection that we narrowed down to. He offered us a deal that was right in our budget. This will make our friend extremely happy. Thanks a lot for the great service Robert.

4.description: Just had my first night with my new mattress and it was was great! It's the first time I bought a mattress so I didn't know how to go about it but at this location with the great help of Victor he made sure I left with something that was going to give me full comfort and so far so good! Victor showed that he was based more on great customer satisfaction than just a sale! I totally recommend!!

1.description: I gotta say this place is horrible. My wife went there for her cousins wedding party and not only did they mess up the bridesmaid's dresses by making them too big and than cutting it super short by having them ready the day before the wedding but they told the bride they would be able to alter her dress and when she went to take it they said it had too much detail and they couldn't do it. So unprofessional I would not recommend this place to no one. And they had a cat running around the dresses. Horrible

0.description: I came here looking to buy a communion dress off the rack for my daughter. The variety here is very slim. I think they only had one dress in the store that would fit. The lady offered to make a dress for my daughter, I said why not. She's very tall for her age and I knew I would struggle to find a modest dress in her size. It took her 2 and a half weeks to make it. The lady worked on it up to the last minute before she said it would be ready. The dress looked very similar to the style we requested but it looked hand made. My daughter was happy so that's all that really matters.  I don't think we'll be back.

3.description: Not a good place to come and wait forever to purchase your weekly meat.  Customer service not the best I'll stick to going to the Guanajuato

1.description: Great food and their pastries are out of this world. They have been better in their customer services.

2.description: This is a fine little market. Clean, well stocked and very cheap. Get all my fresh veggies here. Butchery is very nice and appealing.  Prepared food is good but the servers behind the counter can be assholes.Bakery is in front and separate from store but worth the entire trip.

5.description: I love their selection of fresh cut meats. It's high quality and it has cheap prices as well. They make homemade salsas, and have Fresh tortillas, and tortillas chips. They also offer a table  full of different salsas so you can try them all to help you decide which one you will take home! Their prepare meal are not bad at all, but they are priced high. They also  make fresh mexican bread!!!

6.description: So we moved into the area and had been in this supermarket before but my first impression was "ah-not that good". So out of need, I swung by to pick up some essentials for a mexican household, you know limones, jitomates, cilantro and then noticed the bakery... then noticed they sell fresh tortillas... then started buying in their prepared food section. And then I found 2 large bottles of my favorite "nescafe- cafe de olla" for $5 and I was amazed! I started shopping a little more often there - so often that I only visit my 'favorite' supermarket every 2-3 weeks now. I don't have a regular routine of buying all groceries on a given day like clock work, say Thursday afternoon EVERY WEEK so it works that I can walk down the street and pick up a few essentials and not be forced to fill my car up to the top. My love for their bakery has changed a bit. I used to LOVE their chocolate donuts, then they added cinnamon and the taste was not the same anymore. AND my biggest pet peeve is when the way they package the donuts and then the chocolate falls off by the time you get home and take that little paper off. It's soooo annoying or maybe it's just me. Other than this, their baked goods are excellent and my chocolate donut issue is not worth docking a star. So there!

7.description: It's a great store! I go visit their bakery anytime i'm around because they are truly the best Mexican bakery that I've tried! I've tasted their grilled chicken and i can say that its amazing! everything else is pretty typical of a hispanic grocery store where you can find certain items for a great price but it makes up for other more expensive things. But I just love to visit this place every time i get a chance to get to that area.

8.description: OK, LETS SEE WHERE DO i start..................I loaf of bread,1 pineapple5 bananasSidral Mundet sodaa PoweradeAll for $8.00 Bucks!  good prices. Its a good Mexican market, not my favorite BUT Its good.Shake & Bake seal of approval.

0.description: I really like this store. The store is always very clean. I love that they have cooked food. You can find anything from chiles rellenos to bbq ribs. My favorite thing here is the homemade salsas! They're so so good! They also have a bakery inside and the bread is always fresh and so tasty. The bolillos taste like the ones you get when you go to Mexico. I do feel like the store is a little pricey but you get what you pay for. And it's pretty great quality all around. I won't be giving Morelia 5 stars because of the cashiers. I went in today at 11am and the two young ladies who were working at the bakery were rude. And it wasn't just today. For the most part the cashiers are snotty, rude, and never kind.

4.description: I love coming here for their hot/fresh food in the back corner.  They often have fried shrimp, different "stews", chicharrones, rice, beans, chicken wings, tacos dorados, different types of fish, and much much more.  It's great to stop by to pick up some lunch or grab dinner on the way home.  If they have fresh guacamole I will usually get it ($2.99 for a container), and it's much better than any guacamole from Jewel or any one of those other grocery stores.I also love their bakery!  I have a tendency to always get too much when I go, it's easy to do with all their yummy baked goods.  Bolillos are always a staple and good for making sandwiches; the cookies and donuts are huge.  Like twice the size of Dunkin Donuts.I mostly come for the prepared foods/bakery so I haven't shopped too much in their produce/grocery area.  Their frozen food section is limited, and produce prices are decent but not great.

1.description: Who needs fancy carts with wheels when you have a cardboard box with a piece of rope tied to it?It sounds ridiculous but it's true. The "thing" at this store involves you dragging a box attached to a piece of rope around the store and filling it with various treats. And by treats I mean items at discounted prices that are either dying on the shelves at big box stores, overstock merchandise or just random off brand stuff you've never heard of.It's one of those places that has all this stuff you don't really need but want to buy because it's cheap and God knows you can use an endless supply of Hanes sleeveless t-shirts right? :) Worth checking out on the off chance they may have something you actually need. Their is also one of these located in Maywood or Melrose Park near a textbook store if you're ever in that area.

0.description: If there is something called "Bargains in a Box," hand it to me because I'm curious what I would get.  I'm confident that this isn't a Pandora's box, since everything box you see in the store is wide open and you're welcome to peek and see what's inside.  "Bargains in a Box," in actuality, sells the manufacturers' overstocks or soon-will-be-expired food items.  This store is pretty cool in my opinion.  If you can certainly utilize a place like this for your everyday essentials. Rosa J. will make this review simple by going straight to the point, in the style of Ten Commandments: 1) Thou shalt buy toothpaste and toothbrushes ($1 for a 4oz. size and $3 for a dozen toothbrush pack).  2) Thou shalt buy dish detergent and hand soap (if you don't have any brand loyalty).  3) Thou shalt buy cleaning supplies (trust me...they are loaded in the back of store).  4) Remember to see colors that correspond to the prices that you will pay (or ask one of the associated on the floor if you're uncertain) 5) Honor the merchandise that has intrinsic defects and has missing components.  6) Thou shalt go through the racks of apparel, especially the baby and toddler ones are quite cute.  7) Thou shalt not steal (yep...that one is the same as the Bible).  8) Thou shalt check out the toy sections (if you have kids, nephews, and nieces).  9) Thou shalt check the expiration date on every item you're about to purchase (if that's applicable).  10) Thou shalt prepare for some cash in case the credit card machine is offline (because you won't spend too much at BIAB).  We found a small Keurig capsule rack for $5, a 4oz. toothpaste for $1, and a large bottle of Suave hair conditioner for $2.  This BIAB location accessible via CTA #85 (Central) bus, and the strip-mall parking is available.

58.description: Worst customer service out of any restaurant I've ever ordered from. You call in, it doesn't matter who answers they are literally ALL rude. No sense of customer service, they act like you better feel privileged to order from them. Would give them a better rating  because their pizza is good, but the service is so profoundly bad I can't even give them two stars. Considering there is a pizza place on every other corner in Chicago they should try harder to keep customers. They won't get another dime from me.

56.description: The food here is good. My reason for 2 stars is the customer service. Most times you get a rude person on the phone. Friday night may have been my last time ordering. I ordered 2 dinners that's it, it arrived almost 2 hours later. It was delivered by a frazzled looking older woman and a little girl. I gave a tip because I felt bad for her. I think I should have received a phone call at least if the driver was running late. When I called to check where my order was I could hear them yelling but muffled. I hope they read these reviews and change their how they run the place.

29.description: Never ordering again so many mistakes! Had to call about my order didn't have my number right and they want to have an attitude not my fault I repeated my number 3 times didn't get it right then I called and they took my card number but didn't say that they weren't even going to make the order so done never again!

42.description: HORRIBLE PIZZA AND TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICEEven giving them one star is too much. The pizza is terrible! The sauce tastes terrible and the cheese is rubber. It left a terrible after taste in our mouths. After calling to complain that no one was touching their pizza we were put on hold 3x and a half hour later they finally came to a resolution which they were extremely rude about. Not to mention they said our pizza would arrive in 45 mins to an hour. Almost an hour and a half later we  received our order and it was ice cold. NEVER AGAIN! To say they have award winning pizza is a joke. I've had better frozen food than this.

23.description: Customer service was horrible, my order was wrong, food was cold when I got it, they need to fire every person working there. I hope the owner has a smart phone and looks on yelp cause he's running himself out of business with those rude employees of his. Also when I picked up there was people hanging out there with the girl at the pick up window, they kept staring and giving off an unfriendly atmosphere I can honestly say I'll never eat here again.

47.description: There's no doubt that their pizza is good, I give them that. Their customer service on the other hand, not so much. I order from them all the time and literally 8-10 times the person who's taking your order is beyond rude. I get that they're busy, but I'm giving you business.. The least you can do is be nice to me while I order. Also, if you're ordering for delivery make sure to mentally prepare yourself because you will be waiting for over an hour for your food. Oh! And god forbid you call them and cancel your order because you've waited so long, because they will block your number and prohibit you from ordering there ever again. Mama Luna's your pizza is good, but it's not great. Sorry not sorry.

8.description: I have ordered pizza from this local restaurant for a good 20 years now.. And I have reached my final point of being patient and tolerating their mistakes!! They're are two big girls but the biggest is the nicest the the other one is rude!! They told me 35 mins for pick up I waited an extra 25 mins and the pizza was improperly done! I wanted a full refund but they kept ten percent.. No more walks for pizza!! Exiled!!

31.description: My 'go to' palace for a movie and pizza night. VERY reasonable prices and quite tasty. No complaints here.

34.description: The pizza is decent ( a little greasier than normal) but the customer service is horrible. If they're rude to your face imagine what goes on behind the scenes.

16.description: The food, service and delivery are horrible!!! when I ate here I felt like i was taking a chance with my health. Disgusting!!!

13.description: Stay away from here!!!!!!!! We had to call 4 times before some one answered. Against our better judgement we still ordered a pizza and they told us it would be an hour for delivery. After an hour and a half we called because we still didn't get our pizza. The person who answered the phone seemed annoyed that I was asking where my pizza was. He told me it went out for delivery 15 minutes ago and we were first on the list for delivery then hung up on me. We live less than 10 minutes away from mama Luna on a bad day and still no pizza. Finally just shy of two hours the pizza arrives. If the pizza showing up one hour late wasn't enough it was almost room temperature and had spots on the bottom that were burned. This will definitely be the last time I ever order from here.

11.description: I will never order from there again. After ordering two footballs for my job. I ate two slices of pizza then when I was gonna eat into the other one it had a fly in the pizza. It mad me gross out.

39.description: I like their pizzas, I order here sometimes,the only thing I don't like is that I always find some kind of black powder on the bottom of the pizza.

37.description: Horrible customer service!!! I have been waiting over an hour and 1/2 for a medium 1 topping pizza and a cup of soup we literally live less than 10 minutes away!!!! And when I called to ask where our food is their excuse is that it's elections day! Are you serving the entire city?!?!?! It's the middle of the day on a Tuesday!!!! Never again!!!!

0.description: okay I won't lie the pizza is really good! But delivery there it takes really long ! I had to wait for my pizza for more than an hour ! I feel like they should hired more people so they can deliver faster.

38.description: Mama Luna's, they have a good pizza and really good deals. Football for 21 dollars and a mega ball for 23 dollars. There service is horrible tho the ladies taking orders give the worst attitudes ever. They rush you too order, they don't sound friendly, they never smile, and they can't count one time i gave her a 20 and a dollar and I guess she assumed I handed her 40 bucks and I got back the full amount of money. Smh. But they do got good pizza!! I wouldn't get anything else from there because anything else sucks for sure.

51.description: The pizza is decent but the customer service blows. I called at 5:30 for an order I was going to pick up at 9:15pm. They told me I would have to call back at 8 because they were too busy at night for pre-orders. Well im at work on my lunch and won't be able to call back until I'm off at 9.

27.description: Let me start off by saying we are regulars at this Restaurant. We came as a family for Mother's Day and the Waitress was very friendly and kind but we waited forever for our food to come out. We went today for Father's Day and it was a DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!! We waited 2 1/2 hours for our food to come out, which NEVER CAME OUT!!! Mind you it was only our table and another family there and we had to wait 2 1/2 hours for our food just RIDICULOUS!!! We were told that the cooks were taking care of the carry out orders before they started on ours. What restaurant does such a thing!!!! The Manager was no where around to come out and explain anything to us. What manager runs a business and doesnt care about their customers. This place needs to fire all their employees including the management cause this is unacceptable!!! After being there for 2 1/2 hours we told our waitress we werent waiting any longer we got up and left very pissed off! So much for a Father's Day Dinner for our Father's. They lost a group of customers cause we are done with this place!!!

32.description: For the past 3 years my family has loved this pizza and it has been all we chose to order! even after they charged us twice for a big order and we called several times to try and correct leading us to just give up!  Today I have taken enough RUDE behavior and  truly annoyed since I just got back from out of town, I'm exhausted and didn't want to cook I ordered pizza well I called once at 1.5 hrs and the middle aged guy who was taking orders at 630 pm on 5/6/15 sounded not all there and confused saying oh I THINK your pizza just left confirmed my address so I was like okay, another 30 mins past and I called again THEN all of a sudden after my address was confirmed TWICE they are acting like I'm crazy making up that I ordered a pizza! And wanted to put my order in at 9 pm no way we were starving and said forget it ! Cereal it was, this royally pissed me off! They don't even try to correct their own error HORRIBLE customer service! Just read all other bad reviews and PASS on this pizza! LA villa pizza back home we come! Pricey but great food and service!! Good bye mamma Luna's !

54.description: Pizza is so delicious! We always order a thin crust pizza and it's consistently good. It's definitely one of my favorite pizza places in the city. Thin crust is actually thin. I love the cracker crust. So why 3 stars?The staff is horrible. The same lady always takes our order and she ALWAYS has an attitude. She just sounds so annoyed and can't wait to get off the phone. I have eaten in the restaurant one time long ago. It was not worth repeating.I wish I could avoid the grumpy phone woman but I love their pizza

48.description: Unbelievably rude and disrespectful. Extremely incompetent when it comes to completing a simple task. If you are in search of a good Pizza place this is definitely not the place to go. Don't waste your time or money. You will be highly disappointed.

44.description: I order a pizza and when it arrived it was the wrong ingredients. .. but the thing that I have the most problem was with the customer service they have specially thei supervisor nelly... she needs training. .. I would never order pizza here again I promised myself

24.description: I will never order from there again. After ordering two footballs for my job. I ate two slices of pizza then when I was gonna eat into the other one it had a fly in the pizza. It mad me gross out.

7.description: Gotta love that they have a Mega Ball Pizza!  It's hugh, can feed my entire morning crew when we order it. Price is not bad either. It cost about $40 with tip and delivery.

49.description: Took forever to get the pizza. Was stone cold when I bite it and raw. I called back they argued with me saying why did I bite the pizza If I knew it was cold and raw

40.description: Came over to grandparents-in-law house and they always order from Mama Luna.   It's good and tasty pizza.  They always order the thin crust pizza.

53.description: I used to love the pizza here......I even worked here delivering their pizza 20 years ago. So we decided to try the pizza again since we live only a few miles away. You have to go around the back to pick up your pizza. What a mess. Cars parked all over.....even blocking the door where you go in. And the cars were not there to pick food up. They were just 'hanging out' it looked like to us. The lady on the phone is very rude. I can't believe they are still open. The pizza was not that great either. The neighborhood there is very dangerous. Good luck if you venture over there.

30.description: Pizza was great. The potato skins are ghetto. Alice of American cheese and bacon bits. For the price I paid I expected sour cream and chives.

46.description: TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!!!! Actually that's an understatement! Staff is so so rude. We ordered a pizza and 4 hours later (yes 4) when we called to check the status they said they had already delivered it! LIARS!! I will not be giving them my business ever again! Looking at the other reviews I have no idea how this place is even still opened. Disgusted.

1.description: Buyer Beware!!!! Ordered a sausage and pepperoni football pizza for delivery. Delivery person dropped off a roast beef and pepperoni pizza. Called them before the delivery guy was off the block to tell them about it and said we haven't eaten any of it and don't want it.Aparently, I sound like I have to much Melanin in my skin because she replied if you ate out of it we can't do nothing about it. I replied, I already told you we didn't eat it. Their reply was.... well your order says roast beef and pepperoni so that's what you got. After arguing for 5 minutes. I said ok. Nevermind. Just lost a good paying customer and good delivery tipper :(

55.description: Yeah, the people that work here are rude. The parking lot is crazy, especially on the weekends. But their pizza is good.

9.description: If I could give them zero stars I would. I called and ordered a pizza and it arrived over two hours late ! They didn't say that they had a two hour wait . The pizza was ice cold . I will NEVER order from them again . Invest in some time management for the sake of your business .

26.description: I love the pizza. Hugh amount of pizza for a very reasonable price. When placing your call in order be sure to know what you want, as the person answering the phone has little patience. I order pizza at least once a month.

25.description: I placed my order around 7 p.m. and was told that it would arrive within the hour. When I called at 8:15 p.m. asking where my food was, the girl told me that the driver hadn't even left the restaurant yet. Why is it that Pete's Pizza on Addison and Western can deliver a large pizza to my place in Hermosa within 45 minutes, but Mama Luna's takes double the time to deliver the same despite being much closer?

12.description: Pizza was great. The potato skins are ghetto. Alice of American cheese and bacon bits. For the price I paid I expected sour cream and chives.

59.description: They are rude and do not care about your satisfaction. Ive ordered here several times and this last time will be the last. It took 1 1/2 hours for my pizza to get here. The delivery driver was lost telling me he was outside but he was not. 3 of us stood outside waiting. When he finally got there, the pizza looked ok, so we went inside and my family took a slice (6 of us). Immediately, we felt the pizza cold and crust was chewy. I called and spoke with the Manager Nelly. She said there is Nothing she can do because we already took some slices. She said "we can't sell it back". Meaning if we did not touch it, they would have sent it to another customer. I told her that I have a family to feed. I paid $27 I want my pizza fresh. I would even drop it off to show her how cold it was. She said bring it in And I will tell you to your face that we are not making you a new one. That there was no way the pizza was cold. And if I don't like their service to go somewhere else. This was the Manager yelpers. If they don't change their attitude and poor customer service you can kiss this place good bye.

21.description: Very poor service few months ago I ordered pizza around midnight I didn't get it till like 3 am I called and complained to the staff and today I wanted to order pizza and apparently I can't order because I was blocked .. And my address as well! Do not recommend

17.description: Very poor service few months ago I ordered pizza around midnight I didn't get it till like 3 am I called and complained to the staff and today I wanted to order pizza and apparently I can't order because I was blocked .. And my address as well! Do not recommend

10.description: Called to place an order for pick up, first the prices have changed now they charge per ingredient. Second was quoted 30min for pickup. Upon pickup 30 min later they said it would be 5 more min. Waited 5 minutes only to find out it would be another 8 min. They offered to give me my pizza out of the oven without being fully cooked. I ended up leaving. Got a call stating my pizza was ready 30 min later then my quoted time. Unfortunately they have unreliable customer service.

5.description: Not my first bad experience here, but the pizza is alright and they have a lot of choices. Called back to add something else to my order today, was told I couldn't add to the same order. So I then requested a separate order If that was the case (even with another delivery charge included). He said it wasn't possible and had to be added as a tip. Regardless of their system, the gentleman had a terrible attitude over the phone as if he's doing me a favor (which he was, but then again I'm paying and being polite), and proceeded to hang up. Don't know if it's wise to keep ordering from there, so disappointed!

3.description: really good pan pizza. ordered online, when submitted i received a message saying "thank you for your order. we'll contact you shortly." had to call 20 minutes later to make sure they received the order. they confirmed and gave us a one hour estimate. called back twice. altogether it took 2 hpurs from placing the order to it being delivered.

35.description: One mistake after another, continuesly. Absolutely horrible service.  Waited over 2 hours for a chicken dinner delivery and then they forgot the pops I irdered. Called the manager and he had the audacity to tell me "if you don't like it, don't order from here" rude, unprofessional and completely unacceptable.  It's sad that an establishment with descent food has such ignorant staff. After 10 years I will officially never order again.  And I will make sure none of my friends or family order again.

19.description: Customer service was horrible, my order was wrong, food was cold when I got it, they need to fire every person working there. I hope the owner has a smart phone and looks on yelp cause he's running himself out of business with those rude employees of his. Also when I picked up there was people hanging out there with the girl at the pick up window, they kept staring and giving off an unfriendly atmosphere I can honestly say I'll never eat here again.

28.description: The WORST experience ever! I ordered from here today for my students last day of school. I placed my order around 10:50, my phone call to them was at 10:51 so figure a few minutes for it to be complete. The man asked me when I would like it, I said around noon. I drove over and finally arrived about 12:15. I walk in and they can't "find" my order. One of the people working, a younger guy with a sort of side swept hair thing going on, finally found my order on the computer and was able to print to the order, yet they couldn't find it???? He walks away and wanders around the order area, meanwhile, my time is ticking before lunch begins for my students. I'm getting testy and yell/ask, what they are doing. Same guy comes back and says they can't find my order but they have a similar order they could give me; so basically take someone else's order to please me(?). I said I'll take whatever they have, and they better do something about this crappy situation. Guy wanders away.... AGAIN. He is gone and I once again ask what the hell is going on (and no, I was not nice at this point!). He comes back and tells me they are looking for my pizza. but I had just told him to give me what he can! Another guy, about 30ish with a scruffy shaven face decides to put his two sense into this situation by telling me they don't give free pizza. I had no problem telling him he better do something since they were at fault. I never asked for a damn free pizza, but you sure as hell were going to eat of the cost since you screwed up, I was now standing there for TWENTY minutes, and the staff was completely aloof. Finally the other man that was at the window, Tony got involved. He got the pizzas side swept guy was talking about, brought them out, and did give a discount. He was truthfully the only one of the 4 people sitting in that carry out area that cared at all. Tony - thank you. I will never order from these people again, let alone suggest anyone to order from there. Since I got someone else's order to make up for mine, by the time I got to my school the pizzas were meh warm. I see from other reviews that customer service is definitely lacking... guess they don't see a problem if they haven't addressed it.

45.description: Ordered cheese stick with marinara sauce and marinara sauce contained nasty meat parparticles. Will never buy it again.

33.description: This place has great food but horrible service.  They say pick 30 minute delivery 45 minutes to an hour.  Well,  it's actually 1hr for pick up and 1 hour and half for delivery.  There are 3 people that work the phones typically and none know what they are doing.  You asked them about specific dishes and you get a "please hold" for every question.  God for bid they make a mistake on a order, there's no... apologies well rush it right over. You get rap up the order and we'll get there in an hour and half. Exchange the food was what I was told!  Exchange food,  gross. I would Hate to see what it's like if you dine in.

43.description: All three times I've ordered delivery from this place, the employees that took my order sounded pissed off and hating their lives. You won't hear "Thank you for calling.." or "What can I get for you" from these people. Instead a "Whadaya want" followed by sighs and I'm already fed up with you, tone of voice.Delivery is always EXTREMELY long, 1 hour-2 hour wait. All of their delivery drivers look like they live off the streets or have/had some drug addiction. One of them was an older woman that didn't even know any english at all. The pizza is alright, definitely not great, but not terrible either. Overall I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, mainly because of the nasty staff is what did it for me. If it was one bad experience I could understand, but three times in a row, their staff is just ridiculous!

2.description: Tonight is the last time we will order from Mama Luna's after ordering with them on and off for over 20 years. On and off cuz of bad customer service and bad food from time to time. Tonight I got hung up on twice and when my food came, pizza was over cooked, chicken was burnt and pasta was clumpy. Bad attitudes and bad food!

18.description: The WORST experience ever! I ordered from here today for my students last day of school. I placed my order around 10:50, my phone call to them was at 10:51 so figure a few minutes for it to be complete. The man asked me when I would like it, I said around noon. I drove over and finally arrived about 12:15. I walk in and they can't "find" my order. One of the people working, a younger guy with a sort of side swept hair thing going on, finally found my order on the computer and was able to print to the order, yet they couldn't find it???? He walks away and wanders around the order area, meanwhile, my time is ticking before lunch begins for my students. I'm getting testy and yell/ask, what they are doing. Same guy comes back and says they can't find my order but they have a similar order they could give me; so basically take someone else's order to please me(?). I said I'll take whatever they have, and they better do something about this crappy situation. Guy wanders away.... AGAIN. He is gone and I once again ask what the hell is going on (and no, I was not nice at this point!). He comes back and tells me they are looking for my pizza. but I had just told him to give me what he can! Another guy, about 30ish with a scruffy shaven face decides to put his two sense into this situation by telling me they don't give free pizza. I had no problem telling him he better do something since they were at fault. I never asked for a damn free pizza, but you sure as hell were going to eat of the cost since you screwed up, I was now standing there for TWENTY minutes, and the staff was completely aloof. Finally the other man that was at the window, Tony got involved. He got the pizzas side swept guy was talking about, brought them out, and did give a discount. He was truthfully the only one of the 4 people sitting in that carry out area that cared at all. Tony - thank you. I will never order from these people again, let alone suggest anyone to order from there. Since I got someone else's order to make up for mine, by the time I got to my school the pizzas were meh warm. I see from other reviews that customer service is definitely lacking... guess they don't see a problem if they haven't addressed it.

41.description: Pizza is ok, hit or miss sometimes. The football pizza is extra greasy. Every review about the service is true, we ordered when there was a big sporting event and an hr later we called to ask the status on our pizza they said there was a 2 hr and a half wait which they never mentioned when we ordered our pizza. We got some really rude girl on the phone and we just cancelled our order. FIX YOUR COSTUMER SERVICE!

52.description: I'd like to give it 3.5 stars, but since I can't 3 will do. So the pizza is REALLY good. I love it. I get their pastas for my kids on occasions, and again very good. I went in there a couple months ago to dine in and the place was not that great looking. I went in there this past weekend, and VOILA they have remodeled it!! Hardwood floors, wood tables, flat screen tv's with the games on, giving it a more pub/restaurant feel.If I'd spent that much $ on my business you better believe I'd be advertising the remodel to somehow get more people in the door because if you drive by, it really isn't inviting at all to make you want to step foot inside. Their service is decent. They charge you for every pop refill which I'm not a fan of. And this past weekend they added an automatic 18% tip to my bill for my part of 4! (2 adults/2kids). Now I'm not a cheap tipper, so the issue is not about the tipping, it's about the fact that they made it automatic. You are NOT supposed to do that unless it's for a larger party and you state that policy. Left a sour feeling with me. Overall, good food at a good price, just not sure I'll be back to dine in, carry out is the way to go although be prepared to deal with a terrible parking lot in the back.

50.description: This is my go to place for pizza by default due to convenience. The pizza is consistent and it is good. The cost of the toppings are ridiculously high though. If  I order a football cheese pizza it is around $22.00. For me to add mushrooms,spinach and garlic to 1/3rd of the pizza is an additional $12.00! That price is ridiculous for a quarter cup of those 3 ingredients. I have never had problems with the girls on the phone,  but I am also not an annoying customer. All in all I will order from them again but LIKE A SIDE CHICK  I don't LOVE EM'

4.description: The pizza here is not all that great. What is even worse is the bad service. Call to place an order for delivery and you'll see.

6.description: Absolutely rude! Called in order and told 30minutes for pick-up. Arrive and asked to wait 15 minutes because pizza maker hadn't arrived. Even if he/she walked in during that time,  prepping and cooking would be an additional 15-30minutes. A courtesy call could have been made for the inconvenience,  or offered to deliver for free. Way to kill my craving!

22.description: So I ordered pizza on 8/26/2015 and they delivered the wrong pizza to my home. When I called to inform them of the mistake they acted as if I fucked up. They told me I would have to wait another hour and 30 minutes, ( remind you I'm pregnant and starving and I have a 4 year old daughter that was waiting to eat as well). I asked them instead of an extra large could they give me a family size sense again they messed my order up and I have to wait yet again. These people said no and  hung the phone up on me not once but twice. Then I told them to have the delivery guy bring my money back. They said if they bring my money I better not touch one slice of that pizza. They were very rude and disrespectful. I will never order from mama Luna again as long as I have breathe in my body. If you don't want horrible customer service please stay far away from this place.

15.description: First time we ordered from there, the most ignorant delivery guy. He banged at our door as if he were the police & had the nerve to  call after he left, stating "next time have a person at the door and card ready." The pizza was good so yeah we ordered from there again hoping for a better service. The girl was as well rude, plus half the pizza got here without cheese topping. Fire all your employees, keep the cook

57.description: Food is decent but not worth the hassle if dealing with their staff. Word to the wise: check your pick up and delivery order before accepting it. Open up EVERYTHING. If THEY forget something, they will not refund or replace it if you accept it beforehand. Don't bother asking for a manager either- this place is equal opportunity for bad customer service. Overall a very disappointing experience all 3 times that I've been there. I kept giving them another chance because they are so close, but at this point I'd rather drive a longer distance then give then my money.

20.description: Today our bruschetta was soggy and our mozzarella sticks and pizza were cold.   There was one waitress taking care of 10 tables.   She was very professional,  I would have walked out.  Service was great,  food was not so good.

36.description: I have to say that I am completely done with this place. The customer service is terrible. The pizza is ok...greasy! Other places in the neighborhood are better. But it's cheap and WAS good to order in large quantities. When I went to place my order today I was told that my coupons for free pizza would not work. The coupons say, "save 15 coupons and receive one free 14 inch pizza with anyone topping this is a coupon." At this point I was told that it's not about the number of coupons you have, but the number of times you've called. Essentially what they're saying is they only want you to order one pizza every time you call. In a time when there are pizza restaurants on every corner and customer service is prime, this place is really not doing a good job. I will not be ordering from here again.

14.description: So I called for pizza at 12:00am, they said it would take about an hr, it's 2am still no pizza. No answer, quite unfortunate. Good food, horrible customer service

28.description: I went here as part of a small neighborhood tour I put together.  We were mostly vegetarians/vegans in this group and so we had the pierogis.  The blueberry ones were especially good.  The price was definitely right, as I got a good portion for $5.  The place had vintage video games like Ms. Pac Man for entertainment. It's cash only.

1.description: I like borscht and I'll go anywhere that has it on the menu. That includes Avondale, where Barbakan lists red beet borscht among the soups of the day once a week. And so Saturday brought me here to try barszez czerwony (Polish red borscht). I found a nice neighborhood restaurant with friendly service and comfortable booths in the front room. There was a large birthday party so there were toasts and singing all night. However, I'm not sure I was served barszez czerwony. That soup should be clear, bright red in color, and tart from vinegar and lemon. What I was served was pink, heavy and creamy. My guess is this was a version of borscht made with kefir (fermented milk) and hard boiled eggs known as chlodnik litewski (Lithuanian soup). I was glad to taste this version, and I would put it in the "pretty good" category, but it's not my favorite, so you might detect a note of disappointment. The rest of the dinner--an assortment of salads and rye bread, boiled beef in horseradish sauce, and good French fries--was fine, and I will definitely be back when I am in the hood, and in the mood.

9.description: Neighborhood staple.  This place has been here a long time and I admit I passed it up for a long time heading to Central gyros instead. I live near Cafe Prague and  Ferajna but Barbakan is only about 8 min away and a better bargain. The food tastes like home made like you went to family's for dinner. I am used to a red tomato based sauce for golobki but here it is served with a brown gravy which is very good. We also ordered potato pancakes and ruski pierogi, both of which were good. I do like applesauce with my pancakes which I kind of missed. The small order of pierogi and potato pancakes, a small golobki and a large golobki and a can of soda was only $35.  My only complaint was the service. It was very slow (only 2 other tables with people at them) and the woman seemed more interested in her cell phone. I do not speak polish - I am able to get through ordering and that is about it. I do not know if it was a language barrier issue or if it was just bad service. Nothing that would make me decide not to go back - just plan for extra time! It is not a fancy place - but that is fine with me. Good food, reasonable prices. Easy parking in the free lot across the street.

29.description: The food here is really good and really authentic.  Even if you aren't that hungry, order the small plates and a soup and you will be stuffed!  For a small 5 dollar plate of pierogies, you still get like 10 of them. Service was the only thing bad.  Our waitress seemed to be the only one working .. she had like 10 tables.  She wasn't a bad waitress, they just should have had someone else helping out.I would definetely come back here for authentic really fabulous Polish Food.

23.description: Let me preface this by saying I am Polish.  I grew up with Polish parents and grandparents, eating authentic, home cooked Polish food my entire life.  This, my friends, is not good Polish food.  I swear, everything tasted like it was previously frozen then fried.  I came here with my grandma for her 90th birthday (as well as my g/f and my Uncle).  She had a nice chat, in Polish, with the waitress. We wanted a family style meal for 4.  Busia asked the waitress to bring us out the best they had, served family style.  Waitress refused.  No.  We MUST order everything a la carte.  Fine.  We ordered 1 thing off each section of the menu...  pierogi's, blintzes, a chicken dish, a pork dish, and a beef dish.Where do I start?The "beef" was nasty.  Seriously, it looked like something you'd get in a 99 cent Banquet frozen dinner.  And that's how it tasted.The chicken was basically a breaded chicken kiev.  Again, 99 cents in your local Jewel freezer.  Gross.Breaded pork was not bad, blintzes were pretty good.  (The only reason this is not a 1 star review)The pierogi's were fair.  No seasoning whatsoever.My Polish grandma took one bite out of each thing, and refused to eat any more.  We packed up the leftovers for the dogs, begrudgingly paid, and left.Price for 4 people, NO drinks, over $60.00.Go to Paul Zakopane Harnas Restaurant or White Eagle.Hell, even the buffet at Red Apple is better than this place.Epic FAIL Barbakan.

5.description: Listen to me.  This place has the best polish tomato soup in the city.  End of story.  (Pork cutlet is awesome too!)

31.description: Ever get sick of paying too much for OK, find it at any restaurant food? Then head to Barbakan my friend. Great Polish food in a nice atmosphere.  I started with the sorrel soup which is to die for.  Then I had the veal cutlet which was amazing.  And everything is ridiculously cheap!  Great Polish beer too!I'll definitely be coming back.

25.description: So far these are the best pierogies that I have found (aside from my grandmothers, of course).  We all left here quite stuffed. I had their potato and cheese piergoies (vegetarians - be aware you need to order without bacon!!) and sampled some of their blueberry pierogi as well. Yum!  Others in my group had their cream of mushroom soup, and some sort of meat entrees that looked like they were quite good, even to my vegerain eyes. We had some of their jam blintzed for desert - tasty! I'd go again for sure.

12.description: the food here is great and so is the service. Only reason did not give it 5 stars is the inside could use a little make over and I think it would bring the place a lot more business. Great place though!

21.description: Outstanding white borscht and good schnitzels.  I'm not too fond of the pierogies.  Friendly service though not overly efficient.  Free parking across the street.  Great bang for the buck.

16.description: Barbakan is one of those places that turns out to be a gem once you get over the interior.The prices are very reasonable and the portions are huge. The food is gooooooooood, hearty Polish food. Probably the best in town. The soups are amazing!They also offer meal passes where you basically pre-pay for a full week's worth of homemade dinners.

17.description: Love this place! Inexpensive, delicious traditional Polish food. Basically anything you order to going to be delicious. I've gotten the devolay (chicken a'la devolay) and its amazing!! Great food, great service, great prices. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious authentic Polish food :)

10.description: An average food for a cheap price. Nothing really spectacular. Good place for a fast food lunch.

11.description: This is pretty simple polish food, without the frills.  It seems like the kinda place someone that grew up in Poland would go to.  Stop reading this review and get yourself a cutlet with kompot!

26.description: Barbakan is one of those places that turns out to be a gem once you get over the interior.The prices are very reasonable and the portions are huge. The food is gooooooooood, hearty Polish food. Probably the best in town. The soups are amazing!They also offer meal passes where you basically pre-pay for a full week's worth of homemade dinners.

27.description: Despite a pretty fancy website, the interior looks like a dive bar in a Polish college town, but it's a clean, friendly dive bar with fantastic food.7pm on a Saturday night wasn't busy at all, just a few groups of polish men and a couple hipsters. The menu isn't very descriptive, and the waitress was friendly and the service was good, but she had a hard time describing the dishes in more detail. They offer 5-6 different soups daily, we tried three and they were all great. The pierogies were perfect, and all our dinners were good, but the potato pancake stuffed with pork stew is definitely the star of the show, I could eat that every night for the rest of time.Prices are more than fair for good portions. Everyone but me got the small portions and was happy, I ordered the large and could have eaten two more, but most people will feel guilty after eating the large, ha.There's what appears to be a free parking garage for neighborhood businesses across the street, we didn't notice that until we'd fed the meter, which may explain why there were plenty of metered spaces right outside the door.I wish I could say 4.5 stars, I'm reluctant to give anywhere a 5-star review but this place comes darn close.

0.description: Rosa J. typically isn't afraid of going anywhere that appears hole-in-the-wall, but she hesitated this time with Barbakan Restaurant because of their extremely austere exterior.  Hubby said it was a point of no return.  Well, we sometimes really need to have faith in these Yelp reviews and hope this is one of those dinners to remember.  Some Yelpers have raved about their price points.  I would have to agree with them because I haven't found $1 kompot anywhere else but Barbakan.  Oh by the way, their soup changes daily and is $2.25 per bowl (as of 10/15/2015).  Polish tripe soup is available on Saturdays and Sundays, so BOLO for the little petite Rosa J. at Barbakan since she's a new resident in Portage Pork.  We had these following dishes for $19...incredible deal in the city...second to none: 1) two (2) orders of kompot: it's what many refer to as the Eastern European fruit punch, except it tastes way better than that sugar-saturated Hawaiian Fruit punch at a grocery store.  Give it a try!  2) Ukrainian borsch soup: it definitely didn't skimp on beans.  I was half-way full upon fishing this.  3) bean soup: hubby goes bananas on anything containing beans.  However, his name isn't Jack.  4) chicken livers: OMG...I was speechless!  They were crispy and flavorful.  I could have another small order to-go if I had two (2) stomaches.  5) potato pancakes: the small order came with four (4) pancakes.  I'm SO not Polish, yet I should really be a honorary one because I can live with potato pancakes and a bowl of borsch soup every day of my life!  Hubby and I went with the small orders on our entrees.  I couldn't imagine if someone with an average appetite would be able to finish a large order on anything here, unless you scale up in order to meet the minimum $25 purchase when using a debit or credit card.  We didn't have cash on hand and was informed with debit/credit card minimum-purchase policy.  However, the lady in the house gave us courtesy this time.  There was an ATM onsite, yet it was out of order.  I would like to express my gratitude to our fellow Polish Yelpers for recommending Barbakan.  It's located on the southeast corner of Belmont and Central.  Therefore, it's accessible via #77 (Belmont) and #85 (Central) CTA buses.

20.description: My favorite place to eat in Chicago!  If this were in my hometown I would go every day.  It's one of the best restaurants I have ever visted.  Make sure to try at least two soups!

19.description: This place is in front of a very nice parking garage in the middle of the shopping(??) district. The restaurant was STREET themed with polish TV playing. We orderedpierogies - ok, maybe more meaty?sauerkraut - ok, need more filling!chicken cutlet with cheese - ok, slightly drypork ribs - very good, falls off the bonepotato pancakes with stew - good, loved the contrastthe food was good but smak tak is better!

33.description: If you are looking for authentic delicious Polish food then look no further.  I have eaten at Barbakan countless times over the years and never had a bad experience.The soups are fabulous, and some personal favorites are the Jadlo Drwala (Lumberjack Meal), Placek Po Wegiersku (Potato Pancakes with Gulash).barbakanrestaurant.com

2.description: I went here with my son and husband for dinner. I chose it based on the fact that Jess Cafe was closed because it was a Monday. When we walked up, it looked closed. I was tempted to keep going to Central Gyros, but because of the nice yelp reviews I tried the door and it was open. There was a woman mopping the floor with vinegar. I asked if they were open and she said "yes, come on". My son and I sat down at one of the booths and she brought us menus. We were waiting for my husband. She came over a few minutes after handing us the menu and asked if we were ready, i said we were waiting for my husband. She said ok and took our drink order. Five minutes later she was back and said "ready." not a question, more of a command. I ordered cheese pirogi, meat pirogi, and stuffed cabbage. My son ordered polish sausage with onions. I order the Vienna schnitzel for my absent husband. The food is not good. The potato & cheese pirogi was ok. The meat was terrible. they were soggy. The stuffed cabbage came out with a BROWN gravy. I have only ever seen it with a tomato gravy. It was the same mystery meat that was in the meat pirogi. Tasted almost chalky. My husbands Vienna schnitzel was strange, dry and difficult to eat. My son won with his polish sausage. Probably the only legitimate tasty thing, probably because it wasn't made in house. No ice in the drinks. I would head up to Milwaukee and go to Staropolska if you want good Polish food. This place isn't a local treasure. It's a local dump.

32.description: There must be many "Babcias" working their little tushes off, back in the kitchen....the food is THAT authentic! This is THE place for Polish Comfort Food! Came here for lunch and was stuffed for the rest of the day, but in a good, satisfied way. Pure yumminess! We started with the soup. The Borscht, DEFINITELY homemade, and delicious! I ordered the Pork Stew wrapped in a huge, thin potato pancake. Did I say wrapped? I should say...."hugged." The meat was so tender, it just melted in my mouth. The potato pancake...thin, not greasy....perfect My lunch partner had "Boiled Beef in a creamy, horseradish sauce" I had bite, or two, excellent. Although, I know she was having Potato Pancake envy. The menu is in Polish, with English descriptions. The decor...well, just remember you're not going for the decor. It did have nice, tall, old, wooden, comfy booths. Very good service.I will definitely be back on a chilly afternoon. SECRET TIP....they have a coupon in The Entertainment Book!

18.description: I love Barbakan - I love the cold service, I love the cheap and delicious food, I love the total lack of knowing exactly what you are getting.  We had a plate of meat and cheese pierogi, a vienna schintzel and a pork cutlet, all with the side plates of pickles, cabbage and coleslaw and two drinks and all of that was only $24!!!  My plate came with a hard fried egg and dill mashed potatoes - yum.  Husband's cutlet was bigger than his head!!  And there were at least 7 or 8 pierogi in the small serving!

13.description: I'm not an expert on Polish food or even Eastern European cuisine. But this place is great. We were looking for good quality, inexpensive pierogi and landed here without knowing much else. We were probably the only native English speakers in the place - which I think is a ringing endorsement of its authenticity. The food (pierogi and all) was delicious. It was fast, tasty, and a great introduction to polish cuisine. I'd come here again in a heartbeat.

4.description: I have to admit, the first time I set foot in here I was creeped out.  The place was deserted, the atmosphere quiet, it almost seemed like the restaurant was a front for something...but then the food...oh the food.This place is incredible - the owner (I assume) is a very sweet Polish woman who doesn't speak much English (so you know it's authentic).  Her food was so delicious we stayed and asked for seconds.  We love coming here and it's a treat every time.This place doesn't advertise - it's only word of mouth and people who know that come here.  If the place is empty, it's because the locals are keeping it a secret.YUM!!!

24.description: Went here for an authentic Polish meal and that's exactly what I got!  The food was delicious and the pricing was great!!  I was a little disappointed with the service as there was one waitress for the entire restaurant and everything was super delayed.  The atmosphere is somewhat dark but relaxed.  I would definitely come back here again!

6.description: Being born in Poland I grew up eating home cooked polish dinners and each time I eat here I am not disappointed in anything, most of this food tastes so similar to the way my grandma made it.  If you ever wanted good homemade polish food but didn't know where to go then you have to come here.

22.description: It was a cool 63 degrees outside today but when I walked into the place it was about 15 degrees warmer. That should have tipped me off for what was to come but the reviews had been pretty good so I decided to stay. The server was freindly and helpfully answered my questions about some additional items on the menu that, as a non-pole, I could not decipher. Food was good but priced a little on the high side given the surroundings. The place looks like it may once have been a pizza joint (booths with wooden tables), polish soaps on tv and the aforementioned lack of ventilation. Put down my credit card to pay the check and was informed that there was a $25 MINIMUM for credit card payments. Really? When entrees go for five to ten bucks that means that even a party of four might not hit the magic number, which is of course purely arbitrary. So congratulations Barbakan, you saved money today by keeping the HVAC turned off in addition to the fifty cents or so in credit card fees by making me pay cash. But I won't be back because I have paid less for as good or better in much more pleasant sudroundings.And note to Yelp, I think that this place should be tagged cash-only.

15.description: Dont ever go to that place. All their food is cooked on old used oil, they dont care about the quality of food, its nasty, far fat away from how polish food should look and taste like. They are cheap for a simple reason. You pay cheap you get cheap food. They mess up your orders and enployes raise their voice if you make a complain. PLACE IS A JOKE!!!

7.description: Great service!! Great food.  Loved the pierogi sampler & potato pancakes.  Very filling.  Also had the chicken cutlet with cheese to finish which was a mistake.  It was great but we were too full to really enjoy it.  Will definitely go again!

8.description: Hole in the wall with some of the best Polish food in Chicago. My favorite is white borsch and sztuka miesa w sosie chrzanowym.

30.description: We were very pleased with the food and the service. I had the white borscht soup and veal cutlet which were excellent. Most entrees are available in small or large portions. If you're going with some soup and pierogi I suggest the small size because the portions are generous. Four of us ate for $45, not including drinks. Soft drinks are only $1.00.If I lived in the area I would get their $55 meal pass for seven meals good for 30 days.I hate driving into the city and trying to find (and pay for) a parking spot and I haven't yet had to figure out those new parking boxes. But, GOOD NEWS, there is a free garage directly across the street from Barbakan! I may go there again just for the parking!

3.description: As a Polish girl, sometimes I LIKE to eat a bite of polish dish. When I do I go to BARBAKAN and I eat a soup and potato pancakes with sour cream.Just try mushroom, chicken or tomato soup and don't forget about pancakes. BEST of THE BEST is the white borsch for sure. Good quality of FOOD for a good price. When I am there I feel like I am back in Poland in my collage years.... and feels GOOD :)

14.description: My recommendation for the best, authentic polish food in town. Unfortunately, my group of friends met here for dinner at 730 and they close at eight. Yelp is very misleading with the 10 pm close time on friday!

3.description: Hands downs the best Puerto Rican food next to my grandmas. Great prices and service. Every time we have an event we always carter from them.

1.description: We just had dinner at this place and had the hands-down best Puerto Rican dinner ever! The Yelp rating does not lie,  well worth the drive from anywhere in the city or surrounding suburbs. this inconspicuous Puerto Rican hole in the wall  delivers a pleasant surprise with its food considering it's cafeteria style counter and minimal decoration.  Don't be alarmed by the cafeteria style hot box at the register. The papa rellena was incredibly moist and for the low price of one dollar it can't be beat. The pastelillo filling was delicious and this corn based dessert (didn't get the name of it) really hit the spot at the end of the meal. We also tried the steak jibaritos with arroz con gandules and I have to say it brought me back to eating in my best friend's mother's kitchen as a child.  The staff also  had a welcoming and attentive demeanor. We can't wait to go back for more.

2.description: Tried this place out based on the reviews. Pleased to say the food was fresh and delicious. Definitely coming back. Keep up the great work.

5.description: Excellent food! Rice to die for rice n shrimp soup shrimp n rice chicken stew papa relleno pastel oh my goodness its all addicting. Waits can be long to order and to pay they are super nice and doing their best. Nothing fancy but you willnot be able to stay away huge portions

6.description: Steak Sandwich and the Pasteles is what I had and they were delicious! As far as flavor and taste goes, this is my favorite in the Chicago area and I have been to quite a few P.R. restaurants. My wife loves their lechon and rellenos de papa.

7.description: I have come to the conclusion that this is some of the best Puerto Rican cuisine in the city. At first glance it looks like your typical cafeteria-style Puerto Rican joint we have grown oh so accustomed to in Chicago, all-white interior with a fritura window prominently displayed next to the cashier/order counter, mismatched chairs--you catch my drift. However, the food is extremely delectable. Not overly greasy unlike so many other PR restaurants, and the rice was good--none of that orange slime left behind. You know what I'm talking about. I have been here many times and the food never disappoints... Except one time.. We ordered platano and it looked like it was sitting out all day in the Sahara. The owner walked by, took one look at it, and asked why we didn't say anything. She then kindly explained, en español, that if customers don't bring problems to her attention then she cannot improve their experience nor her establishment. Some customers might leave and never come back and she will never know why. She immediately took the plate then brought us a freshly prepared one that tasted out of this world delicious. Phenomenal service. While the interior décor may leave much to be desired, the food music and service make up for it. Incredible f----in sandwiches.

0.description: The food is always fresh, flavorful and plentiful. Beautiful people with great service!

4.description: Just like my abuela's food. The food is delicious,  affordable and authentic. I had to force myself to stop eating. Ordering ahead would be a good idea here because they have been very busy every time I go. I'm one to choose delivery over pick up any day but for food from Las Delicias de Puerto Rico, I don't care about the drive at all- it is well worth it!

1.description: I always drove past the place I never went in the food here is amazing and the waitress told me there is music Wednesdays forward which I would really like to make it to soon.  I ordered a large shrimp soup . Omg amazing. A lot of the times places are stingy with shrimp not this place a lot of shrimp very tasteful very big bowl. It was empty at that time the waitress so was doubly very sweet attentive and saw that I was sick and made sure I had my lemon the food was good and I'm excited to bring my family to try more

0.description: This by far THEE best Mexican restaurant that I've been too!!! The Micheladas are great! The empanadas de Camaron are delicious! There's even chunks of shrimp unlike other places where the shrimp is cut up in little pieces. I've also tasted the shrimp cocktail and I absolutely didn't have to add anything to it like I usually do. The waitresses are so nice  and attentive and the owner makes it appoint to be there to make sure everything is running smoothly.

3.description: I'm all natural african american. I usually get a blow out or wear my hair in twists. Onieda the co-owner was who I spoke with on the phone and who did my hair. She didn't recoil and I saw plenty of products from combs to styling products for dealing with a 4b texture. I didn't feel that my hair wasn't moisturized including the scalp or conditioned long enough. It was a bit of a drive about 35 minutes so a later time on Saturday or Sunday is probably a good thing. I was started as soon after hanging up my coat. I haven't had a relaxer or texturizer in over 8 years so I didn't feel that she was going to sneak a chemical in that I didn't want. She did inform me that they do keratin if I was interested. My hair is soft and smooth throughout so I will know how long it lasts on average after this week. I usually can go with maybe just blowing out the roots and using the flat iron if I perspire or get too much steam in the shower. Otherwise I just pin curl or use rollers and a silk scarf. I will definitely go back for a reasonable styling and may try to bring my mom who has a texture more similiar to the ladies in the salon and likes color. Overall not the experience I was dreading. You can also pay with your credit/debit card, parking is metered on the street and looks to be free on most of the side streets so pay attention to your signage. This area has a lot of apartments so it's similar to the north side in respects to parking.

1.description: Oneida and Miriam are awesome. I haven't had this type of hair care since I left NYC, oh and the price Is super reasonable . Very satisfied . Thank you Oneida .

2.description: First, let me say that the ladies are sweethearts & you can tell she the owner has loyal followers.  The thing is that the place is more of a free-for-all hang out; sort of like a barber shop can be for a lot of men.  It's cool if you have the patience to wait forever, but I'm not one of those customers.  I HATE being made to wait, especially after having made reservations!  I waited almost 2 hours for service, paid a pretty penny for my roots not to be covered correctly, & found that there were several longer chunks of hair missed when having it trimmed!  It was certainly not worth going there to get my hair taken care of but if I ever want to just go shoot the shit with a bunch of ladies, buy beauty products or tickets to some local dance or concert, I guess this is the place to be!

5.description: My name is Sharon.I go there weekly.My stylist name is Merriam.She have a great personality.She have been doing hair for over 25 years.She does an excellent job.Their also very reasonable with pricing.there are also 2 more stylist there.I just happen to get Merriam that day. They are all good stylist.Friendly atmosphere and they treat you like family.I love it there.They play music, and sometimes we watch TV.
