We eat there too.I pick my time and day to go there when it is not crowded.They are closed only on Wednesday.I am not Dominican, I am a sister.They treat me like family.So if you want to look Great,with affordable pricing,family atmosphere,choose your day and time to go,or walk in whenever you want to ,and still be seen by your stylist this is the place for you.They also do eyebrows.Last but not least, you can get your nails ,and pedicure there.I have been going there for about 6 months. I am from the ATL and I had very high expectations, she met everyone.

0.description: People with curly hair: You do not need an iron or chemical process to strength your hair. This is a DOMINICAN hair salon, and when it comes to curly and difficult hair they are the best.I drive 30-40 minutes all the way to  the West side of Chicago and is worthed. You can either show up or make a previous appointment. The staff is really friendly and professional, they have a lot of experience and specialize on curly hair, whether you need a blow dry, Keratin treatments or even a relaxer. They are also very affordable, since this is not exactly a fancy salon.

4.description: The service wasn't bad. In fact the service was amazing. They are super attentive. I just didn't get the result that I was looking for and I question their knowledge on how to do hair in a healthy way. *Shrug* Guess I'm back to flying to NYC for my relaxers. O well

1.description: Excellent service, new update in my account should be a lot better then old plan. All phones unlimited talk and text plus 4.5 gig data for all phones including home line, which is not a cell phone and it don't need data.  After all I should pay about $180.00, good deal, that's what nice person working there said, but what a surprise,  my bill was  $238.00 at he first month. I thought that it's always some extra cost at the first month, but next month another surprise, instead of lower bill it was even higher $242.00. Came back with question, why my bill is so high and answer was so dumb that the data is high, blah blah. My home phone data was active, but I never need it in first place, all was messed up. I had to change everything again in my plan. I hate when people who are doing their job don't know what they're doing. Or maybe they know exactly what they're doing, but thinking that I'm stupid.  Who knows what's gonna be on my next bill? Another surprise? Will see.

0.description: They were great Alex helped me today my phone was hacked into and he took care of it all. Amazing customer service.
I haven't been here like in 14 months, but the last haircut I got it was good. Bringing my son for a haircut. I'll be able to update my review afterwards.

I have been waiting for a great pupusaria to open up, and my wait is finally over! The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and the pupusas are filling, affordable, and (most importantly) yummy, especially with the curtido and green salsa!I also tried the pollo de tajadas, which was delicious. The chicken had great flavor, and it was served on a bed of cabbage and tostones. This was a pleasant surprise! You need to check out this new spot! You won't regret it!

3.description: So, I am not one who goes to Big Lots but my family was coming in to town and I "played" with the idea of buying a Christmas tree for the occasion.  I walked into Big Lots and my first thought was WOW this store has a lot of stuff.  I decided to pass on the tree but picked up a few items  that were fairly inexpensive.  I can't say that I will become a regular but I can now say that I have BEEN to Big Lots.

1.description: Bobs Red Mill products!!! Cheaper than anywhere else!!! Gluten-free, wheat free these terms also mean expect to pay more money! However all is not lost when you go to Big Lots.I was able to purchase several items for almost half the price of the same brand in Whole Foods or as I call it "whole paycheck".Its definitely worth the trip! The staff is extremely helpful & pleasant as well. Customer Service is important to me as much as saving money!!!

2.description: I was passing by on Diversey and there was a guy with a sandwich board proclaiming 20% off of everything at this Big Lots. My curiosity was peaked and I stopped in.The name of this chain store reminds of a song called Big Fun by Inner City. OK so my brain works funny. But at 20% off we're definitely having Big Fun at Big Lots.I didn't really need anything so I stocked up on essentials like detergent, tp and other paper products and some gardening supplies.I've bought coffee from them before and agree with Amaliya that you can find some decent coffee at a good price. I picked up some Margaritaville coffee which was $4.00 after the 20% off. It's $10.95 on Ebay or Amazon and surprisingly good.If you live in the area or are passing by, a good place to stock up and check out the current closeouts that come through the store.Bonus: same strip mall as Super Pollo.Oh, and now for a techno moment: Big Fun by Inner Cityyoutube.com/watch?v=omfi…

5.description: stopped in with my gf & of course she loves this place cuz she wants 2 decorate the house. ended up gettin 2 cool pic frames & some other household things. ive always been a fan of this place but sometimes the stores can get a bit unorganized & messy. this one wasnt so bad at all. if im in this area then will stop by.

6.description: This is like an overgrown dollar store.  Most things cost more than $1, but the quality and value is pretty much the same.  Still, a fun place to get those random things for cheap.  Especially holiday decorations.

7.description: This store is sort of a mess, but they usually have a good selection of bedding and kitchen gadgets. I've also found some good deals on items for basic car maintenance. Four new floor mats for $12? And they're nice? Score.I prefer to drive a bit further out to Niles to the Big Lots on Dempster because it's a nicer store despite being in a smaller space.

8.description: Seriously. Anyone who is not insane will love Big Lots. I get all my kitchen items from here. For example: I've seen some of their stuff (mainly Farberware) at Bed Bath and Beyond for twice the price. These include stovetop/oven utensils, counter accessories, flatware, etc. They also have good storage bins/waste baskets and some cleaning supplies. You can get bottled water for cheap and some hair products. This particular location has decent furniture, not the best... but you can check it out often for new shipments. I wouldn't buy anything that you need to do heavy-duty work with, though.  All in all, you save tons of cash, especially if you bargain shop.I got a Pier 1 piece for 60% there!

9.description: I love, love, LOVE Big Lots!  It is full o' bargains!  Household items,  groceries, pet supplies, furniture -- you name it -- it's all there.  One caveat -- Big Lots is a closeout store., so their stock of merchandise varies from week to week.  You might find your favorite laundry detergent there on one visit (for $2) and not see it when you go back.  It's really a browsy sort of store.  You always find stuff you need at incredible bargains.  But, if you find stuff that use love and use often, SNATCH IT UP!  They may not have it at all next time!

0.description: Checking this place out!Incredibly great/low prices onSo much in here!So worth the trip out here!,,It's been a while since I've been out this way, I actually used to live about2 Blocks away from here about 8 years ago, used to come out quite a bit andpick up some great deals.So, all these years later wasn't quite sure what to expect as I walked throughthe doors into Big Lots..Here are some of the great things that I found..Lots of Christmas Items, Trees, Snowmen, Lights, so as far as your decoratingneeds go they have you covered and at really great low prices.All sorts of Holiday Gift Sets, packaged beautifully, lots of Holiday Food/GiftItems, Popcorn Tins and other really great creative items.Many various items for your Feline or Canine Pals, my pals are Felinesso I made sure to get them some great Christmas Catnip Pillows..Cat Food, Dog Food, and the always needed item kitty litter, the good stuff,the really good clumping kind, believe me when I say you don't want to dealwith cheap kitty litter that does'nt clump.. messy and yuck!!Yes, only the best for my Feline Pals..A great selection of Housewares, Dishes, Cups, Mugs, Silverware, Cookware,Small Appliances..Linens, Sheet Sets, Blankets, at rock bottom prices.Lotsa Toys, more girly stuff than Boys Stuff, saw lotsa Barbies and Bratz Dolls..Some Nice Really, Big Stuffed Animals, Like 4 feet tall!Loved the Rocking Horses I saw today, don't remember ever riding one in mychildhood but it looked like fun...Also, a great Health and Beauty Section where I found a big containerof Lady Mitchum for $2.20.. this stuff is like $4.50 at Walgreens for the same size,,,normally I don't discuss deodorant but this was definitely wortha mention..So, Not quite sure how Big Lots continues to keep these really greatRockBottom/Low Prices but they do..And, yes, visually, some of the aisles may look kind of disheveled but theshelves are all pretty well stocked..It's really worth it to make this a store to visit because for myself, who doesn'twant/need to save some money?So many positives here, truly..After all these years Big Lots still impresses me,and usually maintaining that longis not an easy task..But, it still seems to be working for them..And, with other businesses folding and going under this is definitely good news..Keep up the good work Big Lots, I know I'll be returning...

4.description: I have absolutely no shame in admitting that I love Big Lots.  They recently just started a reward card where you can gain 20% off coupons after making 10 purchases of at least $20.  I just received one the other day for joining and you betcha I made a bee line for Big Lots.  I openly admit that I am OCD and a neat freak.  I am obsessed with the sterilite 5 drawer storage units at Big Lots.  I use them in my pantry to organize tupperware, and I use them to organize my sons toys.  It makes cleaning and organizing fast and efficient.  They're see thru so kids find what they want asap and know where their toys belong.  I also scored with heavy duty 6 hook chrome over the door hangers to hang up his hoodies and jackets.  Love that I can completely organize for very little money.  I also discovered their coffee.  I drink at minimum a pot a day.  They have something very similar to  Mexican Espresso that only costs $3.50 for 2lbs.  I really really love this coffee.I have also discovered that they sell some great discontinued toys that are hard to find and sought after on eBay.

1.description: Ordered delivery from this place and it was just awful. Right from the moment our food got delivered down to its consumption. Delivery man first called to say he was downstairs, but really wasn't. I explained that he should be around a building with a white fence, he agreed and I had my boyfriend go down to get the food. After about a minute or so, the delivery man called me again YELLING that he was downstairs. I repeated the address and that he should be around a white fence. He then hung up on me. I looked outside to see if there was a car or if the delivery man was anywhere around. He was parked about 5 houses down and as he approached my building, I tapped the window and he aggressively pointed, demanding that I come downstairs even though my boyfriend was waiting right there. Next is the food. We ordered beef pho-- side of broth, I guess? All the places I've gone to for, pho have an insane amount of broth to go with the noodles. Nope, not this place. And the fried wonton?.....I won't even waste my time, here. Overall, not a place I'd be ordering or eating from again.

9.description: Not what I expected at all.  This place EXCEEDED my expectations.  I ordered the combination pad Thai, spring rolls, crab Rangoon, combination fried rice, and the general tsao chicken for delivery.  Quick delivery.  I opened up my first order the pad Thai.  WOW! The presentation for this dish was beautiful, keep in mind this was delivery.  The spring rolls AMAZING, ok I expected some fried spring rolls but these were different in the clear wrap with fresh veggy stuffing, the size of these rolls were HUGE. It came with this tasty sauce and my favorite chili sauce (I've always had to pay extra for this sauce at my old Chinese favorite restaurant. ..not here though). Again the presentation was lovely and appetizing.  Everything else tasted really fresh and incredibly great.  The crab Rangoon was nicely made and also nice in presentation.  I was really impressed, this will be my new favorite Chinese restaurant. I wish I would have taken pictures but I was so hungry and I hate when people take photos of their food lol. Oh I received complimentary cookies with the little message papers inside of them, the name of these escape my mind but I was delightfully surprised. And I received a free Thai ice tea, not even a small one but a decent sized one. It was refreshingly delicious. What a nice gesture. I did not expect such great quality food at such an affordable price.  It almost seemed like an insult on my end to eat this food as delivery or take-out.  I'm born and raised in Chicago, a place where good food is common but this food was beyond my expectations. Awesome job.  I can't say enough.

23.description: They are awsome and have really good food they always greet you with a smile. I Love this place.

12.description: It's an amazing place with amazing food! The shrimp sour soup is the best! The only problem I have is the lack of spiciness. Overall is the best Chinese food I ever had!!

21.description: Moving is never complete until you find a Chinese place. Kim Long has great food and great service. The man working the counter was extremely nice and didn't rush me to order. The do have lunch specials, but if you don't make it for them their food is not expensive. The Singapore noodles were AMAZING! The orange chicken and pot stickers are also great. Oh...and the portions let me have left overs for a couple days which I love. They take pickup orders--which don't take very long and they deliver.

16.description: I really like the food and people @ Kim Long's.The lunch specials are tough to beat.The new address is 5114 W. Fullerton and it's worth the drive.

17.description: this place is going to be remodeled and it has a different location as well that's brand new. It's on fullerton and Leclair just before laramie. They have a bakery cafe next door as well and the smoothie is mighty good! Im love with the smoothies and the tapioca are really chewy just they way i like it.

10.description: A hidden treasure of the Craigin neighborhood. Simply amazing. I love the food, the prices, and the service. Dollar for dollar, this the best restaurant in the area. I used to go to their previous location for years but I'm glad this new spot is just as good but with an updated space. Some will disagree but the egg rolls here are the best! They're crispy, not soggy or bread, like. Enjoy!

5.description: I ordered egg foo young and egg drop soup.  BOTH had shells.  Put me off my meal completely and I will never order from them again.  I seriously can't stand a place that doesn't take care with things like that.  It's inexcusable.  That said, their one redeeming quality was the beef fried rice which I did like, but I only ordered a small because I thought that the rest of the food was going to be sufficient.

11.description: I have always loved this place the food is awesome and the price are so affordable! They also cook very fast and thoroughly. Good for delivery as well.

22.description: The food here is good, fast delivery as well! However, the delivery man had an attitude, that's why he ONLY got a $2 tip, smh.

0.description: Very surprised with how good this food is. There's a couple of dishes I judge a restaurant on if they can't nail it. For Chinese cuisine, it's the egg rolls and a chicken dish. Long story short, Kim Long's egg rolls are some of the best I've had. With the chicken, I ordered traditional Thai fried chicken wings and an order of Szechuan chicken. Both dishes had great flavor. The wings weren't big, but had a nice crunch to them. A plus is that they have about 5 or 6 different types of wing flavors to choose from.Ordering was a breeze. Even on new years eve, Kim Long had my wait time only at 20 minutes. Mind blowing, and made me very happy considering Jess Café told me 4 hours wait time -_-. I picked up my order so I didn't dine in, but I did get a view of the inside. It's small, but has plenty of seating. Jess Cafe was my first choice, but with the ridiculous wait times, I chose to bite the bullet and go somewhere new. I'm glad I did. Kim Long will be my go-to spot for Chinese for now on. And for dessert, don't forget to stop by next door for a delicious donut at Something Sweet.

20.description: This place has a great food and service. The orange chicken is really good and the price is reasonable. I really recommend this place.

19.description: Everyone here is nice. Delivery is crazy fast. I like what I like and that's really the key. If you're in the neighborhood try out the menu if you don't like one thing try something else.

2.description: Food was good but ordered it online - requested steamed potstickers, and got fried.  Diet Coke and received regular Coke. Tiny box of rice for a larger sizes Mongolian beef - so request more rice.  Delivery took well over an hour.

18.description: Moving is never complete until you find a Chinese place. Kim Long has great food and great service. The man working the counter was extremely nice and didn't rush me to order. The do have lunch specials, but if you don't make it for them their food is not expensive. The Singapore noodles were AMAZING! The orange chicken and pot stickers are also great. Oh...and the portions let me have left overs for a couple days which I love. They take pickup orders--which don't take very long and they deliver.

13.description: I have been eating Kim long food for over ten years. I love the egg rolls. The crispy chicken wings are good.

4.description: I have to say, the best thing about this place is the service, followed by the decor. That's about all this restaurant has going for it. The food doesn't look bad (on the contrary, it looks quite appetizing), but it's just, well... FLAVORLESS. It pains me to say this, because I love supporting local businesses, but people are outa their damn minds if they think this is 'great' Chinese food. Check your tastebuds. Seriously. It isn't even 'good.' It baffles me how words like these can even be associated with this establishment. Being born and raised in this city, outside of Chinatown, there have only been 4 Chinese restaurants that I can say are good-to-great:- Mon Lung (Wicker Park area) - Hands down my favorite- Tony's Chinese (Cragin area)- Very good, but sadly they don't deliverAnd the other two are no longer in existence. Brutal honesty aside, I really hope the owners of this place aspire to taking more pride in what they serve, because aside from the food, everything else is great! Please, please, PLEASE make an effort because this area needs good Chinese that delivers!!!

6.description: I come here often when I have a craving for Chinese food. They conveniently have different sizes for portions. I usually get an extra large fried fried which serves at least 3 people. Food is fresh and staff is always friendly. Highly recommend to try their smoothies as well! They're deliciousss!

15.description: Everyone gave good reviews for this place so I decided to try it out. Delivery was fast and also putting in the order was smooth. I had beef pad Thai, general tso, shrimp fried rice, crab Rangoon, and also fried shrimp. The food was good just lacked flavor, but it was fresh. If it had flavor it would been perfect ! Maybe next time

7.description: I ordered through grubhub and wanted to try a new Chinese restaurant and came across this 4 star place. It was the most disgusting, grainy, soggy, poorly seasoned Chinese food I've ever had. I ordered the chicken noodle soup, chicken chow mein, and chicken & broccoli lunch meal with fried rice. The fried rice was dry and had a gross texture and taste. Everything I ordered was so bad I threw it all away, all $30 of it. Bummer that their rating didn't reflect their quality accurately.

8.description: This Chinese restaurant is superior to all other Chinese restaurants in my area strictly based on their amazing egg rolls. I've ordered from many Chinese restaurants throughout my lifetime from all over Chicago and have found that many do not serve homemade egg rolls, but rather a frozen brand with a horribly seasoned cabbage filling and thick nasty dough. Not Kim Long. They are a small family owned businesses, and I've actually witnessed the Grandfather hand rolling their egg rolls in their restaurant dining room. They use a paper thin egg roll wrapping sheet and fill it with their own homemade filling. They deep Fry em till they're golden brown and amazing. Even when ordering for delivery, the always arrive with that amazing crispy outer shell when you bite into them followed by a fresh & well seasoned filling. I always order the same thing: Barbeque Pork fried rice, extra dark & with extra scallions. On occasion Ill order the pot stickers which are huge but taste just okay or the vegetable lo mein which is also just okay. I never order anything else from here so I really can't review any other dish, but my boyfriend is not a fan of their Orange Chicken, so avoid that I suppose.      All together my favorite lil Chinese spot

3.description: I have a ritual of going to Somethin' Sweet Donuts every weekend for a doughnut fix. On my last visit, I asked the woman behind the counter about Kim Long Restaurant, wondering if she had gone there. She gave me a modest, "It's okay" response. It was considerably better than okay.Hong Kong milk tea. Hot and sour soup. Salt and pepper shrimp. Shrimp in lobster sauce.I'm hooked on the Hong Kong milk tea. The hot and sour soup had a lot more flavour to it than what I've had at Americanized Chinese restaurants. The salt and pepper shrimp was a winner. I wasn't expecting the head to be attached to the shrimp and once I got the shell off, it was all good. I'm addicted to the shrimp in lobster sauce.When I was leaving, I saw an older woman who used to be at Somethin' Sweet Donuts when I was going there. She mentioned that the doughnut shop and Kim Long Restaurant are family owned. I guess my ritual now will be to go to Kim Long for dinner and then to Somethin' Sweet Donuts for my usual doughnut dessert fix.

14.description: My family and I use to order from this place all the time back when their location was on Armitage and Kostner. The other day I found out they had moved locations so I decided to order food for my mom's birthday. I called the place and ordered some food. I was very, very disappointed when I got home and opened up all the food.First of all, for $6.95, the amount of Mongolian Shrimp I got was just disappointing. It could barely feed a person. White rice was suppose to come with it and it was a misery. It was a small box with basically 2 scoops of rice in there. I was disappointed because I spent $30 on their food and I received enough to feed maybe 3-4 people with no seconds. Before we would order about $27 worth of food and we would eat a lot between 4 people and even have seconds and left overs. Not worth it. I am disappointed in this place and I would not recommend it to anyone.

12.description: They advertise Asada and al pastor in there menu I call twice different day they never have it,they tell me that there going to have it the next day.This not good way to run a business

3.description: This place has great pizza and really helpful and friendly staff members such as Heather. I will be frequenting this fine establishment more and more now that I have had a taste of their sweet delicious pizza pie. YUMMY!!!!!!

1.description: First time visit today I walked in very nice place small and cozy.  Watched a little tv  and had the best slice that I had in a while there sausage taste like old school pizza joints when i was kid. I will return with the wife and kids

2.description: A nice little neighborhood spot on Belmont just east of central. This neighborhood (my neighborhood) is seriously lacking the wonderful culinary and drinking spots I so much crave. So I am constantly on the lookout for so called "hidden gems" that are close to home. I am not sure I would quite call this place a hidden gem but the pizza is the best I have found in this hood.They have only been open for one month at this point. Catalina's is clean, the customer service was excellent and a solid 14" pizza for $7 is a pretty fine deal. In addition, on Tuesdays they have a $1 slices which is quite an awesome deal along with .50 wings. So far so good. The pizza is not the best I have ever had but it's a solid option this close to home. The crust was quite crunchy almost like a breadstick, which is better than a gummy, doughy crust some places have. Their sauce and cheese tasted fresh and the sausage was good although lacking a spicy kick which I usually like.Overall a very fine option for the neighborhood. Definitely a place I will come back to.

9.description: (Did not try the pizza). I ordered rotisserie half chicken and chesse burger with side of mac& chesse and mashed potatoes thru grub hub. the food was horrible! Problem #1Raw burger and halfway cooked fries #2 rotisserie chicken seasoning and sides super bland no flavor both. Looked like it was the instant kind that you microwave and the chicken was barley cooked enough to not get you sick:-( never again not even to try the pizza.

10.description: Great people work there. They are very friendly and good at what they do. Joey took our order and the cook Jesus was awesome. Cant complain for dollar slices, gyro, and a philly. Loved it will be coming back again when we get free time or are in the area.

4.description: Should have order pizza hut... I mean the delivery was fast and the guy was nice but the pizza had no taste and  the crust was a little doughy . never again

6.description: The pizza is mediocre at best. Ordered a salad to go with it.  It was so drenched in dressing it was inedible.  This place isn't competing.  There are much better pizza options available in this town.  Don't waste your money on this place.

0.description: Yum! I got a slice of sausage pizza It was huge and crispy and gooey!I added some jalapeños and I ate the whole thing- something I never do, but this was just too good to put down.

5.description: The pizza is so good they have a $7.00 mediam pizza that looks like a large and they close at midnight. 5 stars in my book

13.description: I have been here many times and have not been disappointed once. Everything ive ordered so far has been delicious. They use fresh ingredients and its obvious in the taste and quality of the food. I would definitely go back.

11.description: This place has really good pizza. I had the thin crust which was not that thin but still really good. We got the large which is really big can stuff 4 people depending how much they can eat.They messed up my order, I noticed once I got in the car, I had ordered through grubhub half  pepperoni half sausage, but I guess they didn't see the special instructions and made the pizza half pepperoni half cheese, I went back inside and kindly told them about the mistake and they were more than happy to change it, I had to get pepperoni on the other half because sausage wouldn't cook in time but it wasn't a hassle they were very helpful. Definitely coming here again!

8.description: I ordered for the first time here because they left me a menu on my doorstep. Well DO NOT ORDER a shake. My sons wanted one and they got ICY milk no flavor. Really if you don't know how to make shakes.....take it off the menu! I had to throw it out. The pizza was good but I had better, Gyro was good but the Italian beef was not that great.   Don't think I'll ordered again sorry.

14.description: Today was the first time vising Catalina's which I've past several time due to me living in the area and my first impression was the environment and the staff was really friendly which is always an A+ for me and my son and I also dine in he had the double pizza puff and I had the beef sandwich it was so amazing that when our food was done I served it to us I had never had that happen at a fast food restaurant which was very impressive and they also gave my son free refills on his soda. The only con was that I order american cheese to be on my beef and they forgot which wasn't a big deal to me because I know everyone makes mistakes but other than that I highly recommend this place!!

7.description: There was no taste to the burger meat we ordered nor the Gyros meat. All of the juices and taste were pressed or frozen out of them. Odd. The fries and pizza puff were ok, but then again it is pretty hard to mess up deep fried food. The food came quick and was of good temperature. I will give them that.

12.description: You really can't beat the price at this place! It's only $5 for a haircut! I also got my eyebrows threaded and it was also $5! What a great deal!? I've never asked for any other services besides those two so I'm only reviewing those services. Some of the people there don't speak English very well, but they understand when I want a few inches cut off.

3.description: I got to #7 to get my eyebrows done. She's wonderful. Quick and listens to what I want. I've never been disappointed and for $5, not much can beat it.

1.description: The 5 stars ONLY belong to girl #1, she is the best! She has been the only person to do my eyebrows consistently awesome every single time. They look so clean and they're shaped very professional....especially for $5. No $30 eyebrow wax/thread at a "fancy" spa can get you that quality of service.  Fast, consistent, super sweet, and honest.  However, I don't know if it's management....but keep the damn place cleaner! Take some pride in your job and invest in your workers. Warning, it's not fancy, but you get more for what you pay for....especially with girl #1. Cash only. Call ahead to see what days she's off.

2.description: This place is a butcher shop and very unprofessional. I took my son there for a haircut to keep his curls on the top and shaved down on the sides and instead the barber shaved him completely  bald. The barber was very rude from the start and was still being rude when told this is not what we asked for. If this is what we wanted we could have done this ourself at home for free. Will never go there again and will let everyone we know in this area not to go there either. Horrible service and if I could they would get zero stars.

9.description: I had low expectations for this place just from past experience but I walked in and asked for my hair to be cut and the woman I had, Diane was very nice and cut my hair exactly how I wanted it! I only give 4 stars because the guy at the desk was an asshole.

10.description: DONIKA is at chair #1 by the window and she is the eyebrow queen!!!I am 21 years old and I have been getting my eyebrows done by her since I was in the 6th grade. I have moved away, but whenever I am in Chicago I come to her. No where else have I ever gotten a better thread/wax. She does both. She never disappoints, always recognizes me when I walk in, and asks about my mother and sister. She is extremely professional and extremely talented.If you want perfect eyebrows, go to Donika she is the BEST.

4.description: Took my boys there. Very GOOD! Girl #7 to the right was EXCELLENT n SWEET. She took good care of them. I thought I was going to pay more but to my surprise $10!! The staff was also very friendly.

6.description: I go to Kim to get my eyebrows threaded. She does a great job. She does as she is told. I don't like my eyebrows thin and she makes sure they are not. She does a perfect job in shaping them as well. Hope she doesn't go anywhere, I'm tried of having to look around for someone to do great eyebrow treading.

0.description: I do not let anyone touch my eyebrows but Kim. She is the best!!!!! She doesn't leave them too thin and always gives them a beautiful shape:)

5.description: I came in on a Thursday night to have my eyebrows threaded. Finding parking was tough but eventually I found a space. I walked in was greeted and sent to booth #2. At first I was nervous because it was a male that was going to do my eyebrows. All I have to say is dont judge a book by its cover!!! Best threading I have ever had! He was so gentle quick and did a awesome job. All for 5 bucks! How can you beat that???I believe his name is Ashor ask for booth #2 he is great!

13.description: Now opens Sundays.  Parking on the streets could be a challenge.

11.description: Go to the lady on #1 by the windows.  THE BEST whether doing eyebrows or hair. Perfect for when you need a haircut in a hurry or low on cash

8.description: I LOVE this place! $5 for top notch service is what keeps me coming. Sound crazy? Not if you patiently wait for Salwa. She works kind of slow, but try to see it as individual attention for EVERY client. She ALWAYS cuts my hair and threads my eyebrows. My layered haircut is always complimented as well as my eyebrows. I only give 4 stars instead of 5 because parking is street parking and there never is any after 2pm so consider going early. I've been going to Salwa for about 7 years now? I got her by chance when she was still a rookie and I was in a hurry. BOY was I blessed!!! I'd cry if she ever left and didn't say anything!

14.description: For $5 you can't complain. Although after I physically showed Luisa I'd only like 2 inches taken off my hair I practically had to pull the scissors from her hands after 5 inches were on the floor. Good layers, nice cut but don't go scissor happy on my head.

7.description: They consistently stay unreliable when it comes to sticking with their hours of business. Closing at 7am, when their business of hours are at 730am as posted on their sign. They really need to step it up. I always relied on this place.  Shame on me for for not going else where. But it's a New year.

3.description: Excellent selection of alcohol/liquor.  Great hours compared to other liquor stores!

1.description: Great family owned business with friendly service and excellent beer, liquor and wine selection!

2.description: I love that this is a family owned and run business!!  They always have a great selection of liquor.  Also, I never worry about parking because they have a parking lot. This place is clean, safe, and organized! Thank you S&L!!

0.description: After moving to Chicago about 2 years ago I told my family back in Michigan that surprisingly even though Chicago is a large city it has some of the friendliest people a person could want to meet.  The family that runs this store is a fine example of what I was telling my family about the people here.  I know it's good business to be nice to the customers, but these fine folks take it up another level.  They make you feel like they really are glad to see you.  Other businesses could learn a lot from these people!As far as what they have available in their store it's a typical convenience store with a good selection of beer, liquor, pop, chips cigarettes, candy and of course a selection of a few common staples that you might find you need in a pinch but don't feel like going all the way to a grocery store to get.  The prices are pretty typical of convenience store pricing.  They do have a parking lot so you don't have to worry about finding on street parking.One big advantage of patronizing this store is that a lot of the local police like to take their breaks at this store so it's not uncommon to have 2 or more uniformed officers in the store when you walk in.  I don't think of this area as a high crime area, but it's nice to know that the odds of this store ever getting robbed are about nonexistent due to the police presence.  You can feel safe going here at any time of night.  With the regular appearances of police at this store a person would have to be really stupid to ever try and rob it.With the super friendly service here it truly deserves the 5 star rating that I and others have rated it.  Stop in, I'm sure you'll end up agreeing.

4.description: big variety of liquor, great parking.

28.description: I went to Taco Burrito King on my Lunch Break with a Co- Worker. The Portions were huge. I got two chicken taco's ,rice and chips and ate off this one meal for two days.  It was great!!!

1.description: How sad am I! This used to be one of my go-to places for good, cheap Mexican but no more! They must be under new ownership- I hadn't been there for a while- and the food I received tonight was NOTHING like it used to be. Different, tasteless cheese, flabby tortillas, sparse tomatoes... I ordered a combination plate but couldn't get more than halfway through the taco- it was that bad! The beans were watery and the rice tasted like it had ketchup in it! Gah!I will mourn my lost TBK forever.

39.description: My most favorite place to come get food when I've had a bit too much to drink.  What is it with being drunk and wanting mexican food?  Oh, that must just be me.This place is clean, the food is good and they have a killer Horchata.

9.description: Convenient location to our church, this TBK has been pretty consistent with it's quality. The dining area is standard for this regional chain, as is the overall service. They have messed up a couple times on take out orders, but made things right each time. Good food at a fair price.

29.description: The best Mexican food in Chicago!  Prices have gone up a little bit over the years, but still very worth it.  They offer great daily specials and even a monthly special.  Your food does not take long to cook and the staff is very nice.  If you want tasty Mexican food for lunch, dinner, or at 4AM after a long night out you MUST go to TBK!!!

23.description: The food is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!  Being from Texas, I don't understand  how people in Chicago love this place.  I've been to several hoping that one was better than the other...WRONG!!!   This is the place to go if you want to lose some pounds....don't believe me...go there...you won't want another thing to eat for the next 3 days.

5.description: This particular tbk is decent for 2 am, soak up the liquor with grease food. But the smell in the dining area kind of reminds me of my old high school locker room...It's just kind of gross unless you are too drunk to care.In a pinch...It will do

31.description: This place is awesome. Fresh, clean and very efficient. Never had a bad meal there ever. Must see and a must taste!!!!

25.description: Holy Crap!!!! I still cannot believe my eye's. A super King Burrito was the size of a midgets leg almost. Wow what a great deal for the money and the burrito did not have me running around with my ass cheeks clinched all night. open all night which is great for the late night munchies. Fast service and the place was kept clean unlike many small taco spot's

12.description: I have never been disappointed leaving hungry.  I even have extra when I take home.  They have a friendly waitstaff who don't take all day to serve your food.  I applaud them most importantly for keeping  the establishment  well  maintained and clean!Check out my Video.  "Single Mom rocks at storytelling!" on Youtube..

37.description: It seems unfair to review a chain, you should know the food is what it is.  They have the same menus as other locations, although my preference is for a drive thru and beer too - like the Niles location.  But this one is closest to me and serves up the tasty americanized nachos that I love, and the head sized burrito my husband can house.  It's located in the middle of Polish Village, somewhat funny place to reside - but the place is clean, open late hours, and friendly.  Here's the questionable one-star missing issue... the people that hang out there are scary.  Not Halloween night scary, more drunk at 9am, kicked out of the house, going to steal your food when the order is up, scary.  So maybe unless you're in a group, take your food to go.

21.description: If you're looking for some delisious tacos and burritos then head to TBK! I get the steak tacos .the steak is hot and fresh always and the toppings are always cold and crisp. The horchetta is sweet and refreshing and their home made salsa verde is one of the best around. I actually go there to buy a large container of it every now and then. The tamales are great too! They have daily specials everyday! Yay!  The home made rice is always nice! Oh did i mention late night ?

16.description: Food is ok..I especially like their enchiladas, and the flauta dinner which comes with rice, beans, and a salad. Their super steak nachos are delicious. The awesome part is that is open pretty late.

17.description: The food is barely edible!! The meat used was reheated and burnt. VERY GREASY AND VERY LITTLE FLAVOR.  The tamales were all masa and just a hint of meat.  Very disappointed !!

10.description: Well, I'm only giving it 2 stars because, well, that's all it really deserves.  But, the chips and salsa were very good if that's any consolation.  This is my 3rd time going, and the food quality was decent at best.  So, the 1st time I went, it was really late, like 1am.  My burrito was great.  In hindsight, alcohol may have contributed to the good taste.  I went a 2nd time and ordered steak instead of chicken.  What a mistake.  The meat was chewy and had lots of gristle, which was icky.  Basically, I would not make a special stop just to eat here.  Taco Bell is probably a better option.  The Horchata was good, but I can get those anywhere.  The food quality is too inconsistent for me to want to go back.  Sorry TBK.  You need to step up your game, or you're going to start losing customers.  I feel sort of bad only giving it 2 stars, but I feel equally bad for not enjoying my meal the way I was told I would.  On a positive note, the lady who works the register is super nice.  Unfortunately, she doesn't cook the food...

11.description: I've only been here once and that was out of desperation for a burrito. I asked for a steak burrito and I expected some steak chunks similar to Chipotle. Well its more like greasy ground beef. It was also precooked. I have no clue if anything else is better but don't go with steak. Ask for chicken instead. Maybe? On the plus side its large portions.

26.description: i love this place...some others might not understand the concept of reheating meat but ill explain for them,......when ya make too much you have extra....but other than that....the place has the best tacos and burritos youll ever have anywhere...and to the goof who believe lapalapita is considered better???stay off the drugs....believe me.......

27.description: I eat here probably once a week. When I want a cheap, hearty meal. They guys are very friendly and they tend to remember your order! Sometimes I dine in

35.description: I have never eaten Mexican food that I then had cravings for later. This stopped with TBK. I will admit that the only things I've had there are the ground beef burrito, as well as a bit of the enchiladas! Tasty. They also have amazing house salsa. Hot, but not too hot.They are open 24 hours as far as I know, and the guys who work in the kitchen and behind the register are pretty nice.Just dont ask them if they serve rice on their burritos. TBK is not Chipotle :)

8.description: Idk if it's TBK in general but it's horrible food. Not real Mexican food. I live enchiladas and every time they're super dry. Meat tastes old all the time. However I always get great service and it's pretty clean. When I've had to use the bathroom, it's always been clean thankfully. I recommend El Gordo instead. Just down the street on Belmont.

0.description: OMFG... Perfect burrito.  Need I say... American burrito? Thoroughly enjoyable from end to end.The most important part of this review is what I saw while it was being made. I actually commented to the cook and manager about it.  The floor was spotless.  The griddle was spotless and well maintained.  The place had no smell  No grease trap smell.  No sewer smell.  No hours of cooking smudge smell (like so many other places).  This told me that these guys had their act together.  And they were cooking my food in this immaculate kitchen.I watched the line cook work his two spatulas like I used to when I was a line cook at Denny's decades ago.  With a precision of a skilled craftsman.  Fast, accurate and styled.  After many years of my life working on a cook line, watching this guy in this well maintained kitchen gave me such excitement to eat their food.  This is a rare thing for me.Blew me away in eveyr aspect for a burrito/taco place.  Service, cleanliness and product were perfect for a walk up counter business.  Of course its not Maya Del Sol.  But I have to imagine if they had a dining room like that and servers, they could compete.Check out my other reviews.  I'm never this nice.  This is a sweet place that deserves business.  Eat on.

38.description: My husband is a huge fan of Mexican food.  We used to fight alot about take out.  I would want Chinese, he Mexican.  I couldn't stand the taste of Mexican food.  I hated the taste of corn tortillas, cilantro, and the hotness of their version of "spicy" was completely foreign and wrong to me.  My stomach would get queasy after a few bites, and the images from high school Spanish class of women patting the tortillas back and forth in their hands along a dirt road with rancid meat would instantly make me gag.  I would only eat Mexican if it was prepared by someone that I knew, or if I could see what the kitchen looked like.  My husband, on the other hand, would eat iMexican food at any hole in the wall...including from those guys who sell tamales in their Igloo coolers!I'm not treally sure what  happened, but all of the sudden I started to love and crave Mexican food.  My husband has TBK to thank for that!  There are many reasons why I love TBK.  1.They have an open kitchen area where you can totally see everything that goes on behind the counter.  It is so clean there!2.It never smells funky, there isn't the stale air of grease or tortillas.3.Their food is friggin good!  The quality of their meat is also very good.  Absolutely no bones or gristle in their chicken or steak!4.They are open insane hours!  I think that they are only closed for4 hours a day during the weekend!5.This place is cheap, cheap!!! You get a lot of guacamole for under $5!!!

20.description: Food is great. If you're from the west suburbs you'll find it tastes like a Los burritos. Sometimes the staff seems a little immature and unreliable. Not to mention the time I heard the cook shout out that he was going to take a shit right before I bit into my dinner.

19.description: I do not know what is great about this place. I love Mexican Food and Burritos, but this place is so expensive. A typical burrito is around 5 bucks, here its above 5 bucks and is not as great as other typical Mexican restaurants.

33.description: There is no such thing as a night out that doesn't include going to Taco Burrito King. We typically go to this one because it's open until silly o'clock in the morning, it's never too crowded like The Wiener's Circle, and there's always security in the unlikely event of some nutty Texan suddenly remembering the Alamo. I don't eat meat, but their veggie burritos are tasty enough to remind me why I choose not to eat pigs or cows. I always get mine with rice for 45 cents extra. If the generous cook is on the grill that night, I'll end up with a chunk the size of a football guaranteed to suppress my appetite until the next cicada hatching.I can't speak on the entire menu as I've only had the veggie burrito, but this isn't really the place you'd want to sit down for an hour and get the Mexican food experience. It's a place you go after a night of (responsible) drinking laughing about all the funny things that happened that night, and maybe asking for a sip of your friend's horchata.

2.description: No need to eat here no matter how desperate you are. Go down the street for real, flavored meat.

34.description: Their steak tacos are...amazing! Granted I usually come here after nights of "sippin' grandpa's old cough medicine." (If you got the reference...I love you). The guys that work here have been serving me since high school so even though they give creep glances at times, they always make my food with care. No cheese or sour cream 'cause you're lactose intolerant? Sure. :) They never forget.

32.description: One question, why pre cook your meat and then re-heat it?  I am not a fan mostly because of all the drama that happenes in all of their locations.  The do have clean stores but the food and people (not the ones working) SUX!!!The food is okay, but La Palapita is better than here.

18.description: I eat here probably once a week. When I want a cheap, hearty meal. They guys are very friendly and they tend to remember your order! Sometimes I dine in

41.description: What is this place famous for?...solar powered salsa.  The roof of this place is lined with solar panels that were installed by Solar Service Inc.  If you go out to the alley, you can catch a glimpse of what will generate the hot water for your dishes.  The food here is very good and the restaurant is pleasantly clean.

13.description: I've now had their burritos, nachos, and cheese fries.  Friends picked some up to bring over on my first trip and the second time we ate there. I haven't been impressed with any of it and all it really gave me was heart burn and a sour stomach. They use that neon yellow cheese on their nachos and fries...eww. Their portions are huge, so I can see why the drunk late night crowd likes them. However, this isn't authentic Mexican or Tex-Mex...as a born and bred Texan I should know.

4.description: One star deducted: the cashier was pretty (that is about it)...no change?!?! Poor cooks had to exchange change from their own pocketsTwo stars deducted: pretty cashier got everyone's order messed up. There was a young mother w her two kids who were already waiting for their orders before another couple and me and my hubby came in. WHY did the couple ahead of me get their orders before the poor mom and her 2 kids?! If the mom didn't approach the counter, she never would have gotten their food (the pretty cashier totally forgot about her order)Three stars: we waited for over 20 mins for our order. Crazy for fast good!I learned my lesson. I will stick to harlem and belmon't tbk. Tsk tsk tsk on me.

24.description: How is Taco Bell still in business only a mile from TBK? This is definitely the most delicious Mexican fast-food around. it's definitely our new go-to spot when the boyfriend and I are too lazy to cook and too hungry to wait at your average sit-down restaurant.Mmmm, I'm craving some tacos & quesadillas right now!

6.description: Not the same place as it used to be the quality of the food went down dramatically.. This place used to have the best burrito in town. Now it has no taste

22.description: Absolutely worst customer service of any restaurant I've ever been. It's one thing to make a mistake on an order, but to absolutely disregard it and to not even make an attempt to alleviate the situation is unbelievable. And hope that you never have to deal with Tamara "mgr". Just wow. But since the horrible experience I found a restaurant right down the street that blows this away. El Gordo has officially earned my business.

15.description: How is Taco Bell still in business only a mile from TBK? This is definitely the most delicious Mexican fast-food around. it's definitely our new go-to spot when the boyfriend and I are too lazy to cook and too hungry to wait at your average sit-down restaurant.Mmmm, I'm craving some tacos & quesadillas right now!

40.description: Taco Burrito King has awesome specials (check the computer monitor for 'em when you order)- you'll get a heaping pile of food for cheap, and it's pretty tasty too for this kind of place.  The green squirt bottles of hot sauce ROCK!  This is pretty much the only option for late night junk food in the area too.I always thought the lights inside this place were crazy- they're just like those big fluorescent jobs we had hanging from the roof in my grade school gym.  They're enormous, and only like 10 feet above your head- not exactly mood lighting.  But once you realize the place is solar, the energy efficient lights make sense.  So I cut 'em a break since solar power makes this place cool if you ask me.

7.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE THE FOOD AND COSTUMER SERVICE! The cooks are great and the food is fantastic! Quesadillas are the best ones in the city lots of meat and lots cheese! Always open and and food is ready in seconds!

36.description: I know this is a chain restaurant but boy do i get random cravings for sum tbk (especially when im drunk =] ) Anyways their tacos are good, cheap, and filling. I am not a fan of tiny tacos that i can finish in 2 bites. Now let me talk about their rice. It is the best mexican rice that i've ever had. Its seasoned perfectly and cooked just right. If your drunk i recommend the super nachos. They're about $7 but it's best to split them with somebody.  So good and messy, but who cares when your drunk and eating like you never ate before.

30.description: I have been coming here for 14 years and I have yet to have a bad meal or bad experience.  This place used to be a small lil joint but they tore down and built up an enormous place for many to enjoy.  The food is great!!  always fresh, always tasty!!  The employees are very nice and always greet me with welcoming smile! ( I HAVE been coming for a loong time) :0)  I have had pretty much everything on the menu and again nothing has ever disappointed me.  If you want good, cheap food this is the place to go.  & the fact that they are open until the wee hours of the morning is also a huge plus!  Check them out!  you will enjoy it and come back again and again!!  They have great daily specials too!  Also like that they have security in the late night hours for the drunkards who come in.  although I have never seen a need for it. (yet)

3.description: This was by far the WORST experience I have ever had. When you eat it on a good day, it tastes delicious. Every time you come you don't know if the food is going to taste bad or good, because it's so inconsistent, but this was just ridiculous.  The steak burrito I ordered had mostly fat in it and the tortilla was all dried up ripping apart because they obviously used old food. The chicken quesadilla they made was horrible. Normally it's all ooey gooey and delicious, but this had very little cheese and they just threw dried up chicken on top, not even melted together. Oh, and there was a hair in it! Disgusting. Highly disappointed from a regular because they used all old food and seemed all hungover. Never again, this place is just getting worse and worse.

14.description: Not going to eat steak meat that has the same quality as my dogs ALPO canned dog food. Even if I was drunk and starving I would pass this crap hole up!

58.description: Love the Gyros! My gf and I travel from logan square to get the Gyros and Saganaki from here. They are my favorite Gyros in the city, meat sliced thin with just the right amount of Tzatziki sauce.My only criticism is that they overdo it with the table bread, I would rather have pita bread with our flaming cheese. Also, its a little bit pricey for what you get!Love having pretty affordable sit-down Greek food in the city. I would go back here anytime!

56.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! They have high standards. The quality of the food is great. Owners are sweet and special instructions (like putting somethins on the side or substituting) are done without a problem.Service is great as well. We have ordered/gone here too many times to count.  We are obsessed with the fries they have here. If they had a bucket of fries, we would surely order it.   I don't know what it is about the fries, maybe the potato or the oil. Both perhaps. They definitely replace the oil frequently because they never have that old overused oil. This we have unanimously decided is the best place to go for them. They are really great about making sure to put the fries in last on a take out order to ensure they are fresh.   Other good vegetarian options are saganaki, spinach pie (spanakopita), or greek salad (w/o anchovies).  My meat eating friends love the salmon salad, cheeseburger, gyros, and leg or lamb sandwich. Honestly, most things on the menu are quite yummy.

29.description: Was not impressed with the $12 gyro plate where the meat portion was very little. The steak fries came in handy to fill me up! The saganaki was pretty good... never disappoints me. I probably wont be going there more given i know other fast food places where i can get a decent gyro for less than $10. Sorry central gyros!

42.description: I had been here several years ago and loved it.  I wanted to take my husband so he could try it.  We read some of the reviews on here and were concerned that there was some sort of change with the portion size because several people have said that it has gone down in quantity and quality.  We went at around 1:00 pm on a Sunday.  It wasn't busy but about half full.  Many of the people dining there were of Greek origin.  We ordered the saganaki (flaming cheese not sure how to spell it), the lemon egg soup, two gyro combo platters, and a half order of the pastitsio for our toddler daughter (they don't have a kids menu).  You also get a half loaf of bread when you dine in.  The flaming cheese was everything it was supposed to be, very delicious and they light it up at your table and say "opa!"  The lemon egg soup is one of the best I've tasted with lots of rice in it and good lemon flavor.  The gyro platter was more than generous with lots of gyro meat, lamb sausage, chicken on a skewer, french fries, sliced onions, sliced tomatoes, and lots of tzaziki sauce.  Needless to say we had more food than we could eat an brought leftovers home (didn't last past 6:00 pm).  My daughter did love the pastitsio and the half order was definitely generous for a kids plate.  The food is great.  I've had the garlic sauce in the past and that's great too.  Lots of garlic flavor in the food so if you're a garlic lover this is heaven.  Even though the food is fantastic, it definitely is a bit on the expensive side.  I still think it's totally worth it.  The serving staff is very friendly.  I've never had a problem parking on the street outside the restaurant and we actually parked directly in front of the door without any issue.  I recommend this to all people with a Greek tooth.  Our meal was about $60 in the end (we also ordered soft drinks and apple juice).

23.description: Went for lunch to compare them to Windy City Gyros.  Waited 20 mins to get our order taken. It was 1pm on a Weds, and only two other parties in the restaurant.  Gyro 'value' plate, $10.69. Gyro was fine, nothing major. A bit on the salty side. A side of tzaziki sauce was 50 cents extra. Small cups for soda [Coke if you want a can, generic cola if you get fountain] and one refill allowed. The fries do indeed suck. Large steak fries, undercooked and pale.  My bf and his cousin had pitas that was dark brown and hard fried on the bottom. Mine was soft and ok, but not homemade.I'll go back to Windy City, or try Rosie's. If we had to eat here, I would but there are so many better places to go.....

47.description: This restaurant certainly deserves the 5 stars for what it offers at this location. 5 stars for great food, authentic, tastes great and is consistent. 5 stars for friendly service, friendly courteous, always looking good and are attentive, owners. 5 stars for free parking that they share with the community across the street. Certainly 5 stars for the value of such real Greek food, with a variety of meats, vegetables, salads, cooked in the oven, pot or gyros style. Always get their Greek wine if you want and can easily substitute your fries with peas () or dandelion greens () for healthier choice. They beat straight up the fancier restaurants in Greek Town. How do I know? I am Greek, I cook Greek, I split my time between Greece and US, I travel everywhere and I have been sampling these establishments for 20 years!   (Bon Apetit) and give them a big ! (efharisto = thank you).

8.description: The gyros was well enough, but it lacked flavor. It didn't really taste like a gyros. I usually get a gyros at Best Sub #3 on Belmont. The ones they make are DELICIOUS. The pita is browned to perfection with butter, and they have the best creamiest sauce.Central gyros meat is too gray. I did love that it was shaved because I like my meat very thin. The portion was skimpier than I am used to. The raw onions were cut just right. My mother had hers with grilled onions, and they have the best cut grilled onions I have ever seen; perfectly thin. The sauce was fine, but it could have been creamier and more flavorful. The pita was not browned the way I like, it was too soft.I ordered a chicken Souvlaki and I would not order it again. The portion of chicken was so skimpy it made me mad, and there was too much pita bread for the amount of meat. The chicken itself could have used more seasoning.The cheeseburger was OK. The beef tasted more like a fake pepper steak burger out of a box. The onion rings are SO SO good. The delivery fee is $4, which is too high in my opinion. I probably would not order again.

31.description: Usually the food is very good at Central Gyros. Sometimes it's only okay. Many times I've enjoyed the fried zucchini with skordalia. I've always found the prices to be a tad bit high for the neighborhood.

34.description: Very bad people skills. Told person on the phone that the order was skimpy as per other reviews for a Gyros plate. I put notes in the order to "put a good amount of meat" He said he didn't like how I put that and rejected the order. Not good business.And if you look through reviews I'm not the one.

16.description: I love combining flavors and textures and that is what a gyro is. The softness of the pita with the crispy meat, the onion, tzatziki sauce and the tomatoes make a little flavor explosion in your mouth. This place is a good as it can get, with home made sauce and lots of other things on the menu that look great. Authentic Greek food.

13.description: The food is good but the waitresses are snobby. There was one that was always rude. I do not know her name. But when our order was wrong when we specifically told her what we wanted, she insisted that we tell her next time what we want in a snobby tone. Funny part is, we specified what we wanted. She just didn't want to admit she either was not listening or didn't write it down. Waitress cared more about being right than fixing my order.

11.description: Went for lunch to compare them to Windy City Gyros.  Waited 20 mins to get our order taken. It was 1pm on a Weds, and only two other parties in the restaurant.  Gyro 'value' plate, $10.69. Gyro was fine, nothing major. A bit on the salty side. A side of tzaziki sauce was 50 cents extra. Small cups for soda [Coke if you want a can, generic cola if you get fountain] and one refill allowed. The fries do indeed suck. Large steak fries, undercooked and pale.  My bf and his cousin had pitas that was dark brown and hard fried on the bottom. Mine was soft and ok, but not homemade.I'll go back to Windy City, or try Rosie's. If we had to eat here, I would but there are so many better places to go.....

39.description: My favorite neighborhood place ..Best Saganaki ever .. Greek salad dressing Gyros are great !

37.description: The food is not an issue but customer service is..the man that answers the calls is obnoxious...very rude...i've been going there all my life (20 years) but I'm never going back again..he told me his name was John but i think he lied

0.description: So I have to admit before you read on, that this is the first gyro I had ever tried in Chicago. I was told this place was the best, but I haven't had much to compare it to in Chicago, but as far as other cities like the ones I have had in New York and Los Angeles, this place tops it all!!So savory and moist! Just bursts with flavor after each and every bite. And don't even get me started on the potatoes! Yuuuuummm!!

38.description: Best Greek food period!  They have the best saganaki and gyros in the city.  Friendly staff and clean.   Been there forever.

51.description: Bring back the family style dinner! Everything is really great- the moussaka- egg lemon soup- saganaki- chicken- greek salad- chocolate cake-flan-dolmades-pastistio- just amazing, quality food.

27.description: I'm so glad I gave this place is shot. It's true homemade Greek food at extremely reasonable prices. Their saginaki, chicken souvlaki, egg lemon (chicken and rice) soup, everything we ordered exceeded my expectations.

32.description: Good food, great value, fast and friendly service inside the restaurant and I definitely recommend the egg lemon soup! All the food arrived hot, delicious, and the service was very solicitous, I will be returning.

54.description: Very Good Food and services Gyros are very good as is the Greek Chicken!

48.description: In an area lacking good restaurants, this one is above average. Super friendly service & a nice clean place. Gyros was very good.

44.description: This place is so overpriced! $10 for a gyro "dinner" with fries. When the waitress brought the pita to the table, it looks as though it was a regular sized gyro. Pita bread was very good but meat was very mediocre. Portion size was not even close to what I would have expected for a $10 gyro plate. Tastes like any other gyro place and nothing stands out here. Go to Nick's Gyros at Touhy and Harlem for a real gyro. $10 would get you a gyro dinner which makes TWO packed gyro sandwiches and the taste is phenomenal.

24.description: Still one of the best and most consistent Greek restaurants in Chicago hands down. I have never had a bad meal here and have been coming here for over 10 years - the Greek Chicken, potatoes, lemon and rice soup, spinach, and their fish were all out of control!!I cannot understand some of these other reviewers' comments - One person thinks $3.50 for soup is expensive? Really? A frickin' can of soup at the store is almost $3.00 or more, so how can $3.50 for incredible home made soup be expensive? People really are a holes sometimes. If it were free they would still complain!  Not sure about the gyros since I don't eat them, but I bet they are good.I suggest the Olive Garden then - it's not home made, and similar to Campbell's and it's all you can eat. I am just glad I don't own a restaurant - people who don't even DINE at some places leave rotten comments - not fair to anyone esp the owner of a restaurant. Yelp needs to be monitored or require some sort of verification that the customers actually have been to a place - the anonymity is not working nor fair in many cases.

7.description: So you wonder how a gyro place could be different then any other.  Doesn't the spit of meat come from the same distributor?  I don't know but for some reason Central Gyros does it better.  They cook the meat just perfectly and I think they make their own sauce.  By far the best gyros in town.  Again, if you think they are all the same, this place may change your mind.

49.description: Awful, awful, awful.  For a place that specializes in gyros, you would think that we could get more than 2 slices on a gyros plate that were not like gyros jerky!  Perhaps it was because there was a party of about 25 people taking up the time and energy of all the staff, but in addition to the dried-out mess, we didn't even order the plate, we ordered the sandwich!  My soup was nasty and the fried shrimp came out on top of the fries, which just means they were soaking-up the grease from the shrimp.  Any self-respecting greek restaurant (and I have eaten in plenty and worked in one) knows you put them on some toast for that specific purpose.  It took us about 15 minutes of sitting there with no plates or anything on the table to get a check.  I was sad I opted to come in here instead of Barbakan, where the food is ALWAYS top notch.

40.description: My bud and I dined at Central Gyros, a rather spacious restaurant on Central near Belmont.  There is a free parking garage across the street.  Our meal was off to a good start with our appetizer.  Our server allowed us to order a mixed plate of fried eggplant and fried zucchini, with garlic sauce of the consistency of mashed potatoes.  Good stuff there.  We each ordered a combination platter with lamb, pastitsio, dolma, rice, potatoes and peas.  However I don't believe either of us received any lamb.  Perhaps we were overwhelmed by the fair-sized starch-fest of a platter to mention the lack of lamb.  What made the situation worse was that everything on this plate was mediocre at best.  We drank our Greek beers to think about how good the appetizer was.  Perhaps the best moment was seeing someone at a nearby table order the flamin' saganaki, always an entertaining moment at a Greek restaurant.

53.description: When the servers ignite flaming cheese with an "ooopa"  it brings back fond memories of Parthenon Gyros on Devon ave.  which has been gone for a very long time.  This place has good gyros its tasty but seems to be seasoned a little less than other places (or that's my imagination).   Good steak fries with the plate.  I only had the gyros with that said I doubt I would get anything else from them because that's why you're going there.

30.description: As always! It's still the best gyros in chicago!! We try to go twice a month cause we live 10 miles away.It is the best I have ever had! I used to go here all the time 35 years ago! Hasn't changed at all still the same great place!!!

46.description: Like some of the other reviews i have been coming here for years and though the food is Great  i think he will lose customers since he is cutting corners with the portions of Food but i do think the quality is still there

1.description: I brought my parents here for lunch.  There is validated parking across the busy street.Chicago has a massive amount of Greek fast food aka Gyros.  Central Gyros is not a fast food place but some of the food resembled that feeling.  When you step inside the narrow entry way on the right you are greeted by the cook and specials on chalk boards.  Am I suppose to order now? the register is present? confused we are an older guy approached and asked to sit wherever we would like.  Still confused about having to order we see waitresses.  Phew, complicated.  Menu was massive.  lots of meaty combination items and traditional Greek fare.  The parentals order some chicken kabob and Gyros combo.  I ordered a dinner combo to share, mine has gyro meat, pastitsio, dolmas, vegetable, rice and potatoes.  Combinations come with soup.  The gyro meat is well cooked and rich in flavor.  The pastitsio was pretty good but the tomato sauce was a bit too sweet.  The dolmas were the best, full of flavor and moist in the middle. The rice was buttery but the potatoes had too much thyme.  My mothers chicken kabob was a bit dry.  The veggies consisted of steamed peas with some tomatoes flavorless sauce.  Some of the items were hit or miss, there are other plenty of good options in Chicago.

55.description: I grew up eating here and it was fantastic! The last couple of times coming here and as recent as 3 day ago, I'm very disappointed in how small the gyros were and how expensive everything was. I could have easily eaten two gyros that's how small they were but with a BIG price attached to them.  Food is still good but the value sucks! I can't see myself coming back here.

9.description: The Best Greek Restaurant on the north side of Chicago. Chef Salad & Saganaki it's a must! Welcome to Central Gyros. Oppa'a :)!

26.description: I placed an order for delivery. Guy who answered the phone was very rude. I ordered chicken souvlaki plate which is an extreme rip off. It cost $12.95 and the portion is enough to feed a bird. Instead of fries or rice I asked for soup (egg lemon) HORRIBLE! tastes like starchy water! When the delivery driver came to my home, I gave him the money expecting change back and he just drove off!! I will never order from this place again!

25.description: I used the yelp order online (eat24) Love the techs support. However and order that was suppose to 1hr took an hour and a half. The combo plate was great (shockingly was delivered hot). The tiramisu was dry and bland. Will not be ordering again from this establishment.

12.description: This experience has left me underwhelmed. We placed an order for a pickup. I thought $12 for a gyros plate and $3.50 for a soup was steep. But since there's so many amazing reviews, hey, we gave it a shot. For starters, the fries are pathetic. They're steak fries that are undercooked. Plus, they should say it comes with an order of "fry". I got 7 fries. After I shared a couple with my kids, we each got 2. The fries suck. The gyros is decent. It isn't remarkable. I've had better that is significantly cheaper. That pretty much sums it up. The lemon rice soup was ok. Again, not remarkable. So underwhelmed and out $32 for a "meh" dinner. Disappointing.

59.description: I'm glad those who grew up with this place appreciate it, but it only convinces me that options for good greek food have been lacking in the area.Let me start with the fact that we didn't try the gyros with our carryout order - perhaps those are fantastic here.However, we did experience:~ Average saganaki: decent size, minimal lemon, no fired-brandy flavor~ Average avgolemono soup: very thin/watery~ Awful taramosalata: near non-existent roe flavor and strangely bitter~ A very disappointing (and crazily over-priced) shish-ka-bob dinner: I was convinced I received a souvlaki dinner by mistake until I found four small pieces of onion & pepper between four tiny pieces of pork~ Bland eggplant salad, though a decent sized portion. ~ Average pastitsio: ruined by (what tasted exactly like) Franco-American brand canned spaghetti sauce on top~ Shorted order: tzatziki sides we paid for weren't included in our mealOur next $60+ will be much better spent at almost any other restaurant in Greektown than here.

21.description: Some of the best gyros I've had!  The fries are good too.  They even deliver and it was really fast.  We ordered a slice of cheesecake and I wouldn't suggest to order that.  Very dry and felt like it was sitting out all day.  I didn't enjoy it at all.

17.description: Gyros plate is the same size as a gyros sandwich and cost several dollars more for the plate you would expect more meat with a gyros plate what a scam owner should have some sort of measuring system for meat for sandwich and plate hint hint

10.description: This place is great, I order take out probably a couple times per month.  The staff is always friendly, the food is good, fresh and hot.

5.description: Just got delivery and ordered a gyro and soup. I am very pleased with everything. The flavors and portions are good. The lemon soup is great for a sore throat and the gyro had an excellent pita and good quality meat.

3.description: I dunno, seemed pretty standard to me, I liked the unlimited refills, and that its like a real restaurant. But the gyros seemed pretty standard, I expected a lot cuz they have that spinning sign of gyro meat in front. Also someone said this place is legendary. Seems just OK to me, nothing I would go out of my way for. Very local dude vibe, I liked the interiors, the service was good also. Eh, what is it missing? Oh yeah, the fries are huge cuts of potatoes, which I don't really care for. But I ate everything and burped up gnarly garlic smelling stuff for days so it was real legit gyros.

35.description: Their Chicken Souvlaki is delicious. Also, hands down have the best gyros. They never skimp on the meat and it's not greasy like a lot of other places. It's a little more pricey than other places but the quality of food is worth it.

19.description: Probably my favorite gyro place in Chicago. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good gyro.

28.description: I order food from this place at least twice a week. I even got everyone at work addicted to this place. I suggest the chicken Cesar salad.

45.description: I grew up a couple streets over from this place, so this is "my chicago", far different from the other northside neighbor hoods I resided in as an adult.  Awesome customer service, the owner was there (saw him on Chicago's Best!) and he came over to ask how everything was, which is sooo nice!  We were just about the only table in there, although it was a weird time...like 3:30 on a Saturday.Gyro was good, but didn't blow me away frankly.  Solid though.  Get the sandwich, the plate was a bit overpriced for me, 2 sammies would have been a better value.  And give me fries with the sammie!  Hope you guys make it!

33.description: This experience has left me underwhelmed. We placed an order for a pickup. I thought $12 for a gyros plate and $3.50 for a soup was steep. But since there's so many amazing reviews, hey, we gave it a shot. For starters, the fries are pathetic. They're steak fries that are undercooked. Plus, they should say it comes with an order of "fry". I got 7 fries. After I shared a couple with my kids, we each got 2. The fries suck. The gyros is decent. It isn't remarkable. I've had better that is significantly cheaper. That pretty much sums it up. The lemon rice soup was ok. Again, not remarkable. So underwhelmed and out $32 for a "meh" dinner. Disappointing.

43.description: I was looking for a local place for some AUTHENTIC pastitsio with bechamel sauce.  What I got was a cold block of pasta noodles covered in red sauce that resembled lasagna.  (false advertising on their menu) I did carryout so I was unable to return to complain.  Included for $13.09 was a couple slices of fresh, but cold bread.  Not included were any type of vegetable that would have likely been served had I dined in, no butter for the bread, cold white rice, and a small cup of warm watery rice soup.  They also neglected any plastic utensils and napkins.  Had I not been able to drive home for this, I would have been eating Viking style.

2.description: I ordered here today for my company, waited for 1 hour and 40 minutes for delivery, food was cold got no refund or credit was assured food was warm and that i am a liar that i need to return the food to them my self to receive a refund. I decided to take the hit and save my gas money and frustration with possibly having to have to argue with them if i did go there, Such a waste of time and pointless frustration. Business like this should not be around to waste people's time.

18.description: Still one of the best and most consistent Greek restaurants in Chicago hands down.
