I have never had a bad meal here and have been coming here for over 10 years - the Greek Chicken, potatoes, lemon and rice soup, spinach, and their fish were all out of control!!I cannot understand some of these other reviewers' comments - One person thinks $3.50 for soup is expensive? Really? A frickin' can of soup at the store is almost $3.00 or more, so how can $3.50 for incredible home made soup be expensive? People really are a holes sometimes. If it were free they would still complain!  Not sure about the gyros since I don't eat them, but I bet they are good.I suggest the Olive Garden then - it's not home made, and similar to Campbell's and it's all you can eat. I am just glad I don't own a restaurant - people who don't even DINE at some places leave rotten comments - not fair to anyone esp the owner of a restaurant. Yelp needs to be monitored or require some sort of verification that the customers actually have been to a place - the anonymity is not working nor fair in many cases.

41.description: Hard to believe after all these years I only just recently stopped in for a quick bite. Looks like I've been missing out on some quality gyros action!So many places advertise having the "best gyros in town" or "served 5 million+ of the best gyros in all of Chicago land"....Well, Central Gyros could easily claim either of those headlines. The diner is a bit worse for wear in spots and probably could use some TLC here and there but you're not coming here for the décor! Hostess was pleasant and quickly led us to a window booth. Waitress arrived promptly and was also very pleasant. No complaints so far...We started with some mandatory saganaki (OPA!) which was then quickly followed by a gyros platter. Taste wise, it was everything you could ask for and this is how gyros should be served to the public.But one complaint I have to bring up is the small portion of gyros meat/lamb they provided. When paying over $11 for a gyros platter, they simply do not provide enough lamb! From the comments on Yelp, it appears they used to offer much more and may have scaled back as of late.Hopefully, this will change after enough complaints. Beyond this, a great choice to satisfy that Mediterranean urge

52.description: Pretty pricey for lunch. A warning for those that like diet coke.... It will be Pepsi. The bread is store bought, very little flavor or authenticity.

50.description: Dont get me wrong, the Gyros was good and the service was okay, but to be sincere, I think Outdoor Grill on Milwaukee and Pulaski does it just as good and cheaper than here. I give it two stars not for the taste, but the price that is unreasonably high. For the same quality of Gyros, I rather try somewhere else.

4.description: Always fresh, tasty, and authentic. While the interior is a bit dated, the staff more than make up for it with their charm and it gives this mom and pop place an extra warm feel. Their agvuolemono is a go-to in our house especially when someone is sick. Their portions are generous and prices are more than fair. I recommend stopping in for an MGD in a frosty mug while waiting for carry out or bring the family and they will treat you like you're one of theirs.

6.description: Central gyros has been around for decades and they still serve quality Greek food. Family friendly,great service,clean restaurant. The only thing I'm disappointed with is the price has gotten expensive. Parking is free across the street. I think they need better specials because there is lots of competition these days. But the food and atmosphere are great.

22.description: I live in California now but Chicago is and will be my forever home. So going back home I expect good food on my plate and Central Gyros is always on my list of to go places. Saganaki flaming cheese is a must - it's a mom and pop place but they'll always say Ooopa when the cheese comes out. The Sulvaki sandwich or the plate; pork or chicken is my go to comfort make me feel good I'm home meal. So good my mouth just waters thinking of it and knowing I'm thousands of miles makes me sad.  Food is bomb!! Don't just go for the gyros. ...which are good too but think outside the box bc the food here is excellent, and the portions are huge.  Service is on point and they are always checking on you...I miss you Central Gyros!!

15.description: I've been eating at Central Gyros for over 30 years.  I grew up coming here with family, and the food has always been consistent and delicious.  This is authentic Greek cuisine, and you can count on it being freshly prepared.The Saganaki has the perfect blend of salt in the cheese, and melts evenly.  It's always fun to yell "OPA!" with the waitresses!Another great appetizer is the fried eggplant with garlic sauce.  I don't know what they do to make eggplant crispy, but it is the perfect crunch without being greasy.  I have tried to replicate it at home, and I still can't come close!Pastitsio is a Greek version of lasagna, and it is hearty and the perfect comfort food.  Pair it with a side of egg lemon soup, and I'm in heaven!

57.description: Long time customer here, I'm talking 20 years.  Always had great food at reasonable price.  Last couple years has really gone down.  Portions are half of what they use to be.  Prices to high for area.  Unfortunate, use to be a great spot for the family to have alittle saganaki, greek dinner and a glass of roditis.  Cannot recommend any longer.

20.description: I've been eating at Central Gyros for over 30 years.  I grew up coming here with family, and the food has always been consistent and delicious.  This is authentic Greek cuisine, and you can count on it being freshly prepared.The Saganaki has the perfect blend of salt in the cheese, and melts evenly.  It's always fun to yell "OPA!" with the waitresses!Another great appetizer is the fried eggplant with garlic sauce.  I don't know what they do to make eggplant crispy, but it is the perfect crunch without being greasy.  I have tried to replicate it at home, and I still can't come close!Pastitsio is a Greek version of lasagna, and it is hearty and the perfect comfort food.  Pair it with a side of egg lemon soup, and I'm in heaven!

36.description: I would recommend the combination plate, plus their Greek village salad. Their baked 1/2 chicken Riganati served with rice and potato is also very good.

14.description: We are home visiting with my inlaws from out of town and we ordered four delicious meals from here for delivery. We got our food fast, hot, fresh, and amazing. You should definitely try this place out.

0.description: I really like this Walgreens located on Diversey and Laramie.  The staff is always helpfull and the store is always clean.  I used to shop at CVS (closer to my house) but I switched after they messed up my prescriptions.

3.description: No more military discount here. You need a VA ID in which you need to register for though the VA. Your military ID is not good enough. So this has caused me to turn to Lowes where I can save a little. This has also opened my eyes to a better store and merchandise. :)

1.description: Poor customer service given to me by manager  Andre, he was very rude and arrogant ,  wouldn't let me speak and even accused of stealing when couldn't  find receipt  but showed up on on my credit card. He seriously  needs to get fired he is horrible  smh

2.description: There must have been a corporate memo that worked its way down the chain of command: be more like Lowe's.For years I dreaded going into this Home Depot unless I knew exactly what I would be purchasing.  This was the case yesterday, on Black Friday.  Only at Lowe's have I been greeted by each and every single employee that I walked near- and it just happened at Home Depot!  They also asked if I needed assistance, I did, then they gave me directions on how to get to the aisle that I needed to get to.Way to go Home Depot corporate, you changed the store-level culture of being devoid of customer service assistance!

5.description: O.K..   so I need a lot of crap for my apt.  I head on over to Home Depot looking for all kinds of stuff.  They only has 3/4 of my things.  This is Home Depot, don't they have it all.  I got this laser so that I could put up my frames.  The sticker showed now 10.48 was 14.99...  I payed for my items and went home.  We search for some items and there not in our bags... they forgot to give us the last bag!  We head back to the home depot to get the bag and the cashier laughed it off oh yeah, we forgot to give it to you....  no shit sherlock...  did you think I came to see you?  As I'm walking out I look at the reciept, they charged me 14.99 for the laser light thing... I go to returns and wait impatiently.  The girl at the register is moving slower than a turtle.  For every return she keeps calling a manager to get approval.  So let me get this right!  You're in Returns, meaning thats all you do, just returns... Why the hell doesn't a manager do it if you're going to keep calling him for the returns... It just didn't make sense to me.  I had to wait just to get that extra money back about 20 minutes... 15 minutes just for them to look up the price... 35 minutes for an exchange that was there fault... Geezzzzzz.

6.description: I have only been to this Home Depot once and it was a great experience.  We were there to order doors with Luis R. in millwork so I did not experience the checkout line or other departments.  If you want someone who knows doors/windows go here.  Luis was really patient and had a good sense of humor.  The assistant manager Vince was also very helpful and got us to purchase certain items from Home Depot for a better price than what I had been quoted at Lowes.

7.description: I did a lot of waiting. Spent about 5 hours of my day trying to get a grill, riding my bike to this store (after i was told on the phone they have the grill I wanted), trying to rent a van, riding home to get my car because I didn't have proof of auto insurance on me, and ultimately going back to discover i had been sold the wrong grill and to be told by the manager, Kevin, that I couldn't purchase the grill i had already payed for because it was unsafe.The manager never apologized to me for all of the trouble and seemed to try to ignore me when I approached him, even though the mistake was the stores. I've never felt so disrespected in a retail store.  Luckily two employees, Maria & Barbie, treated me well. I think after I talk to Kevin's boss and to corporate that I'm going to avoid Home Depot like the plague. Even an occasional incredible deal isn't worth it. Back to Tenenbaum for all of my hardware needs.

0.description: I wanted to get hardwood floors installed and hardwood floors refinished and Vrenly helped me tremendously. She kept in close contact with me throughout entire the process. She made sure I had all the information I needed. She went above and beyond her job to ensure I was a happy customer. She stuck with me from the beginning of the process to the end. Awesome job! Thanks a lot Vrenly.

4.description: I somehow ended up in this neighborhood tonight.  I dont know how, it just happened.  And my friend needed boxes for his move this weekend and by the grace of cod we see none other than the bright orange beacon of light from the Home Depot.  It's a sign!  It's a miracle!We trot in with a mental list of his moving needs (boxes, tape, packing paper, shelving paper) and immediately find the boxes, tape and packing paper.  Check, Check, Check.We maneuver around the store closer to the kitchen section with shelving paper on our mind.  I get distracted looking at the mailboxes and my friend disappears in to the night.  I start up and down the center aisle looking for him and in the distance see him cross the aisle.  Target acquired.I continue lugging boxes and tape and a nice young lady Depot-er asked if I was with the tall guy with boxes and when I confirmed she steered me in his direction.  Thanks!My friend and I are reunited.  Time for check-out.  For some reason we thought we could do the self check-out.  It did not go well.  Ashley was working the section and once she saw our confusion and ineptitude she happily came to our rescue with her scanner gun.  She joked with us and picked up the packing paper that kamikaze-ed right out of the plastic bag I was instructed to hold.Plenty of parking.  Nice employees.  Decent prices.  NOW LET'S BUILD SOMETHING TOGETHER.

1.description: Tiny mom and pop grocery store that has amazing tacos. The meat in the tacos is always tasty. The couple that run this place have been here for years. They know what they are doing.

2.description: Your typical pop and mom corner store.

0.description: Absolutley love this place. We just moved into the neighborhood about a year ago and this was the first neighborhood store we went to. The owners are super nice. Everyone there greets you with a warm welcome. The carnicero is a sweetheart. He is always nice and  makes conversation with us, Loma you are amazing and thanks for making us feel welcomed.

12.description: OMG!!!! PHENOMENAL PUPUSAS!!! I cant believe Im the first on YELP to review this place.I've only driven past it a million times and never looked twice because I HAD NO IDEA.I also ordered Kak ik which is a delicious turkey soup from guatemala.DELICIOUS!!! To drink I ordered MARACUYA.I had no idea what it was so I googled it.Its passion fruit juice.It was the perfect accompaniment to my Central American meal.I WIIL RETURN!!! Taking some to go for my picky little Italian buddy.Only because I think its good for people to think outside the norm when dining out.You just MIGHT BE SURPRISED!!!! Definite THUMBS UP for Latin Patio.

3.description: Guatemalans this is your place to be. They host tons of events and a lot of charities events too. Last time we went we celebrated my cousin birthday of a group of 10. We had great service and delicious food. I've only been here twice but my family has come here often. Wouldn't mind going back and trying new things.

1.description: My family and I have been coming here for quite sometime. Food is ok nothing compared to mothers cooking but it'll do. The only improvement that needs to be made is keeping things in stock. The atole de Elote didn't have any corn kernels. There was no sour cream for the rellenitos. Small little things that aren't hard to improve. Overall place is just ok.

2.description: Before I begin: this is a BYOB!Another one of those hidden gems but Guatemalan style. I'd like to think that this was one of those restaurants I discovered. But of course it's not. Hidden away in the streets of Central avenue lies a restaurant with real and authentic Guatemalan cuisine (well okay food). Our main entree was ordering just appetizers, and between four of us I was amazed how full we did get. I mean chuchitos (which basically are homemade "sope" tortillas with the fixings of your choice. We had jorochos which are some kind of flower mixed in a batter and place inside the "sope" and let me tell you, I would eat these again in a minute. But wait, we also order the chicharones (fried pork skin) and it balanced out the chuchitos to the point of "AHHHHHHH. I'm telling you, the fact that an entree is less then $8 is amazing but when you order appetizers and they fill you up, this is a good thing! I also had to have the atole de elote which of course is a corn drink thanks served warm and ever so delirious! My only negative is that they need to up the size.  One thing I will point out is that the menu would be better if they also included the meals in English. I mean not a big deal but of course one of our party didn't speak Spanish so we had to translate and still it was fine, but English subtitles would do. ANDY I never knew that you could park in the "free" parking lot across the street! And here I was adding almost $4 to park. Now I know, so for authentic real Guatemalan food,  this is one spot I would come back again for. And also, it was Saturday so they have live Music in the other room so that alone should drag you out!

9.description: So my husband and I like wanted to try something different than the regular taco and burger joint and wanted it to include BYOB. Checked on yelp and found this local place and it totally hit the spot :9! We brought our own beer l, polish beer at 9+ alc vol for us mexicans. The bad thing was we had to get sone ones attention to take our order, they had a small party next door and were a bit busy serving their food but no biggie, we got someones attention and was really nice especially when i told her this was our first visit here. We ordered the pupusa dinner and chicharon con yuca dinner which hit the spot. Food was fresh and delish and we only paid $23.00 + tip. I would of gave a 5 star but i had to get some ones attn to weigh on me, that was one! Two, i had to use the restroom and had to interrupt the party next door to access the bathroom :( wish there was a side door to get to that more privetly, 3rd issue was they close at kitchen at 8ish and were cleaning to closes while the restaurant was kinda full still. This won't make me not cone back tho, food was good i will just come earlier or order to take out :)

10.description: It's been just about a year since I started frequenting this fantastic establishment. The Garnachas are to die for, and the Pupusa de Garnacha is just as deadly! (In a good way, of course.) Plus, it 's BYOB, the staff will even bring you wine glasses and ice for your bottle. Fantastic service, incredible food.

4.description: Most authentic Guatemalan restaurant in the area. I ordered Garnachas, Tamal Chapin, Churrasquito, and Pache which is a kind of tamale made from potatoes. It was very tasty and delicious like home. Service was very attentive and friendly. Had a great experience. I will visit again to try other interesting dishes in the menu.

6.description: My buddy and I dined at Latin Patio on a weekend evening, and it seems to be an unknown gem.  Located on Central near Belmont, the casually quaint restaurant places an emphasis on Guatemalan food, and Central American food in general.  While you can order basic stuff like tamales, the way to go is to order the sampler platter filled with sausage, pork, flautas, and yucca.  But you gotta try at least one pupusa, or make a meal out of them and order several of them.  The cheese and loroco pupusa (what the heck is loroco - a flower bud?) with some slaw is delicious.  I washed it all down with passionfruit juice, as a quinceanera was going on next door.  You can park across the street in a parking garage (for free!).

15.description: I was there tonight to attend a fundraiser for a marimba band in Guatemala.  The food was fabulous; definitely the best pupusas I ever had.  At only $1.99 per, you could certainly eat a lot of them!  But that wasn't all by a long shot.  The chicken dish we shared was flavorful and tender with being mushy, the burritos were good, both veggie and steak, and even the chocolate covered frozen banana for dessert was simple ad delicious.  A meal for six, with horchata, came to $78.  A great place!  Spread the word.

0.description: AAAMAZING GUATEMALAN TASTE!!!!!!!  I am really harsh on my Guatemalan cuisine due to  the fact that everyone in our family cooks really really good inc me  The place was clean quiet 10am on Monday just what I was hoping for. Attention right away food came out quick and warm tasting really good prices were right def recommend that ppl check this place out

5.description: The food was alright, but the service needs some improvement. My family and I were excited of trying this place, because it is rare to see any Central American restaurant in Chicago, but the result were completely the unexpected! The waitress need to calm down on their attitude.

13.description: Great Papusas, price is amazing. I'll be coming here more often. They offer breakfast as well.

11.description: This is as good as it gets for authentic Guatemalan food in Chicago. I'm Guatemalan and I've tried several Guatemalan places in Chicago and they were all dissapointment. This is the first time I can say I'm going back if I'm craving Guatemalan food. It's not as good as Antigua in Miami but it's pretty tasty. I had the pupusas and chipilines. I would definitely recommend it for authentic Guatemalan food and I will be coming back.

8.description: i went there for lunch and the food was okay but the service needs to improve.

14.description: I've been craving pupusas for months. .I happened to be running down central one day when I saw a huge PUPUSAS sign. . Amazing!  A must try if you're in the area!

7.description: Being as I have yet to find an authentic Guatemalan restaurant in the city, I was excited to try this place out. There's a great selection of Central American food but it just didn't hit the mark, maybe because I compare it with my grandmother's cooking. The food was alright, nothing exceptional. On the positive side, you get to try a lot of food for your money. I will say, we went early on a Saturday afternoon and the restaurant filled up fast.

3.description: I absolutely love this place. The waiter remembers us by name and always greets us with a smile. He'll ask how the other half is doing if we aren't around and makes sure to make conversation while we wait for our order. The food is so good too and not expensive at all. I highly recommend all to give it a try whenever you're craving Chinese food.

1.description: Impressed, 5 stars for take out.  The food was made fresh and the portions were large. Our food was steaming hot even after driving 8 minutes home. Broccoli Beef was well balanced with vegetables. The beef was juicy and flavored nicely. The Orange Chicken was sweet and the chicken was moist and cooked perfectly.  Chicken fried rice was also well done and complimented the meal.

2.description: It's a lazy kinda day today, not really looking forward to throwing down in the kitchen today, I'll leave it up to one of my favorite Chinese Restaurants tonight. Great Food, Great Service.

9.description: Super fast delivery and delicious food!!!

10.description: The prices weren't too bad, but the food was.  I had delivery so I couldn't take back the awful Chicken Pad Thai.

4.description: Great Chinese food, solid flavors and amazing prices. One of those hole in the wall places that you want to keep going back to because the food is so good. Really nice staff too, good customer service.

6.description: 2 words.  Lunch. Special.Humongous portions (I can usually make at least 3 meals out of one lunch special), cheap (even for a lunch special), and quick and super-friendly service.  What's not to love?Besides the options on the lunch menu-their soups are not fancy but they're also pretty good.-crab rangoon is a favorite-dumplings are also huge-thought it might not be the first place you think about for wings, their chicken wings are really good.-Smoothie deliciousnessGreat place if you're craving chinese food on the fly!

12.description: It''s been a few years since I have been here, mainly because I no longer work in the area.  That said, I still come back for one thing: their cantonese chow mein.  I don't know why I love it as I do.  I think it may be something with the presentation.  They actually mix the noodles with the veggies, unlike other places where the noodles are buried somewhere underneath all the other items.  Yum.

5.description: Delicious!! My favorite Chinese spot!! Prices are perfect, service is amazing and food is heaven!! Dinner specials bring plenty and delivery is FAST! Definitely recommend!!

11.description: It's not gourmet, but it's cheap and fast. The best part is the lady who is always there. She's so nice!!! You can feed your family for about a week on $10. Though... most everything tastes the same.Recommended: pepper steak; mongolian fried rice.

8.description: Wound up here on a whim because the place I had been headed to instead was closed on Sundays.  I was not disappointed in the least because China House served up very tasty and hot (temperature and spice) Kung Pao Chicken and rice.  Very large portions too so I had some to take home, despite ordering a "Small".  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Decor is quite utilitarian inside which is probably appropriate for a busines that most likely does more carry-out and delivery than dine-in sales.

0.description: This place is the best Chinese restaurant in the area! hands down! great portions! good quality! and love the customer service! always helping a neighbor out just like we would here at State Farm! Thanks China House!

7.description: Solid Chinese food for a swell price. I suggest getting the lunch specials. Mostly because the portions are huge and around 6-7 dollars. I really like the fried rice as well.

3.description: The first time I came here the food wasn't all that but just a week ago I came again and I'm pretty darn sure they changed the chef because their tortas are extremely delicious! Their carne asada is so fresh and juicy it makes your mouth watery. Super friendly servers. And the food is so good! I like the new chef they hired, he/she gives you fries with your tortas

1.description: I'm writing this in pain after eating the worse steak sope Ive ever had.Meat wasnt seasoned well, it had huge chewy chunks, and burnt pieces that I had to spit out. 8 o'clock on a Friday night with only 3 tables I would think they would pay attention and care about having repeat customers.My father couldnt eat his seafood soup it was so bad. When I brought the soup up to the counter to say something our waitress tried to argue with me and gave me attitude . "Why didn't you say something sooner" and  "I already put it on the bill" she was sighing and rubbing her forehead like her life depended on charging me for this soup.The manager didn't want to come out of the kitchen to talk to me, when she finally did she easily took the charge off. I wasn't trying to get something for free I just didn't want to be charged for the inedible soup.The waitress said twice she didn't want our tip but I tipped her anyway because up to that point the service was the only good thing about that place.

2.description: My husband and I had their tacos. They were disgusting.  The "meat" tasted awful, it did not taste like beef at all.  You would think the seasoning would have helped but it was terrible.  Too bad it was takeout, I would NOT have paid for that (whatever it was).  I would like to say that ill give it another chance, but it was simply THAT bad. I will bot be going back.

5.description: Worked late so decided to stop in and pick up a late dinner on the way home. They now accept credit cards, which is great. The steak meat was a bit salty than I last remembered, but the food was good overall.

6.description: I had their carne torta with everything on it. I love the seasoning and how tender the meat was. Their salsa was extremely spicy but delicious none the less. Definitely going to come by here again and try some other things on their menu.

7.description: Good service and great tasting food. The meat is seasoned and fresh. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because of "cash only" other then that downer the parking lot is big the eating area looks clean and food again was awesome.

8.description: Fast and fresh food.  Don't know about the review that said cash only.  I used my card.

9.description: This is the best Mexican restaurant! The service is wonderful and the food is just as good. Classics like the veggie burrito or chicken tacos are truly to die for.  Their salsas are amazing, especially the green one with chicken -- yum! The restaurant is also cheap so you can eat there often without breaking the bank. The servers -- especially Mary -- are friendly and fast and you can expect the same great service every time. Check it out!

0.description: WOW..!  1) The salsa has some flavor to it with just the right amount of kick to it.2) The tortillas look and taste home made.3) Beans are fresh and not caned.4) Huge parking lot (they'll need it after I spread the word)This place is the real deal. I had the flotas and I have to say they were the best I've EVER had at a restaurant. Try this place.

4.description: Salsa is hot and delicious with just enough texture. The guacamole is fresh and made just the way I like it.  I've been here 7 times now and so far everything I have had has been really good. The parking lot is just a bonus. The service is spotty and the margaritas could be better but the food is spot on.

3.description: This is more American than  a Mexican  restaurant. They have an amazing orchata water, an they're lunch specials are not bad. I usually get their steak nachos which are not bad at all. Guacamole and chips are ok, tacos are not bad. I had tried their burrito and they usually have to pay extra for cheese, and sour cream.

1.description: This lovely hidden spot is always open when you need a good taco dinner. Good food and great prices. It's a yum yum!! Open til the weee hrs of the morning.

2.description: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago. I live a block away from here and I usually stop by once a week or so. The food is standard Mexican but it's so good. Comfort food at it's best. Quick service,  very nice people, huge portions, and amazing horchata.

9.description: Great when the bars close!  I love the food when im drunk, but Im sure its just as good sober

10.description: The food is nothing particularly special.  I've had the (chicken, I think) burrito, not the huge one, but one that was like $5-6 (they have three sizes).  It was pretty good, not fantastic, but certainly hit the spot at drunk-o-clock.  I've also had the burger, it was smallish but cheap and tastier than you'd expect at a Mexican joint.  Probably rates three stars, but bonus for being open late (24 hours is only on weekends) and for having some American food.  Not much seating, though (I think it's like lunch-counter-type only).

4.description: I used to eat here a lot when I lived nearby.  The food is awesome for those of you who love to drink.  The place is open all of the time.  You can get your greasy food on after a day of drinking at the bar that is nearby.  This place has burritos that are huge.  The people are friendly and you get served promptly.  The prices are cheap.  I say, after a big day of drinking at the divy bar nearby, go eat some Burrito King and you will feel alright!!! Hell YEAH!!!!!!!

6.description: My wife used to live in the neighborhood, so when we had an apatite and happened to be over there we stopped in.We were greeted by two very friendly young lads.We ordered a burrito and a chili rellenos dinner.  The food came fast and both were very decent.My only complaint was the place was a bit dingy, but it was no big deal.I'd definitely stop in again if I'm in the neighborhood.

11.description: This is your 'standard' "hole-in-the-wall" Mexican restaurant. This address had been a tavern in a prior life as recently as 1994. I seldom entered it; but it looked like an OK place.You can park in the lot of the convenience store just east of it, across the alley.I think it has different owners than back in October 2008. The primarily Spanish-speaking family which staffed here (and the television set turned to Telefutura or Univision) have been supplanted by two males, of which the Hispanic male works the grill. The TV set is now tuned to an English-language channel.I usually have the burrito here. Not the one described beneath which is purportedly as big as your head, but an average-sized one. The deal here is the burrito and an order of french fries for $5.40 [$6.01]. You have a choice of seven main ingredients for the burrito. I usually flex between ground beef and steak. This evening, I had steak.The steak was a bit tough in some spots. At least two cuts were unchewable. But most of the steak was ok. The onions are chopped, and are very fresh. The fries are institutional, but prepared very well. They keep their temperature for a good time, which is rare amongst any restaurants. (I took this order out.)The 'American' items are still on the menu. I haven't had them.Is this a venue worth going out of your way for? I say "no". But it's an ok place. There are not a lot of dinner options in Belmont-Cragin, especially around Belmont & Cicero.Transit options: The #77 Belmont bus runs past here _all the time_. The #54 Cicero runs twenty hours a day on that street; and the #X54 Cicero Express runs five days a week from AM through PM rush hours.

5.description: One word....Yumm!!!!

7.description: Yup, another typical 24 hour neighborhood Mexican restaurant. They have all the standard fair. Tacos, burritos, tortas, etc. They also have a breakfast menu with all the typical Mexican breakfast choices such as chorizo con huevos. And all are just as good as any other typical small neighborhood Mexican restaurant. They even have hamburgers if you so desire. The food or the "circuses" will not be knocking anyone's socks off that visits here. It's decent food that will do the job of filling you up if you are hungry.A friend had to drive there to get his drunk dad his burrito fix. He wondered why his dad made him drive really far to this place when there are other restaurants closer to him. After he found out why, he told me. Then I got curious. So what is the main draw of this place? What makes it so different from any other typical Mexican restaurant? Well, it is open 24 hours. Which is helpful if you live around Belmont and Cicero.But it really is their burrito. No, not the regular burrito that's on the menu, but their biggest one. And they don't mess around when it come to it. There's another Mexican restaurant that claims they have "burritos as big as your head." Well, Burrito King puts that place to shame!Burrito King really does have a burrito that is comparable to a person's head (ok, pretty damn close). It's friggin' huge! A (roughly) foot-long burrito that weighs in at around 3 pounds, and costs just over $10. It may be worth it to some to stop in just to see the damn thing! It easily feeds 2-4 people. It's like a urban legend! Go check it out if you're hungry and got the cash to burn! But I do have a feeling not too many people order it, because sometimes the cook has to ask for advice on the best way to fold the damn thing!

8.description: It was a late night and my friends and I were coming back home from a party and we all needed to get something to eat. It just happens to be that after drinking alcohol my friends and I crave burritos. I'm not sure why, but this place had the best tasting burritos I've ever tasted. The meat wasn't over cooked or dry like at other locations I have been at. The cooks are very friendly and have a good humor, they even crack a joke here and there. My friends and I will be giving this place another visit soon.

0.description: Hell yes!! In Chicago there are many, "we have a big burrito" claims, but this place is it, bar none. It's three pounds for 11$ and some change, that's with tax, and it's a steak burrito also.Small, friendly and clean. Even the clientele is friendly, had a nice conversation about the pope situation and the state of the Catholic church while waiting for my burrito to get packaged to go. I will be making this a regular stop. I even took a picture of the huge burrito that served up a few meals. It doesn't fit in those plastic bags the size you get at the grocery store, they put a paper bag on each end, then put it in the plastic bag. Half of it hangs out, I recommend you carry it like a new born across your forearm.

3.description: Expensive frames, high prices,  lousy area,  nice girls work there but there is some guy who was there when I picked up my son's glasses and when my son complained that he could not see with them,  he got kindaticked off.  I won't be back in that neighborhood.   I like the guy that used to own that place, but not this one.   Even Sears is better, cheaper and more polite.

1.description: Went to get glasses for my daughter and son on 12/3/14 and they told me they would be ready in 8-10 weeks because of my insurance. Tomorrow is going to be 12 weeks and I still haven't received them. First and last time I come to this place. I do NOT  recommend this place to anyone! Very disappointedyUPDATE: 3/4/15 Finally got the call that the glasses were ready. Well when we went they told me that only my daughter's glasses were ready. I asked why if they were ordered on the same day she said she didn't know. Then I asked if I could get my son's prescription and she said that I had to go to the clinic were my son got the eye exam. Very unprofessional. 13 weeks to get only one out of two pairs ordered. Let's see how long does it take to get my son's eyeglasses!

2.description: Was very upset at the customer service I recieved on thursday Dec 11 2014. I currently am disabled and have medicaid and medicare. I went for an eye exam about almost a month ago and was told that my primary insurance only covered glasses and not the eye exam. I then told the lady I have a 3 year memebership for America's Best I was able to afford a few years back I can go and get my exam there and bring the prescription here to get it filled correct? She said yes it will take approximately 8 to 10 weeks to be delivered because of the insurance I said okay I will return another day with the prescription.  On Thursday I returned I explained the situation and was told to pick out a pair of eyeglasses which I did and then was told by a young man that I needed to leave my original prescription with them. I then got upset and asked why? He then stated that the insurance company would not approve the payment for the glasses if the original copy was not sent over. Of course I knew it was a lie. His co-worker seconded his response and stated that I needed to give them my original prescription I then replied no again I paid several years back for my 3 year memebership and I wanted to keep "My prescription" what I do with it is my business I paid for it afterall but I did want to use it online to purchase cheap inexpensive glasses if I was to find a cheap website but then again that was none of their business I didn't feel like I needed to explain anything to them. Meanwhile it seemed like they were amuzed by my reaction of wanting to keep my prescription I was highly upset and disgusted another man walked into the front and seen I was upset he then expained to me that they(Galileo Optical) "prefer" to keep the original and only send out the copy to the insurance I was shocked by his response and said wow these two gentlemen told me otherwise he then said we will put your order through with the copy then he turned to the young ignorant man and his response with his back turned to me and his co-worker was I am not taking care of her I dont even want to talk to her Wow ! 2 thumbs up ! Great customer service! You should be Employee of the year! GALILEO OPTICAL PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES TO KEEP IGNORANT COMMENTS TO THEMSELVES AND BETTER TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES! I Will pick up my glassea when they are ready but will never return here again THANKS

0.description: I went in to get an eye exam with my mom on February 2nd because we had recently switched our insurance plan and this office was the closest provider that accepted our new insurance. We had an appointment with Dr. Berry and she was wonderful. She was extremely thorough and answered all of our questions. My mom speaks English as a second language and so I really appreciated Dr. Berry's patience examining my mom because she's not the easiest person to understand. Dr. Berry was really good at making sure I was confidently answering all her questions so I knew I was getting a good exam. The doctor said that my mom was showing early signs of cataract and so she wrote her a referral to another doctor that can help, all of which is going to be covered by our insurance! At the end, Marianne helped me and my mom pick out a pair of glasses that were covered by our insurance and we spent about 10 minutes looking. The office has a lot of really nice frames, but we were really only looking to get what was covered by our insurance. We got a call from their office today that our glasses were ready and we just picked them up and everything worked out great! Everyone was so nice and willing to help. They're really all we're looking for in an eye care facility. Keep up the good work everyone!

4.description: good place and good workers. I struggled to put my contacts on, but they bever gave up on me. They want you to leave happy. I would recommend everybody to go here.

1.description: The pizza here is pretty great but the service is pretty terrible. The young ladies at the front counter have a bad attitude. The last time I was there in person I promised myself I wouldn't eat there again because of how unfriendly they were. It's such a shame because the pizza is great. And I since I live 2 min away, the pizza is always so fresh!

9.description: First and last time ordering from here!! If we die you know why!! Pizza was burnt!! Pizza Cheese was gummy!! Cheesy fries... you call that cheese?? OMG WORST FRIES EVER!! Called to get a new pizza but my choices were feed my family or wait... so we ate it!! bad choice!! Now we all have stomach aches... Cochiaro's made it out to be our fault for being hungry and choosing to eat the burnt pizza... REALLY?? NOT WHAT I WANTED FOR MY EVENING... does not deserve one star!!

23.description: I'm fine seconding what Elisa said about how she likes COCHIARO'S.They print restaurant flyers which you can find in the neighborhood, containing coupons that give customers an even better deal.In the neighborhood their stuffed pizza isn't better than most though, it is simply THE best.

5.description: Idk why this place is even open I ordered two large and they got delivered 2 hours later super cold! I live only a couple blocks away so I should've just walked to get it myself. The pizza was cheese and it was the worst, it was cold, cheese tasted like plastic the bread was hard and the sauce ? What sauce?

25.description: The pizza ain't that great but every thing else is delicious. baked mostacholi mmmm and the ribs and rib tips ar to die for. some of the best ive ever tried and a great portion

12.description: Horrible customer service!!! To start off I  am a manager at a pizzeria as well and the number one thing I train my employees to do is great the customer! As soon as a customer walks in a simple " hello how can I help you?" Is what the customer who mind you is paying your hourly pay is supposed to be greated but nope not here I walked in to place an order because my child wanted hotwings for dinner and I was so upset with the service I recieved. No greeting, no thank u ur order will be out in so many minutes not even a reciept one girl was on her cell phone squating down behind the register and two other girls were behind the counter and the cook was obviously not busy because he was in the front as well so now I go to my main complain I went to purchase another can of soda and at the same time asked the cashier who's name was Alyssa "Do you know how much longer my order will be? " and she replied " I don't know I didn't take your order?" I WAS SHOCKED ! Really ??? Wow well then I told her really thats not the way you are supposed to answer I then told her That I managed a restaurant as well and said what she should have replied was I will check ma'am what did you ordered unfucken believable I then asked if there was a manager on duty as she walked away the other cashier said no there isn't this restaurant is obviously not being managed correctly and the owner should reconsider training employees on customer service I mean the customer does pay the employees payroll it doesnt come out of the owners personal money! I WILL BE STOPPING IN AND SPEAKING WITH THE MANAGER AND POSSIBLY THE OWNER

21.description: This place has a pretty extensive menu in addition to pizza after renovating a few years ago. They sell slices here and also have cheap "football" sized pizzas.Also if you are a fan of cheap and a fan of cheese fries.. I would recommend the ones served here.  You get a ridiculous amount of fries and artery clogging cheese on the cheap.

16.description: Another great pizza place. The slices are thick and filling.  A little pricey but not bad.I usually order delivery from here, parking here is pretty bad unless it's like super early I guess. Not much else to say about this place.

17.description: This place has a pretty extensive menu in addition to pizza after renovating a few years ago. They sell slices here and also have cheap "football" sized pizzas.Also if you are a fan of cheap and a fan of cheese fries.. I would recommend the ones served here.  You get a ridiculous amount of fries and artery clogging cheese on the cheap.

10.description: Well, I've only stopped in a couple times for slices of pizza to go so this review will be based on that alone.  As far as the pizza goes it was good.  Nothing to write home about, but a good fast alternative to ordering from a regular restaurant and waiting for my meal to be prepared.As far as the service goes I found it to be completely adequate.   I don't mean that to sound negative, but I found it to meet my minimum standards of customer service.  Nothing bad just no real enthusiasm about being there which of course then gets transferred to customers as a kind of a very laid back customer servie experience.Will I stop in again?  Yeah, I probably will, but I sure will go into it with realistic expectations.  Try it you may very well find it to meet your needs.

11.description: I love their food but the staff is so unprofessional. They don't greet customers and I can't tell you how many times I've been here and they were playing behind the counter with each other. What happened to professionalism and greeting customers with a smile? I mean we are paying to dine here. Good food but poor service.

26.description: If you live in West Logan Square, this place is great for cheap pizza, chicken, ribs, et cetera. They deliver, and the food is actually pretty good!My boyfriend and I stopped in here one night on our way home and picked up some ribs, a meatball sandwich, and fried mushrooms. The portions were HUGE. The ribs were $7 and came with a ton of fries and coleslaw. The sandwich was under $5 and came with fries. The order of mushrooms was massive, also. We didn't even come close to finishing it.The sauce on the ribs was slightly spicy and sweet, and the ribs were cooked very well- very tender, not chewy at all. The meatball sandwich and coleslaw were pretty decent, nothing to write home about. The mushrooms were piping hot and really flavorful.Prices are really reasonable. We recently tried the pizza here and it's pretty good, better than most pizza joints in the neighborhood.

22.description: My fiance and I ordered from here 2 weeks ago and got a stuffed spinach pizza. The sauce and the crust was fantastic, and the spinach was just ok. We really want to try their thin crust and other stuffed toppings.

0.description: For some reason I want to call you Coochies! LmaoI have a bad mind at 1 a.m. As I sit here and write about Coochies. But Coochies has nice salads and I enjoy their meat.No for real, chicken Cesar salad is amazing for $7 and it is big as hell. The pizza is greasy so you better pick up some liquor at J.J. Peppers before you get that coochie. Food is super fresh here and super fast. If you need a fix on Sunday Funday before Dexter, this is your favorite corner to go.Oh cochiaros, I love you and your name.

20.description: This place should get at least three stars from me. There is one thing and one thing only that holds me back from doing that, and unfortunately it has nothing to do with the establishment itself, but instead its surroundings- PARKING. The parking here is absolutely ridiculous. Cochiaro's Pizza shares a minuscule parking lot with a large junk gift shop, a Subway, a J.J. Peppers, and I believe a currency exchange (if I'm not mistaken). The problem starts once the lot is full, because then, people begin to park behind you and block your car in. This leads to two things- frequent parking lot rage (and I've seen it get ugly here) and then there are the people who park far from the cement parking strip to avoid being blocked in. It only makes it harder to navigate the lot. Getting out of a spot (if you can find one) can be treacherous. There are people and cars bouncing around everywhere. This says good things about Cochiaro's. The food is great. The prices are dirt cheap. I can get a large slice of cheese pizza, an order of fries (that always come out piping hot and fresh), and a liter of Coca Cola for about three dollars. Not like I really need a liter, it's just that the price of a liter here is just slightly more than a can, so...why not? I have tried the buffalo strips here, and they weren't that good. I figured this is mainly a pizza spot, but from I read, they excel in other things, so I've just got to try them some time. IF I go back, considering the parking situation totally sucks. It's too bad, because the pizza is great and it's very close to the job. But, there are a lot of places to eat lunch in the 'hood, so...yeah.

19.description: 2 slices of good pizza fries and a drink under $4 is a deal in any language. I've been coming here for about 8 years and its the only place (aside from JJ Peppers) that's still around. Sausage pizza is good, fries are awesome, good burgers...

2.description: The food is pretty good... However I will not frequent this place because the lack of customer service. I came in the other day to order some buffalo wings. I literally sat for 35 min waiting. When I asked the girl at the front (dark hair kind of big ears) how much longer would my food take? Her reply was, well we have other orders in front of you. Even though I have watched people come in and out to be successfully served. I waited another 10 min at that time I requested a full refund and suggested there be a better way to handle waiting customers. It would've been better for the cashier to let me know that they were behind (so she says) when I started to order. At least I would've had the option.

18.description: This place should get at least three stars from me. There is one thing and one thing only that holds me back from doing that, and unfortunately it has nothing to do with the establishment itself, but instead its surroundings- PARKING. The parking here is absolutely ridiculous. Cochiaro's Pizza shares a minuscule parking lot with a large junk gift shop, a Subway, a J.J. Peppers, and I believe a currency exchange (if I'm not mistaken). The problem starts once the lot is full, because then, people begin to park behind you and block your car in. This leads to two things- frequent parking lot rage (and I've seen it get ugly here) and then there are the people who park far from the cement parking strip to avoid being blocked in. It only makes it harder to navigate the lot. Getting out of a spot (if you can find one) can be treacherous. There are people and cars bouncing around everywhere. This says good things about Cochiaro's. The food is great. The prices are dirt cheap. I can get a large slice of cheese pizza, an order of fries (that always come out piping hot and fresh), and a liter of Coca Cola for about three dollars. Not like I really need a liter, it's just that the price of a liter here is just slightly more than a can, so...why not? I have tried the buffalo strips here, and they weren't that good. I figured this is mainly a pizza spot, but from I read, they excel in other things, so I've just got to try them some time. IF I go back, considering the parking situation totally sucks. It's too bad, because the pizza is great and it's very close to the job. But, there are a lot of places to eat lunch in the 'hood, so...yeah.

13.description: I don't like to go here anymore because all of the combos are required to have fries and a drink, you can't  just order a sandwich or hot dog. I've always disliked fries and it's  too much food, and I only drink water not that stuff with too much sugar or soda. I would like to order just two hot dogs, or just the sandwich not all the extra crap that I have to pay an extra 3 bucks for that I won't eat or drink. But they won't let me order it without fries or drink or at least they will charge me for it no matter what.

4.description: The food is ok but the cashiers aren't usually very welcoming and have an attitude about them. The tables are usually dirty and could really stand for a remodeling or a general good cleaning. Kinda pricey too for the quality of food.

24.description: I've ordered 3 times - Delivery is fast & Pizza is good...  4.25 Stars!!!

6.description: My Neighborhood pizza spot. They have a Great sauce flavor. You can walk in and get a pizza by the slice or pick from a nice variety of menu items like the meatball sandwich.

15.description: Salad!Absolutely love...love...LOVE THIS PLACE!The days I don't pack a lunch to work I am always calling in here for my salads!Staff is friendly and after I give them my phone number they already know what I want and how I want it ;)I always get their salads....the one that is my fave aside from chicken Caesar is their garden..sub romaine..add feta! They tend to load it with veggies the way I like it and know I am a 2 Italians 1 Caesar dressing chic..Always made fresh...quick so I never have to wait!Cochiaros keep doing yo thang!

7.description: My family usually orders the football pizza when I'm not in the mood to cook. We have enough pizza to eat for lunch, dinner and lunch the next day. The pizza is really good. They also have tender delicious rib tips. We've had other things from there but these two are our favorites. The only reason I only gave three stars is because on several occasions I have went there, the girls that work at the front counter never have hair nets on. They even have their hair down instead of up in a bun. That is a big no no when working in food service. I have even seen a couple of the girls playing in their hair while at the front counter. I always want to say something to them but I don't want to take any chances with them doing something to my food.

8.description: Order from here probably once a week and for any family gatherings. Pizza is always fresh and hot, wings are delicious and the lasagna yummy! The girls who answer the phone are always professional, quick and knowledgeable.

3.description: Had a slice of the deep dish sausage pizza and a drink for lunch which rang up to around $5.  It is a pizza place so I would expect the pizza to be the star, but honestly I was not impressed.  Crust was a little bread-y, service was meh.I may have to try more of their food, but my experience here didn't really leave me wanting to come back.

14.description: These people don't fuck around with cheese. We (three people) bought the large Chicago-style, and were filled up by the end of it. I had three and ad half pieces, and was good. (I am 6'4", and 250#) I haven't tried everything, but I am definitely chomping at the bit to try the broasted chicken.

3.description: I have passed this place many times on my way to visit my sister on Laramie but to my surprise everything I saw there was disappointing. The Mexican bread was not pleasing to the eye and my nephew tried their pizza and he didn't care for it. What a shame because the establishment before was Abondanza Pizzeria that was there for many years before closing.

1.description: I have no idea why someone would call this the best pizza, it's horrible! First of all it's way too expensive. It's also way too greasy! I've gone there before for pizza slices and they either don't have any or they're old slices. I bought two slices the other day and it was clear it had been sitting there for ages. I paid $4 for two slices of pizza that had the texture of an old leather boot, couldn't even finish it. The bread there is also hard and lacks texture. I wish I could like this place since it's near me and the Villa supermarket is great, but this place sucks.

2.description: Wow, how time flies. It's been almost four full years since I've been here. However, it was great I Yelped it and had it "on file" as reference. Needed to buy some bread on my way to work and this was right on my route! They open bright and early at 7am and I parked right in front about 7:30am, got in -bought my bread -and got out. Clerk was very friendly! Glad I know of this place. This will be my "pit stop I need some Mexican bread" go-to place...for sure!

5.description: It was not looking good at the beginning of my first visit. I was really mad that they didn't have the BBQ chicken I wanted (even though it's on the top of the list on the menu) so I had to change my order to the meat ravioli but it was still very delicious and the portions were huge. I would definitely go back, especially for the sweet mexican bread

0.description: I love this place! The best pizza in the northwest Chicago area. My favorite pizza is the Mexican style and the Chicken Alfredo. The Italian Beef is delicious and fresh. They always have good specials. It's very convenient because they have a bakery and the Flan is delicious! Try not to go on a Tuesday when the Chef is not there. Other than that I highly recommend this place.

4.description: I usually get the Mexican bread from here on the weekends since it's nice and fresh. They also sell pizza which is not bad at all and prices are great. They also have a grocery store next to them which is fantastic. Inside the grocery store they sell tacos, tortas, burritos, and on the weekend Mexican specialty dishes. Their tacos and tortas here are delicious! They also sell rotisserie chicken and carnitas!

0.description: This place is awesome. It used to be a tattoo shop too but now it is a supply shop only. I got my first tattoo from this place over 10 yrs ago and it still looks great. Now I am married to a tattoo artist, so this place is very much apart of my life. My hubby does his own art so he mostly only gets the combo needles and the inks here, but they sell all types of products. Also keep your receipts from all of your purchases because once you've accumulated a certain amount you can redeem them for money off your next purchase.

3.description: Just left here after waiting an hour for a so called hot and ready pizza. Order a pepperoni pizza and the cashier told me they forgot to put the order in tge oven after waiting there for about half hour. Asked for a refund and she told me that i would have to wait for a manager to come in for the over ride. Forget tgis place!!! Never again!!!!

1.description: Incompetent workers ! How the hell do you get an order wrong ! Stupid high school kids ! Stay in school and don't drop out , because if you can't get a damn pizza correct .... what else are you going to do ! Worst location ever !

2.description: Horrible customer service. Giving a really bad attitude. Making the customers not to come back here

5.description: 2 stars because it's a large pizza for $5. CMON! They bake it for you and put it in a box. Seriously... the box alone probably costs a dollar at Crate and Barrel and imagine the ingredients that go into the pizza. Whew!This is a definite MUST if you are having a party and are on a budget. The service is shitty. You can be standing in line for 10-15 minutes and the cashiers are either arguing with each other or ignoring you profusely. That kind of apathy takes talent. It's supposed to be Hot n Ready, but usually it's neither. However, if you go in for cheese pizza, you are likely to get it right away. I usually preorder it and pick it up. Preordering doesn't usually help though, when there is only one cashier open and she is taking orders from 20 people ahead of you in line.IDGI!? They need a manager who knows how to delegate tasks. It could run a lot smoother down there. But then again... fi dolla!

0.description: If I'm in the pizza mood for thin crust pizza, I'd say 80 percent of the time, I order from here.  Why?  Well, large pizza for 5 bucks with a choice of topping.  I mean, you can't go wrong with that.  Frozen pizzas in the stores actually cost more.  Most importantly, the pizza is pretty decent.  The best? No. not even close, but still tasty, especially for the prices.1 bad thing is that this place  can sometimes get busy in the evenings.  Nothing you can do about that, at most you'd wait 10min for pizza( hey, you know it's going be hot and fresh.

4.description: They do take a little longer then most little caesars, but they make really good pizzas here! Love coming to this location!

1.description: The outward appearance isn't exciting but the food and amazing service will immediately make you forget that. The food is delicious. Very authentic. I've visited this place twice already and both times I enjoyed the food and the nice waitstaff. They do not accept debit/credit cards.... Cash only. If you want authentic food, please visit this place. They also sell Honduran products.

2.description: This place is decent. I have never tried hondurian food until now. My Boyfriend and I decided to have lunch here since our car was being fixed across the street from this joint. The food tastes slightly like a mix of Puerto Rican food and Mexican food. The staff was really friendly. There was only one other couple eating there. It looks like they don't carry a lot of business here. But 4 stars to their friendly staff and decent food.

0.description: This is a cool little Honduran spot. After being seated the waitress greeted me with a complimentary bowl of chicken soup--maybe the best I've ever had. Very authentic Central American spot. Nice menu, good for take-out as well.

3.description: I too am writing this review to say...BEST STOP FOR VERY AFFORDABLE SOUVENIRS. ....thanks to those that reviewed before, as we would not have discovered this treasure trove otherwise......yes there's your basic dollar items, but some great values are found in this little  shop for .99 to 5.99 in tshirt, pens, magnets, mugs...etc and soooo much more! :)

1.description: "Dollar Land" appears to be the cousin of "Dollar Tree," except they aren't related.  I found this place via Yelp because some have mentioned that an assortment of Chicago souvenirs could be found in here.  I have verified the statement to be accurate.  Toward the end of the store, you will find lots, lots of key chains, enough for every freakin' hotel room in the world.  There are also mugs, picture frames, postcards, cold-weather accessories, t-shirts, and some random Chi-town memorabilia.  If you own a real estate agency and are in need of a large classic downtown Chicago panoramic photo, they have it for sale for about $14.  Unless you can spot one (1) of those in a thrift store, the price is considered decent in my opinion.  If you're in charge of a Big Fat Greek wedding, you can a plenty of hair pieces, bands, and ties.  They may not be made of genuine Swarovski crystals, but they are just as sparkling, perhaps under a different refractive index in which you cannot really detect visually.  Wanna funky shoelaces for your boring Timberland?  Grab some of these here in Dollar Land.  Other noticeable electronic essentials are converters and transformers for your decade-old electronic devices.  Hubby saw a transformer for converting 300 ohm to 75 ohm.  Yeah, that was what he said since I'm pretty clueless with knowing exactly what it does.  I just jotted it down verbatim.  I had some spare cash so I didn't see the need to look for my credit card.  It's always useful to carry some cash with you since most small businesses in Chi-town prefer green dollars.  You can't never go wrong making friends with George, Abe, Alex, and Andrew.

2.description: Great prices and huge inventory of things. I would definitely recommend checking this place out. Also if you're looking for souvenirs this is the right place to go. Not too expensive.

5.description: Awesome store ! So many accessories for $1 and some kept behind the counter for only $3-$5.Their accessories are endless in this store. You could probably stay in this store for a good hour or so.Parking sucks, so come prepared.

6.description: Chicago Souvenirs! The best prices in... Well Chicago. If you're from Chi. (Not some far land like Naperville and you say you are from Chicago) you will have no problem finding this place. Souvenir key chains, caps mugs for 1.00! Oh my! Why would you pay $10 for the same stuff on Michigan Abenue?

7.description: hands down. best dollar store in chicago. best earrings. best fake nails. eyeliner for under $2.00. i can usually spend 1-2 hours in this store. amazing.

0.description: Great place for souvenirs. This place is very cheap meaning affordable you want spend that much on gifts.

4.description: Excellent souvenir buys for minimal price. I would recommend to anyone who wants to buy for others but does not want to spend the ridiculous $6.99 for a key chain. They have thousands of keychains, coffee mugs, t shirts, magnets etc...

58.description: A GEM!I got a humungous pita sandwich that was bigger than my face for $3.49. The woman who helped us was so sweet and we watched as she cooked everything right then and there. This place is wonderful. Try the lentil soup too!

56.description: I tried this place because it's closer to me than Pita Inn. Yeah... it's nothing like Pita Inn. The prices are higher, but the quality and quantity is lower.  Glad I used a Yelp deal. Not coming back.

29.description: I am a fan of this place. Fresh food, good service and great price. What else your can ask for?

42.description: Love this place, great people, phenomenal food. I highly recommend this place.

23.description: Great service and awesome food.. What's not to love? Lentil soup was one of the best I've ever had. We got the sample platters to try a little of everything and was not disappointed. Wish I had found this gem before...

47.description: We weren't sure about trying out this new place, because I am obsessed with the chicken shawarma from the Pita Inn. Still, we gave it a go and were pleasantly surprised. I had the chicken shawarma sandwich, my friend had the vegan plate, and we both got the lentil soup. Everything was super tasty and reasonably priced. The shawarma is very different than what I've had at other places, but in a good way. It comes in a sort of creamy (yogurt?) sauces with onions and herbs.I would definitely order delivery from here again!

8.description: I often get delivery from here and I hope they continue to do well because the food is damn good. Only knock is sometimes the delivery can take too long. It's usually the owner delivering. He's a funny and really nice dude. I'm truly surprised at these reviews. This place is a gem. I haven't had many better chicken shawarmas than theirs. Taking the foil top off its little cozy cocoon evokes the joys of Christmas morning. It's on the long/skinny side, but the way the pita is a little crispy and the hot sauce goes so well with it, everything is seasoned so perfectly, and you peel the foil away with each bite, the thing is just a delight. Their baba ghanoush is a little smoky and just so freaking good. They also have Vimto which is like an Arabic cream soda. Weird, but awesome. Like the rest of it.

31.description: Food was not great and over price for a gyro. There is a better gyro place one block down.

34.description: Chicken shawr....what ever you call it wasnt "clean" in flavor. 6.99 for that was a little bit too much for dry chicken so atleast the flavor could've compensated for its size. Subway over this little sour patch lol. I tried better chicken pita over this.

16.description: Best Chicken Shawarma! The Stuffed Falafel Were Amazing! One Thing I Was Disappointed With Was That They Didn't Have The Beef Shawarma. But Overall, Great Food And Service!

13.description: I love this place. The balsamic rice is phenomenal. The  Sulten combo is my fav. Great flavors. Very clean environment and the young guy is always a warming, friendly and funny dude. This is by far my favorite local restaurant.

11.description: Wow! Finally a good Mediterranean place nearby the brickyard to eat without haVing to drive far. I came not expecting much, but when I tasted the hummusi was sold. We also order the Sultan Combo Plate and I was surprised how delicious this was and at a great price. Well definitely be Coming back more often!

39.description: Ordered delivery and it was AWESOME! Falafel sandwich, fries, chicken shark and hummus about $22. Delivery was in good time, driver was really nice. I'm so glad this place is so close!

37.description: Came by to check this place out with my girlfriend who is a vegetarian because of the different vegetarian/vegan options they have. Kinda on the ropes at first because I'm not a vegetarian but the complete opposite, so as I looked through the menu it was not just vegetarian but had everything that you would expect to put on a pita. I went with a Gyro Supreme and all I can say it was DELICIOUS, I had plenty of gyros before but the fact they had their UNIQUE twist with added cucumbers, feta, and banana peppers just had me very HAPPY with my decision. As far as my girlfriend's salad she did not enjoy as much as I did the gyro, but only because the salad was over seasoned as well as the croutons. The Baba Ghanoush was GOOD, I normally don't have crave it but overall tasted GOOD. If it wasn't because the over seasoned salad and croutons I would had rated this place with 5 STARS, but a very FRIENDLY environment with the staff being funny cracking jokes making it more a fun experience.

0.description: This establishment is close to where my wife works, so we decided to have lunch here.  We had the Chicken Shawarma sandwich and it was delicious.   The grill it on a panini press to give the sandwich a crunchy edge.  As a side dish, we had the Jerusalem salad and Hummus.   The salad was evcellent with fresh tomatoes and cucumbers, while the hummus was creamy.Overall, an evcellent stop and healthier alternative for lunch.  The owners are friendly and are happy for your business.

38.description: This was our first time here and I have to say, Chicago Pita Grill is underrated!  This place is AMAZING! We got the Mediterranean sample platter, falafel,  and Greek fries. Everything was fresh,  grilled perfect,  great seasoning,...I can go on and on. Great customer service. This place is definitely UNDERRATED. I wentered back just this week and will keep coming back! Definitely a must try!!!

51.description: great middle eastern food so close  to my house usually go sawarma inn on lincoln but will be coming here on the reg now  they even deliver yess winning

27.description: Great food, was delivered fresh, and hot. Really hit the spot. And the meat was Halal, not many places in the neighborhood have both tasty and halal food. Had the plate special and the chicken shawarma sandwhich, tangy and great!

32.description: Delicious! The best falafel and hummus I've had hands down! I ordered the chicken shawarma sandwich and it was also delicious. As I mentioned to the funny guy behind the counter that it was my first time here and needed to try the lentil soup at the next visit, he gave a sample to try as I was waiting for my order. Now that's great customer service. Come for the service, come for the clean eatery, come for the affordable price. But for goodness sake, come for the food! I'll definitely coming back!

54.description: Just had this delivered for the first time and the food was awesome! We both had gyros and they were packed with meat! Also, the hummus was one of the best I've ever had and the pitas with it were delicious. Definitely will be ordering this again!

48.description: awesome food and awesome customer service! the cashier is very very polite! he made my day with his jokes and hilarious attitude. I couldn't decide what I wanted on the menu so he voluntarily gave me free samples. He was very very inviting and I loved it. Also, if you are one of those people who is afraid of dirty kitchens, these guys make everything right in front of your face. so no worries. It's not too pricey, you'll get what you paid for. Plenty of seating. Sometimes they close later than the times posted online, so you should call and check if you plan on coming after 9.

44.description: Very good chicken shawarma and very nice staff. I'll definitely be returning!

24.description: Best Chicken Shawarma! The Stuffed Falafel Were Amazing! One Thing I Was Disappointed With Was That They Didn't Have The Beef Shawarma. But Overall, Great Food And Service!

7.description: Ok, just ok. I ordered the chicken kabob dinner which in other restaurants is usually rice, potato, salad, u know a dinner! What I got served was a kabob sandwich on pita with some rice. That's it!! For abt nine or ten bucks! The flavor of the rice was blah and mushy , the kabob sandwich was also blah. I won't be coming back to get my Kabob dinner fix here again. Too pricey for the portion. Also b careful in that lot, it's super tight!!

49.description: We moved into the neighborhood in October, and didn't discover this place until several months later. The food is EXCELLENT. It's on par with some of the best Mediterranean food I've ever had.My favorite is the chicken shwarma, but the kefta kabob is really good too. I love their hummus. They garnish it with pickles and olives and these delightful little spears of red goodness that I was told today are pickled radishes. (Who knew?) Always served up with toasty pita, it never disappoints.My wife really loves the curried chicken sandwich, and I have to say that it's pretty damn good (whenever I can get her to share a bite with me). They serve it with some sort of amazingly delicious sauce...I think with a yogurt base.This place is not perfect: not so great ambience; it's tucked back behind a Subway in a little strip mall. The dining room seems a little too big for the 2 and 4 top tables; they could really use some cozy booths if they hope to attract more people dining in. Once we ordered a side of falafel, and it was slightly over done. But everything else - the food, the service - is top notch. If you're not in the mood for hipster lines at Sultan's Market, come to Chicago's Pita Grill for food that's just as good without the crowds.

40.description: Love this place! I live about 5 mins away, this is my local go-to middle eastern fodo place. I am obsessed with falafels and their wraps are amazing! I echo the other reviewers on the deliciousness of their lentil soup! Chicken shawarma also a great treat. Plus it's a family owned place, and that just gives me a warm feeling in my heart, just like the warm feeling in my tummy after I'm done eating from here. :)

53.description: Really fresh, delicious Mediterranean. Had the Greek salad and was very impressed. The owner was really nice and checked in on us too. Will go back!

30.description: I purchase a coupon from yelp 20 dollars for 14dollars . I place the order for pick up and they would not accept the coupon cause it was for dine in and not take out.Iam so piss off I had to buy my order out of pocket plus I still have the coupon that I purchase.iam so disappointed on the service and they were so rude

46.description: Kind of in the middle of nowhere, but we live in that direction, so it's not too much farther West. I LOVE their chicken shawarma. I've had chicken shawarma elsewhere and haven't been impressed, but Chicago Pita Grill wins. Those pickled things are the shit. The baba ghanouj is also absolutely delicious and smoky. I think I may be drooling as I type this. The pita's always served warm and fresh. If the owner (or whom I assume is the owner) is there, he's always quick with the bad jokes. Nice guy, though.

1.description: If I were just rating this place based on the food, it would be a 5 star rating. The chicken shawarma was the best I've ever had. The chicken and sauce were amazing. The basmati rice was also incredible. The Greek salad was good. I would skip the fries, but who needs fries when you have all the other options? The baklava was excellent. The atmosphere was a bigger issue. The restaurant is set up to order at the counter, which makes it seem that food will be prepared quickly. We were told that they were out of rice and that it would take 20 minutes for more to be ready. It took longer than that to get our food. The room was also extremely cold. It was so cold I had to keep on my heavy winter coat for the first whole meal, as did all the other women and a few men in the restaurant. The worst part was that they had a big screen TV on the wall that was playing a TLC surgery show. The last thing I want to see when I'm eating is a bloody open heart surgery. The restaurant needs to get their efficiency systems and atmosphere figured out. In short, the food is amazing. The overall atmosphere and experience is lacking. I will definitely be back and update with a higher rating if the atmosphere improves.

55.description: Okay so I've been here many times since my initial review and have been treated much better. It's now our go-to place for delicious Mediterranean food. Chicken kebab plate is yummy and a good deal. Delivery is always quick and the guy is very friendly. Food tastes great, not stale like other places. A+!

9.description: Delicious food, staff is friendly, their jokesters too ;) a little pricey!  They always charge me full price for babaganuche, even though I ask them NOT to serve me hummus, which is included in the entree, as well as no pita bread... Bedsides that, super good food !

26.description: Nothing else like this in the neighborhood.  Good quality food but don't expect to get your money's worth when it comes to meat though.  If they would just serve a good amount of meat with their meals i would go back and often.  Until then, I will consider something else because of that.  Will try again but scared I will be disappointed.

25.description: Gfhvgggfu gyhhb ghhbvc ggcg fihg. Yxgur t gg f fjxjjdijdj duuuejjd dudhjud ududhdhj dujdbdbb

12.description: Stopped in here cause I was taking back roads home and I was starving. Ordered 2 chicken schwarmas and they were cold with not much meat. Not good at all.

59.description: I tried the Chicken Shawarma sandwich and a side of hummus which was great. The sandwich was flavorful and big enough to share. The only problem is the location. Its off to the side and around the corner so it was hard to spot... I actually drove past it twice before I realized it was next to the subway. Overall, it was a good food experience not to different from other Mediterranean restaurants but good and if I'm ever in the area again I would go back.

21.description: Great little middle eastern joint, chicken kabobs are great, rice could be better, great service however.

17.description: I am a fan of this place. Fresh food, good service and great price. What else your can ask for?

10.description: Found on Yelp and ordered. The gyro platter was SO good! Greek fries were not good, won't order those again. I'll def order from here again!

5.description: Damn good, let me come back and get it again, that chicken shwarma sandwich is the bomb kid....they have their own parking lot. Sweet place, super clean, lots of room to sit and mingle. Tasty, will return and get another star up...
