3.description: Ordered gyros, greek fries, falafel and fattoush salad. My only complaint is with the fattoush salad. I'm used to the salad being quite big with lots of leafy greens and veggies. I ordered 1 large ($4.99) and 1 small ($3.49) fattoush salad and couldn't believe how small they both were, not to mention the lack of actual lettuce.Other than that everything had good flavor, and the staff was friendly.

35.description: My family just can't get enough of this place the food is bananas people and not only is the food great! But it's consistent, we have all gone some where and thought wow that was pretty good only to go back and it's was just blah the second time around how frustrating and that usually leads to me never returning. This is a family business and you definitely get that family vibe if you dine in the owner Mario is hilarious and always cracking jokes serving you excellent food with a smile the place is great the service is great and the people are awesome I'd recommend this to anyone that wants to have a great meal enjoy a nice environment and leave with a full belly and a smile on your face!!

19.description: Love love this place their chicken shawarma is so good and the rice out of this world if you never tried this kind of food and you can't decide what to order I suggest you order the Sultan Combo you get all their meats to try and then u can pick your favorite one well hope this helped....

28.description: This place is amazing! Stuffed falafels are so good!! I used to think Pita Inn was good but not anymore! This place is way better. Lentil soup and falafel sandwich is very good too.

45.description: A true scam of a dive. Had higher expectations coming here due to the previous reviews but found myself with a horrendous experience. I ordered their signature Pita Grill Special dinner plate and boy was it off. The plate was so light that I took the food back. The cook was confused. I was given two small pieces of chicken, a few beef chunks and couple of thinly sliced gyro pieces on a pita with a bunch of fries. All of the meat fit on the pita and that was it for the price of $9.49. Talk about fleecing your customers. I would have been better off ordering any pita sandwich and would have gotten more meat ( I hope) than the dinner plate. The meat was not fresh and was reheated, very dry and no texture. At least give your customers some extra gyro meat since you fail to give enough chicken or beef. Absolutely low class from this establishment and I will never return here no matter what. If you feel like paying high prices for mediocre food and small portions, then please continue on. There are many, many other similar like places that serve you better.

33.description: This place doesn't look very impressive, but it's easily one of my favorite takeout places northwest of Logan Square, and one of my fave falafel/shawarma joints in the city as well. Their falafel rocks my world. Also the family that runs the place is super amicable.

43.description: As a native New Yorker blessed to live in the city, I've not met a place that offers both good food and awesome friendliness of all staff members. The food is delicious, well seasoned and the meat is juicy and tender. I got the sultan platter to taste a bit of everything and was not disappointed.  I will most likely return to this place again before my short two month stay is over.

2.description: After reading all the positive reviews, I was eager to try this place out but after yesterday's experience I'm regretting that.I ordered a vegan falafel and a beef kabob dinner. They seemed to be frantic the entire time and there was definitely tension between the staff. I used a coupon I got on Yelp and the guy seemed confused about it. Luckily he figured it out and waved the few cents left. I initially asked for the salad with the falafel, but saw that the rice was good. So I asked if I could switch it to a rice instead of a salad and they initially said yes. Then they tell me no cuz it'll be another 25 minutes till its done (mind you, I've already waited about 10 minutes). So I said forget it, just get me the salad. Then another 10 minutes go by and the guy calls me over again. He tells me that the dinner is supposed to come with rice too and it'll be done in another 15 minutes. By this time I'm already frustrated and would rather just get my food and leave, but the reviews raved about the rice so I said I'll just wait for the rice to be done. So I asked if they could do the rice for the falafels as well and they looked all frustrated about me switching my order. YO if you're going to make me wait for 35 minutes, I expect to get what I want. The staff knew I was not happy about the wait and miscommunication, so I expected to get something comped. Nope, nada. And right when I was grabbing the food (40 minutes later), the guy tells me to grab only ONE pop can from the fridge which comes with the beef kabob dinner. Ok wow. You can't throw in another one for the inconvenience? Finally got home an hour later and started eating. The rice was good (that's why they got 2 stars), but the beef was dry and the falafels were okay. All in all, I don't think I'll be coming back again. The customer service was severely lacking and the rice wasn't good enough to ignore the dry beef.

18.description: My family just can't get enough of this place the food is bananas people and not only is the food great! But it's consistent, we have all gone some where and thought wow that was pretty good only to go back and it's was just blah the second time around how frustrating and that usually leads to me never returning. This is a family business and you definitely get that family vibe if you dine in the owner Mario is hilarious and always cracking jokes serving you excellent food with a smile the place is great the service is great and the people are awesome I'd recommend this to anyone that wants to have a great meal enjoy a nice environment and leave with a full belly and a smile on your face!!

41.description: i love this place!! Family business and the best Greek Salad and Shaorma in town! Go with confidence if you want to eat something delicious! We already went 5 times!

52.description: Ordered here for lunch through one of their website. I found it strange that they said all entrees come with a salad, but when I placed an order of sultan combo under their entree the lady called to let me know that they won't give me a salad. I told them that it clearly written on the website. She told me it was a mistake, so sorry.  Whatever happened to customer is always right. I should've cancelled the order and saved myself $35. The food was mediocre and the service was not so good. I would pass on here since there are many better options around

50.description: The falafel sandwich is disgusting,cold pita soaked in watery souce

4.description: I love that this place offers multiple Yelp deals! The workers were so nice and friendly. I enjoyed that you could see how they were making your food from every angle! Portions are large and the restaurant was simple and clean.

6.description: Come to Chicago's Pita Grill for chicken shawarma sandwich - you'll be hooked!  You could definitely taste a difference in freshness of the housemade pita bread and tahini sauce.  Chicken was seasoned well and juicy.  They add pickles and onions to it, which is unconventional, but those pickles are amazing!!!  I think it worked up my appetite more.I also like how the sandwich is wrapped so you can unwrap the first half and work your way down.  All the excess juice neatly falls to the bottom.  The portion was just right for lunch, but I could eat two if I was starving.  My only issue was that the lentil soup ordered for carryout was spoiled.  It was sour, and I'm surprised that there wasn't protocol to catch stuff like that.  More of a watery consistency, but flavor seemed to be okay if it had not turned bad. Conclusion: Shawarma is excellent.  I would have second thoughts about ordering soup again.

22.description: I love this place. The balsamic rice is phenomenal. The  Sulten combo is my fav. Great flavors. Very clean environment and the young guy is always a warming, friendly and funny dude. This is by far my favorite local restaurant.

15.description: in my opinion, best schwarma and sampler lunch special.  if I were to have once last meal on this earth, this place would be up there as my top 3.  in addition to their schwarma and sampler plate, I've had their baba ghounish and chicken breast pita.  the owners have been talking about introducing meat and veggie filled pastries which i'm looking forward to as everything is excellent and authentic.

57.description: Absolutely delicious. I always get the shawerma platter, gyros with rice (their rice is DELICIOUS), or the sultan combo plate. I recommend getting some garlic sauce or tahini sauce with it to go. You won't regret it. The meat is always warm and juicy and packed with flavor. The rice I could eat on it's own. The vegetables, unlike a lot of other places in the area, are fresh and crisp. I have also tried their falafel and they are onnn point. Too good. Will be coming back again. Most meals I have ordered have been under $9. I introduced my friends to it, and now they order food from here a lot.

20.description: Went on a Tuesday night.Fun and friendly staff.Loved the Pita Grill Special.Lentil soup was delicious too!

36.description: I was underwhelmed. The food was not that great. I didn't like the iceberg lettuce. I expected less American junk food and more real Middle Eastern. Honestly, I doubt I'll be back since I can head over to Lawrence and Kedzie and there's plenty of better options.

14.description: Went on a Tuesday night.Fun and friendly staff.Loved the Pita Grill Special.Lentil soup was delicious too!

12.description: I'm giving Bemo's 5 stars out of nostalgia, their friendliness, and the food.  I've been coming hear since I was kid and I'm psyched that they now have seats.  Yes, it's basic Chicago cuisine.  Hot dogs, Polish sausage, Italian sausage and beef, brats, Phillies, fries, etc.  It's greasy food and probably not very good for you.  If you're lookin' for healthy - stear clear!My personal favorite is the mostaccoli soup.  They take the juice from the Italian beefs and add it to mostaccolis.  I know, it's sounds gross but I'm addicted to it.  It's like my crack.  Love it!  My second personal favorite is the chicken Phillie.  It's a great sandwich that they serve on garlic bread.  Mmmm...And they give generous portions of everything.This isn't the kind of place you would travel across the city for but if you're in the area I'd say it beats McDonald's or Burger King any day.

7.description: This place is under new managemnet. The new owners are very friendly and make you feel at home. Portions are good size. Fries are fresh cut. Had their Philly Cheese Steak. Best I've had in years. Great place for lunch. Will be back soon.

3.description: Bemos has become a recent favorite. Fresh cut fries are a true sign of a good dog establishment and theirs are very good, and they put way more in the bag than I can ever eat. For an added bonus, put the fries on your dog for a near Gene & Jude's experience--without the drive. The dogs are very good, though the buns are generic and not steamed. The Philly Cheesesteak is what my GF gets, and she says over and over, "It's really f**king good." They are fast, affordable, give you tons of deliciousness, and are always very nice to me. They've earned a fan.Bonus health points: Something Sweet--with the best donuts around--is just one block west on Fullerton.

1.description: Great food & excellent service. Vietnamese food is delicious and freshly made. Will definitely come here again.

2.description: The worst Italian beef ever!. The meat was so pale with no flavor whatsoever.. The food got me and my wife sick. I will never go back, unless they decide to use fresh meat which I highly doubt. Good luck to all you brave souls that try this place. But I recommend just finding a Portillo's and getting your money's worth. But I guess it's true what they say you get what you pay for and at Bemo's you really do get what you pay for.. Cheap quality!.

9.description: great!

18.description: Ooo, I can't believe I am going to be the first one to write a review for Bemo's.  This place has been in the same spot since I was a kid.  It started as a TINY hot dog joint in the corner of the parking lot, over the years loyal customers came in and helped support the renovation.  Bemo's turned into a large hot dog resturant.  LOL.  I kid you not, this place has a lobby now with tables.  The food is classic Chicago Style.  Beefs, Polish sausage, Cheeseburgers, Hot Dogs, Chili Dogs, Cheese Fries.  Everything is on the menu and Fries come with any order.  Cheap, good food, friendly owner.  I love Bemo's.  Try the Milkshakes made with icecream and the cheese fries!!!

10.description: How can someone give this place one star? I'll admit it USED to be not so clean because the building was old and so was the decor. But now that it's renovated it's always clean. This place is "Chicago hot dog joint" at it's best. I grew up around there, and now that I moved and tasted suburban food I miss this food with a passion. Besides the delicious subs, hot dogs, and fries...they make this DELICIOUS grilled chicken on pita bread with grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, and mayo. SO GOOD! So good, I'm going to drive myself out there (1 and a half hours) this coming week. And they haven't raised their prices in soooooo long, that you can still walk out with a hot dog and fries for $2. C'mon! I pay $2 out here in the suburbs for a refill of pop at these disgusting tasting hot dog joints. Gotta love Chicago!

13.description: This place has been around for a long time.  My grandma used to pick up subs for us from Bemo's when she lived in the neighborhood.  Love the ham & turkey sub and cheese fries.  Great place!  Especially in the summer when it's too hot to cook!

16.description: Pretty sure this is location my dad just took me to.  I wanted to revisit the Vienna hotdog, though I do not like hotdogs. I still do not. They are gross. At least that's my opinion. And here they did not serve it with tomato. But Chicago hotdogs MUST have tomato, right?! I had to ask after I took it to table, and man at counter said something I didn't understand but part of it was "I told you I don't put tomato." I pointed out that the PICTURE had tomato, and I needed the real deal.Here's the thing, though, them fries are GOOD! That's why my dad took me and my grandpa there. They found this place while out one day, and he said the fries were the best they'd had. For $1.59, you get the full on dog AND a goodly amount of fries. And the fries look homemade. Have skin on, real potato, no frozen taste or texture. Really tasty.Forget the hot dog. Blech. But get thee some fries! The price is certainly right. You can feed your dog and yourself! (My dog wasn't with me, but if she were, I'd have given her the hot dog and kept the fries for myself.).

17.description: This joint has been around forever, and has a menu with many different offerings.   After driving past it dozens of times, I decided to stop in and check it out.  Their hot dogs are bargain-priced.  Their fresh cut fries are not greasy llike Gene's & Jude's or Parky's, but still very tasty.  I don't know if I'd put Original Bemos' in Super Dawg's class, but it will cost you less than half.  On Wednesday's, they offer milk shakes for 99-cents.  You can't beat that!

15.description: So I've driven by Bemos quite a few times and decided to stop there one day for lunch.  The place seemed pretty clean, not too many people there but it's kind of nicer that way.  I got a double cheese burger and some fries very reasonable and very heavy.  I almost fell asleep instantly after eating the burger.  Nice combos and pretty standard for a greasy spoon.

0.description: hands down best banh mi sandwich ever!!!!!!!!!

5.description: Oh Bemo's, your greasy goodness and huge portions have me coming back over and over again.  Love love love their fries that have the skin on, and if you get a combo it comes with a "Large" drink.  By large I think they mean "so big you can probably use it as a bucket".  My small hands have a hard time holding the thing.Food is great, and comes in great portions.  Last time I went I ordered their gyros dinner.  So good!  I think the most surprising thing on their menu is the egg rolls.  First hot dog/burger place I've been to that also served egg rolls.  And they're actually pretty good.  The tamales are not the typical tamales you get from the lady selling them from her cooler on the corner, they're the ones that come pre-packaged,  A little mushy, I'm not a fan of them.  But their other stuff is delicious!The owners have owned this place for years and are very friendly.  The space is open & clean, the parking lot is a little small but I'm grateful that they have one!  Great place to get a quick (and big) meal!

11.description: I was here one afternoon after doing grocery shopping. This time, I actually allowed myself to have its chicken breast sandwich (minus the tomato). This was adequate. The chicken (white meat) tasted fresh (not frozen). Again, this shows the versatility in the quality of its main foodstuffs - even items you would not expect to be as good as the items for which it is more well known were good.The french fries were very, very good. They were soft, slightly greasy, but with solid potato flavor. If you order a "combo", the size of your soda (Pepsi products) is immense.This is getting amazing. I might actually try its italian beef sandwich the next time. If that is even merely average - look out. Original Bemo's would get the fifth star for its congregation of quality meals.

8.description: I gotta say. The teriyaki beef sandwich is probably one of the best sandwiches in Chicago. I'm always driving around the streets of Chicago. So I've tried so many Resturaunts all over Chicago. Bemos is fantastic. The prices are cheap,and the food is awesome. The teriyaki beef sandwich is so darn good. Real peices of steak,onions and green peppers.Provolone cheese drenched in a great teriyaki sauce.And the fries are the best around.. I love this place. U gotta check it out!!

4.description: I was here with my family yesterday.  We tried the Philly steak, gyro, double cheeseburger, Vietnamese sandwich aka as "banh mi", and side orders.  In general everything are great especially the Vietnamese sandwich.  Will definitely come back for more. Great services 5stars!

14.description: Bemo's is disgusting. The food is soooo crappy. It's unbelievable. I've eaten here several times and each time was bad. I've actually thrown whole baskets of food away because it was so disgusting to me that I couldn't' eat it. I would rather go to McDonald's or Burger King before here. 1/2 star for cleanliness1/2 star for friendly service

6.description: Great cheeseburgers, yummy crab Rangoon, and awesome service! Can't wait to try other stuff on the menu.

3.description: First time ordering and was not disappointed! The finished product was so beautiful, It was more perfect then what I had it pictured in my head. The Red Velvet was moistured and everyone loved it. So happy and without a doubt will order again!

1.description: They did an amazing job with my boyfriends cake. Not only were they really helpful but their customer service is great overall.  Nevertheless their cakes are delicious. I would definitely recommend.

2.description: I ordered communion cookies, for my daughter. They did a very nice job.  I am not giving them a ten because the decor was a bit off. I think that this franchise is part of Pierre's owners.. or affiliated somehow.  The prices are fair and the craftsmanship is very good. I will order again.

9.description: Welcome to the Neighborhood!  Love this place ! the greatest pastries & cakes and has seats to enjoy our coffee :) , had my son birthday cake from viva cake and it was great masterpiece and also was great

10.description: It's a great bakery that also has a cafe seating area inside. I had my son's cake made here and was amazed with the job they did. It's hard to find a bakery that can work with your ideas and make them a reality.  My son was excited when he seen his 3D cake. I would recommend this place for sure.

4.description: Best flan I've ever had and the staff is very friendly as well. I brought the flan to a family halloween party and people were still talking about it the next day.

6.description: Best 3 leches cake I've tasted! Yummy treats and great looking cakes. The customer service is an added plus, they really appreciate your business and are very nice!

11.description: Love Love LOVE this place!  So happy to see a new business in the neighborhood!  I don't have a sweet tooth, or rather DIDN'T have a sweet tooth but now I'm hooked! Great Pastries & the owner is a gem. You won't be dissapointed~

5.description: My wife and I just happened to be walking past the bakery and decided to check it out. We ended up ordering a graduation cake and bought some treats for the road. Veronica provided great customer service. She was extremely helpful and patient. The cake was everything we expected plus much more. Excellent customer service, excellent prices, and delicious pastries. Will be back again for the next occasion or sweet tooth.

7.description: They recently opened up and I loved their bakery items. The pastries are not only inexpensive but also delicious. I would recommend them to anyone, they also have some innovative ideas for cake designs. On tops of that the service is also impeccable.

8.description: Yum yum yum, this bakery has such great looking and tasting cakes, there is never any cake left when I serve these cakes at my party and with good reason. Even though they are far from my home I have found my perfect bakery.

0.description: Great cakes! Red velvet cake and their Flan is amazing

1.description: Best authentic Mexican restaurant in the city! Oh, and it doesn't hurt that they have awesome prices too! The place is a little small if you're eating in, but that's about it...very deelish...check 'em out!

2.description: Terrible food. Terrible service. Avoid at all cost.

0.description: How long have I search for the perfect mom and pops mexican joint?  Ever since I left LA, I've been trying to find you EL KACHETON!Pros Chips - Warm and crispy, with their home made salsa?  match made in heaven.Salsa - Choose between green and red, regardless of what you choose, it's got the right amount of heat and taste.  I think they sprinkled "crack" on them because it's so addicting.Burritos - probably around 2lbs, I'm pretty big dude, but i can't even finish their burrito, their carne asada is marinated and cook to perfection, with perfect combination of fresh lettuce, tomato and sour cream?  It's ORGASMIC.Tacos - carne asada taco for $1.25? come on, where can you get a taco with that price?  portions are huge, i get full with just 4 tacos.  Again, the red salsa is the key.  it brings heat and compliments the meat, cilantro and onions perfectly.Also, every table has a roll of paper towels.  Good thing because i was sweating after i downed half ketchup bottle of red salsa.and big thing of pickled jalapenos and carrots on every table?  come on! I LOVE YOU!Cons - Not really bad if you ask me but for some people these might be a turn-offIt's pretty small restaurant, so big group is not recomended.  tiny bathroom (unisex) but it was very clean.  decor is non existent.  might have few flies flying around but it's mom/pop joint.  so "shut up, sit down, enjoy your whooping portions of food and get out"

This review is partial because I only go to Three Muskies annual fish fry (which was rumored to end last year) to meet up with old friends for a reunion. The owner has a special secret batter, he fries with--not to mention he catches his own fish, or accepts the generous contributions from his fishermen friends. As the batches of battered fish come to the table, you don't really know what type of fish you are getting, but its all good. Sometimes the wait for the fish is long between batches, but read more » there is a nice spread that Three Muskies puts out (e.g. a special coleslaw also made by the owner) along with other potluck-type items regulars contribute for the unofficial reunion. Three Muskies is a humble establishment, friendly atmosphere. Even R's elementary-aged grand kids stop in for a few minutes.  No frills. No snots, just down to earth, humble but classy, hardworking, mostly blue-collar clientele :) The only negative is they lack enough chairs and tables for the annual fish fry crowd, but no one seems to mind.Cheers to your annual fish fry "R & T" :)

12.description: FEMALE MANAGER HAS A HUGE ATTITUDE PROBLEM. It took almost an hour and a half to get our pizza. The tracker online said it left the store at 5:16 and it didn't get to my apt. until 6:07. When i called to voice my concern about the pizza sitting in the driver's car for almost an hour, the manager got an attitude and just said he had other orders to deliver. And of course the pizza tastes old and heat-lamped. I guess it's my fault for ordering this garbage anyway. Good job Dominos!By the way, there's a $2 delivery charge, none of which goes to the driver. What a f*cking joke.

3.description: One Star is honestly being nice. I placed an order at 3pm so my pizza could be delivered at 5:30 pm. At 5:37 I get a call saying the pizza won't be delivered for another 2 hours. Are you kidding me? Oh and let me say, she said she called before yet there was nothing registered on my phone AND no voicemail. Never again.

1.description: I used to avoid ordering from Domino's since there's so many other non-chain places to order pizza from.  But over the years Domino's stepped up their game in almost every category & now I order from here pretty regularly.  Their online ordering system is very easy to navigate & shows the progress of your order from when preparation starts to when the delivery driver leaves with your food.  I especially like ordering online since you can customize your order with minimal chance of the order getting botched.  The delivery has been consistent each time I've ordered & typically receive it within 10-15 mins after it leaves the store.  I haven't had any issues worth mentioning & will continue ordering from here when I'm looking for a quick, affordable place that delivers all day.

2.description: I order a medium pizza online and it takes over an hour to get here, when it does the pizza driver pulls up and starts beeping his horn like 5-6 times then calls me, I answer "is that you beeping like that?"   He responds "uh yeah I thought that was you outside" um 1. You don't know me like that and 2. How unprofessional. I will never order from here again.

9.description: Wow, I'm surprised at the negative reviews for this place.  I can't say I'm a real regular customer here, but I do grab a carry out special about once every 2 or 3 months.  Personally I've never been anything but very happy with the service and the product that they sell.  Whether  I order in person, on the phone or on the internet my order always tastes great and is ready when they say it will be.  I will definitely continue to frequent this store!  I can't honestly say it's the best pizza I've eaten since moving to Chicago a couple years ago, but when you click the box to give it a 4 star rating off to the right of the box with stars it says, "Yay, I'm a fan." and that certainly describes me so therefore they get the 4 star rating.  Thanks for the great pizza and great service Domino's!!!!

10.description: Ordered two medium pizzas online and it took over an hour to receive them. Not only were the pizzas wrong, but one of them is all burnt. To add to my frustration, now they decide not to answer my calls. This is unacceptable and I will NEVER be ordering from this location again!!!!!

4.description: The pizza was cheaper by calling to the store app was more expensive The pizza came really fast ordered as sausage and jalapeno pizza good and spicy delivery guy was friendly he didn't mine I came out in my underwear

6.description: I Happened to be visiting my cousin in the city on a busy Sunday during the football games. I must have called two other local independent pizza shops and they told me that it would take over an hour and a half just to deliver two large pizzas!!! lol can't wait that long especially after having a few beers the munchies really got to us hahhaaa. So I called this dominos and Eddie the Store Manager took my order. I told him that we were super hungry and we're also on a time crunch just so I could get the pizza a little faster. This gentleman hands down was probably one of the most professional pizza managers I've spoken to. He waited patiently on the phone while I was asking everyone what they wanted on their pizza and he didn't put me on hold either. He said it would take 45 minutes to an hour at this point I didn't care because their prices were way better anyways. Literally 35-40 minutes later Eddie delivered the pizza himself and our order was on point... Extra crushed peppers were added in the bag as promised! Definitely one of the best pizzas I've had in a while. Hot and fresh ready to dominate!!! Thanks Again for your professionalism Eddie you will hear from me again lol!!

0.description: I passed by yesterday and took my favourite pizza. All locations doing really good job. I can comment here a nice atmosphere and helpfum staff. It was done on time and exactly how i wanted. Cause my order is different from their menu. Thanks.

5.description: itssa real chicago style pizzai luv eet

13.description: Cold ass pizza

11.description: Have pizza from there came nice an warm..super fast delivery... Love the app.. You can add coupons with no problems..

8.description: Domino's... always a good choice. Perfect on a Saturday night when it is raining out and you just want to watch a movie and eat yourself silly. Tastes great with Coca Cola too.

14.description: The worst pizzeria ever. One of my friend ordered from that place (that was the first time I had Domino's) we got three pizzas all of them were burned, they were black ... the second time my other friend ordered pizza from Domino's (I told him not too because of what happen the first time) he didnt listen, when we got the pizza it was burned again. One time my husband ordered a pizza for me and used his card, I couldn't get the pizza because my husband wasnt at home and I did not have his credit card with me so after waiting one hour for pizza they took it back.

7.description: Dude,  Eddie. We had a mishap tonight where our order was cancelled on accident. I don't know how. Internet mishap, out of delivery range... Something.  I called because the tracker was no longer tracking. I spoke with someone unhelpful who then connected me to Eddie, the manager. I told him I planned on grabbing tacos around the corner from my house.  I love Domino's and appreciate their customer service, but I was starving! I was hungry and irritated and needed to eat. Eddie, the manager, insisted that he would deliver it himself with care and precision. We had a bit of banter and within 20 minutes, I had the pizza I was promised.  He was a complete gentleman and refused my tip. I am thoroughly impressed with how he handled my situation.  Through a faux pas, Eddie has made my experience very positive. What. A. Dude. What a dude.

3.description: Pizza was delicious :) They have mexican food i try tacos alpastor & the were delicious  im coming soon again !

1.description: I've ordered twice from there through Grubhub, Both times it took 1:45 or more to get my pizza.  and when it arrived the pizza was cold.  I will say that the pizza is decent though.

2.description: I ordered recently for pick-up and came away very disappointed by both the pizza and the tone of the service (I was treated with a dismissiveness which bordered on rude - both on the phone and when I got to restaurant). Perhaps they were having a bad day, but in a city where great pizza is the norm - especially as found in neighborhood storefronts - the deep dish pizza I brought home was well below average. First the highlight: The crust was actually very good, and held up to the time it took me to get the pie home, It had a nice flakiness, but enough density to avoid the "sagging" one might find when a slice is picked up.  It's too bad that there wasn't a better product on top of it.  The sauce was seasoned with a huge amount of oregano, which made the underlying cheese (what there was of it) nearly impossible to taste.  The additional toppings I ordered were scattered scantily on less than half of the pizza, and were invisible under the sauce. Together, it was a firm mouthful of not-very-good and not-very-much.

9.description: It seems as though it's a new place, so bear that in mind...My phone order took quite some time to take down, and the person answering the phone had to consult with someone off-phone 2-3 times during the call. All I ordered was two pizzas - but like I said, they're new and let's write it off as someone trying to get it right. The pizza arrived on time (about 45 minutes), and that's about as good as it got. The sauce was waaaay too sweet and basically lacked any flavor. And that lack of flavor seems to be a theme with their pizza. We ordered a small cheese pizza (for the kids) and we got a large all pepperoni, with half sausage and the other half red onion. The pepperoni had no bite whatsoever, and the sausage was really bland as well. The red onion ... I don't think it was red onion. I would bet my life on that. Feh.They may change some stuff down the road, but as of this point I won't be ordering from them again. The upside: the lakhma they we got for free was quite nummy. Hint: eat it first as it isn't as good cold.

10.description: So I ordered a large (14") one-topping for five bucks, and that's about what it was worth and not a penny more. This pizza is about one step above Little Sneezer's, that one step being they bother to use sauce (though the purpose of using sauce seems to have more to do with adding texture rather than flavor). Otherwise, the quality of ingredients are about on the same level. All said with tax, delivery and tip, it was about $10. Would I order it again? Only if I were desperately broke -- which I am, which is why I ordered from this joint in the first place. The minute I actually have, like, a job, will be the last minute I ever consider ordering from here again.

4.description: I picked up a large (14") spinach thin crust today for just over $5.  That's where I think they have Caesar's beat.  You get any one topping from their selection of 20 for no extra charge.  The pizza had a nice cracker crust and the spinach was whole leaf, not chopped if that matters to you.  All in all, I got my money's worth and will give them a try again.Being my first time, I can't comment on the sandwiches and other menu items, but I will write an update when I do.  The person who took my call was friendly as was the person I talked to when I came in.Worth it for a cheap neighborhood place.

6.description: Decided to try this place since they advertise a 14 inch pizza for $4.99. So I order a half pepperoni and half bacon to go and head on my merry way. Don't get me wrong, I wasn't expecting much for the price but all this pizza did was send me down the hershey highway. The Bacon tasted off, don't know if it was spoiled or not but it just tasted Michael Jackson bad. The cheese was actually the only thing that stood out. The sauce was bland and the crust was light and not much else. Now I have an Iron Cast stomach so if the meat made me sick, anyone with a low tolerance would've been done for. There are way too many options in the area to ever make me look this way again as it's just not very memorable.

11.description: Great Pizza esp when compared to other local places.  Price is very good.  Pizza is thin crust cracker style, with a sweet sauce. We've tried a number of toppings and they're all good.  This isn't pizza you'd drive 10 miles for, but for neighborhood places, on a "I don't wanna cook " nite, this place is perfect.  We've had the fried mushrooms, which seem home-made and are very tasty.  Phone ordering has always been easy and pick-up swift.

5.description: They recently changed they're online delivery options and I couldn't find the amazing pizza deal they used to offer.  It's still decent, but I looked for other places because without being super cheap, this place isn't really worth it.

7.description: As every place is entitled to an Off day,which apparently the people dogging this place unfortunately experienced...  this place DEFINITELY has Many more GOOD DAYS. The spinach stuffed pizza gives GIORDANOS a run for its money, as does their thin crust Chicken BBQ pizza and veggie pizza, and i never care for veggie pizzas.  Their Buffalo wing's sauce is Addictive and so unlike any other buffalo sauce ive ever had before. I get cravings for their wings! The philly sandwhich is DELISH as are their salads. I really like their grilled chicken salad on my Healthy days. I can only have this at work since i live on the south side, but its always a delicious treat for lunch!  So I invite those who didnt enjoy their first experience to try it again, and dont forget the Wings!

8.description: While I can't say too much for the pizza (we ordered a thin crust once and didn't find it to be the best or worst of Chicago's offerings), I  will say that the CHICKEN PHILLY was phenomenal.  I don't usually call a restaurant back after eating to compliment the quality and taste of the food, but this experience compelled me to do so.  The Chicken Philly sub had all the classic elements: hoagie roll, thin-shaved chicken breast, grilled onions, white american cheese - clearly a well-studied, experienced Philly-preparer is involved in the process here.  It doesn't even matter that we live just outside the delivery area; they still got us our 2 hot sandwiches and an order of tenders in about a half hour.  Awesome experience!  Looking forward to ordering for years to come.

0.description: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THEIR PIZZA. Especially the $5 14" pizza. Very good for the price. They guys in there are very friendly and accommodating. I tried the Lokma. It was delish! It is pretty much a funnel cake in little balls with honey and sugar drizzled on it. I also had the fried Ravioli, wish was good. But you only get 6 little pieces for $5. Its good for a small snack. I will be going back again.

3.description: My Chilean friend who grew up in Miami had been craving good Cuban, as we were coming from Baltimore, where there is a dearth of Cuban food.  This place totally hit the spot for her and myself.  She had a steak sandwich, while I had the cubano.  Tasted exactly like Miami.  The warm churros are the perfect dessert.  Nice place, very small - so be prepared to take your order to go or to wait in a crowd for your seats like we did.  Yum!

1.description: If you happen to find yourself in the area, stop by Cafe Marianao! Now to anyone that frequents here, we know that there's a lot to complain about... The phone number that doesn't work, the awkward parking situation, the limited about of seats vs. the amount of space that's in the place, the fact that it closes at 4pm everyday, and the customer service. Now that we've gotten all that out of the way, make your way over here to order a Double Steak Sandwich with a large Cafe Con Leche. That's the only thing I've ever gotten from either location in the past 5 years (but I hear everything is good). This food is best served hot and fresh. So either eat there or eat it in your car. I've done either depending on the weather outside. You may ask, why would I rate this place 4 stars despite the logistical issues here. My reasons are 1. I love to support neighborhood businesses and a helpful review that attracts more customers may get some of these issues resolved. 2.  The food is damn good. 3. The coffee is great! 4. I love this place and you should too.

2.description: Just know that there is no "comfortable" place to sit and have lunch. But seems like most people don't mind sitting in stools and facing the wall. (And if there is no stools available you have to steal someone's as soon as they stand up ) But you have to try their sandwiches and cafe con leche! The best in Chicago I would easily say! I won't walk in here without my husband cause you basically catch one of the guys attention, order your food and then just sit and wait. (And hence why I am giving them 4 starts instead of 5). Now a days most restaurants have figured out how to properly take orders and take care of their customers.

5.description: The best breakfast sandwiches EVER! Small, but friendly. More people need to check this place out! Worth the 20 minute drive!

6.description: Best Cafe Con Leche i had in my entire life!  the steak sandwich are the best i hardly recommended.

7.description: One of the best steak sandwiches in the city. Cuban style. Cafe con leche is always fresh and the steak always tender.

0.description: I have known of Marianao since 1980 when we moved to Humboldt Park in Chicago. They always have the BEST steak sandwiches and cafe con leche that I have ever tasted in my life. These sandwiches always take me back to my childhood because they still taste exactly the same. I hope that the gentrification in the areas where these stores are located does not ever put them out of business. This is truly a Chicago treasure.

4.description: Get the Cubano...

58.description: A hidden gem. Appetizers and main courses were excellent. We shared the Papadzules Yucatecos appetizer, I had the Enchiladas de Camaron and my husband had the Molcajete Cielo Mar y Tierra. Portions were large, service was truly friendly but the servers didn't hover. The tortillas seemed to be homemade as well. We will return there with friends.

56.description: Food was good, however they are not accommodating.  After telling them about a food allergy and asking for a substitution as the rest of it looked awesome, all I was told is no.  There were no options for anything not exactly as the menu described.   I won't be going back, the food was not worth the aggravation.

29.description: Wonderful upscale Mexican cuisine. Staff was gracious and helpful. The menu offered several main dishes that would please. I choose the Asada and my wife choose the pork. Both of us were very satisfied. We will definitely return.

42.description: I went there with my bestie! We both love Mexican food and Margaritas, so we decided to check out this new to us spot. It was a world class customer service as well as absolutely amazing and tasty food. At some Mexican restaurants presentation of food is sort of sloppy, but at this restaurant presentation of food on the plate was exquisite. For appetizers we had Tostaditas de Ceviche "Chichihuliti" - spicy appetizer, not too filling which is good because we wanted to make sure we had enough room for our dinner. For dinner we ate and highly recommend to anyone to try: Culeta de Puerco an Tinga Poblana (good for pork chop lovers!) and Pechnga de polla en crema poblana. I am definitely coming back !!!

23.description: We had a wonderful evening at Sol de Mexico. The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. The staff was very knowledgable about the menu and explained every dish as it was served. We very much enjoyed our meal at a very leisurely pace. I highly recommend this establishment.

47.description: Came here couple of weeks ago based on the reviews.  On a Friday evening, at 7pm, we were the only ones in the restaurant. By 8pm, the waitress was hovering over us so that we would close out and leave and they could shut down for the nite.  The food and the margarita were good, not necessarily great.  I will go back there after 6 months or so and check it out again. While I don't want to make any judgements based on one visit,  honestly I don't have much to praise or criticize.

8.description: Great Ambiance! Great Mole! Great for dates!! Great Art Pieces!!

31.description: Best customer service HANDS DOWN ! Carlos the owner is so sweet and humble!!My cousin is planing my bridal shower here and we are so excited about it ALL !!!!!!!!food: we had a mini tasting of what dishes we are having for the party and well.... Let's just say the food tastes as good or better as it looks ! I'm mexican and I'm very picky about "upscale " Mexican food . I don't like when ppl try to fancy up food and it's just tastes like everything but Mexican ... NOT HERE the food is amazing can't say anything less.....Decor : the interior design is so beautiful that I really felt like I was having a dinner in San Miguel de Allende ..

34.description: The food is decent can't really complain about it but service was super slow. Went there with my husband on valentines night and it was seriously total chaos...got seated waited 15 min to get water and another 15 for someone to ask us if we had already been taken care of, we told the lady no one had come and immediately order appetizers. Finally our waitress for the night (although we had diff waitstaff through the night n she never really check on us) asked what we were having (not friendly or happy just blah) but we were aware of the whole situation while waiting, we watched as the servers (or busboys) went crazy bcz they were short staffed n had a full restaurant to serve, at one point it was hilarious to watch servers come out with food n not know to which table was it for lol same thing with the drinks! It took an hour to get drinks n appetizers. We asked for the dessert menu n never got it so decided to just ask for the check. The restaurant was clearly short on waitstaff and the owner should've know how busy it was going to get on a valentine night with all tables reserved plus accepting walk ins so there's no excuse for the very slow service which almost ruin my night but my husband n i just decided to have a laugh about it while watching all the chaos unfold. No but seriously Sol de Mexico get your act together n provide good service even on a busy night bcz honestly I think that was my first and last night at your restaurant and that's a shame.

16.description: Authentic Mexican food with great flavor. The drinks are well done; I recommend the Chabelita if you like beer combined with spice. The service is great. Very polite and considerate.

13.description: We have been here twice now and both times were wonderful, start to finish. Authentic, flavorful food, with exquisite presentation, and a very reasonable price. On top of that, the ambiance is accentuated with wonderful art work.If you're looking for excellent Mexican that isn't the usual fare, please try this place out.  And be sure to leave room for dessert.

11.description: The food and service were great.The prices are too high for me to go back though. Too bad

39.description: This is one of the best restaurants past Logan Square. Highlights include the sopes, beef shank, and skirt steak. Warm and friendly service and atmosphere.

37.description: I have been visiting this restaurant from the time it opened up, that should speak for it self.  My husband and I love great food and service, Sol de Mexico has both.  The owner comes and chats with you and takes your criticism well, and if you ask for substitutions he accommodates you.  The menu gets changed every few months, which is great because you will never get bored if your a constant client, like us.  No rice and beans as sides here....the menu is creative and delicious.

0.description: One of the best Mexican restaurant in town in such a unexpected location...the food and service was superb and their silverware is very unique, the waitress was nice enough to write down the name of it.   Had the Entremes appetizer, all four items were delicious, main course was the Lamb and the Pollo Mole Negro and both were very good, the mashed potato with the Lamb was so good and the mole was expertly made...will definitely be back to try some more items on their menu.

38.description: On a Saturday night one might prefer a night out, some romance, or some time among the pretty bottles behind a bar.  The kid works counter to this so on this particular Saturday we went with the take-away option.We kept it simple and ordered the venison and the Chilean sea bass. They quoted 20 minutes. I got myself together and started driving.The neighborhood doesn't have much to offer at night and a lot of the block seem darkened to this place stands out. The inside is cozy, lit by paper stars lamps and decorated with fun art. There's a small bar in the back with a healthy amount of pretty bottles.As soon as I walked they were ready with the bag of food. I thought I'd arrived early.  I handed over the vCard Andover heard so,even talking about the black molé so quickly tried to halt the transaction to acquire some (in case a charge was required). They rang me up anyway, suggested I sit at the bar, and one of the women disappeared into the back only to returned with a little bowl of dense black lovely and a spoon. The favors were amazing. Earthy, a little smokey with a hint spice. She was so kind and brought me a freshly made tortilla as well. I've never smelled or tasted a better tortilla. The again most tortillas are the standard corn or flour variety without much flavor or character. I thanked them profusely and high-tailed it home to open the presents.The Chilean tilapia was served with unknown vegetables that were all good but the fish itself and the sauce were extraordinary.  The fish was seared on each side but cooked perfectly on the inside.  The sauce was so icy and rich.  The venison was also perfectly cooked and served with Mexican rice with veggies.  The sauce on the venison was a lovely red molé full of dried pepper and spice. Less smoke than the black molé and a little brighter but still earthy and rich.  Heading back here as soon as I can to keep working my way through the menu.

51.description: Great service great food! We made reservations for 7 pm last Friday, we got there right before 7 but the place was almost empty, so we sat wherever we wanted, they were training a new busboy and were very attentive to our needs, the food was excellent and the service just as good. Looking forward to going back again

27.description: Food is good,  the hot sauce that they gave us was very  mild, asked the waiter for something  spicier, he brought out two other ones that where  better but didn't methion that they where going to be $5.00 additional each.

32.description: I was really looking forward to eating here for Valentine's Day, especially since my boyfriend raved about the food. However, choosing it for our dining location was a huge mistake. First off, they tried to bump our reservation off because we were 15 minutes late. As a "fine dining" establishment, you'd think they would let you know ahead of time about a late policy or something. But we still waited to get our table and other couples were filing in late as well behind us, being told the same thing. The young hostess finally relented and seated us all accordingly. The place was packed, so I didn't mind the wait to sit. Then, when seated, we waited at least 15 minutes for our waitress. Again, I saw they were understaffed (1 waitress in our section and maybe 2 others in the front) so I tried to pay no mind. We finally place our drink orders and waited another 20-25 minutes to get our drinks. Once we get our drinks, we place our order (no appetizers; I got the enchiladas and my boyfriend got another entree). We wait. Thirty minutes pass by. We tell a waiter we're still waiting. Forty five. We tell the seating hostess we're still waiting. An hour. Boyfriend gets up to get get the owner. He apologizes hastily as he's making drinks behind the bar and says he'll check. At NO point in time does our waitress ask us how we are or acknowledges us, even. Just a quick glance and walks away once. Finally, 15 minutes after we talk with the owner,they tell us our food will STILL take 45 minutes. Now, with no appetizer and just entrees, I was perplexed to see other customers who arrived after us get served their food. So the best explanation for this (we weren't given an explanation from the staff) was that while understaffed on possibly the busiest time for restaurants, our waitress never placed our order in the system. We walked out at 10pm, 2 hours later, having eaten nothing,  as the staff gawked at us and said nothing. Worst dining experience ever.

54.description: Really solid Mexican food - very fresh.  Everyone loved the shrimp and cactus dish....  A little out of the way but worth the trip.  Great atmosphere and service as well as food.

48.description: The food was great. We had to order take out and still was a very delicious meal. Can't wait to dine in and try the drinks and appetizers.

44.description: We went with friends, venturing outward from the North Side. I was curious to try their version of mole. Unfortunately, that night it only came with lamb. I'm not an omnivore, the waitress suggested no adaptations, and I didn't want to get cornered into vegetarian (there were a few options). So I went with Pescado Zarandeado, which was a really generous slab of medium rare mahi mahi, more or less on a salad. A very healthy, light summer meal, but bland, if you're accustomed to adventurous Mexican/ Latin food. I made the wrong choice---my fault. The menu seems to change, so I would suggest you check in before you go and interrogate your waiter about the specifics. Good margaritas, though!!!

24.description: My fiancé and I went here last Friday for dinner and had a wonderful time!  We got the chef's choice 5 course meal w/ wine pairings and it was incredible.  They gave each of us 5 unique menu items and 4 generous pours of wine.  Every course was incredible, there was not a single one that we did not love.  We will definitely be back!

7.description: Worst customer service ever.. food sucks.. and not authentic... Im all about trying new places but this  place is on my ban list..

49.description: I love the interior.  There are two rooms one is a little more colorful than the other.  They have a marvelous Tequila drink (and other spirits but mostly tequila) menu.  The food is totally Mexican but with a gourmet twist.  I wasn't very hungry so I had the sopas appetizer.  I really enjoyed the fillings but not the shell.  Maybe it was the oil they fried it in, I don't know.  My dinner dates enjoyed their mole and tamales.  I will probably go back to try some more when I have more of an appetite.  I liked the look of the special that another customer ordered.  It looked like it could be split by at least two people.

40.description: Just walked in 30 mins ago with the boyfriend and our first impression was mom and pop type of feel. We sat down and the owner greeted us with a warm smile and a bowl of chips and sauce, which were tasty. She knew we were first timers so she recommended the pambasos, basically a burrito on garlic bread. Ahhhmazeballs. Just saying. I'm definitely coming back to try more off the menu. Also there steak is very tasty and fresh!

53.description: The service was great and responsive. One thing I really enjoyed was relying on them to suggest meals and drinks which added to the experience.

30.description: This place is a few doors down from home for me and what a gem. I could see from outside this was something different. I took friends and one had rabbit in a green mole, another had a beautiful flank steak and I had lamb chops in a dark mole. Never had such dishes in a Mexican restaurant.  And cooked exactly as ordered. Prices are competative for this type of dining and you get so much more this far away from the restaurant scene. I'd honestly say somewhere between Frontera Grill and Topa l' Bomba.  Seriosly! The circuses are different but the staff is so nice, warm and welcoming.Worth a trip west.

46.description: This place is absolutely delicious! It's Mexican food but not tacos and burritos but actual traditional Mexican food!  The decor of the place is so cute with its Mexican flare, you can tell that they went above and beyond to make the place look amazing. What I love the most is that they change their menu so you get to try different and new things every time you go. A little pricey but definitely worth it!

1.description: My wife and I wanted a night out at a good resturant. We were avid fans of this place since the owner is so hands on from all aspects of resturant and we very much like the food. That said, we had good expectations. To start, the owner did come out to greet the clientel and as always is super friendly. We always appreciate that. Let me get to the reason for the review. My wife ordered a pozole dish that has chicken. To our dismay, the chicken was undercooked. That is already bad as it is but my wife had to wait close to 15 minutes to get the attention of a server to say what the problem was. On a side note this was happening all night long (the service). No consisent server or service. She did get another plate minus the chicken. We ordered dessert and were done. The worse thing regarding our service was that the owner did not come out to acknowledge the incident. Last I checked eating an undercooked chicken can get you really sick. At the end of the night a server removed the dessert from the bill which was a whopping $4.00. That left us speechless. We are not asking for full compensation of dinners here but just some ownership to the lack of service and food. This place charges quite a bit for their dishes so you would hope to receive some type of consistency in all aspects.

55.description: I have wanted to dine at Sol de Mexico for months and last night was my chance. Family took me out for my birthday.  We walk in and our server was pleasant with a smile a star alone for that.  We went over the menu and decided to start with the Sopes and they were excellent.  My favorite was the chicken in mole and surprisingly the plantain and cream.  For main dishes my husband had the chicken with mole and my son and I had the steak dishes with side of Mashed Potatoes.  We all enjoyed every bite of it.  For dessert we shared the Flan de Café mmmmmm.  Service once again was wonderful.   I forgot to ask if its true that they change their menu every three months.  I am heading back asap to try the lengua dish before it leaves the menu for a while.  Thank you Sol de Mexico for a wonderful dinner.

9.description: Hidden gem in the Belmont-Cragin area! This is my family's favorite restaurant. The food and service is exceptional all around. We have NEVER had a bad experience here.

26.description: We came in on a Friday night and it wasn't crowded at all. The passion fruit margarita is great and we shared the cliche it was ok. We also ordered lamb in mole and steak. They were pretty good. And then we got the coconut pie and vanilla flan. Also very good. The tortillas were freshly made. Parking was easy we found a spot right outside the door. Definitely worth the drive. Nice deco inside the restaurant.

25.description: Love this place for Mexican in the area. Best upscale  Mexican we have hit.Great food with fun decor on the inside. They always accommodate my kids picky tastes with custom tacos that aren't in the menu.I get the chile rellenos and it's awesome! The margaritas are big alsoGreat place to hit especially if you live in the area as it's better than most

12.description: On a Saturday night one might prefer a night out, some romance, or some time among the pretty bottles behind a bar.  The kid works counter to this so on this particular Saturday we went with the take-away option.We kept it simple and ordered the venison and the Chilean sea bass. They quoted 20 minutes. I got myself together and started driving.The neighborhood doesn't have much to offer at night and a lot of the block seem darkened to this place stands out. The inside is cozy, lit by paper stars lamps and decorated with fun art. There's a small bar in the back with a healthy amount of pretty bottles.As soon as I walked they were ready with the bag of food. I thought I'd arrived early.  I handed over the vCard Andover heard so,even talking about the black molé so quickly tried to halt the transaction to acquire some (in case a charge was required). They rang me up anyway, suggested I sit at the bar, and one of the women disappeared into the back only to returned with a little bowl of dense black lovely and a spoon. The favors were amazing. Earthy, a little smokey with a hint spice. She was so kind and brought me a freshly made tortilla as well. I've never smelled or tasted a better tortilla. The again most tortillas are the standard corn or flour variety without much flavor or character. I thanked them profusely and high-tailed it home to open the presents.The Chilean tilapia was served with unknown vegetables that were all good but the fish itself and the sauce were extraordinary.  The fish was seared on each side but cooked perfectly on the inside.  The sauce was so icy and rich.  The venison was also perfectly cooked and served with Mexican rice with veggies.  The sauce on the venison was a lovely red molé full of dried pepper and spice. Less smoke than the black molé and a little brighter but still earthy and rich.  Heading back here as soon as I can to keep working my way through the menu.

59.description: We had a truly special and memorable meal here.My primary concern before visiting was, is this restaurant highly rated only because the area lacks other quality options?  I now can say with certainty that this restaurant would be a standout in any Chicago location, even downtown next to the legendary Rick Bayless.  Indeed, the closest reference point to Sol de Mexico is Topolobampo.Our starter was the four-sope plate.  The sopes were crisp on the exterior and moist on the interior, better than any I have had.  The four fillings were very different and all excellent, and a tremendous value for the price.Both of our entrees were outstanding.  One was the perfectly cooked and seasoned lamb in a dark, rich mole sauce, with a creamy, cheesy potato in a crispy edible bowl, and some green beans.  Delicious.  The second was a special -- roasted pork, moist and flavorful, with very spicy habanero sauce and savory black beans, again in a crispy boat.  We attacked this like hungry lions.Service was very professional and friendly, and the decor is bright and cheery.  Wine list is better than most comparable spots and is fairly priced.  There is a long list of specialty cocktails, although we did not have any.If you want a fine dining experience at a reasonable price, with food loving crafted by a very talented chef, this is the place.  And you can park right in front on Cicero -- no need for a valet here.

21.description: If you'd like to experience the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE that has ever existed in the history of dining establishments, please visit Sol de Mexico.  For any other dining establishments that are trying to compete for this award, please read on, as I'll periodically provide tips on how to provide below par service to the masses.I was eager to try Sol de Mexico, based on the great Yelp reviews.  I made reservations online, but when I didn't receive any kind of confirmation page/email, I decided to call to make sure that the reservation went through.  Sure enough, it didn't, but I was able to make my Mother's Day reservation with Maria.  Or so I thought.TIP #1:  Create a website and make your customers believe that making a reservation is actually possible.There were people waiting outside and inside as I made my way to the hostess.  She already had an unwelcoming look on her face as I began to tell her that we had a reservation for 4 at 8pm.  'We're not taking any more people.''But I made a reservation.''We can't take any more people.  We're overbooked.'(I glance around and see an available table for 4 just beyond her and noticed more in the next room.)  'Soo, why would you accept my reservation if you're not able to honor it?  You should've told me that I wouldn't be able to get a table over the phone when I made the reservation.'(Getting frustrated)  'We accepted walk-ins, so we're overbooked now.  We can't take any more people.'TIP #2:  Think of the most qualified, gracious, people-pleasing person that would be perfect for the host/hostess position.  Hire the opposite.No apologies, absolutely no sign of any kind of desire to rectify the situation.  My mom tells me that we should just go somewhere else.  As we leave, we encounter another family who made reservations that weren't able to get seated.  I'm not sure what kind of business model Sol de Mexico follows, but turning away patrons who have made a reservation on the most lucrative day of the year for dining establishments is outrageous.TIP #3:  When Mother's Day approaches, turn away everyone who made a reservation.  Better yet, also hang a huge sign in your window that says, 'We don't like making money.'There are a MILLION amazing Mexican restaurants in Chicago.  One would think that you'd be on top of your game with all the choices your customers have.  Thankfully, I did my research, and we had a fantastic dinner nearby, but it was still a frustrating experience.  If you were able to turn away about a dozen people in the 2 minutes that I was there, I can't imagine how many more families whose Mother's Day you ruined.

17.description: I would call it high end Mexican food.  Absolutely delicious.  My husband had lamb shanks.  I had the steak.  The mole is award winning.  I would like to go back to try their tasting menu.  Margaritas were very good.  I tried the habanero and the pomegranate.

10.description: Fantastic food, great service, good decor, and not just standard Mexican food. Highly recommend!

5.description: Love their customer service, atmosphere and decorations. It's The food is also AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!! I can't even explain the taste sensations going through my mouth when I tried the puerka with pumpkin sauce. Might sound weird but WOW. and the chorizo and bean salad accompanying this dish was so perfect, I can't say enough! The apps we chose were the ceviche and the sopes- my favorite. each one had a different topping like meat, chicken, guac and one with fried plantain!!!!! Can you even imagine the tastes that are going through your mouth!! I also had a guava mojito, which is always a hit. They had sangria too which I tried and it was okay. The dessert was just the perfect end to a perfect Sunday night.... Traditional flan, but it was so soft and sweet, melt in your mouth greatness!!!! If I hadn't been so full from everything else I would have enjoyed a nice glass of Frangelico..... Next time... Always a next time. Can't wait!!!

3.description: We came in on a Sunday so it wasn't that busy and we the meal was very delicious. Ambiance is very nice, welcoming, and trendy. Food looks just as good as it tastes. We tried various margaritas, my favorite one was with cilantro! Will be back for more.

35.description: I went back recently to treat mother in law Z to a tasty Mexican dinner. Once again totally amazing. It's totally worth the effort to make a trip out to the wild Wild West.

19.description: Great service and great food. The tortillas were handmade. I had a glass of white wine and my girl friend had a glass of red. Both choices were perfect for our dishes. The waiter took care of us from beginning to end. He went out of his way to name each of the ingredients that were in each type of Mole we ordered. I'm definitely coming back for more!

28.description: My fella's band is practicing in a new neighborhood, which means a new neighborhood for exploring eats. Our first go was a good one. A very good one. The queso fundido turned us into murmuring idiots. So did the sopes. And the pineapple margarita.One tip: When they say the jalapeño margarita has "jalapeño syrup," take note that it also has an entire jalapeño, seeds and all, crushed into the drink. Holy fahrenheit, I almost died after a single sip.

45.description: Too hot to cook and totally not in the mood to make anything at home  I decided to treat us out to dinner.I had heard of this place froma  couple of people but damn................I was not expecting this!This place is great! Fromt he moment you walk in you know your in a serious Mexican place. No tacos and Burritos here folks..... this is the real deal Holyfield.The food was delicious our appetizers the sope platter had 4 different sopes, choriso, plaintain!, gucamole, chicken mole yummI had  the "Mummified shrimp" Fantastic! they are wrapped in jalapeno bacon and served around a small bed of rice and surrrounded by this AMAZING sauce!!Great atmosphere not crowded and not ghetto! cool vibe for sure! Oh and a decent TEQUILA selection. Yeah I can get drunk here specially with the golden age (50's 60's) of mexican music playing in the background.Shake and bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: HELL NOOO those tight jean wearing thick rimmed glass posers wont come here. This place is too far west and I didnt see any vegan options (thank god!!!) stay in Logan square man stay in Logan square!..actually come here hipsters hipsters I want my property value to rise :)

33.description: Sol de Mexico is an obscure little restaurant located in an obscure little part of Chicago, and yet has been in Michelin's Bib Gourmand list for the past few years. That speaks for itself. The food is absolutely amazing. The highlights are definitely their mole sauces. I had the lamb in black mole sauce and my wife had the tamales in green mole sauce. Both the dishes were fantastic. The butternut squash soup was to die far too, and their drinks were amazing. All-in-all, great little place for some good Mexican food at very decent prices.

43.description: I've been visiting this restaurant occasionally from 2012 through 2014 (present). I've always been very satisfied with the various meals that I've had. The rice and beans are fantastic, which is usually overlooked at other restaurants. I've had several different dishes including carne asada, lamb, chicken in mole, and fish. It's been consistent over the years and all has been cooked perfectly.The staff is very friendly and professional. The decor is well done with what looks like original works of art.The wait for food might be a little longer than some people would like, so do not visit when you're in a hurry. According to other reviews substitutions are not accommodated. I haven't had this issue, because I have no dietary restrictions and I don't mess with a chef's work.I recommend this restaurant for those looking for Mexican food beyond tacos and burritos.

2.description: We usually come here once a week either by myself or friends.  Everything that I have ordered here has always been pretty good.  The waitress always was very helpful whenever we had a question on the menu and was always available when we needed service.

18.description: Best customer service HANDS DOWN ! Carlos the owner is so sweet and humble!!My cousin is planing my bridal shower here and we are so excited about it ALL !!!!!!!!food: we had a mini tasting of what dishes we are having for the party and well.... Let's just say the food tastes as good or better as it looks ! I'm mexican and I'm very picky about "upscale " Mexican food . I don't like when ppl try to fancy up food and it's just tastes like everything but Mexican ... NOT HERE the food is amazing can't say anything less.....Decor : the interior design is so beautiful that I really felt like I was having a dinner in San Miguel de Allende ..

41.description: A few Fridays ago, my friend and I were looking for a place to just have a nice dinner and a few drinks. We didn't want to go anywhere where we would wait a long time for food.I was looking through Yelp and found this place (again!) I had forgotten about this little gem of a restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised to find they had a nice selection of Tequila. Our waitress was very accommodating. She made helpful recommendations and recommended different flights of tequila (which I did not see on the menu). I had the guacamole and chips (for starters) which were made fresh. The tamales de elote were superb! The sopa Azteca was fanstastic and hit the spot on a chilly night (so did the tequila!) I will definitely be going back!

52.description: This place is a real find.   Every dish was superb.  Best ceviche I've ever had.  Make the trek.

50.description: Great find in our hood - get the Tamales! No kid menu but the cheese quesadilla worked in a pinch.

4.description: Extremely tasty food, friendly and prompt service, and cool decor. This is one restaurant that I will be celebrating at more often. I took my grandmother here for her birthday and the staff was super nice! We had many delicious plates, including the guacamole, sopes and the steak. The desserts were also amazing (flan and crepes). Mmmmmmm!!

6.description: Walked in on a week day with my bf. The place was kinda quiet and different . Carlos is great , he helped us pick something from the menu , a really good steak and a seafood dish . The food is SO delicious it has an amazing taste.  Also the best Bloody Mary. I definitely recommend this place.

22.description: Best take ion Mexican ever

15.description: Appetizers were good. Wasn't too crazy about the fact that there was so much fat on my dish but the staff was so sweet. I think if I returned it they would have changed it. Really nice staff makes you want to come back

57.description: I came here in a quiet monday night with the family. The staff was extremely nice and made us feel at home. Beautiful place. Lighting was perfect, colorful decor great music. I ordered the carne asada and i must say it was the best steak i've ever had. I like it medium rare and was cooked to perfection. Juicy and an explosion of flavor in every bite. Had it with black beans, guacamole and platanos maduro. Everything was goooood! My wife had the quail in molé and she said it was well worth the hype. We will definitely be going back with our friends. Highly recommended!!!

20.description: We went  to Sol de Mexico on a Saturday night. We wondered why they weren't very busy. After we ordered we discovered the reason for the lack of business. We ordered two steak dishes and one salad and guacamole. The guacamole came and it was really good. The waitress forgot our salad and brought us two almost raw steaks. We ordered them medium rare. Of course, we returned them to the kitchen. The steaks were very disappointing as was the service. We will not return to Sol de Mexico. Very disappointing experience.

36.description: EXCELLENT dinner!  One of the best carne asada I've every had. Very tender and tasteful. First time here, but we will be back for sure!

14.description: If you'd like to experience the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE that has ever existed in the history of dining establishments, please visit Sol de Mexico.  For any other dining establishments that are trying to compete for this award, please read on, as I'll periodically provide tips on how to provide below par service to the masses.I was eager to try Sol de Mexico, based on the great Yelp reviews.  I made reservations online, but when I didn't receive any kind of confirmation page/email, I decided to call to make sure that the reservation went through.  Sure enough, it didn't, but I was able to make my Mother's Day reservation with Maria.  Or so I thought.TIP #1:  Create a website and make your customers believe that making a reservation is actually possible.There were people waiting outside and inside as I made my way to the hostess.  She already had an unwelcoming look on her face as I began to tell her that we had a reservation for 4 at 8pm.  'We're not taking any more people.''But I made a reservation.''We can't take any more people.  We're overbooked.'(I glance around and see an available table for 4 just beyond her and noticed more in the next room.)  'Soo, why would you accept my reservation if you're not able to honor it?  You should've told me that I wouldn't be able to get a table over the phone when I made the reservation.'(Getting frustrated)  'We accepted walk-ins, so we're overbooked now.  We can't take any more people.'TIP #2:  Think of the most qualified, gracious, people-pleasing person that would be perfect for the host/hostess position.  Hire the opposite.No apologies, absolutely no sign of any kind of desire to rectify the situation.  My mom tells me that we should just go somewhere else.  As we leave, we encounter another family who made reservations that weren't able to get seated.  I'm not sure what kind of business model Sol de Mexico follows, but turning away patrons who have made a reservation on the most lucrative day of the year for dining establishments is outrageous.TIP #3:  When Mother's Day approaches, turn away everyone who made a reservation.  Better yet, also hang a huge sign in your window that says, 'We don't like making money.'There are a MILLION amazing Mexican restaurants in Chicago.  One would think that you'd be on top of your game with all the choices your customers have.  Thankfully, I did my research, and we had a fantastic dinner nearby, but it was still a frustrating experience.  If you were able to turn away about a dozen people in the 2 minutes that I was there, I can't imagine how many more families whose Mother's Day you ruined.

3.description: I don't usually give my secrets away, but no one likes vinyl anymore anyway so here I go. I collect anything on vinyl really...I started in the late 90's with my dad's "let's eat a bunch of mescaline" records...and now I collect everything (that shouldn't be stored) under the sun-even cheesy smooth Jazz records (yes, I have a hefty Kenny G collection as well... BOOY-Yah-kah-shah). Don't ask me why, it's just what I do. Anyway, I never had any luck at this salvation army finding anything I wanted mainly because the two crates of records were the same records every time I went in. One day I went in and the whole wall was FULL of vinyl... So I haggled the manager down to 50 cents a vinyl for 80 records. I had to pass up a bunch of records that I wanted because I was on a budget, but she gave me the deal. So yeah, anyway...I went back there the next night when a different shift was working and hustled the other 400-sumthin records for 12 cents a piece (I knew they were getting in the way). The good lookin Latina gal at the register smiled at me like I was their savior when they gave me the deal. Most of it was like new condition Chicago house records pressed here in the city, Cajual label, tons of totally radical new wave and Polish beer drinking records, and...everything I could ever want or want multiples of and other great stuff I never knew existed... I don't know if I should spin these things or just naughty all over them - probably both. Regardless, I am looking forward to moving these things when I move out. This place is awesome for finding easy bake ovens also. I bought one for my sister after she moved back from London and lost hers. Two easy bakes and an imitation that was recalled because it tended to catch fire have been on sale at this Salvation Army for months.
