It's worth the tiny chicken pot pies (cooked by a light bulb), but I'm an older brother, so...I just eat them in one bite and let her use the easy bake. As long as we're both happy, there is harmony. Anyway...long review, but this is what a thrift store can bring (back) into the world.

1.description: Who decides the prices for the items being sold??Everything is over priced like crazy.Am I wrong or do the items not get donated?Like you get them for free right? So....come on!!I understand you making money to pay employees and donate the rest but holy jeebus.

2.description: This place used to be great. My ex and me would each get like 40 bucks worth of clothes every time we came here. I wish I had appreciated it back then...It's really gone down the drain this past year. A lot of the racks are not as filled up as they used to be. The prices have gone up.. There was a plain black turtleneck for 10 dollars. I almost had a stroke. They used to have a great collection of vinyl, but they've raised the prices on those too and the collection sucks now. Well I guess it depends what you're looking for. If you want polka and organ records then this may be your dream place! Also, they now have male employees following customers around. I wish they were at least being subtle about it, but they're not. It's just not what it used to be at all.This place used to also smell really bad. Which, imo, made it even better. I can't tell you how many times it either smelt like genitals or urine. I'm not being sarcastic. It added to the charm. It smells good now though. Maybe that's why more people have been coming here. It blows.

0.description: If you ever want to take advantage of their "$0.69 sale" on Saturdays on the SA Chicago north-side locations, come at 0900 hour SHARP!  I came in at 0910 hour, and people have already grabbed all the "color-tag of the week" merchandise onto their buggies!  Well, many of them do the "tag-team" style.  Each of them would be assigned to a department, look for items with a specific color tag that is priced at $0.69, place them in the cart, and perhaps weed some of them out at the furniture department since there's more room to maneuver.  Yes, it's a freakin' hot mess.  Lines to checkout are Long at 1000 hour because the customers would be done with shopping around that time.  By the way, they do charge you an extra $0.49 for each plastic bag, so my suggestion is to bring your own to achieve your maximum savings!

4.description: This is my favorite of all the Sal. Army stores I've been to. The thing about thifting is that you really have to dig and put up with some stuff. This place does, on hot summer days, have that musty smell.  But they keep the doors open, so it helps a little. Except for the records, and huge mountain of bags in the back corner, everything is pretty organized and clean.  I have found some designer names here, but I mostly come here to find shirts with a great print on them, which i can later alter if need be. Overall, it's always worth the 20 min walk for me.

3.description: Quick, fresh flowers. Reasonable prices.

1.description: This is my go to shop for awesome flowers. The roses stunning! I love coming here for Mothers Day. Also, they have late hours PLUS delivery !A few weeks ago on a Sunday I needed a bouquet of flowers to be delivered last minute. They were about to deliver my flowers on time and the charge was very reasonable . Now, it can be a bit on the pricey side but it's worth it for the most part.

2.description: My family and I have been doing business with Jadwiga for years and she always does a GREAT job! She's fast, efficient with a fresh, quality product every time. Priced just right! You will be pleased and your flowers will be complimented. More people should know about her. GO for it!

0.description: Great job - very nice lady helped us. She have us a great price and personally delivered our centerpieces to our reception location over 30 minute drive away from her shop! We were very pleased. Thanks

3.description: Draino..Damn my hair!Came in on 10/4 for some draino because I refuse to pay over $5 for one at CVS or Target and to my surprise Dollar Tree sells it and it actually works better than those that are overpriced!Staff was friendly and helpful!

1.description: Your last minute stop to get whatever you forgot. Great prices and a little bit of everything.

2.description: It's great to have it in the are only problem are parking and dirty bathroom long lines...it takes forever to get another cashier... Also half the staff is nice half has attitude at times you don't know what kind of attitude you will get. I'd give 5 stars if they clean the bathroom more often and good friendly attitude.

0.description: Just another Dollar Tree. It's good they have one in the area.BUT man, their parking lot SUCKS!! Only one way in and out. Good luck trying to turn left onto Fullerton after exiting. & be careful where you walk and with kids....Their parking lot is disgusting!!!Drug needles and weed baggies EVERYwhere...along with the trash.Damn, manager, go clean the parking lot at least....

4.description: OMG finally a Dollar Tree in the Fullerton & Cicero Area... the closest ones to that area aren't close at all! Store is big and was pretty busy because they just opened, and everything was fully stocked and organized. Lets see if they keep up with it... I love Dollar Tree though! Get everything you need for $1 not a cent more. Great for party decor, prizes, school supplies, kitchenware... etc. You name it! I'll def update in my next couple of trips... could be that it was grand opening week and they were on top of things... To be continued *dun dun dunnnnnn*

1.description: If you're looking for a good haircut at a good price, Platinum Fades is the place to go. They've got the right tools along with people with years of experience who take they're time to provide you with exactly what you want. The barbers are chill and have no problem engaging in a conversation. Plus, the barber chairs are comfortable, who doesn't like that?

2.description: First time customer and was very impressed. Upon entering the owner oscar greeted me and was very welcoming. Angel cut my hair and provided great customer service and a great haircut. I will definitely be returning soon.

0.description: Just moved to Chicago, and was looking for a barbershop that had a great feel and vibe. The barbers really know what you want and very professional, make sure you ask for my boy Rene for any type of fades he's a magician with the clips.

3.description: Bravo! This place is great. I had the fish stew and it was more than I could finish. But I really wanted to consume every drop. I am a total trencherman, so this is a lot of food.My pal had a combo of steak sausage and what looks like a scored strip of backfat seasond and grilled. All of these I will order next time. Mmmmm.$15.00 for soup d'mar is great. Same for a giant plate of meat. We did not even get to the signature pupusas. Definitely next time.

1.description: This place has been open since about April, but I didn't know it existed until it popped up in a search for restaurants near work recentlySome notes:There is free street parking, yay!Service is excellent, yay!Pupusas are cheesy and delicious, yay!Now I have not been to many Salvadoran restaurants, but I can tell you that of the pupusas I have had I enjoyed these the most.The pupusas are very cheesy and come in a variety of options.  I ordered the garlic, revuelta, spinach, and asada.  Not only do the pupusas come in a variety of flavors they are also much bigger than I expected.  I ordeed four, but really 2 was sufficient for meal.  And they are only $2.25 each!  They are served with a side of salsa and pickled veggies that cuts into the heaviness of the cheese.The rest of the menu also looked pretty tasty and the prices seem very reasonable.  I am looking forward to trying more of their food!  It's too bad our office will be moving soon :(

2.description: The pupusas are good, the curtido is the best I've had in the city but the service makes me not want to go back. I would most likely order for pick up before eating there again. We had the bean and cheese pupusas, the masa had a nice flavor and they were stuffed nicely. Because they were filled with so much the pupusas were fluffier than I'm used to but very good. The curtido was fantastic. Some places put too much vinegar or oregano which leaves an overwhelming taste but this one was perfect, the right balance of flavors. I could eat it alone as a salad. We were the only table in the restaurant & it took 10 minutes for us (table of 2) to get our drinks. We had to ask for silverware, extra plate and each was brought at separate times about 3 minutes apart from one another.

0.description: This food taste amazing just as good as the home country. The best I've had in Chicago. I always buy from this place. The service is pretty decent. The restaurant is clean. They have a lot of decor from El Salvador which makes it feel homie.

4.description: I've moved to Chicago 3 years ago, I tried to find a good Salvadorean restaurant without any luck until this place... Love the Pupusas!! This is my new favorite place!!!

3.description: Visited it over with my work collegues on late night.The servers were nice.I shared the veggie burrito with my friend. It was nice.The best part is they have a guitar artist who plays your song requests.Overall a nice place to have food and enjoy live music late at night!

1.description: The flavor of their chicken was off, the seasoning/adobo used for it tasted almost like mole; not what you expect from rotisserie chicken. I also found the quality of their beef asada meat was not good ether; but I am picky with the beef I eat.Their rice was good, at least. Their refried beans had pork in them, so no good for a vegetarian meal.

2.description: This place is great for fast takeout. You will definitely have your food in hand about 5-10 minutes after ordering. It is ok for groups and can get very loud, but I wouldn't recommend it over Lazo's.Pros:-Better than Lazo's (next door) in terms of food quality-Cheap with a good selection (you can even order beef tongue as a meat selection)-Easy to get to by Blue Line, Western  Bus, or Armitage Bus-Nice waitstaff-Best fast food in the area (don't even think of going to McDonald's across the street)-24 hour serviceCons:-I have definitely had better Mexican food in the Chicago area (Arturo's is great though for fast food Mexican places)Overall, Arturo's is a good Mexican restaurant, and I frequent here regularly.

9.description: i love this place!  i was so glad when opened this location...it's closer to me that the western/armitage locatio (which was still worth the hike).  by far the best mexican food in the area.  the burritos, the tostadas  and the chips and salsa totally rock my mouth!  the staff is super sweet and the owner is as friendly as the come.  all of the above at a great price too (except the chips and salsa...that part is free!).

10.description: I am sooo glad Arturo's made another resturant closer to my house.  The original is on Western and Armitage and it took forever to get there.  The food here is great and the resturant is bright clean and airy.  I like to sit in here in the afternoon and have a meal with my granny.  Carne Asada Tacos are delicious and grilled perfectly.  The horchata is flame-o!

4.description: I only get tacos, but they are awesome.  Comparable to some of my favorite San Francisco Mission Taqueria food.  Get the Al pastor and the Lenguas.

6.description: I love tacos so much. Arturo's were some of the best ive ever had!

12.description: Best salsa fresca ever.  Super fresh and hot.  Great burritos.  Yummmm, Arturo's.  It's very healing after a night of partying.   Yummmm, healing burritos (now day dreaming).  I did not give them four stars because I haven't tried anything else on the menu.  I can't stop eating the burritos!

5.description: Eh, my food was okay, but way too over-priced.  Considering the plethora of taco joints on Western between Milwaukee and Lyndale, I much prefer Las Asadas and Ojo de Agua.  Arturos charges for cilantro, onions, and avocados on their tacos-- their vegetarian is lacking.  The service is great though.

11.description: Good food

8.description: I heart Arturo's. Best enchiladas EVER. Mexican food is my favorite type o' cuisine, so it takes a bit to impress me. This place rocked it. Great staff, very clean, quick service. Oh, and great horchata. Plus, they have parking (but don't accidentally park in Lazo's lot). And after dinner you can head across the street to Margie's Candies (if at the Western and Armitage location). That place is fantastic too. Yummy ice cream. Okay, go to Arturo's!!

0.description: omg their steak tacos are so effin good.  and the service is great. I'm coming back for sure!!!

7.description: I love the chorizo gorditas here. They are so tasty. I love the free tortilla chips and the salsa verde. So tasty. Service can be sort of laid back at times so if you are in a hurry I would maybe think twice about coming. I would give 5 starts but sometimes I have gone and the gorditas haven't always been up to par.

3.description: Classic mexican dive, good food, crappy decor, and off the beaten path. In my experience, when you combine these three elements it makes for the best eating experiences. Here are just a couple of reasons this place impressed me:1) Homemade Tortillas- Check!2) A menu with a more thorough selection than just Tacos and Burritos-Check!3) Drink choice that include huge bottles of Mexican Coke AND Pepsi-Homerun!!!!!!The Al Pastor tacos al mano are very good, no need to go all the way to 18th street anymore. The huaraches and sopes are homemade as well, no pre packaged frozen stuff here. And everything was good quality and fresh here. Being in a city where mexican eateries are a dime a dozen, La Paz definitely stands out like a downtown tourist. A true diamond in the rough.

1.description: I'm don't usually write reviews but for this place I will. I used to love this place, really good food and awesome horchata until a few weeks ago. I was in the restaurant and ordered to go, while waiting I heard a lady from the kitchen scream. I didn't think anything about it. I got home and while eating, my meal was extremely salty, to the point that I was not able to eat it. There was a lot of salt under the sour cream that was most likely spilled which caused the lady to scream. I did not try calling this restaurant or anything I figured if this restaurant would send this meal out like that.... Who knows what other stuff could happen to food and they still send it out. I won't be going back.

2.description: Hands down, my favorite taco joint anywhere. The drink selection as a whole is great, but the horchata is fantastic! The red salsa is the best I've had anywhere. And, of course, the tacos are DELICIOUS. As much as I hate my neighborhood, it's REALLY nice having such a fantastic place just around the corner. I can't wait for the temperature to pick up so I can go more often!

0.description: one hand made tortilla taco and you will have enough to feed two kids for $3. Their horchata is legit and I love how they cook everything on the grill. It sucks to live in the hood but its nice to have them here :-)

4.description: I can say my fiance and I are pretty good with food advice and let me tell you... La Paz has some of the best tacos a mano in chicago! All i have to say is EVERYONE has to go and have one. Don't get scared by the little taco place. Once you try it you will be hooked. We drive 25 miles just to get our taco fix. yup, its that goood!

3.description: Wow, what an excellent and delishious sandwich. I've been here 3 or 4 times. Never been disappointed, it's been a fast and courteous service with good food served hot. Check them out.

1.description: Didn't order one of the sandwiches this café advertises as its main fare, but I did get a salad with grilled chicken that was VERY tasty. The chicken was a bit under-seasoned, but was grilled perfectly.Likewise, the peppers and onions in the salad were grilled with an incredible char that made it awesome.As if that weren't enough, their café con leche was also wonderful!Incredibly happy to welcome to them to the neighborhood!

2.description: Wholly shit by far the best super steak sandwich on the planet let alone chicago. If you don't give them a try your dumb. Seriously everything they serve is outstanding.

0.description: I absolutely love this place! Great food! They open at 6am so you can stop in and get a sandwich and coffee on the go. The staff is super friendly. And they have DELIVERY!!Awesome place for Cuban food!

3.description: This place is great for the Polish-American crowd. They have a large variety of books and magazines for all ages. What I like about this place is they often have popular American titles or magazines translated into Polish. It's a great place for browsing.

1.description: They have a very large collection of Polish children's books, which is specifically what I came to buy. Man working there was quite helpful to this non Polish speaker.

2.description: They have a large selection of Polish books, magazines, as well as music.  The atmosphere is really nice.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  And if you're here, you may as well go to the produce store almost right across the street.  They have a cafe in the back.

0.description: Fantastic company. I ordered Polish books from them several times and each time I received excellent customer service and the books arrived very promptly. My most recently ordered books arrived within 2 days even though I live on the west coast.

12.description: Worst Chicken fried rice I ever tasted! It was so dry and bland....chicken tasted like dark about to go bad meat! BLAH...It had absolutely no flavor what so ever.  I also ordered Chicken with broccoli and it had zero flavor and broccoli was hard as a rock not steamed at all.  Keeping the menu and writing on it DO NOT ORDER AGAIN!

3.description: Wait wait, what?  How I have I not known about this place before moving to the neighborhood?  Yeah, it's got a cheap name, and it looks like nothing special, but Chicago needs to know, this is how Chinese should be.  As an east coast New Jersey native, a snob about pizza, bagels, and Chinese, I think I have the credentials to say, this place is pretty damn good.  First of all, the serve Lo Mein, not Chow Mein, or whatever other dumb noodle product, and they do it right.  The other usual suspects are perfectly done too: fried rice, chicken/beef w/ broccoli, Kung po chicken, potstickers, egg rolls, chicken skewers.  They're very reasonably priced, and when I'm too fat and lazy to walk 1.5 blocks to pick it up, they are happy to deliver.

1.description: I ordered from this place because of all the great reviews that everyone has given but its obvious  that people don't know what they're talking about  it's obvious  they must eat food that has no flavor very often  because  they don't know  good food because  they gave this restaurant  all this credit  I feel like I wasted  $29  for no reason  thanks to the yelpers  who sent me off  step it up guys !!!!I'm giving them a two star instead of one because the crab rangoon was good very good actually. I ordered a shrimp with lobster sauce and my boyfriend ordered a beef chop suey. The shrimp lobster sauce needed more salt the rice was hard and dry and not much taste. My boyfriend said the Chop suey needed more flavor as well this is my first time ordering from here the delivery came fast but I could have just ate the crab rangoon I probably won't be ordering from there again the rice was not good at all

2.description: Chop Suey King has been my office's regular Chinese take-out place - partly because our receptionist loves their food, and partly because they are fast, low-cost and filling.  The lunch combination plates are packed with so much food that they are essentially 2-for-1 deals, since they are impossible to be consumed by one person.  Stir frying tends to bring out such fragrant aromas from the food, but I've tried many things that I thought was just so-so.  The beef seems to be from fattier parts, and they don't have enough wok-fried flavor in the fried rice.  However, I like that the vegetables are always fresh, and they cook it slightly firm.  Oddly enough, despite trying everything from the Mongolian beef to the shrimp with lobster sauce, I think the best things are their egg rolls and wonton soup.  The egg rolls are made with just the detectable amount of peanut butter nuttiness (secret ingredient), which is delicious!  A large order of the wonton soup is more than enough for a meal - six large wontons (mostly pork), shredded BBQ pork, carrots, peapods, and cabbage and topped with fresh scallions.  I'm usually ordering with the office out of convenience and have  stuck with these two - they are truly excellent, especially for under $5!

9.description: This is probably my favorite dingy aquarium Chinese restaurant ever.While it's far from refined, they give you AMERICAN! sized portions at a killer value.  The lunch special will feed regular sized mortals for at least two meals worth.  Working near CSK is dangerous as I tend to find my palate visiting their version of the Orient once a week with no regrets.Their vegetable egg foo young is probably the best I've ever had especially the second day when the gravy has congealed into dancing cubes.  The General Tsao's chicken is more than adequately flavorful and their generically flavored egg rolls are always cooked perfectly.

10.description: LOL i always order take out.  One day I went in and the delivery guy recognized me.  He stated my address like it was my name!!!Amazing wonton soup, egg drop soup and Orange Chicken.The staff is nice. you cant go wrong.  don't waste your time going east into the city when this place is in your neighborhood.

4.description: Ordered the chicken fried rice and it was absolutely disgusting.  I had to push chicken to the side and only eat the rice. Won't be coming back.   Only positive was the spring roll.

6.description: Reasonable prices and good size portions. Fast delivery and freshly cooked food. Also very good customer service.

15.description: I special ordered sesame tofu three times from here--always takeout.  The first two times were great, which is why I went back.  The third time the tofu had weird gooey things, and I actually found a piece of sesame chicken in there as well.  I am a vegetarian, and while not a hyper sensative one, found it a bit gross to find chicken in the food--like, what else ended up there?  I haven't been back since, though this could have just been an off day--try it out, if you want =)  My friends liked it enough.

0.description: I must start out by sharing that I am not a big fan of Chinese food. I once was but I either overdid it or grew out of it. But one day my brother and sister-in-law decided to order from Chop Suey King and I fell back in love:).  They give you big portions of tasty food.  You are almost always eligible for free egg rolls - yes please! And also have other freebies based on the total of your order.  My family and I stick to what we like. Which here would be: orange chicken, sesame chicken, chicken fried rice, egg rolls and crab rangoon. I've never been disappointed. And if we order with friends they've never been disappointed with their orders either.  I actually had a friend from NY say if he lived in Chicago this would be his Chinese spot.  I highly recommend based on my own experiences. I recently moved and tried local places without luck. I was beyond happy when I called and they said they would deliver to my new home!

5.description: Excellent food. Big portions for reasonable prices and free, unannounced egg rolls in your to-go bag (same may be true for dine in, but I haven't done that yet). The combo fried rice is a must every time.

13.description: OK. I went here again. I grommed the menu. No one (except me) is going to throw this one out.The 'lunch special' is its "special combination plate". For $4.75 [$5.25 including tax], you can choose from 32 combos. Twelve are notated as "Hot & Spicy". The main item is accompanied by shrimp fried rice. You _may_ substitute another kind of fried rice for an extra 75¢. You also get a 12-ounce can of soda (its choice), and an egg roll [it wasn't just for me - but it still is not worth eating].After 3:30 pm, the combos jump in price to $6.25.It now caters. You can order party trays for $20 - $60.There are _125_ regular items on its menu. There are also three "family dinner" packages [2, 3, 4 people] for $16.25, $24.50, & $34.95.I cancelled the tip for 'Good for Groups' because there are only three booths here, holding four persons each. Carry it out, or have it delivered. It's on Grubhub, and it also takes direct phone calls (and faxes [@ 773-725-5050]).It has a television which receives terrestrial digital signals only.The food here tastes good. I wonder how it manages to maintain such quality care considering all these items it offers.

11.description: Good food. HUGE portions for the money. I loved their shrimp and beef fried rice. That's right, two in one. Delicious!CSK also gets extra points for being open on Monday and for having a menu available online (non-business site).I will definitely be trying other menu items in the future.

8.description: Great food (Chinese places around the West Lawn area have really taken a bad turn), offer delivery, and good prices.  My neighbors turned me on to this place and so glad they did!  Have recommended it to everyone in my area.  Love all the spicy options on the menu and they do not disappoint!

14.description: AAhhh Ssoooo!!!  Beware of the Ancient Chinese Bottled Water Trick!  It works like this:  Step 1. Tell customer that there are no cups for a simple glass of water.  Step 2.  Force customer to buy a soda or bottled water.Step 3.  Repeat all day long.Works like a charm!!!I went there 3 times last summer.  The first time, I walked out appalled by their chicanery.  Second time, they got my order wrong, but it was delicious.  Third time, they again got the order wrong, and the food was VOMITIOUS!Will not go back.

7.description: Great fast delivery and food was excellent. I've been looking for a place nearby that has good chinese food rather than just average and this is my new go to place.

12.description: My first experience with Super Pollo was definitely a mixed bag that could easily turn anyone away from future visits; however, I found some of their menu items worth a return trip.I joined a decent size group of Yelpers for an afternoon delight. I didn't think it would feel like an eternity but yeah it did. The service was not that good but I need to mention that this place wasn't equipped to handle a big table plus their regulars. That being said, it's just about unforgivable to have your patrons dying of thirst and forgetting an order too.I did enjoy a new treat for me, a papusa. It was quite good and with multiple options which all sounded good. My missing order did eventually show up (graciously for free) and it was very tasty, Honduran pastelitos  aka empenadas. I'll be back to try this same combo with much less of an entourage although the company made this first visit bearable.

7.description: If I could give no stars I would. First of all, I'm not Mexican. I've eaten here before with my boyfriend who is not Mexican either. I am here now for lunch with my son. The service is slow and apparently catered to those who speak the native language. I ordered a large orchata. I'm posting a picture of what they gave me, which they say is the "large" for "here". A Mexican family ordered a large horchata as well and got those big to go containers. I told the server that's what I wanted, she said I had to say "to go", shrugged her shoulders and walked away. Mind you, the Mexican family next to us is eating in as well. Then I ask for water, they being it over with no ice. My tacos were cold, as if they just reheated the steak. They never came back to check on us. But clearly catered to the other Spanish speaking tables. I'm glad we're moving. We love Mexican food, but this place sucks. Unless you're Spanish/Mexican, don't come here. Also, they put carrots and green beans in their rice! Why??!!!? There are plenty of better taco joints around here. We unfortunately came here today because the Chinese place next door is closed for some reason today. Never coming back here when we're in the hood after we move to the burbs. Good service = good tip. This is the last day this place is getting my business. Bad service + cold food = no tip.

3.description: Not the best food out there, the place is very dirty and when I went with my family there was only one girl working, the horchata was the most decent thing in the menu.

1.description: This place definitely deserves more than three stars but they were actually out of a few items that we really wanted to try prior to coming here. Service was good, but only one server. She did well though, for being the only one.

2.description: I just want to say 1st time comin took forever to get a menu + I waited for a long time to get my food + they didn't get my food right.i guess it was ok

9.description: The pupusas here are okay (3 out of 5), but this place gets an extra star for being the only Honduran joint around! Maybe I will try the Mexican menu next time.

10.description: This place is awesome! The closest you will get to Honduran food. A bit sketchy looking if you never been to Honduras but that's all part of the culture. Highly recommended!

13.description: Located on the east side of a huuuge shopping center lot, back from the street.  There is endless parking.  You just need to drive in to find it as it is dwarfed by the huge lot.  The shopping center lot (north side of street) is across the street from a McDonalds and Aldi (south side of street).  This place has both Honduran and Mexican dishes and is very modest in appearance inside.  The Honduran food is the last few pages of the menu, and another reviewer said we should focus on the Honduran food, so I did.  I give the place 4 stars because I enjoyed my food and some food of other people at the table looked very good, so I want to come back and try other things.  Also I feel the waitress and cook tried really hard to serve us, a group of 13 hungry people in a small restaurant, along w/ a few other tables.  It helps a little if someone in your party speaks spanish, but the whole menu is in both english and spanish, and the feel is very welcoming, so you should be AOK either way.   I got the Cena Tipica Carne Asada- traditional steak dinner which came with fried plaintain, avocado, refried beans, (and hard cheese and sour cream on the side but I am not big on dairy).  I liked it - avocado was an entire 1/2 avocado, refried beans had interesting seasoning, steak was skirt steak (I believe) as I expected, and was moist and good.  (So this is not the kind of steak you get at Gibsons, folks).  It was $10.50 and many other things on the menu were cheaper so when I try other stuff next time I'll pay even less.  Someone else got the Honduran enchiladas which are open faced.  The waitress explained that enchiladas from Honduras come open like that.  Anyway they looked very yummy so I will come back and get that.  They had liquados of various fruits, which you can have made w/water or milk.  They have a lot of fruit liquados (shakes) listed on the menu and it seemed like they are all dependent on what they have that day.    I had guanabana which I have never tasted before.  It tasted good but pretty mild, almost like vanilla.  Then I had a shake made from maracuya to go, which was pretty interesting.  It is similar in flavor to an orange, but a little tangy.  One person had theirs with milk and next time I'll probably do that - a maracuya shake w/milk.  For food next time I want to try the papusas and also the baleadas.  Both were on the menu and inexpensive, and are supposed be very Honduran, so I have no excuse next time.  Here's a wikipedia page about Honduran food en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ho…

16.description: My husband is Honduran and I've traveled/worked extensively in Honduras, so we know what typical Honduran food tastes like.  The carne asada was good, but the rice looked old and refried beans were obviously from a can.  The baleadas were crunchy and all of the filling was liquid that dripped out of the baleada, resulting in you eating the equivalent of a slightly soggy cracker.  The worst thing, though was that after we'd had their complimentary chips and salsa, I saw the waitresses take salsa off other people's tables and put the little dish of salsa (used spoon and all!) into their refrigerator and then take it back out and give it to another table. So not sanitary.  :(  The prices for things like sopa marinera were super high ($18), so we didn't even try that.  I've had it elsewhere in the States at Honduran restaurants for $10 and it was fabulous.  We like Antohijtos Hondurenos en Waukeegan, IL much better than Super Pollo.  Probably won't be back.

17.description: This is a cool palce to go to eat. The food is good and their fried chicken is especially good. They serve it as light, medium, or extremely spicy. The service is quick here and the rpices are good too.

15.description: Four stars for its quick Honduran food.I've been here twice, and enjoyed the food and service both times.  it's a little hard to find, being stuck in the back part of a huge strip mall, but the food is good.Their baleadas are good, with a nice balance of flavors, they have pupusas, other typically Honduran foods, and a really nice Sopa De Caracol (conch soup), and a selection of other typically Honduran foods.They also have standard selection of Mexican dishes, tacos, etc., but I haven't eaten them there - go for the Honduran food!

0.description: I traveled to Honduras about four years ago, and instantly fell in love with the food and the culture, so of course I had to find a Honduran place in Chicago. Thanks to the greatness that is Yelp :-), I found this gem on the North side of Chicago. I came on a Sunday afternoon with a pretty good appetite because I knew I would want to try a variety of things. When we walked in we were instantly greeted, and we were told we could sit wherever we wanted. The restaurant had a very comfortable feel, and the music playing in the background made it even better. The menu has a lot of items! Since its a dual Mexican/Honduran restaurant, there's a wide variety of items to choose from.Feeling adventurous, I ordered the baleada and Yucca con Chicharron, and my mom ordered a torta de Lomo(Ribeye). Since everything is made fresh, it took a little time for the food to come out (nothing extreme). When it did come out, everything looked and smelled delicious! The portions were very generous and everything was very flavorful. The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because although my mom ordered a lomo torta, she ended up getting a ham and cheese torta. I ordered everything in Spanish so I knew I ordered the lomo, so after asking the waitress why she was given ham instead of lomo she explained that they were out of lomo and a few other items. It wasn't a huge deal, but it would've been better if she told us that prior to bringing out the food. She offered to bring something else, but the torta looked good and we ended up keeping it. So for the cheap prices, and being the only Honduran place around (that I know of) I'd say its a good place to visit!

5.description: Tastes even better the second day. I'd never had Honduran food before and I hadn't spent much time in Belmont-Cragin. Soooo.... it made perfect sense to me to knock two birds out with one stone and get some Honduran grub in the 'hood. To begin with, the restaurant is larger than it seems. Set in a strip mall, form gives way to function, but the function works. Also *extremely* noteworthy: English is not spoken here. You need to come with a Spanish speaker. I spent weeks trying to figure out the menu, hours of operation, etc. by the phone and, finally, just conceded to driving there and poking around. Even though the menu is in English, the service is not and if you don't speak Spanish, you will be frustrated by your experience. You will.That said, my food was enjoyable. There were some hit or miss items so stick with my picks for hits.Hit -- papusa with cheese and beans.Hit -- berry WATER. Don't order your agua fresca con leche. NO! Get it with water and you'll be so much the happier. Every sip I took was refreshing, flavorful and very satisfying. You'll have to take my word on it. Other tried to have a sip, but you know I don't play that. I don't know where your mouth has been. Back up from my beverage. No, not even a new straw will be enough to counter the mystery of your oral history. Sorry. Buy your own. You'll want to. And, you might want to have someone look at *that*. I keed because I love.Hit -- fried chicken with cabbage, Honduran sauce (the name cracks me up; this is tomato and pepper-based; chunky like a salsa, not thick like a paste) and bananas (not plantains). Don't think KFC or, even, your mom's fried chicken. This chicken has a crispy skin that bears a closer texture/taste resemblance to grilled chicken. The components, on their own, aren't very exciting. When mixed together, though, the dish really comes together in a familiar yet comfortably different way. But, like I said, I actually enjoyed my leftovers more than I did the initial meal. Maybe the flavors had time to settle into each other. And, that brings me to my last point -- leftovers! For $9 or so, I had two filling meals. I like that kind of bang for my buck and I think you will too.

11.description: I live fairly close and I visit a store in this strip mall every few months or so but I never really payed attention to this Honduran place. Because their is a huge population of Mexicans in the area, I assumed it was another Mexican joint. Small place but large enough to seat our group comfortably. My quarter chicken was very flavorful but the part of the chicken I got was poor so their wasn't really much meat on the bones. The corn side dish I got was pretty terrible, standard canned corn, unseasoned and drenched in butter. The black beans in a surprise scene stealing move were pretty good, flavorful and not too salty. Service was ok but it could have had fewer mistakes and a little more organization. The language barrier was probably responsible for many of the mistakes made in terms of forgetting to bring out certain items, drinks,water. Overall, I might return to check out some more traditional Honduran dishes,with my Spanish speaking beau in tow of course.

8.description: As a Honduran native (born and raised), I really loved their baleadas and plato tipico. Their pastelitos were ok.

4.description: My fiancé and I were in a rush to eat something late at night. They let us in even after they had closed 30 minutes ago. The food was good and the service was great.

14.description: Typical Central American chicken place hidden in a strip mall on the west side. I passed it up a couple times trying to find it its that nondescript. I had the typical chicken dinner with rice and got a Honduran soda to go along with it. My meal was pretty average but good. I have had better Honduran food than this but I didn't hate their food her. I took bites from my friends plates and they were OK as well. Because we arrived with a group of around 10 of us the waitress and cook were a little overwhelmed but we didn't have horrible service and when the waitress forgot something and we pointed that out to her they corrected it right away. If your looking to try out some Honduran dishes and your that far West it wont hurt to stop here and try their stuff out.

6.description: After many years of a reluctance to head west (maybe it's all the - at least I hope - fireworks I see and hear from over there), I am pleased to report that there is, in fact, life west of Pulaski! And what a tasty life it is. Far from being in some sort of strange, foreign, uninviting world, Super Pollo sits nestled in a mini-mall surrounded by such "strange" wonders as a Big Lots! But beyond the sort of rundown exterior the food inside was top notch. As I had previously discovered with Costa Rican, Honduran resembled Mexican slightly but was different enough to bring new flavors and perspectives into my life. I ordered the Honduran Enchilada "pero no carne." What met my eyes looked like no enchilada I'd ever seen. Open faced on a soft, thick bread it came covered with cabbage (which the menu oddly and hilariously refers to as "babbage") and a hard boiled egg on top of the usual bed of beans and rice. The flavors blended so well together and the cabbage added such a wonderful kick that I began to doubt the Mexican restaurants I was used to's preparation of the dish. And at $7.00 for three, I actually had enough for dinner. Take that local taquerias! The chips and salsa (very close to a pico-de-gallo) were also some of the best I've had. Well worth the trip all on their own. Others at the table found their food hit-or-miss. But, one thing I think we all experienced was some very odd service. We were warned about the lack of English that the staff speaks coming in. But even with our Spanish "translators" in tow (thanks Janet W. and Rafael C.), water took forever to be re-filled and drink and food orders were actually lost. We were a large group but this was still very off-putting. Still the menu is huge and contains more familiar Mexican dishes for the less adventurous. And I definitely want to try some more Honduran food. I'll just, you know, make sure to brush up on my Spanish before a return, simple, not scary at all, trip on the 76 bus.

1.description: The manager here is top notch! Evertytime I visit this location, he is out on the floor working as a regular employee, never asking for help. Just being a team player and not letting that "role" get to himself! A++++ Mr. G!

2.description: It's Walgreens.  Just thought I'd let you know that there's one on this end...

0.description: Its down the street, people are friendly. I go to this location a lot and I have not had any bad experiences.

This place has great barbers.... make sure you make an appt and call ahead! My barber, Orlando, has always taken care of me and I have been a loyal customer for a few years now. A few tips, bring cash since I only see people paying with cash (including myself) and I am not sure if they have a credit card reader. Also, most of the barbers here are well known and they all have their set clientele so at first it may be hard to get an appointment with one of them. Plenty of free parking on the street along Cicero Ave so thats always a plus!

1.description: #5 breakfast hits the spot, worth the few minute wait on a late Sunday morning! Coffee is 8.5/10. Guy with the $4 double cheeseburger next to me looked like he was in heaven.. Til next time!

2.description: If your bus driver and mail carrier used yelp, then there'd already be a review for United Grill.  My egg sandwich was thick, the coffee was strong, and my OJ came with ice and a straw.United has a seriously positive vibe and if I lived in Chicago, I'd be here every week.

0.description: This is a subjective review of course. Not everyone likes cheap and fast but I do! I ordered the steak and pancakes and all that stuff for breakfast. I just MOWED down on my thin, flavorful steak and drank coffee. I was full without finishing it all.Friendly service. Great atmosphere. Great prices. For me a diner doesn't get better.

58.description: I got the $20 for $40 yelp deal for me and my son and it was great. My only complaint is that they ran out of 2 signature Cuban dishes that we wanted to try (Ropa Vieja and Congri). We were there on a Monday so we got the lechon asado special with white rice and black beans. And also a steak with totstones and yellow rice. For the most part everything was really good. The lechon was a little too salty for me, but it had good flavor. We had a cafe con leche and a cortadito after dinner with a pastelitos de guayaba, one with cheese and one without. Definitely prefer the one with cheese. Overall a great place to eat and listen to some great music.

56.description: $20 for $40 Yelp coupon?!?!?! Ummmmm yes please!!! Alcohol included forvthat deal as well!!! Very delicious Cuban food and customer service that makes you feel like youre at home. One of my favorite Cuban places in Chicago for brunch.

29.description: Always love coming here for lunch! such delicious Cuban food! The expresss on Diversey doesn't disappoint either!

42.description: The food tasted amazing! The carne tasted delicious and the congri rice had great flavor.

23.description: When we pulled up I saw the colorful decor & walking in felt I was at an authentic Cuban place. Nice atmosphere, very friendly, helpful & attentive server named Gloria and the manager checked on us at the end to ask how everything was & she was also very friendly & helpful as we used the yelp deal $20 for $40 & had to order for to go to use it up, she made helpful suggestions. Had the trio de empenadas which was fresh & yummy. I tried the chicken fajitas which weren't bad but not super flavorful. My husband loved the ropa vieja. Plantains delicious. Pina colada delicious. It is def worth trying!

47.description: i love love this place for a good cuban sandwich the options are plenty and the people are friendly - we always start with the mariquitas - plantain chips with aioli dip (which is sometimes very very garlicky) - no make out sessions after that, m'kay?

8.description: I enjoy coming to this place but truly I think the North Ave location serves better and fresher food .... So, next time, I will just drive the extra mile to get better food... BC I order picadillo de carne (ground beef stew) with a side of rice and two fried eggs and my eggs were so cold and rice was old ... I give it 3  bc my hubby's sandwich was better.

31.description: Love the food can't wait to visit again!

34.description: This place is pretty good. They also opened an express senor pan on diversey by Laramie. Sandwiches are really tasty. Glad it's not too far from my work area.

16.description: If you fancy a well made Cuban sandwich and a cafe con leche, this is it. I love a good cafe con leche and my boyfriend and I frequent this restaurant to pick one up whenever we can. Everyone we've encountered has been super friendly and we've never had any issues with the length of time it takes to make the food. It's also very affordable. Bonus: I love hitting the congos on my way out to indicate I had an awesome time. It's the kid in me.

13.description: Great portions. Good Pricing. Delicious food - get the ropa vieja :) and the sampler platter. Only down side is that they close early on weekends

11.description: Do not try the ropa vieja. It's so chewy hardly enjoyable. I poured the juice of the ropa vieja over my  rice and basically just ate rice n beans. The steak sandwich was good but also chewy. I had take out but noticed the restaurant is very cute and service was friendly. Def wouldn't return from my side of town. The food isn't worth the travel.

39.description: This place never fails with their food - always flavorful, and great portions.  I've been here several times, and it seems as though the service has improved tremendously.  Their coffee is always stellar, though I do wish there were more milk options.  Do yourself a favor and try the sándwich de lechón asado - just be ready to get a mouthful of grilled onions, though, as it's piled on high with most of their sandwiches.

37.description: Went for breakfast-lunch,  service was ok , food was good, one thing I didn't like by the time I was eating was watching the bus boy touching his cold sores in muoth and nose and after he  was serving food and handling glasses for drinks, I understand every body gets that some time, but I saw the manager next to him and she should encourage hin to wash his hands all the time or simply giving him a sick day to recover, that's very important and disappointed to see it in front of customers in special when you are eating

0.description: I love this place! The food is always tastefully done. There is good service. The only complaint I would say is that there is some waitresses seem extremely unfriendly. Hardly a smile. Other than that everything else is great!My boyfriend bought a deal from yelp for $20 that was worth $40 of food. One of the ladies there (maybe the manager or owner) gave us flan to complete it which was super nice! The flan was also amazing. Overall I love this place and will keep going back!I really recommend it.

38.description: The steak sandwich was very tasty. The empanadas were awesome , especially with the oil like sauce to dip in. All in all this place dishes out great food.

51.description: A Cuban gem!!! BYOB and the food makes you feel like you are definetly in Cuba! Beat cuban sandwich soooooo goooddd!

27.description: Love love love this place. I am definitely a much returning fan. Waiting patiently for my double Cortadito to go for my road trip.

32.description: Great mom and pop restaurant with delicious, authentic Cuban food. Service is a little slow but that's the pace in Cuba! Lol! Try the Ropa Vieja, traditional shredded beef dish, served with white rice, black beans and sweet fried plantains. Great Cuban coffee and homemade desserts are offered as well.

54.description: Love love love the food! Staff is great and always very friendly. Love that you can call in your order ahead of time. Try their breakfast sandwich it's one of my favorites.

48.description: Excellent service and good deal (20$ for $40)! We came here as a group of three and they even split our entree into three separate plates without us asking. The appetizer combo was also fulfilling. Shout out to Gloria for being an exceptional waitress.

44.description: A well made Cuban sandwich is about as high on my list as a great "diner"  breakfast.  I'll drive miles for either.  So, based on the rave reviews in Yelp, I did the drive out to W. Fullerton.  The place was hopping, but service was really friendly and attentive.  Nice menu, fairly priced.  The Cuban sandwich was good ( I couldn't say "awesome").  Lots of meat & perfectly melted cheese.  The bread was fresh, but a little too doughy for any grilled Cuban-type sandwiches on the menu.  ( For me, a great Cuban sandwich should have a "slight" crunch....think grilled cheese sandwich.)As another fellow Yelper noted in her review "Don't count on the chips that come with the sandwiches."  She was so right.  "I've had "mariquitas" (fried plantain chips) when they were less than 15 minutes out of the deep fryer, and wanted to "slap my mama" they were so delicious.  Not so with the one's on my plate today.   Bottom line,  I would definitely return and try a main dish ( as opposed to a sandwich). The entrees being served looked and smelled delicious.

24.description: First time here and used a yelp coupon. First if you don't know where you're going you will pass it ,lol. so its right by the vidock next to the domino's if your wondering .It was a little packed on a Saturday evening around 5 p.m.It has a cool decor and I like how the waiters dress with the hats. Our waitress was named Gloria,who was awesome and so patient with us considering it was my first time eating Cuban.We got the sample platter which I thought was really good and pretty much gave you a taste of the whole appetizer menu. We also got the Cuban sandwich which was so fresh ,hot,and ready to consume.The pork could have been marinated a little more with spices and a tad more mustard and pickles but other then that it was great.Also when you check into the place with help you get a free Cuban coffee with milk with is great with dessert which we got the flan.Will be back :) most definialty.

7.description: A well made Cuban sandwich is about as high on my list as a great "diner"  breakfast.  I'll drive miles for either.  So, based on the rave reviews in Yelp, I did the drive out to W. Fullerton.  The place was hopping, but service was really friendly and attentive.  Nice menu, fairly priced.  The Cuban sandwich was good ( I couldn't say "awesome").  Lots of meat & perfectly melted cheese.  The bread was fresh, but a little too doughy for any grilled Cuban-type sandwiches on the menu.  ( For me, a great Cuban sandwich should have a "slight" crunch....think grilled cheese sandwich.)As another fellow Yelper noted in her review "Don't count on the chips that come with the sandwiches."  She was so right.  "I've had "mariquitas" (fried plantain chips) when they were less than 15 minutes out of the deep fryer, and wanted to "slap my mama" they were so delicious.  Not so with the one's on my plate today.   Bottom line,  I would definitely return and try a main dish ( as opposed to a sandwich). The entrees being served looked and smelled delicious.

49.description: Great food! Great service! I got the standard Cubano with plantain chips so yum. The flan is also excellent choice! Thanks yelp for the coupon!

40.description: A caballo!This joint has great steak sandwiches.If you add avocado, cheese and do the fried egg on your sandwich, it'll take it to another level!

53.description: Great experience. Pleasant staff. Try the mango smoothie, it's the best.

30.description: I tried the steak  sandwich ..it had lettuce, onion and tomato and the  added aguacate  and the white cheese for an extra charge but it was worth the charge ! It was so delicious and amazing . It was my first time here and my boyfriend ordered the ropa vieja sandwich .also very delicious . It was kind of hard to see the place since it was hidden but I'm glad we found this yummy spot . I recommend to try all the Cuban entrees

46.description: I was pleasantly surprised with my visit to Señor Pan on Fullerton Ave. Loved the ambiance! The sandwiches and cafe con leche were very good. I, especially liked the homey Cuban cafe and coffeehouse feel with a mellow vibe, and the decor/ the art/ things from Cuba, just things that we can't see elsewhere. Made me feel like I was transported back to the day when I visited a Miami Cuban Cafe -only this one is more mellow, spacious with excellent service. The young lady that took care of us was delightful, helpful and very courteous. I'm so glad that this Cuban Cafe is located in Chicago. And I look forward to visiting again to try the Cuban drinks, sip more Delish Cuban coffee and try more on the menu. This is a fantastic spot for those that like a laid-back eatery, making you feel like you're out of the Chicago, even for just a moment...top it off with great company... I hope it stays like this forever!

1.description: Noooo, no no no. $7 for a shredded beef sandwich (the small one) that had tomato sauce and spices on it. The beef was EXTREMELY chewy. Zero tenderness! This is a sign that the cook has NO idea what the hell they are doing. The spice? Laughable! Slight tomato flavor with no garlic and no real spice at all. This was basically the shittiest beef sandwich Ive had in years. They should be EMBARRASSED to serve this crap especially for $7!!! -- Chewy beef-- ZERO toppings-- Very little spice-- ZERO garlic flavor--small-- poor parking spots-- expensive for what you get ($7 for chewy shredded beef on a bun... no cheese or toppings) ++ Employees were nice++ Nice dining areaBOTTOM LINE: No Idea why or how this place stays in business when there are 100 Latino places to eat that no ONLY have a much better product, but also for $4..... NOT $7.

55.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Great costumer service, everything on the menu is great! There salads are the best

9.description: Love Love Love this place. Went for my first time and was greeted immediately with a smile. The atmosphere was amazing I felt like I did travel to another country. Cafe con Leche was on point as well as their food. It was worth every second! Definitely will be back for more!!

26.description: If you fancy a well made Cuban sandwich and a cafe con leche, this is it. I love a good cafe con leche and my boyfriend and I frequent this restaurant to pick one up whenever we can. Everyone we've encountered has been super friendly and we've never had any issues with the length of time it takes to make the food. It's also very affordable. Bonus: I love hitting the congos on my way out to indicate I had an awesome time. It's the kid in me.

25.description: Cuban sandwiches and coffee with milk! Yum, yum, yum! The plantains are so good. It's food is honest to God the greatest!

12.description: Never disappointed with food and price. The meet is always tender and flavorful. The service is quick and friendly. I only recommend that the black beans be less watery and more love in it. I highly recommend this place!

59.description: The food is great but the service sucks. Maybe it's because they are always packed but usually our table gets ignored.

21.description: just ordered 2 ropa vieja dinners,  1 lechon dinner with yuca frita that's so fire! their garlic tastes just right,  i'm addicted to this lechon lol

17.description: One of the best place for Cuban food in Chicago.... Being a Miami transplant this is the closest I could find.Congri is not  like the one I am used to.Cuban sandwich is good, empanadas excellents, the lechon is riquisimo too :)

10.description: This was the place me and my boyfriend picked for our first dinner date a year ago because it's Cuban -- and he only eats Cuban food. Till this day, this restaurant lives up to my boyfriend's expectations. He's lived in Cuba all his life up until three years ago -- he knows what it's supposed to taste like. & I can quite agree with him that it is delicious.I always enjoy having Rope Vieja in sandwich form, and itself with congri, and yuca en mojo as sides. (& that yuca has the perfect taste) My boyfriend loves the pork-chops, and the steak -- they're juicy, and easy to eat. Their chicken dishes are also quite amazing. -- Also their cafe con leche is toooooo die for -- so sweet refreshing. The service is always optimal! Everyone is extremely well informed of the menu. The wait time for food isn't long. They throw really nice birthday celebrations with their hats on, and birthday music. Overall, I'd recommend this place to anyone wanting to try authentic Cuban food.P.S. The Yelp deal on here makes this place 10X more affordable for bigger tables.

5.description: Never ever disappoints! Staff is amazing, so friendly and accommodating. Decor is so pretty to look at. Awesome inviting atmosphere. We eat in as well as take out and we've also had catering from here. Don't forget to try the lechon empanadas they're amazing! The flan is fantastic and omg the ropa vieja is fantastic. Always fresh and hot food accompanied by outstanding service and awesome prices.

3.description: A most perfect lunch joint for takeout, couples, or small groups. Family friendly.The ropa vieja sandwich is the only true way to go.  It's saucey and savory.  It is hard to chew, and will get in your teeth, but I tell you, my friends... SO worth it! the bread they serve the sandwich on soaks up the sauce in a complimenting way.... *salivating in nostalgia*I have tried the pulled pork/lechon sandwich which is also good, but fares on the drier side.Don't count on the chips that come with the sandwiches. I think they're okay, but papery, and sometimes lack in flavor.  Needs like a cajun seasoning, or something with a kick. Instead, order a side of sweet plantains! can't go wrong.Ive tried the champagne soda - DELISH!also had the flan, which was also really good, drizzed in caramel. Very thick, creamy, and condensed in flavor. If only I lived closer... this would definitely become a guilty pleasure. It is definitely worth a drive to. On the plus side... they're open pretty early! since they offer bakeryish items, I believe they're open at 8am. they also offered a pretty nice groupon deal and yelp offer, last i checked.

35.description: WOW!! Where do I start? The food was absolutely AMAZING! I ordered the Lechon plate with white rice, black beans with tostones and a order of trio empanadas. From the first bite to the very last bite I couldn't believe how good the food was. This is the first time trying this place and won't be the last that's for sure. Can't wait to try there food again.

19.description: It's pretty sad that lately I have not been impressed with their sandwiches or the cafe con leche. They just changed the bread they use for the sandwiches so now I feel like they taste different and not in a good way. The cafe con leche has just been  "blah" as well with no real taste. Sucks that they pre-make the cafe con leche and just keep it in a carafe there unlike before where they used to make it for you on the spot when you order it. Might have to start to look for a new Cuban sandwich place in the area since I'm pretty sure there have to be other places....sad day for me!

28.description: This place is clean, well appointed, and lively. The food is consistently good and the price is right. My husband loves the Cuban steak sandwich, and I love the ropa vieja. Delish!!!

45.description: I went with two Cubans. We were all extremely satisfied with the authentic flavors, attentive service, and great music! Worth the trip to beautiful Hermosa Park!

33.description: I could not find the Senor Pan Express on Diversey on Yelp so I'm leaving my review here...I called in an order for a 2 grilled cheese sandwich no meat and a coffee and a juice  I was charged for a full sandwich with meat over $6 charge whereas a piece of French bread with butter is less then $2.  I mentioned this to the counter guy and he was rude about it and said that is how they charge it. So they could of given me the meat on the side and I could of given it to a homeless person.  Rude service and way overpriced ! and I was initially excited about this place opening on Diversey . I will never go there nor recommend it ...Lucky they got a 1 star because Yelp does not have 1/2 star rating !

43.description: Nice friendly ambience, good food, good prices. The owner is usually there and always friendly. Authentic Cuban food.

2.description: First off let's start with the bad...Uhmmmm absolutely nothing.Now that that's out the way let's get into the absolutely delicious Señor Pan. The empanadas are hands down the best in town. I've ordered the trio on every visit and they are all amazing each time, make sure you try the Ropa Vieja its .50 extra but more than worth it. The skirt steak is probably my favorite item off the menu, it's tender, juicy and marinated to perfection. The lechon asado, Ropa Vieja (entree) and steak sandwiches are amazing as well. Honestly haven't tried anything I didn't like from this place. A must visit!

18.description: This place was amazing! Top of the line customer service and the food was on point. Our waitress was efficient and caring... it's really hard to find one thing wrong with this place.. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys Cuban food. Flawless

41.description: Excellent service!!  You'll never leave dissatisfied.  The best Cuban cuisine in town.  I traveled 20 miles, definitely worth the trip.  ¡Azúcar!

52.description: I have eaten here several times and I have never been disappointed. Staff has always been welcoming and very polite. I always order the ham egg n cheese omelette because it is always so fresh.   I will continue to be a customer as long as they continue with the great service and reasonable prices. Thank you, Señor Pan!

50.description: Came in for a pickup , very impressed by the decor of the restaurant . My order was ready and fresh . I had the Cuban steak sandwich it was delicious. The meat was very tender . The black beans were oh so scrupulous . Must try . My husband had the fried pork chunks the flavor was wonderful . I can't wait to dine in at Señor Pan very soon .

4.description: Absolutely love this place...started off with the cafe con leche...such a great starter for a cold day...and im not really much of a coffee drinker I drink the whole thing in one sip...then i had lechon sandwich with the pork soup...so much food i took some home...then we ended the meal with pastelitos de guayaba...we be back...

6.description: I found another great restaurant on Yelp.  Señor Pan is rated 4 1/2 stars w/1$ sign.  We went Sunday night around 7 pm and the restaurant was packed.  There are 2 locations.  The location we went to @ 4615 W Fullerton Ave.   They have a large menu with very reasonable prices & the food we had was very good.I had the Masitas de Puerco Fritas.  This is Deep-fried pork chunks were very tasty, but a little dry w/red onions, yellow rice was very good as were the plantains all for $10.95.  We also ordered Ropa Vieja shredded beef in tomato creole sauce & The Choice beef Churrasco Cubano was very good.Good food, good service and huge portions (I have lunch tomorrow).  Best of all Yelp had $40.00 worth of food for $20.00 & we all had left overs on all 3 dishes

22.description: Really wonderful customer service. The food was awesome. I have the shredded beef with yellow rice and it was awesome. Also the virgin pina colada it was amazing. Going to come back again I recommended! FYI this is my first time here. Oh yeah and the plantain chips is also awesome.

15.description: Phenomenal service, food, and atmosphere. Our server Gloria was super friendly and extremely efficient. I would definitely recommend coming!

57.description: Señor Pan has great menu, so much flavor so many meals to choose from. Quality is great. Awesome place to go spend time with the family. The service is on point and so is the decoration and music.

20.description: Wow yess yess and more yess. Very sumptuous food, the cafe con Leche is great and the subs are very excellent quality.

36.description: If I could give "0" stars I would!  The staff here are sooo rude.  I WAS a long-standing customer but no more!  We just placed a pick up order and when we got back to work we realized they did not give us the three soups we ordered.  We immediately called to inform them that they forgot to give us our soup and were rudely told they packed the soups and gave them to us.  Finally, they agreed over the phone that they would give us the soups if someone came back to pick them up.  Considering it was their mistake, we think they should have delivered it to us.  Needless to say, when we showed back up to pick up our missing soups they tried to give us only one soup.  It took a number of back and forths of the manager and cashier being extremely rude before they finally agreed to give us our missing soups.  If you want very RUDE service, feel free to visit Senor Pan.  Otherwise, I suggest going to El Cubanito on Wrightwood & Pulaski if you want Cuban food, along with good service.

14.description: I locked myself in the bathroom and no one would come to help. I was stuck in there for 10 hours. The cook was at least nice enough to slide some fried plantain chips under the door. For being covered in the fuzz from the floor they were pretty good. Next time maybe I'll see if they can slide some chicken under the door.

12.description: Perfect mexican place to eat. Tacos de canasta were amazing. They are very hard to find. Unexperienced servers, but other than the food makes up for it. Horchata is amazing there.

3.description: drove from aurora to chicago just to check the tacos de canasta    sorry im from mexico city this is not  tacos de canasta is some small taco in a small tortillaim disappointed after 1.5 hours drive the take like 20 minutes to take your order im looking at the cook in is waching the game in the tv in im waiting for my order after 25 minutes arrive in a ask the lady this is the tacos de canasta im looking a some small tacos sorry guys my first in last time here nothing here for me by the way no taste in the food

1.description: Food is delicious! I'm a big fan of their tortas de carne asada. I've also had tacos here and burritos (I live a few blocks away) and they're all great. Took away a star however because it takes long  seems to take long even when it looks pretty empty.

2.description: Ordered through grub hub and was slightly disappointed when it said my order wouldn't arrive for over an hour. Pleasant surprise when my food showed up at the doorstep half an hour later. Food was hot and yummy, I had been craving chorizo so I ordered a burrito chorizo. Tacos I ordered for my daughter were really good too, I think I ate too much! Good job!

9.description: Awesome Mexican Food. Great prices. Fresh food, authentic flavors. Great Customer service

10.description: Went here last nite with 1 of my friends and we LOVED it! It's not ur typical Mexican dishes but we were feelin adventurous so we went for it. I had a tripe taco, chicken taco and asada taco. All 3 were really yummy! You could taste the flavor in each one and it was delicious! The lady that served us was sooo nice. Since my friend speaks Spanish they conversed about the foods and she answered all our questions. The food tastes very authentic and fresh. We will DEFINITELY come back to this place for the great food and wonderful service!

4.description: Sooo good. We've been ordering from the same mexican place for about 2 years. But just to change it up, we decided to try this place. Well, to keep it short, this will now be the go-to for mexican food. :)

6.description: I'm very disappointed of this place, I red the other reviews and I was expecting a lot more in the service and food.It took more than 30 minutes to get our orders, I got mine 8 minutes after we ordered and the rest of them in 25 minutes later, I even asked to heat my mini Tacos de canasta in the microwave because they were cold.The food has an excellent flavor, but the service is really bad.

15.description: I have only been to la chilangueada once.A friend recommended this place to me.She recommended it for the hurraches.OMG!!! It is soooo yummy It like this long piece of bread with salsa on the bottom,meat,beans,sour cream,cheese and more salsa.Very good.The service was great too.

0.description: This is the only place in ALLLL Chicago where I have found "tacos de canasta" that are the real thing!!The "papas con chorizo" are to die for! The only problem is that I could not stop eating and got quite an upset stomach, but I guess 8 tacos would do that to anyone : ).This place is way out of my neighborhood but I will be driving here very often! Worth the drive for sure!

5.description: I will not order from here again! You cant go wrong with steak tacos. They were just basic and ok. We ordered also chicken tacos and they were pretty good. Chicken was flavorful. I ordered a burrito and it was horrible. The tortilla was crispy, i could barely get thru a quarter of it. The beans were not well blended , i felt like i was eating them right from the can.

13.description: Finally found a good Mexican place that delivers to us. It wasn't fast, but it was delivered warm and uncongealed, which is more than you can say for most delivery Mexican. And they have a lot of vegetarian options. Any place with flor de calabaza offerings is a winner in my book.

11.description: This place is located in a pretty heavily populated Mexican neighborhood, with lots of other Mexican food places around. But this place is by far my favorite. The carne asada is what got me hooked. No nasty fat, not too greasy, and tasty! It's a modern looking place, with cool Mexican wall decor, and El Gordo y La Flaca on the flatscreen TVs. The jugos (juices/drinks) are all natural too!

8.description: Finally, authentic Mexican food in Chicago! I'm a Chilanga and I approve this restaurant :)!      We ordered via Grub Hub and were so pleasantly surprised! When I saw they had cuitlacoche and flor de calabaza I started to get a good feeling...their huaraches were amazing, quesadillas delicious. I love their thick homemade tortillas. The service was fast given the distance from restaurant to our house is 4 miles. Only thing, please send more than one lime next time! :) will definitely order again and highly recommend.

14.description: Hey, Arlene G. beat me too it! This was a really great find -a hidden gem. She and I were trying to meet somewhere between my work and her house and there is really nothing along Cicero Ave -especially considering parking. This is just slightly west of Cicero Ave. I found the menu to be interesting -I think they offer some items that are specific to a certain part of Mexico (I'm thinking D.F. or "Mexico City" due to the "Chilango" in the name. Chilango is slang for someone from Mexico City). Also, I saw things like bambasos and different kinds of tamales I had not seen in other restaurants. I like that they have nopales (cactus) which you can't always find in every Mexican place. Overall, the food was cooked to order, fresh and had a "homemade" vibe to it. I was really impressed that this little tiny "hole in the wall" had such great food. Well, now we found our place in between both of us. Can't wait to go back and try other items!

7.description: Ordered from these guys through Grubhub & was pleasantly surprised. Order came in less than and hour, and the food was very authentic & piping hot. I liked how their burritos are not all tortilla & lettuce (Las Asadas, I'm talking to you!) Will totally order from them again!

3.description: I will never shop here ever again. I, perhaps may never shop at another Radio shack just because of this recent visit.I walked in having a problem with one of my iPhone accessories. There was a quite a few people in the store being helped and I walked in watching an employee texting on her phone and another employee walking around playing with all the dummy phones. I asked for help and they didn't even acknowledge me.Then, another woman walks in. Her and I were standing there for a few minutes when the employee playing with the phones decided to help her out, not me. I complained stating she obviously walked in later than I did and I should be helped first. But the employee insisted on arguing with me about how I need to wait my turn and be patient or I will need to leave.So, I waited. I didn't want any trouble. One of the other employees working there, who was working very hard, decided to come up to me and apologize and insisted on helping me. He helped me out but the product couldn't even be fixed so they had to issue me a store credit. Prices are high, service is not good at all.. Two more reasons why Radio Shack is a no-go. It was a mess. To say the least and I am glad I'm not just another ordinary hot-head like others or things would have gotten bad. But, it happens, right? I don't think so. I will never shop at a Radio Shack again, especially this location in particular.

1.description: Old lady manager is super unprofessional and rude. She even went out of her way to call nearby Radio Shack stores to not help me, when I wanted was to get a gift for my mom. Me and my mom were authorized to make changes on our cellphones, but when I wanted to upgrade my mom's phone for Mother's Day- this particular store's manager just went on a screaming rant about how I couldn't do changes without my mother's permission. I was able to go elsewhere to Vernon Hills mall since she had badmouth me to stores in Gurnee and tried to do the same elsewhere, but she was told I was in my full rights to do changes, since other stores were able to confirm my authority to make changes, as well as my mom did. It's a shame this old lady manager doesn't know how to work professionally, even her own employees wanted to help me, but since she was at the store and didn't cared to verify anything I had to say, she totally dismissed me out of her store. I can only wonder what reasons she had against a customer trying to buy her mom a phone ? Was such an inconvenience, since I live nearby and ended up driving to Radio Shack at Vernon Hills. I will never step a foot inside this store again. This incident happened about 3 years ago, but I will never forget it. Vernon Hills manager assured me they had submitted a complaint, so I greatly appreciated the customer service from them.

2.description: I have been in this store before and found the associates very rude. But not this time! Victor immediately got the right people and parts involved, promised me a very quick turnaround on an iPad repair. When I picked up my iPad it was in awesome condition - Karl was beyond exceptional! Super professional!

0.description: We will shop her again because of the SERVICE! My friend was having  an issue with her new iPhone connecting with her Bose Wave system (the latter of which doesn't have bluetooth).  She had tried the the hard-wire way that worked with her other iPhone and it didn't work.  We dragged the Wave system , and the two people working there (didn't get their names, but a man and woman) wired up everything (with the same hardware) and it worked.  They were very gracious about it, and didn't laugh at us or the music on the iPhone ;0 I've shopped here previously, and will be back again, especially after this customer experience!

4.description: Kudos to Jose Floras, an employee at the Round Lake Radio Shack.  I needed a new charger for my bluetooth and Jose did his best to try and find me one that would fit.  Unfortunately, none of them did.  But, he went above and beyond.  He didn't stop there trying to help me.  He found me the charger on Amazon and printed the information off for me.  I have always shopped at this store and have found the employees to be courteous and helpful.  Sure, you might have to wait a little bit, but the wait is worth it.  You don't find customer service like this anymore.  Thank you, Jose, for being such a nice and helpful person.

3.description: wellchicken is very goodsidesflavour salsasgood porcions tostonesyucasaladbeansricemaduroscornfriesvegiesreal good chickenthe only thing is the staffslooow service is just one girl servingcome on ppl owners don't abuse have at lease 2 waitressand the batroom stink is like the sewer problems or somethingi like the locacion on belmont  is better........

1.description: Expecting great chicken but was disappointed. The chicken was very very bland. The rotisserie chicken at Costco is tastier and bigger.

0.description: I have always come to this location and it has always been consistent. The chicken is always cooked perfectly and the sides are always fresh. It does take a while to get your food but no minus star because the food is fresh and delicious. Service is quick and friendly.

2.description: ..been loving Mr.Pollo since the summer when I moved to Chicago. More usually I hit up the Belmont location (logan square) though; perhaps I'll stick to that. The food was delivered timely and the driver was very kind (it was a hellish cold that evening) as he called ahead to tell me he'd bring my food up to the door. Tell me why I ate 90% of my 1/4 chicken special before finding a stringy public hair in my rice... and then another one.
