(granted I was hunting)f*ck man.  some cultures worship the cow, others the duck; for me, don't f*ck with my pollo. and they done f*cked with my pollo!The Belmont location has been great though! yucca fries are just crispy enough, fries are super bomb, and the pollo is damn near delicious....all for like $7, really tho. "keep it 90's with those pubes fellas"-cham

5.description: I came here from a recommendation of a friend with my wife and i got to say thanks jesus you were right. Juicy tasty suckulient chicken. Served with big portions.and you get to pick your own side dishes. Very affordable prices for such big portions. Hot fresh good food. Very clean establishment and nice friendly people .Great place for groups,family,or a date. Great job guys i will be back & i 'll recommend this place.

6.description: I have been eating Mr pollo for over 10 years.  Staff is good owner cares about his business.  Great food.  The salsa and chicken are amazing

7.description: One of my favorite foods is chicken. So when I find a spot with good chicken I will definitely keep that menu handy and continuously come. I have no complaints so far about the food and the staff are nice and friendly. The food is ready pretty fast and the prices aren't too bad.

8.description: Great tostones (fried smashed plantains) and Yuca fries. Hands down best chicken too. Good service (Spanglish speaking) on the phone and in person. They DO deliver but it's so close to home, ain't no thang to park on Diversey street and pick it up.

9.description: This place is horrible chicken under cooked takes forever to get delivery and thats if your luck enough to get your order put thru for delivery as it seems no one here speaks english. Asked to speak to a manager and the lady kept hanging up on me. Then a guy answered and hung up on me, great customer service huh. Too bad cause i like the sweet plantains.

10.description: This place has the best chicken in the area!!! Hands down. They deliver which is a plus and if you go to the place service is always fast and friendly. I can't believe no one has yelped about Mr Pollo on Diversey. Great sides to go with your chicken and the caldo de pollo that they give you is always on point and it's free!!! My fav sides are the platano maduros and the rice and black beans!!! So if you don't know Now You Know!!!

4.description: Love their South American rotisserie chicken so juicy, with my favorites side order of fried sweet plantains, fried yuca,fried plantains

3.description: I just can't go back here.  This is closer than the vacuum repair place in Naperville, so I was too lazy to drive further and I paid for it.  Literally.  I took my vacuum in because it quit working.  I explained to the repair guy what I thought was wrong.  He had it for a week and I picked it up in a rush and took it home.  It was working, but only if I held it still.  Who vacuums like that?I took it back, explained the problem again and he assured it me he could fix it quickly.  I have 4 boys and some people would shudder at all the crumbs and junk on my floor.  It's summer and they just walk around eating!  Four days later I called to see if it was ready.  Someone else took the call, found my vacuum and said there was a note on it and he didn't know what it meant and I would have to call back later.At this point I was getting desperate and had to use the shop vac.   Not a good time.  I called again and the person who answered the phone was surprised that I hadn't been called to say it was ready.  The "quick fix" took a week.When I picked it up, someone else was there, gave me my vacuum and walked away.  No help with the door or getting it into my car.I'm all for supporting local businesses, but I need good customer service and it's not happening here.

1.description: Took in my Dyson vacuum due to my error.  I had the vacuum on the counter getting out the threads that had wrapped around the beater bar and I dropped it. It didn't work.  A small plastic piece attaching the filter had broken off and it didn't  suck.  I took it to Dupage Vacuum and like all the other reviews was given a "tour" of all the other high end vacuums they sell while telling me all they see are Dyson's.  I never heard of the German vacuums which were touted.  Well they checked out my vacuum and told me it was clogged, the filter would be cleaned.  $160.00 yes.  I go to pick it up and the filter on the front was just sitting on the vacuum.  They never repaired the broken piece.  I advised them of it and it took all of 5 minutes to fix.  Don't really know what they did but I can tell you this was one time I just know I was ripped off.  I'm sorry but $160 for a clogged vacuum.  Never again.

2.description: I went to vacuum my house to find out my vacuum was broken.  It was hissing and smoking with a foul odor.  Company was coming over so I needed the place clean.  I brought the vacuum into Dupage Vacuum without much hope for the vacuum.  Ryan showed me some vacuums but told me to give him a little to look it over. He called me back a few hours later and told me he could fix my vacuum and overnight the parts needed.  He really saved me.  It was good to see that they were a local store too.

5.description: I am always extremely happy with the service I receive from DuPage Vacuum.  Their knowledge and friendly demeanor make them my first and only choice to help keep my business (and my vacuums) running!As the owner of "Maid to Perfection" cleaning service I rely heavily on my equipment.  I have a lot of commercial grade vacuums that get a good workout every day.  Inevitably they break down.  Bruno and his crew always provide prompt, courteous and quality repairs.  I know others have commented on having to wait for parts.  Well I do too, but DuPage vacuum (or most any repair shop) can't possibly carry every part for every vacuum they repair.  Hey, even car repair shops usually have to order your parts!If you want good service, a friendly experience and fair prices, DuPage Vacuum is the place to go.

6.description: Du page Vacum has been nothing but the best. Any problem i have had they have fixed. They also cleaned some rugs that i had that were dirty and they did the best job! I am part of molly maids and i have to say, if we have any problems with our vacum we choose dupage vacum. Also if we cant get an stain out of our rug or carpet we go to dupage vacum. They are nothing but professional. Ligitament prices for repairs and carpet cleaning.

7.description: This store special ordered a hard-to-find vacuum bag for me. Very friendly and helpful.

0.description: I have a 30 year old Hoover upright which I brought in about a month ago. He advised that this particular model was a very well built model and suggested I not buy a new one (the sell all kind of new vacuums ). After thoroughly searching all his sources for required part since they weren't made anymore he went to an expert repair guy who suggested novel repair with a new part. It worked, the vacuum hums like it was new and I couldn't be more thankful and appreciative for going way beyond my highest expectations, all for the first stated nominal cost.  Got a vacuum to repair? Drive the extra miles and you'll be as happy as I was.

4.description: I own a carpet store on the north shore. We have always used Dupage vacuum for all of our vacuums. His prices are always competitive and we feel comfortable that we are getting the right vacuum for our needs. When we need a repair, the turnaround is quick and always done right. They go the extra mile like cleaning the machine before they return it. Nice, family owned business - you can tell they really care.

28.description: Excellent seafood place in the neighborhood. The shrimp is fresh and well seasoned. Get ready to get your hands dirty as you pull away the shell. Also ordered the whole octopus and it was cooked just right, seasoned in Nayarit sauce. The portions are good considering the prices. The service was spot on and the drinks are done right. Definitely will eat here again.

1.description: Needed to vacate my condo for a few hours, so decided to go on a lunch "adventure".  Love Mexican style seafood, so did the 35 minute drive from A'ville to Belmont-Cragin.  Once again, (most) Yelp reviewers were spot on with their comments.  La Costa was well worth the drive.I ordered Caldo Mixto, a seafood chowder (of sorts) with octopus, shrimp , fish & veggies.  The octopus, ( so frequently not properly cooked) was extremely tender.  In Mexico , fish soup is typically made with a lake/freshwater fish like carp or tender little "pescado blanco".  In Jalisco & Michoacan, I've had it with catfish.  Here in the US , most places use catfish. After checking with the chef, turns out that La Costa uses "Swai" .  I've never tried Swai, simply because when the Jewel sells it for $3.99 per pound, it struck me as a specie I might want to take a pass on.  Furthermore, its one of those aqua-cultured wonder fish like Basa & Tilapia that is farmed along polluted rivers in China & Vietnam.  (Not unlike many poultry farms here in the United States, these animals/fish are fed on corn or soy based diets, have less than optimal living conditions, and have usually received  antibiotics to stave off disease. ) But I'm not a hater.  I will readily admit that I've eaten my share of Perdue chickens, grain-fattened beef, and catfish farmed in a hole (dug in the ground) in rural Mississippi.The Swai was a tender , meaty whitefish.  Unlike the earthy flavor of a catfish, Swai didn't have a distinctive flavor.  The tomato / seafood broth was one of best I've had in Chicago.  It was redolent of shellfish flavor, and garnished with red & green peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, celery & chayote squash.  There was an ample amount of Swai, medium sized shrimp, and tender octopus.  It was served Nayarit-style, with toasted garlic bread.  While I didn't sample any other menu items, I watched the servers pass by with the stuffed pineapples ( mentioned by numerous Yelpers), platters of grilled & fried seafood, and numerous of the ubiquitous seafood cocktails.  Serving sizes at La Costa are very ample.  I'm coming back .

9.description: Came here today not too happy.  First they seat us by the restrooms.  Then we order margaritas to drink the worst ever tasted really watered down they used cheap Sauza Tequila you couldn't even taste it they don't use real fruit premade mix .  I had a shrimp cocktail no flavor what so ever, every other place I've ordered this from it was a red thick constancy the one here was really watery not enough tomatoe juice of ketchup.  I will never go back there again, nor do I recommend it.

29.description: The food was excellent and you get a ton of it! We could have easily shared one of the dinners. Loved the Nayarit sauce. It's very clean, nice atmosphere, decent parking.

23.description: I would genuinely give this a 3.5 and not a 3. For sure not a 4. This is an authentic Mexican seafood place and not bad for the neighborhood. I would have hoped for better communication on what we were eating like how spicy something was or wasn't. They brought out like 4 things with our chips and had no idea without trying what was what. Well the spicy was super spicy and kind of ruined the first 10 minutes of my meal. I would say this is a good place for kids. Very open and good options for kidsOur meals were good but not great. Priced between great and good but not sure my price matched my meal. I know we will for sure try again because we live in the area and want to support local businesses

5.description: Not bad ...not bad at all. Get the shrimp empandas, guac, and lime ceviche. I deducted a star cuz the margarita was sub par.

31.description: A hidden gem in the Cragin area. Who would of thought you could find great food, beautifully decorated restaurant, attentive staff, and live entertainment in your neighborhood.  The better part of downtown.  I gave it only 4 stars because, several drinks should not exceed the meal tap.  For Seafood eating that offers well seasoned, beautiful presentation, and fresh tasting food.

25.description: This place is new and stopped by because my friend has a DJ come in after 10 on weekends! Fid try the shrimp cocktail and it was good! So far i had micheladas and the make them pretty good :) also, been here for the DJ if u like batcahta and groupos banda, norteno, Mexican groups tho this will be ur spot. The place is nice and clean w modern feel, i have been here a few times already and its a nice il spot plus staff is nice!

12.description: Really good mariscos and the service was as good as it gets! Portions are a bit small for the price but still great tasting mariscos and the micheladas are fantastic!

37.description: This is the most amazing new restaurant!!! The place is beautiful, the food presentation is pretty much a work of art and the food is outstanding (And huge)! This is the perfect spot for a date night or girls night out. I will definitely be coming back often!!

21.description: Had an excellent experience. Went with 5 guys who are big eaters.. the portions were perfect. We ordered the plates for sharing.. Whole octopus, perfectly prepared with a spicy sauce. Langoustino with their signature nayarit sauce.. and a plate of octopus, shrimp and oysters in a spicy sauce.  service was excellent by Cecilia, never had to wait for beers .. buckets on the table full of cold ones.  The menu is extensive and all the preparations looked delicious. Complimentary ceviche and sizzling spicy salsas when seated at arrival. Nice decor and comfortable ambience.. If you are a fan of  mariscos with fresh and authentic preparation, do not hesitate to visit. We will return.

16.description: This place is awesome!!!!!!They have the good food... there camarones cucarachas are delicious and there langostinos!!!!!Great customer service... I would rather go here than Islas marias...  the concept is incredible

17.description: Roaches Roaches Roaches, there was three roaches in the tostada baskets, then our waitress just said it wasn't from the food it was from the table, this is the worst eating experience of my life, and I ate off the floor with my hands in Iraq. This place needs to be shut down.

10.description: Amazing experience!!! and the food Phenomenal,, nice ambience really loved the decoration, especially the boats in the roof.. we visiting the place after long day at work!! we start with shrimp empanadas and was soo good and the avocado on top make  a nice touch.. the only thing that maybe can be concern was about my stake was just little cold but the seasoning was perfect and pretty good portion of each dish. also I recommended the cheesecake is one of the best cheesecake I ever had!! nice place to spent time with family or friends!! sure come back again Don't forget to tried the ceviche on the beginning when you first sit down its sooo delicious!!!

11.description: Just opened and I could not be more impressed. Very fresh fish. The place is very modern yet classic inside. Lively music and a lively atmosphere makes you feel like you are in a Caribbean seaside. The soups are astounding!!! And the dinner plates are certainly large enough to share with another person. Heck, a better reason to bring more friends to dinner. For those people who pike to watch soccer on TV, there are many in the walls playing futból all the time. I'll gladly be returning here with many more people (more so I can try out more food).

26.description: This place is awesome!!!!!!They have the good food... there camarones cucarachas are delicious and there langostinos!!!!!Great customer service... I would rather go here than Islas marias...  the concept is incredible

27.description: Great food!!! Great service !!! Definitely will come back soon. Finally a great seafood restaurant in the north side.  Micheladas are  delicious too!!

35.description: Food and service were excellent everyone very attentive.  Live music available for right now my favorite New Mexican seafood place.

8.description: This place is a gem, the food is amazing.  I had the spicy octopus, it was delicious.  Everything else I saw looked great too, very unique dishes.  There is also a bar and they serve micheladas.  The only gripe I had was that the music was too loud.  I suppose it depends when you go, I'm sure they don't play loud music all the time.

0.description: This place has really amazing Mexican seafood. We came on a Friday and there was a little bit of a wait, so we sat by the bar, no wait. Greeted by the bartender Mari who was awesome and a really good server. We ordered both beer and a margarita but don't recommend the margarita, it comes pre made and I noticed the bartenders adding club soda or something to it- just stick to beer here. The bad margarita will not keep me away from this joint. We have oysters, grilled shrimp & skirt steak. The shrimp had this spicy red sauce that almost made me want to lick the plate. The steak was done to perfection, tender and tasteful. You should come here and grab some of the best Mexican seafood around.

38.description: Just opened and I could not be more impressed. Very fresh fish. The place is very modern yet classic inside. Lively music and a lively atmosphere makes you feel like you are in a Caribbean seaside. The soups are astounding!!! And the dinner plates are certainly large enough to share with another person. Heck, a better reason to bring more friends to dinner. For those people who pike to watch soccer on TV, there are many in the walls playing futból all the time. I'll gladly be returning here with many more people (more so I can try out more food).

20.description: Excellent experience... Food is amazing, we have been there 3 times this month!!! We have tried the Piña La Costa, Filete Perla, Caldo Siete Mares, Camarons en Molcajete, Coctel Vuelve La Vida, Pona Colada & the Margaritas!! All fantastic.... They also give you Ceviche when you first sit down. We went on a friday night and they had a Mariachi. We also went on a Saturday and they had a Norteno Group playing live music!!!Fantastic environment... You must try it out!

19.description: Amazing. The stuffed pineapple and langostinos... whoa.  I couldn't talk from the second my food arrived.  It was hypnotizing. Beyond delicious.

33.description: I love, love, love this place. I've been here a few times already. The food is AMAZING, The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. My GF and I are really picky with our michelada's and must say they are very good. The owners came out and introduced himself (Very nice people).We finished eating and started ordering drinks. We were there drinking and talking for about 4 hours. They didn't kick us out LOL! They even gave  us some free samples of their margaritas (very delish).I highly recommend this place and cannot wait to go back again.

2.description: From my last review, I've said I would come again to this wonderful restaurant and I did. Here this time came with my grandma and step-grandpa. They enjoyed their caldo mix with shrimp, octopus, etc. my grandma enjoyed her huachinango.

34.description: 4 stars.... Pretty attentive service food is pretty decent!! Hopefully they keep it up!

32.description: My husband and I tries this place and we thought the food was delicious! I had langostinos and my husband had red snapper. The food was presented beautifully and it was so juicy and a little spicy. I would eat this everyday if could!

18.description: This place is new and stopped by because my friend has a DJ come in after 10 on weekends! Fid try the shrimp cocktail and it was good! So far i had micheladas and the make them pretty good :) also, been here for the DJ if u like batcahta and groupos banda, norteno, Mexican groups tho this will be ur spot. The place is nice and clean w modern feel, i have been here a few times already and its a nice il spot plus staff is nice!

13.description: Excellent experience... Food is amazing, we have been there 3 times this month!!! We have tried the Piña La Costa, Filete Perla, Caldo Siete Mares, Camarons en Molcajete, Coctel Vuelve La Vida, Pona Colada & the Margaritas!! All fantastic.... They also give you Ceviche when you first sit down. We went on a friday night and they had a Mariachi. We also went on a Saturday and they had a Norteno Group playing live music!!!Fantastic environment... You must try it out!

4.description: I would genuinely give this a 3.5 and not a 3. For sure not a 4. This is an authentic Mexican seafood place and not bad for the neighborhood. I would have hoped for better communication on what we were eating like how spicy something was or wasn't. They brought out like 4 things with our chips and had no idea without trying what was what. Well the spicy was super spicy and kind of ruined the first 10 minutes of my meal. I would say this is a good place for kids. Very open and good options for kidsOur meals were good but not great. Priced between great and good but not sure my price matched my meal. I know we will for sure try again because we live in the area and want to support local businesses

24.description: Not bad ...not bad at all. Get the shrimp empandas, guac, and lime ceviche. I deducted a star cuz the margarita was sub par.

6.description: The seafood is delicious, and the service is very good. The portion sizes are gigantic, and you could likely share one plate between two people. I will definitely be going back!

22.description: Wow what can I say about this place. The atmosphere was great, and the waitress was awesome. The decor is pretty cool with the boats, and fish all around on the wall. The place is a great place to eat. I would highly recommend the shrimp that is wrapped in bacon. Omg it was awesome! Great place to eat I would love to try other sea food dishes of theirs. I will be back soon. Also met the owner and she was very nice to us.

15.description: Great ambiance, if you love the Mariachis, great place for live music. Food was reasonably priced and flavor was on the same page. Will go back for drinks and some good portion appetizers.

7.description: I went to this restaurant last night (Saturday night) about 9:30pm.  I checked out the reviews before going and everyone was raving about it.  For me the experience was just okay, I expected it to be better.  It was half empty, and lots of garbage on the floor.  There was live music and it wasn't very packed so I liked it.  You can't really have a conversation because it's so loud. there was a group having a birthday celebration and they were extremely loud. Standing up all around the tables, kids running around and screaming.  The food was just okay. I liked that the fries weren't hard as if they were reheated. I ordered momia camarones and they were very roasted.  They were so crunchy that I couldn't eat all of them. The food was brought to us in 5 minutes of ordering.  Making it obvious it wasn't cooked when ordered it was reheated food.  I drinked all of my soda and I had to ask the waitress to bring me another one. She didn't even check up on us if we needed anything. Overall the service could of been better. For those reasons I don't think I would go back.

36.description: Love this place.May I make a few suggestions? Paper towel rolls at the tables.Bigger plates. (As in the size of the actual plates not the amount of food portion)I will be coming back here. Great food and great margarita s

30.description: La Costa great food and excellent service.  Keep up the good work guys. Pescado zarandeado just great, charbroiled red snapper with lots of flavors. Highly recommended!!! Also camarones ala diabla mmmmmmm delicious.

3.description: Food was great first of all. My girlfriends came on a Saturday for the mariachi my friend recommended. None of us speak Spanish which was a challenge when I showed up w a reservation and the hostess just looked around and said no tables. We decided to wait at the bar and told the bartender what happened. She took care of us. We all ordered Effin cucumber and soda. They muddled the cucumber in the drink!  Best part!  We got a table quickly but after 8 there was a line.  Food was beautiful. They bring out the app with the fish and tostadas so an appetizer is not necessary.

14.description: Had an excellent experience. Went with 5 guys who are big eaters.. the portions were perfect. We ordered the plates for sharing.. Whole octopus, perfectly prepared with a spicy sauce. Langoustino with their signature nayarit sauce.. and a plate of octopus, shrimp and oysters in a spicy sauce.  service was excellent by Cecilia, never had to wait for beers .. buckets on the table full of cold ones.  The menu is extensive and all the preparations looked delicious. Complimentary ceviche and sizzling spicy salsas when seated at arrival. Nice decor and comfortable ambience.. If you are a fan of  mariscos with fresh and authentic preparation, do not hesitate to visit. We will return.

1.description: Best person here to see is Agnes, but she is only there on Sundays. The place is quiet and the prices are decent. They don't have a parking lot, so that can get a bit hectic on the weekends. The interior is very modern.

2.description: Been going to Mira's since before it moved a block west.  Usually have Ewa cut my hair but Edyta is also very good.  For the price, it's a great cuttery.  They only speak Polish fluently but take polite American customers as well.

0.description: My mom has been a client of this salon since for almost 20 years. I remember our salon outings when I was a little girl at their last location. Today I am all grown up, married, and I wouldn't think of going to another salon. Mrs. Ewa A. is the most wonderful stylist and human being. All of the ladies are very friendly, and they are true professionals!

29.description: Waiter service needs improvement, walked in no one attended me until 10 min after I sat down I used to go often back when it was a fast food restaurant a huge step back

42.description: I absolutely love the food! The delivery guy knows me lolI babysit a lit and have ordered from each house and no matter how far I am the food shows up fairly quick and its always hot!

23.description: what a disappointment this place has become since moving to the new location on belmont.  1st off, you better order well in advance for your food, otherwise your going to wait a significant time for your food because they are extremely slow. I ordered 2 jibaritos's and two alcapurrias 10 minutes before I got there and it still took almost 20 minutes to get my food. They also must have gotten rid of their old cooks, because the last few times I have been there, I have been very disappointed in the food they put out... time to find a new place for Puerto Rican food

47.description: First time at the new location (moved from Central and Belmont) took 10 mins for the waitress to take our order. The hostess isn't too concern as we made her aware we have been waiting a while she was busy chit chatting with the other guests I assume her friends.I hope the food tastes as great as I remembered but if not I don't think I'll be coming back here. SMH!Ok so the food was actually good!  But I had to get our waitress' attention to get more water.  We told the owner how poorly the serves are bringing their A game,  she apologized and gave us cheese cake as a complimentary.  Server also apologized.

8.description: I am right now writing this review at 7:36 pm and on the yelp site it says that borinquen is open until 9. We called about 5 minutes ago and they rudely told my mother that they were closing for the night. Seriously??? Maybe you should update your hours! On other occasions we have called and they barely have any food left. Even during lunch hours. Maybe the move wasn't for the best.I would not recommend coming here you're better off cooking the food yourself.

31.description: 1st time at this location. Location looks clean and spacious. Food was good and service good as well. My only observation would be to get a receipt with a detail of what it was consumed and the employees being a little bit more knowledgeable about Puerto Rican food. For eg I asked for a "Sandwich Boricua" which is in fact a"tripleta" with "bacalaito". They didn't had the bacalaito which is not a deal breaker for me really. The thing is the Waitress was going back to a "jibarito" which isn't was I wanted and she noticeable wasn't comfortable to answer some basic questions about Puerto Rican food. After all being said and done it's a place that I can come back to give them another try.

34.description: New location is definitely nicer and bigger but the food just doesn't taste the same when they were still on central & it's kind of expensive. For that I take the drive to La Bomba on Armitage and get my expectations exceeded.

16.description: This is my second time ordering for delivery and againg the first time took the 2 hours to get my food delivered and the second time one hour and a half.  Both times when I received my order my food was call, their excuse was that the delivery guy has other deliveries at the same time. If they are so busy, they should hire more delivery personnel. I order a mofongo and is the worse mofongo I ever had, it was tasteless and it looked like if they only smash the plantain and that's it. Won't be ordering ever again from this place.

13.description: Giving 1 star and doesn't even deserve that...tried giving them the benefit of the doubt since moved to this location...wow, was I wrong...needless to say, they open at 10am with nothing prepared by 11am...ARE YOU KIDDING...food for thought: maybe they should open thier doors when the food is actually ready to be sold...then you have to wait an extra hour for your food...Thanks but no thanks rather deal with less drama at the BOMBA...

11.description: Food is a better than ok (Jibaritos/Habichuelas/Arroz) ... They were better when they were at their Central Location. Went in a couple times.. Horrible restaurant management. Waited... Without even knowing where to wait. People were sitting for take outs... Waiters didn't even acknowledge any of the people waiting.. Just a hi... and bye... Eventually sat our selves. I ordered a drink after she brought water.. never got it the whole time I was there... Missed one set of utensils... Never went back...Ordered for delivery and they said it would be an hour wait... 0_0I said no tomatoes... and I got tomatoes... Giving it a two because I know their potential.If your closer to La Bomba... Go there.

39.description: ill just say the food is good here.....and they deliver...but...I found a dead roach in the bathroom..no Bueno...I wont be coming back...it is complete throw off....the place appears very clean but come on!!! I wont tolerate little critters lurking around my food n my kids

37.description: This place sucks BIG TIME!! I HATE HATE THIS PLACE! Can someone please tell me "how the hell do you go from a small place to a bigger one and your service suck?" I will NEVER give this place my money ever again. They were doable before they moved to this new location after that not sure what happened? First of all I called yesterday 5-24-15 and the phone rang for at least 2-3 minutes before she picked up then asked to put me on hold and that was another 3 minutes. She finally picked up and I placed my order for 2 steak sandwiches and a steak jibarito. At that time the clock said 2:07pm and she said it'd take 10-15 minutes. When I got to the restaurant it was empty besides two tables that were being occupied and i said "I was there to pick up my order." The guy (tattoos on neck) asked me my name and he couldn't find my ticket. He than walked to the back. He came back and said "my food wasn't ready." I asked him "how is my food not ready? It's 2:57pm and I placed my order at 2:07pm almost an hour ago and she said it would be ready in 10-15 minutes." He than proceeds to tell me that "the bistec was still cooking that'll it'll be another few minutes." So I left, he didn't even seem apologetic or try to credit me anything or offer anything for the inconvenience. I would not recommend this place and the owner needs to do something with all these reviews stating the same thing. He/she should be embarrassed. This place gets no stars from me. I only gave one cause yelp made me pick something.

0.description: Yes there are lots of complaints and mixed reviews on this place with good reasoning. I too have experienced waiting over 30 minutes for a simple order but I still say give them a shot. I also happen to think the less than desired service happens only at their busiest times on certain days, because today (Sunday around 2) my Father ordered 3 jibaritos (2 meat 1 veggie) with sides of rice and was out in about 15 minutes. Since I don't eat meat my order most always consists of a vegetarian jibarito and a side of rice. Instead of meat they prepare the veggie jibarito with sautéed peppers, tomatoes,onions, cheese and the rest of the ingredients.Even without the meat the jibarito is still flavorful and delicious. Since moving to a new location which is now more of formal sit down style, I think they just need to get a feel for this different type of dining. (They used to be more of a fast food restaurant) Hopefully they can get the service side together because the food isn't bad.

38.description: Came here for dinner with my family and have to say we were disappointed. Not all things were bad but here is what transpired. 1. The waitress tells us if anyone wants any steak of any kind, its a 45 minute wait.  There were pork dishes and chicken but no steak at all. This place is known for Jibarito sandwiches especially the steak jibarito. So sadly none of that. 2. I ordered the carne frita (fried pork medallions) and not a fan. Tough tough tough meat and dry to boot. 3. My brother ordered the mofongo (plantain ball filled with chicken) and that was dry as well.  I have had it before in Puerto Rico and LOVED it. Sadly not here, dry and the chicken broth they served it with still just get the mofongo an oily coating not a brothy taste to the mofongo. The service was slow as heck. I am ok on Island time just relaxing but it was pretty darn slow. I was the last to get my dish after the waitress wanted me to recap what I ordered so they could bring it out to me.  SO yeah, disappointed. However, the people were just so nice and kind. We were pretty loud laughing and having a good time with my family but just disappointed with the food. Will not be back. Other places to venture down Division for good Puerto Rican food.

51.description: Horrible service, we got there and a guy said to sit wherever we wanted, they brought the waters holding the cup from were you drink! Disgusting!! Server came after 5-10min and asked if we were ready to order, obviously not because nobody gave us a menu! Chicken was nasty, jibaritos too hard!...  Server brought us the check without us even asking for it and just said "for when you're ready"! Never again am I going back there!

27.description: The service was horrible and the food was little to be desired....we waited 40 - 45 mins for our food to begin with and the taste was not there ...the Puerto Rican rice was majorly bland no flavor at all...the papa rellena was a bit soft not quite fully cooked ...we wanted alcapurias and they were not available even though they were on the menu...there was no Friday special available at 7pm .... the waitress was not attentive at all our drinks came after our meal which was 40 - 45 mins late already and not what we had originally ordered...definitely a miss big time not coming back

32.description: This is my second time ordering for delivery and againg the first time took the 2 hours to get my food delivered and the second time one hour and a half.  Both times when I received my order my food was call, their excuse was that the delivery guy has other deliveries at the same time. If they are so busy, they should hire more delivery personnel. I order a mofongo and is the worse mofongo I ever had, it was tasteless and it looked like if they only smash the plantain and that's it. Won't be ordering ever again from this place.

54.description: I was a regular customer of this restaurant before they moved and I'm so glad they kept the great flavors but now they moved to a huge, updated restaurant and now I'll be a regular here aswell!! Casual fine dining and delicious!

48.description: Food is awesome, place needs some tweaks service could b better & lightning needs dimming.

44.description: I TRIED with this restaurant, I really did! The service here is HORRIBLE! They put you on hold for 20min & then when you come into the restaurant they ignore you! Take your business elsewhere because they obviously don't want it here

24.description: Every time I come here they are out of something. Such as bread, soda, alcapurria.  It's always something. They seem short staffed. You walk in trying to pick up an order you called in and no one seems to want to acknowledge you. Got better service at the location on Central. They might have bit off more than they can chew moving locations.

7.description: I've had jibaritos from borinquen when they used to have their old restaurant at an old run down Taco Bell on Central.  They've made it a lot fancier here now since it's more of a sit down.  As much as the service isn't a plus as everyone says, the food definitely makes up for it.  I've also gone to their other restaurant locations and the service is just about the same, but the food was still amazing. Give it a shot, but only if you can be patient with their service and know that you'll have some great Puerto Rican food.

49.description: In all fairness it has been a few months since my wife and I were at this location, it was probably a week after they moved to the new location. at the time the food was pretty good, not quite as good as I remembered from there old location but good none the less. The service however was worse than I have ever experienced. We literally saw our waitress 2 times, once when we ordered and then when, after what seemed like an eternity we were served our food., we waited 10 minutes after we were done before I decided to just go to the register and ask for the check. I remember at the old location there were no servers, it was basically a place order at counter and then come get it when it gets called out. I guess that the staff have no idea how to be servers. hopefully the service has gotten better since my last visit, since I no longer live in Chicago, I do not get to this area very often. I may take a chance in the future, but only when the reviews seem to get better. Good P.R. food is impossible to find where I live, so I hope that this place gets its act together.

40.description: We love their jabarito and kids love their pastallios. The rice and chicken is so soft delicious.

53.description: I've always loved my Borinquen, whether they are on Central or Belmont. I only worry that this location isn't as noticeable. The old location had huge murals all over the building that caught your eye, but it would be more difficult to find the new location unless you're specifically looking for it. Food is just as good, and can I get a YAY for having the salsa for my alcapurrias!!!! They forgot my alcapurria, but I went right back in, and they gave me two for my troubles.

30.description: I had to wait for 10 minutes for the hostess to come and take the order because the waitresses saw us but none of them took the initiative to come and help us while some other customers got there later and they were helped before us.   Still we had to wait for our order while the other customers were already eating.  Really bad service.  If it wasn't for Angel I would have had a worse time. I was literally at the point where I was going to leave before ordering. They need to step up their waitor service

46.description: Not sure if this is a usual, but they were extremely understaffed today. After waiting much longer than anticipated for my take-out order, I come home to find out that I don't even have cheese on my jibaritos and I was given the wrong soda. It's a bit frustrating to drive all the way home to notice this as I was already waiting for a long time observing the customers dining in, having their own disappointments with the service.

1.description: Good food when they HAVE IT! Lack of professionalism and service. Wouldn't go here ever again. Details: 1. Never have what I need in food. (Been here 5 times since the moves to give them a chance.) 2. Ghetto (having personal conversation, rants and cursing with family members and slamming stuff because there pissed) 3. Lack of communication from service. (Give me the opportunity to leave or stay because you don't have bread, butter, steak, chicken or rice. Don't wait after I waited 30 mins all together.) 4. Rug is dirty, we all see it. Clean it or remove it. 5. Greet, Smile do something. Let me know how long it's gonna take me to sit and eat whatever food you may provide for the day. 6. When ask for management information they had nothing to give me and supervisor on duty didn't even come to see what my concern was. This place needs to be CLOSED DOWN! Or needs training in business badly. Please stop representing Puerto Ricans so horribly.

9.description: New location is bigger and a bit nicer, but the steak jibaritos at the Western location tasted better. It was missing the addicting garlic taste that Western has. One side of it was even cold. It didn't come with as much rice either. They also don't carry diet soda. Service was just alright.

26.description: We enjoyed the food at the location on central but once they moved to Belmont Avenue the food has not been the same. The lechon has more fat on it and it is not as tasty. The Arroz con Gandules which we had yesterday was very bland and we had only a few Gandules in our portion. This has been a consistent  pattern and we will not be visiting this place no longer. This is a shame because we always enjoyed their food.

25.description: I always loved this restaurant when it was on Central. Went there Sundays after church . But I've recently had a very bad experience and I believe that their management now is sincerely unprofessional.Unfortunately you have to at least give it 1 star so it can let you give your review and that's the only reason I chose 1 star. We wanted them to cater our party because we loved their food. 1st wrong thing... Food was delivered late and they called @ 1:45 to say they were going to be 30 min late.2nd wrong thing..... The Lechon was extra greasy and the pastelillos were rubbery. The "manager" says well the Lechon does have grease. Really? It was so greasy I had to keep draining it. It was not good and my visitors kept saying are you sure this is from Borinquen? 3rd wrong thing..... When I talked to the so called "Manager" all she kept saying was "well we don't refund on catering orders maybe if you would have brought the food back we would have". Are you serious? What kind of management tells customers all I can do is apologize and not offer nothing in return?  We even tipped the driver in good faith. We shouldn't have tipped nothing because they were almost 45min late. All she kept saying is all I can do is apologize. When a manager knows they are wrong they should offer some kind of refund. I wasn't asking for half but at least something to show that you are a well managed business and that they don't want to lose any customers.  That's not how you treat unsatisfied customers. I spent almost $500 and she could do nothing for us. Well since they couldn't do anything for us the least I can do is let people know my horrible experience before anyone else wastes their money at this place.Please be aware that their management is unprofessional and badly managed.

12.description: Stopped in today because my husband wanted the shrimp soup, it took about 15 mins for someone to come take our order, once the waitress came over, I ordered the chicken jibarito, she stated that would take 45 mins so I was gonna order something else since my husband really wanted their shrimp soup. He orders it & she says the shrimp soup is gonna take 30 mins or so?? Really? Instead of giving us menus they should've just told us what was available!!! We walked out, I see things haven't changed.

21.description: Service was terrible..I order alcapurria, papa rellena, and sweet plantain. The waitress told me once she brought our food that they didn't have alcapurria, and if I wanted something else.. She could've at least told me before hand they didn't have any. Our sweet plantain was terrible not sweet and very dry. I  then asked her for a take out box and she totally forgot. So I had to go up there and ask for it myself while she was having a conversation  with another waitress. I think I won't give this place a second chance.

17.description: Delicious Puerto Rican Food, friendly service. Can call ahead for fast take out.Just like mothers home cooking . Must go you'll enjoy

10.description: Please don't order from here for delivery. It takes about 2 hours to receive your food and the people who work here are horribly rude.

5.description: This place has been around for decades starting on California avenue and on central ave but after the recession they sold off assets, restructured and ended up on Belmont and Laramie. They have been serving fresh,hot,tasty authentic Puerto Rican cuisine for at least 20 years and yes as time goes by your bound to lots of changes both front and back of house.But their food is always on point. If you can over look perhaps a long wait and focus on the food I believe they would have 5 stars always. I truly believe they will get it together soon. Its been less than a year since opening this new location.I wish them all the luck because their really isn't many great institutional Puerto Rican restaurant anymore like this one.

3.description: Food here is decent. I have great friends that are Puerto Rican so I know my PR food lol. The steak sandwich was ok but could have used more steak...  The rice and beans could use some more serious flavors. The garlic sauce for the jibaritos and tostones are decent but it can't beat the home made kind you fine in a grandmas house in PR. This place will cure a craving so it does its job.

35.description: New location is bigger and a bit nicer, but the steak jibaritos at the Western location tasted better. It was missing the addicting garlic taste that Western has. One side of it was even cold. It didn't come with as much rice either. They also don't carry diet soda. Service was just alright.

19.description: First time at the new location (moved from Central and Belmont) took 10 mins for the waitress to take our order. The hostess isn't too concern as we made her aware we have been waiting a while she was busy chit chatting with the other guests I assume her friends.I hope the food tastes as great as I remembered but if not I don't think I'll be coming back here. SMH!Ok so the food was actually good!  But I had to get our waitress' attention to get more water.  We told the owner how poorly the serves are bringing their A game,  she apologized and gave us cheese cake as a complimentary.  Server also apologized.

28.description: Our rehearsal luncheon was a success!!!Thank you Boriquen Resturant!!Look forward to next time.

45.description: I give Borinquen restaurant on Belmont  4 stars, their food is amazing the servers are awesome, not the mention the new location better than the old one, jibaritos are my favorite and there is no other place in Chicago were they make them better.

33.description: Ok place to go if you're craving P.R. food. But beware for delivery coz it seems like it takes them years to get you your food! Still... the food is ok. It was better before, idk what happened? Hopefully they get back into shape and start making the food amazing again.

43.description: I came here with my friend and he ordered the special of the day which they did not have ready (it was lunchtime already). He then ordered a CoCo Rico drink and the waitress brought it 10 min later.  Our cups of water never got filled and we never got checked up on after we received the food.  We got sat down by the speakers which was playing some music (nothing wrong with that) but I asked if she could turn it down a little so I can actually have a conversation with my friend without yelling. She turned it down but halfway through our eating, she comes back and turns right up again and just walks away. The food is hit or miss. When its good it's really good but sometimes it's a gamble. The service is horrible. I don't understand how the owner doesn't see it. These servers don't have a clue about customer service and If the owner doesn't do anything about it, then I can't imagine this place lasting much longer.

2.description: Worst service possible! !!!!!!And it was only for carryout.... If you don't have it together for carry out why would I dine in.I waited for 36 minutes,  36 minutes for an order of the most basic things they should already have. I asked for 2 relleno de papa 2 alcapurrias and 2 pastelillos oh and a small Arroz con gandules. First they wait 30 min to tell me they are all out of the rice then I see the 6 people that came after me leaving with their orders of from what I overheard much more elaborate dishes. Then when I finally get my food I get home and see the gave me what they wanted!!!!!4 relleno de papa and 4 alcapurrias,  basically just to get me out of their face because I was notably upset.  On top of that they didn't even have any meat in them or hardly for that matter. NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME , GO TO THE HOOD AND GET SOME REAL PUERTO RICAN FOOD THIS PLACE IS A JOKE!!!!!

18.description: 10/5/15 7:45pm , Ordered for delivery and might i say what an awesome experience it was. The ordering process was fast any easy. customer service was 6 stars out of 5.  Thank you being well mannered. Best of luck Borinquen.

41.description: Delicious Puerto Rican Food, friendly service. Can call ahead for fast take out.Just like mothers home cooking . Must go you'll enjoy

52.description: The customer service sucks, waiting to order and the waitresses just dancing, waited for a few minutes before leaving to another restaurant! The food is good I think since I have been there before it is just the customer service!! How they survive like that is beyond me

50.description: The only reason I gave them 2 stars was because our waitress was very very nice. Oh man. On the day we came in it was around 3 pm on a Tuesday afternoon. We asked for an order of pastelillos and they had none.  Ok. So instead we ordered alcapurrias and bacaladitos. I asked the waitress to please bring hot sauce. Which if you have been here before, you know they make their own, anyway she said they didn't have any.  Again ok. I then ordered a jibarito de lechon, I was told they didn't have any lechon!  How is that possible?!?!?!  That was the only reason I even came to this place. So instead I asked for the jibarito de bistec.  I asked for garlic on the mayo side of the sandwich.   Normally I love their jibaritos. This time not so much. The platano was so over fried it was hard and very crunchy when it arrived. It also had no garlic, like I asked.   There was however a ton of mayo instead.   I just didn't enjoy the food. Nothing was like it was when they were over on Central. I hope that this was just a fluke. I'm going to come back to see it the food improves. I don't want to give up on this place it was a favorite of mine.

4.description: I love the food at Borinquen! It is always delicious and made great! The service is 50/50, but still I am never disappointed

6.description: Came here for dinner with my family and have to say we were disappointed. Not all things were bad but here is what transpired. 1. The waitress tells us if anyone wants any steak of any kind, its a 45 minute wait.  There were pork dishes and chicken but no steak at all. This place is known for Jibarito sandwiches especially the steak jibarito. So sadly none of that. 2. I ordered the carne frita (fried pork medallions) and not a fan. Tough tough tough meat and dry to boot. 3. My brother ordered the mofongo (plantain ball filled with chicken) and that was dry as well.  I have had it before in Puerto Rico and LOVED it. Sadly not here, dry and the chicken broth they served it with still just get the mofongo an oily coating not a brothy taste to the mofongo. The service was slow as heck. I am ok on Island time just relaxing but it was pretty darn slow. I was the last to get my dish after the waitress wanted me to recap what I ordered so they could bring it out to me.  SO yeah, disappointed. However, the people were just so nice and kind. We were pretty loud laughing and having a good time with my family but just disappointed with the food. Will not be back. Other places to venture down Division for good Puerto Rican food.

22.description: The wait for take out was beyond ridiculous 3 alcippurias n a steak n onion dinner was an hr wait and the place was empty with two other family's waiting on a slow Wednesday evening I am to the point of just driving to the hood to get served properly because the convenience I thought I had is not very convenient after the ridiculous wait no apology from the employee or an extra free alcupurria for the wait nothing I might have to call the night before so the order can be ready in a timely matter  this place is a joke

15.description: Jibaritos used to be good. They have lost their touch. The jibarito I bought today came with no lettuce and no tomato with minimal mayo when I clearly said I wanted it with everything when I was asked. The arroz con gandules was similar to any Mexican yellow rice with little to no gandules. This was the worst service I received from this place.

20.description: I wish I could give this place no stars. I was a walk in and ordered 3 alcapurrias and 1 relleno de papa to go, a very simple order. They said it would be 10min. 20 min later I asked where my food was and they said they were making fresh alcapurrias. That shouldn't take more than 10 min. You stuff them and fry them, that's it, I make them at home all of the time. 30 min later I asked about the food and they said "sorry waiting for the alcapurrias still." I wanted to walk out but I had already paid, I was starving, and I figure how much longer could it possibly be. Finally after 45 min I received my order. The lady apologized and told me since I waited she put an extra alcapurria in the bag for me. I was very upset but I said thank you anyway and walked. I get home, open the bag, and THERE IS NO EXTRA ALCAPURRIA!!!! She lied right to my face. I love Puerto Rican food but will never step foot in this place again. From one Puerto Rican to another, this place really let me down and made our culture look bad.

36.description: This place needs more than good food, it needs people that want to work and customer service on the phone and in person. Being on island time is not a good thing slow service bad service and the food isn't that great bad attitudes,in a nutshell would not recommend this place.

14.description: Absolutely one of the best jibarito I have tasted. They seasoned the meat really good. Really good service. I would definitely recommend going there if you want good Puert rican food.

3.description: Ordered a pizza online got an email saying 30-40 minutes. I let 50 minutes pass then I call. The guy confirms my address and says its leaving now it will be there in 5. Let's say when he says 5 he means 15. Never again.

1.description: What the..??I should've checked yelp first.Ordered at 6:55pm on a Monday (today). Was finally delivered at 8:11pm.Called after 50 mins (was giving him the benefit of the doubt...) and guy on the phone was nice. Said it'd be 3-6min. Ok...11 min later and guy's finally here.Hesitantly open pizza box to see the sauces SMUSHED into the cheese sticks. See pics. Yeah um this is disgusting. Never again.

2.description: Got a call from the manager of Papa John's today. I explained my situation and he was very understanding and told me that I should have gotten a replacement pizza that day, and he's going to inform his staff of the correct Papa John's policy about wrong orders. He credited a replacement pizza to my account and apologized. I am glad we got to resolve this issue and how courteous he was! Hope his attitude can rub off on his associates!

5.description: Ordered a pizza online at 6.40pm. Got an email saying 30-40 minutes. Called after an hour to inquire and was told 10 more minutes. It came 20 minutes later. That's 80 minutes. Pizza was not warm enough to call lukewarm. It was edible. Won't be using them again.

6.description: I don't know what happened to this location. Quality dropped and when they say your pizza will be ready in 20 minutes, what they really mean is an hour 10 minutes. Yeah. Ordered through the app, allowed 30 minutes and STILL ended up waiting 40 minutes in store. I don't know what's going on here. But they need to fix it immediately.

7.description: Great customer service! Called to attempt to cancel my online order, couldn't do it because the gentleman who answered the phone was TOO sweet! (I felt bad for ordering delivery 20mins before close, reassured me it wasn't a problem at all)

8.description: The "manager of the store" had no clue about a yelp deal. Also, the specials are sometimes a better deal than this deal. And Papa Johns pizza tastes worse than Dominoes and Pizza Hut

9.description: In our first time ever ordering from Papa John's online, we came away with the impression that we should never order again from Papa John's online.We place our order at 6:50.  We finally received the order at 8:10, after being told 30-40 minutes.  A call to the restaurant around 7:30 yielded a terse "He was backed up and just leaving" statement, along with the assurance we were getting a free 2-liter.  OK, how bout just my pizza on-time instead.  The driver got there, and was just standing on the street.  I had to walk down three flights of stairs and meet him at our door.  To add insult to injury, the pizza was kind of warm, not anywhere closet to hot.

0.description: This place is Amazing. I ordered online and accidentally put anchovies on my Pizza so when it arrived I was like OmG i dont want this. The manager made me a new one with no problem.We LOVE the Breadsticks and My Kids LOVE this Pizza!! They always deliver within 30 minutes to my house and the Pizza is ALWAYS Hot. And their Chocolate Chip cookie pizza is soooooo good. We put Vanilla Ice Cream on top. I know its not Gino's East but they have decent Pizza at e great price!!! They have great deals if you use the Papa John's App :)

4.description: LOWER GRADE INGREDIENTS, LOWER GRADE PIZZA, PAPA JOHNS!There are so many good local pizza places in the are, I don't know why I gave this a shot. Pizza was so greasy, you'd think they dump 2 cups of oil in the pan to start the process (probably do). The crust is so dull and lifeless, it really puts the nail in their coffin.

0.description: Nice !!!!!!!!!! Had a Great Time , Good People , Good Drinks , Clean  , Fun Mixed crowd of Blue collar folks . Good Pours . Bouncer was decent too !

3.description: The food was fantastic. The service was great. And all the food came out fresh. Definitely a great spot for a nice family dinner.

1.description: The best pupusas and Atole de Elote around ! A must to try if you haven't .  The place looks small from the outside but quite spacious and clean. The service is good and the waitresses are very friendly. Prices are very reasonable also. All good reasons to want to come back.

0.description: I'm gonna have to say that this place is the best salvadoran food I've eaten here in Chicago. The pupusas were well stuffed. The tamales were delicious. Horchata was authentic. Can't wait to try everything else. The service was good too.

2.description: Don't expect to get a slim and small pupusa here. They're quite plump and large. The chorizo, frijole and loroco are the best I've tried. I also a ordered the corn atole, super tasty. The price for food items is really inexpensive and the service is nice. I like the family run atmosphere and the lively music. Now if only this place were BYOB...excellent authentic food, I'll be back :)

5.description: I've never had food from El Salvador so I didn't want to miss this opportunity to try it. I ordered the chorizo pupusa and a chicken tamale. Amazing!! The tamale was wrapped in a banana leaf (I think) and was super moist. The chorizo pupusa was delicious! The condiments included a spicy and non-spicy salsa and a type of cabbage salad that had a simple, almost bland dressing on it. I loved the spicy salsa! And, the cabbage salad added a nice crunchy texture to the food. Highly recommend this place!

6.description: My favorite spot for Atole de Elote & pupusas!

7.description: The pupusas are so tasty, and the pickled salad and salsa that go with them are the perfect complement.

8.description: The food is delicious if you looking for pupusas this is a great place to go. I tried the yuca as well and the pescado frito and it was all great food. This is a great option if you looking to eat good food. The people in the restaurant are friendly and very nice. Prices are good and I definitely recommend this place.

9.description: Dios Mio! This place is amazing! There popusas are very close to the ones you can have in many parts of central america. I am guatemalan and hondurian and approve this place. There popusa loca is a must! Its not the nicest restaurant in the world but they have very good food, my parents love this place.They also have very tropical drinks like maranon, maracuya, nuece, horchata, tamarindo etc...

10.description: I see so many signs for 'Pupusa' and 'Pupuseria' in my old neighborhood. I used to giggle at the name because I had no idea what it was-pupusa-hahaha! The other day our gym had a member appreciation day, and so of course right after my workout I headed over to the table that had probably the most unhealthy food-pizza, fried rice, and then another tray of what looked like arepas-which I have had before (basically thick white corn tortillas with a filling). I looked at the menu in front and saw that these were indeed 'pupusas'. These were filled with cheese and had a spicy salsa to go along with them-absolutely delicious. I didn't feel as guilty eating them as I would have if I would have chosen that BBQ chicken pizza. I also noticed the menu (which was in Spanish and English) had an address in my old neighborhood. I think I will be heading back there to try more of these now not-so-mysterious pupusas (still makes me laugh-hahaha! I can't help it).

4.description: Best pupusas and Salvadorian food in Chicago. Enough said.

1.description: I was recommended to try the place by a food group on facebook & I was disappointed. The service was fast & friendly, but the food was not good. We ordered regular sized shrimp 2lbs. I gave them away!!!!! The food was fresh & hot,  but lacked flavor. Needless to say I won't be returning.

9.description: Sometimes I crave fried oysters, jumbo shrimp and clam strips and playing Ms. PAC-MAN: i.e. Sometimes I crave this place!Don't expect much in ambiance; it's all to go and all fried but it's good. They do accept credit cards but bring your id, and don't forget your quarters to play some old school video games while you wait.

23.description: Strictly a take-out place, corner of Grand and Long.  Very informal neighborhood type of place.  Couldn't eat in if you wanted, because there are no tables, though there is a pin ball machine to play while you wait.  Not sure how long it's been there, although I can remember a fish/seafood take-out place being here from when I was a kid, but I don't know if its changed hands, how many times its changed hands, etc. You can order shrimp, various types of fish,scallops or oysters, and even frog legs, everything breaded and deep fried.   I sampled the regular-sized shrimp, smelt, and cod.  All were good, though a few of the shrimp seemed a tad tough.  The smelt  were fine and dandy, and the cod was very good.  They also serve various sides, and you can get soda to drink.  Their house sauce that comes with the orders struck me as a blend of a very vinegary hot sauce and mustard, not much depth to it.  Its not bad seeing as its free, but I'd suggest having a bottle of your own cocktail sauce or tarter sauce on hand.

12.description: Classic takeout style fried seafood joint here. It's the only seafood place where I refuse to call ahead, reason being they have Ms. Pacman and Galaga arcades for a quarter as well as classic Simpsons pinball for 50 cents. So I look forward to the nostalgic entertainment while waiting for my usual jumbo shrimp and fried scallops. The jumbo shrimp is very good quality, the closest i've found to my fav place Goose Island. And the Scallops are good as well, and reasonably priced at $10 a pound. And also hush puppies, an order of 10 for a $1.25......awesomeness. So when I wanna get a competitive game of Ms.Pacman on and satisfy my seafood itch, this little gem definitely fits the bill.

21.description: i found this place on my way to el burrito amigo. (which has my fave tacos al pastor in town) anyways, i've been on a fried schrimp kick lately and thought i could make some room for some schrimps too. they were fresh and fleshy little buggers fer sure but i thought the breading was too bready-too thick. i really liked the vinegary/mustardy and strangely orange hot sauce. never had that kind before!the macaroni salad was great. lots of black pepper. if i lived in the hood i would likely order from grand ave quite a bit. good people at the counter, good prices and good food. they also have many other fishys/crustaceans on the menu so they may do other kinds more to my liking.i still think Franks on Addsion is the best i've had.the search goes on.

16.description: This is where I buy my 1 pound of regular shrimp! Great mom and pop shop. Order ready in 10-15min if you call ahead. Love it.

17.description: I picked up a large order of food here after my dad (who used to fish in Puerto Rico when he was a boy) kept insisting on how good it was. This place is very good! First off, they have a pretty good selection on the menu. My order included jumbo shrimp, cod, catfish, oysters, potato salad, macaroni salad, coleslaw and fries. After I ordered everything and was waiting around, I wish I would have tried other things like buffalo jumbo shrimp and crab cakes... etc. But I will have to try it next time.All the sides were awesome! They are individual sized but if you get a bunch of everything, you can share them. The catfish was a bit salty, but I had never eaten catfish, so I don't know if it's supposed to be like that. The cod was good! The jumbo shrimp I liked and could only eat 3... oof! I didn't try the oysters... Overall, it was great. The shrimp was a bit tough, I guess... but I liked it just fine. All in all, I split all the food with my mom, dad and roommate. We all were stuffed and there was food left over. All that for $26??? Where else could you have seafood for that price? It's great.There is diagonal parking right out front. They take cash and credit cards with proper ID. The people were nice. Small place, etc. etc.Closed on Mondays. I had looked online before and some site said Sundays... Can't believe everything you read :)

10.description: I ordered 1.5 lbs of jumbo shrimp @ $14 per lb. the hot sauce taste like the one at goose island and the shrimp were fantastic. Good find near my home as we just moved out this way. I am definitely going back whenever I get a taste for shrimp.

5.description: Good food at a good price,carry out only.Shrimp scallops and a really good selection of fish. 1# 3/4 # or 1/2 #.they also have dinners.

11.description: I here it's great but why do I have to wait till 5 to get some buffalo shrimp when there short staff now and probably short staff at 5 and the lady on the phone is really rude. Guess I won't be going there.

22.description: I picked up a large order of food here after my dad (who used to fish in Puerto Rico when he was a boy) kept insisting on how good it was. This place is very good! First off, they have a pretty good selection on the menu. My order included jumbo shrimp, cod, catfish, oysters, potato salad, macaroni salad, coleslaw and fries. After I ordered everything and was waiting around, I wish I would have tried other things like buffalo jumbo shrimp and crab cakes... etc. But I will have to try it next time.All the sides were awesome! They are individual sized but if you get a bunch of everything, you can share them. The catfish was a bit salty, but I had never eaten catfish, so I don't know if it's supposed to be like that. The cod was good! The jumbo shrimp I liked and could only eat 3... oof! I didn't try the oysters... Overall, it was great. The shrimp was a bit tough, I guess... but I liked it just fine. All in all, I split all the food with my mom, dad and roommate. We all were stuffed and there was food left over. All that for $26??? Where else could you have seafood for that price? It's great.There is diagonal parking right out front. They take cash and credit cards with proper ID. The people were nice. Small place, etc. etc.Closed on Mondays. I had looked online before and some site said Sundays... Can't believe everything you read :)

0.description: Why in the world would Yelp leave a review of a restaurant from 6,7 or even eight years ago.  Its ridicules Get your shit together Yelp.  Maybe we should start reviewing you.

20.description: Shrimp.... Shrimp... Shrimp..... WOW... there isn't much more to say but this is the place to go..... Great people.. but even better food.... for this type of food it is all in the batter and let me tell you there isn't a better batter in the state....a small corner place with HUGE taste.. you will go back once you try it.... I drive for over an hour to eat the food here and so will you !!!!!!!!!!

19.description: A pound of regular shrimp is $10.98 (with tax)...get extra sauce (.22¢) because you will need it (the shrimp are not itty bitty). I go here at least 2 times a week. Best in chicago! Make sure you try the house sauce!

2.description: Personally I think Grand Ave Shrimp and Goose Island Shrimp are the best take out shrimp joints in the city.  It's the same recipe.  I always get a small order of fried clams and a pound of jumbo.  Always always always pay the extra and get the special shrimp sauce.  They call it the Grand Sauce here.  It's just that much better.  Large soda pop selection and sometimes they have these great butter cookies.  Yum.Be prepared.  The breading is thick.  Some save too thick.  But that is the deal with this place.  Their signature.  Service is typical of a take out place so exercise some patience.  It adds to the flavor.Park on the side.  Not on Grand Ave.

18.description: I'm a huge shrimp fan and grew up in New Orleans, so I tried the shrimp from this place. I was eager, but was quickly let down. Don't get me wrong, the shrimp are indeed big but there's also a thick batter covering them. I prefer my shrimp lightly breaded instead of eating so much batter. If that's ok with you, then you'll be happy. I'll continue my search for good shrimp in Chicago.

13.description: Very bad service on the phone about a month ago. African american man with a very bad attitude. Called back to cancel my order.  Shame because I really like this place normally. Dont need someone with a crappy attitude handling my food

4.description: I grew up in Chicago, but now live in Arizona.  The first place I hit when in town is Grand Avenue Shrimp house.  It is unbelievably wonderful, this is my happy place.  Also, everyone is so incredibly anxious to please, if I crave something special they bend over backwards to fix me up.  I must also mention, I  love, love, love the coleslaw.The next very best thing is the coconut cake, soooooo yummy.

6.description: Better than average on most of the items as far as price. The food is great! Good people as well

15.description: I went here over a year ago for the first time with my Father who ironically like the last poster is Puerto Rican.  He was in from PR and we were just bumbing around visiting family and friends.  As we were driving around he said let's go to this great Shrimp house, so I obliged him.  We got two pounds of shrimp, some hot sauce and two sodas.  We went and sat in Riis park and ate the shrimp.One word:  ExcellentI had never had shrimp battered the way they did it, I even now have a hard time explaining it.  It is not a typical batter, it is more like a true "breading".  The shrimp themselves were very large and cooked well.I now will stop and get food for clients and friends here to show them one of the little hidden gems not everyone knows about.  The place is small, but everyone is very nice and everything is consistent.

7.description: Oh I am so spoiled by Redhots, the shrimp here at Grand is big but you can't really taste it with the gummy overly thick breading that crushed my craving for shrimp.  If you want other fish, this an okay spot.  Fries OK to yuck.

8.description: I always order a pound of jumbo every time I'm there. There mild sauce is my favorite! One of the best shrimp houses I've been to.

3.description: This is a great place to grab fresh shrimp if you love lots of breading. If not, you may be disappointed.

14.description: I finally decided to try this spot after driving by several times, but I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon. The food is kind of pricey for what you get and the flavor was lacking. I had the catfish nuggets and when I went, they weren't serving certain menu items because of Lent, so that was a hassle. My friend had 1/4lb of fried shrimp and it was just ok. There was a LOT of batter on them and they had no distinct taste, in fact they were very bland. I really wanted to like this place, as I am a fan of JJ Fish and other establishments that pride themselves on their fried food, but this place just didn't cut it for me. For around $10 spent, my friend and I were both still hungry and left unsatisfied. Perhaps I will give them another shot, but no time soon.

3.description: I'm torn between rating this one a 4 star review weighing heavily on the very friendly service I received and a 3 star rating based on the food flavors.  Ultimately as you can see I went with weighing more heavily on the food flavors since food is the main reason to try a restaurant.First off though I want to give kudos to the very friendly manager who served me at lunch today.  She never once seemed peturbed that I didn't have a clue what I wanted and was very friendly when answering my questions.Yeah, we should be able to expect that kind of treatment everyplace, but as we all know sadly customer service is lacking terribly in a a lot of businesses.  Thankfully this young lady provided good old fashioned friendly customer service.As far as the food flavors go it was a bit of a roller coaster ride.  I did find the roast chicken to be fairly greasey and would have appreciated more seasoning on it.  I realize that a lot of customers may be on low or no sodium diets, but realistically if they're eating fast food they probably aren't overly cautious of what they eat.  Just a little salt would have been a huge improvement.  Yes, there may have been some on the tables, but I had my meal to go so maybe on to go orders they could automatically throw in a packet of salt on every order since it is pretty cheap.  Since I started out with a negative comment on the food I'll continue on that line and then end with what I felt where the high points of my meal.  For sides I had mashed potatoes and gravy and also the macaroni and cheese.  I found both of these to be almost bland.  Again on the potatoes some salt really would have given them a big boost in flavor (and I'm not the type to add salt to food most times).  As for the mac and cheese it really needs to have a cheesier flavor to it.Now the positive to finish the food review.  I really enjoyed the chicken strip and the chicken bites.  They were both very tasty and not the least bit greasey which I appreciated.  I also had their honey mustard dipping sauce for the chicken strip and bites and it was great.  One very pleasant surprise was that I normally can't stand fast food biscuits, but I found myself eating the entire biscuit so my hats off to KFC on that accomplishment.Overall it was a good meal and now I know what I like there and what I'm better off avoiding so my next visit will be even more satisfying.  Stop in and give it a try and it's entirely possible that you may find their flavors to be better than my take on them.  Thanks for the friendly service!

1.description: Let`s start from the customer service - the best! The cashier was so nice and charming, smiled all the time and even served my potato wedges on the table , cause i forgot them :D The best potato wedges so far! The chicken was okey, the sides - yammy ( cow slow and smashed potato). Definitely will visit again =]

2.description: Worst KFC . I ordered fries and chicken bites.Their food is always mushy and warm not really hot. The inside looks like it was from 1986. Bad customer service waited too long for an order!Bad customer service waited too long for an order!

5.description: Mash!Friendly quick service...and close to my job whenever I get my mash craving! and mac and cheese!If only reviewing about the sides...I love them...KFC chicken not so much...too greasy!But again I do suggest mash and mac and cheese above all on menu!

0.description: I do like it here, sometimes I get bored on other places and come here instead. Like the name says, they serve crispy tasty fried chicken in this place. Love my wings to be very crispy that is why I come here. Nothing beats that crispy good tasting wings at KFC.

4.description: This place blows!! On two different occasions, placed an order through the drive thru, and both times they were "out of chicken". SMH!!! This is KFC how does this happen? Poor management I think. Never again, not that location.

0.description: Sadly this place is closed now. I was able to have my birthday dinner from there and then a few weeks later the line was disconnected and the windows papered over. This is a real loss in the neighborhood. R.I.P. C.C.- - -Champion Chicken just opened and i couldn't be happier. The Belmont Cragin area lacks a variety of "good-for-you" foods so its recent opening is a welcome one.Champion Chicken is deliciously seasoned (probably marinated too) char broiled chicken. If you are familiar with YaYa's Chicken, that will get you close to the taste. I believe the style is greek and most meals are served with pita bread. They also serve burgers, gyros, and hot dogs, but i haven't tried those yet. So far, the chicken has been great. It is also good to know that since it is grilled (right there in the store), it is a healthy choice. In addition to being really tasty, it is also a great value. You can get a whole chicken w/ 2 sides for $9. That is a meal for 2 for less than $10!Good stuff.

3.description: Great hole in the wall , they have this great mexican concept  that you can add anything to anything , but I like the vampiros as for my wife she loves the yogurts.  Try this little place. Highly recommended.
