1.description: Drove super far from the Noble Square/Ukraknian Village area to try this paleteria and was pleased. I tried the pinguino (mango sorbet, chile, chamoy and mango), very delicious. My hubby had the yogurt de fresa with bananas and strawberries, and granola and he was very pleased. My little man tried a mini paleta (yes, mini! ... The less mess the better) de arroz con leche and was happy! I took a paleta de nanche, de limon, & fresa to go. I will def return when I'm in the neighborhood.

2.description: Everything I've had from here is good. The mamey ice cream reminds me of living back in Mexico. The cookies and cream paleta satisfies the little fat kid in me. And the fruit cocktails make me smile right away. Great for the up coming summer!! But yes, be prepared to wait and remember-- patience is a virtue. Don't be rude to the ladies! They're working as hard and fast as they can and the complaining doesn't make it faster!

0.description: I didn't know that there were so many combinations for ice cream and yogurts, but this place is conquering that concept. Personally, I love the yogurt with fresh fruit (grapes, bananas, strawberries, guava, & apples) you get 3 toppings added (I get granola, oatmeal, and dried shredded coconut) anything additional is an additional charge. My mom got the gazpacho estilo Morelia, it seemed like a weird concoction of fruits, onions, hot sauce, orange juice, and queso fresco.... I know I gagged at that thought, but she swears it's awesome. My kiddo got a Mexican chocolate popsicle (paleta) and loved it.  I tried the vampiro, I didn't like it. It's basically mango ice cream with that red hot spice, so it's got that sweet and spicy mix. I'll stick to the yogurt and paletas thank you.

4.description: This place is absolutely heaven on earth! My husband and I go here all the time. During summer we walk here and have a little mini date. During the winter we just get what we need and head home asap! The vampiros are my favorite along with their eskimales, dont know if I spelled it right. My husband prefers the yogurts, I'm not much of a yogurt gal. Go any chance you get you'll love it I assure you.

1.description: Can a Black Man get a  good  haircut in Logan Square?  The answer is sadly no. But he can travel just a bit west and see MJ. Brand new and still under construction. I walked in was offered a beverage (declined), he began by asking me what I wanted and how I wanted the cut. Important because I can't have a razor line. The most important thing for me in a cut is get the lines correct and making sure that I'm clean all the way around. MJ excels, no stray hairs to report.  He is professional, amiable, pleasant, and inexpensive. Now'  there are shops in Logan Square that cut hair, but  I don't want spend time with home boys and loud music. I prefer a professional with skill. Clean and quick  with a happy ending to boot (get your mind out of the gutter!) he finished with a  head and neck massage.  Will return.

0.description: I'm at MJ's watching him shave me. There's a feather stuck in the edge of the mirror and I ask him what it's for and he tells me a delightful story about how he saved an injured pigeon but I don't buy it. That feather is a symbol: This guy has a feather touch. Look, you need to listen to me here. I'm an overbooked, stressed out, everything at the last minute professional. I don't have time to tell you I don't have time. I never stop. I'm a busy man.So I live for life's little luxuries, even when, sometimes, I have to build them into my schedule myself. Sometimes when I tell my wife and family I'm "in a meeting," I'm actually at my favorite cigar shop smoking something from the Drew Estate. Or I'm getting a shave. A hot shave is a modern luxury I will not give up under any circumstances. If armageddon happens and we all end up like the walking dead, and people are looting groceries and liquor stores, I'm going to back a truck up to a barber shop and fill it up so at the end of a day of looting and fighting off our android overlords, I'll still be able to get a decent shave. Like French cuffs and 21 year old Scotch, there are some luxuries that aren't luxuries. They're necessities.So trust me when I say I've been all over Chicago looking for the perfect shave. And trust me when I say you cannot beat the shave you'll get at MJs.I fell asleep under the hot towels and MJ's deft touch. I woke up with a face so smooth I wondered if I'd gone through reverse puberty. My wife won't stop kissing me. I look great, I feel great, and I smell great.Feather. Touch. Trust me.Best hot shave in Chicago.

3.description: I've been here twice, and ended up with the same technician, which was a very nice, young woman who made casual conversation.  They only charge $10 for manicures and I thought the first time was good so I went back.  Unfortunately, on the 2nd time, there were bubbles on my polish after it dried.  I suspect that it's either the clear top coat they're using was old or because she turned on the little fan at the station while waiting in between coats.  Anyway, I had to get a polish change the next day so it was a waste.  Free lot parking.

1.description: WORST PLACE EVER!! I walked in just for an acrylic fill. An older lady convinced me to go ahead and have all my nails redone for a rate of $27. I agreed. While having old acrylic removed,I have always had my nails soaked properly for at least a good 30 mins before anything is done. This lady went crazy clipping off my nails in all sorts of ways and digging underneath them with a fake nail and her own nails. While doing that she ended up ripping half of my real nail off while trying to cover the bleeding, I pulled my hand away from her due to the pain and she pulled it back then poured a green liquid that stung like alcoholic then stuck my hand in the fan and grabbed it back. My finger was in horrible pain!!! She left the rest if my nails uneven,still with pieces of acrylic,ripped, and told me only $10!?!? I had to leave immediately! This lady was out her mind, have no idea how she is a nail tech is she even is. Had no knowledge and kept trying to cover her mistakes! WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! SAVE YOURSELF YOUR NAILS.

2.description: I will start by saying I have been coming to this salon for YEARS.  I have never had a problem till recently.  Let me say I will NEVER return.  I gave it two stars (which I think is a lot), and here is why.  So the goods are the woman who took care of me was very nice.  The parking lot is free, and they accept credit.  Problems: #1 I went in to get a no chip nail polish (which I have gotten before in other places) and was told my nails are too short so I couldn't get it done. (I don't understand how come my nails are too short to paint.)  However, my mother's nails (who are as short as mine) where ok length to get the no chip.  I should've left then.  Needless to say I didn't get a manicure. But stayed for a pedicure (sigh...i regret this).  The woman was nice enough I think she's the owners ex wife.  Heres problem #2 When she put the toe separators on my toes I felt a pain.  Didn't think much of it until I got home to realize there was cut under my pinky toe!!! It was there before I got in. I don't know if it was from the scraping or what.  Problem #3 I was using two cards. (i was paying for my mother and my work) I only had $21.70 on one card and was going to put the rest on another.  Well it upset the owner (as I had to explain I don't know how many times that I was paying the whole amount just on two cards) he couldn't grasp why I couldn't pay my total of $22 on the card I explained to him and the cashier I have only 21.70 on the card and I was going to pay with the other card that i was showing him.  Finally he said ok.  Then the other man (the cashier) asked how much I was going to pay on the other card. I said the rest of my bill.  He asked $33? I said sure if that's how much I owe. He got mad and said well you owe the other amount.  I had to do the math in front of him and said to charge the extra $34.30 on the card.  I really could not figure out why he was unable to do the math.Problem #4 The owner did my mom's manicure. He cut the nails too short and she now has infected cuticles.  To think about it #4 is reason enough to change from a 2 star rating to a 0 unfortunately I have to give it a star.  I do not recommend this place. Its a shame because I did like it and was a customer for the good part of at least15 years.

0.description: I have been to this salon a few times.  I am usually very picky when it comes to where I go to get my nails done.  However, the few times I have been to this salon, I certainly left happy.  The nail tech filed down my nails the way I like and painted my nails perfectly.  They have a lot of vibrant colors to choose from and the prices they charge are very reasonable.  Thank you Just Nails - I will be coming back!

This is a great store for Peruvian products.  They have papa huairo, do~a pepa, cua cua, rocotos, very delicious lucuma ice cream. very fresh turrones and light inka kola.  Good prices, some Peruvian gifts available too.

3.description: So I have to say I go to Dunkin Donuts alot and this one in particular on Division and California  they have the nicest people working there.  They now know me because I love the service,  and I also love the Vanilla Bean Coolata . Honestly every one of the ladies that work there are the nicest people and they make my coffee perfect.

1.description: Do you want to know why people choose to spend an extra buck or two on Starbucks coffee rather than Dunking Donuts? It's because they actually get your order right. There may be a slip up every now and then, we're only human, but they don't stand there and start rolling their eyes or clicking their teeth in annoyance because they have to redo the drink THEY messed up.Why else? ...CUSTOMER SERVICE. This is really a dying concept in today's society. I don't expect the staff to be anticipating my visit, but they certainly shouldn't dread it....which seems to be the reaction customers are receiving from the staff at this particular DD. It's really frustrating that I have to drive an extra 7-10 minutes to another location, when this one is conveniently located within walking distance from my home.They've remodeled the location, but what good is a face lift when you're still rotten within?

2.description: I love you're donuts lol . N you're coffee. Addicted to glazed donuts .. Blah . I am always at every other location . Lol

5.description: I like the upstairs area. I meet with clients there whenever I want to get out of the office. The staff is friendly and they are constantly cleaning.

6.description: I love this place. I travel a distance just to be here. the second floor is a great feel, i can just bring my drink upstairs and enjoy the peaceful sight. great place for everyone from high school students to college students trying to study. i had an interview up there with a side of coffee. and the tension mellowed up.

7.description: This place was just remodeled to have two floors, which I think is pretty cool. But the overall service is horrible! First, I went to try and go through the drive thru, I was hanging out there for 10 minutes without being recognized, so I decided to go inside. I went to the Baskin Robbins side to get some shakes for my girlfriend and her son. There were two workers doing some inventory on ice cream and slapping labels and such. I wasn't acknowledged for 15 minutes of me standing there. I then order the 3 shakes and it took the guy 20 minutes to get them ready. There were people behind me being serviced way before I was, and they even had larger orders. Not to mention the person helping me had a bitter attitude. This happened last night around 8PM. Horrible customer service, don't think I'll ever be coming back.

8.description: This place knows their customers well.  After a couple of visits, they knew what we were going to order from the moment we walk in.  This location is well kept clean and I haven't had a burnt bagel yet!

0.description: Im regular visitor in DD. But usually i go to the the one near my home, but not this time. My friend asked me to meet him here. I said that i have one near my home and i dont want spend driving 40 min. But he convinced me to come. And i am happy that i fid that. Amazing customer service and so fresh donuts.

4.description: Horrible service! The staff, especially the manager are rude and lazy! They keep on messing up my order and then the staff gets angry when I tell them that they gave me the wrong sandwich. Don't waste your time at this location!

28.description: First time here. Food was delicious. Prices are good. Relaxed environment. I had the breakfast wrap. Enjoyed every bite of it. Included hash browns for $7.95My wife also enjoyed our visit here. Every one at the restaurant is very nice. We will definitely eat here again.

1.description: Near the corner of Long and Belmont Ave., can you find a neighborhood gem?  I've got one!  Rosa J. and hubby walked to Tutti Fruitti this morning.  It's more of a breakfast/brunch/lunch place than being an actual coffee shop.  However, I don't know about you, but I can't just drink coffee alone without a consumption of food.  Perhaps their the storefront isn't something that you would absolutely pay attention to.  Once we walked into the restaurant, the interiors felt homey and comfy.  They serve western-style breakfast/lunch items with a twist of southwestern flair.  Prices are quite reasonable; ambiance is serene and free from distractions.  I had the "South of Paradise" omelet.  Ingredients were fresh.  The omelet itself wasn't heavy and oily, like what an old-fashion American diner would serve.  I could tell the owners emphasized on the use of natural agricultural products, so I'm diggin' it!  Hubby, on the other hand, went with the "Tutti Veggie" skillet.  It contained a plenty of fresh veggies cut into large chunks.  That was definitely his kind of breakfast since food like this is easy on his stomach.  Both entrees came with a choice of toast OR pancakes.  The owner lady friendly informed us a $10 off, GrubHub discount, for our next visit.  Tutti Frutti is a lovely family-owned business in Belmont Cragin neighborhood.  For $22 and some change, we had a great, healthy, and filling breakfast to start our days!

9.description: So I was coming off shift, and stopped by here on a recommendation from a friend. I ordered the chilaqules, and they were AMAZING! I'm fairly picky with my Mexican food, but this hit the spot. Plus the portions were big for the price. So glad I came by. Yelpers, please don't let the eclectic front fool you, this place is worth coming in!!!!!

29.description: Great food!  Everyone I know who has eaten here loves the food.  The service is slow but the waitresses are always nice and attentive.  Only complaints are it's a mom and pop place they don't always have everything they need to make what's on the menu and there hours are very unclear and they don't post them on the door and the hours on Facebook are not correct.

23.description: New favorite breakfast spot! Avocado Chicken Chipotle Sandwich . And they gave us little heart shaped cookies on Valentines Day which my gf thought was adorable.

5.description: We were in the neighborhood and looking for something different to have for breakfast and lunch. This is a nice, but small restaurant with excellent food. My wife had the chilliquilles they were really hot but very delicious. The kids had the steak sandwich and they both loved it. My other son loved the French toast. I had the skillet and it was great. I will definitely go back to this restaurant and recommend it to others. Free parking in back of restaurant if you get there early enough.

31.description: I like the food here. I've only ordered breakfast but what I've had has been very good. I have only ordered from them through Grub Hub, I've never been inside the restaurant. One of the problems I've had with their food is that they are very inconsistent. I've ordered the Monkey Nuts Crepes a few times now and sometimes I get nuts and chocolate, sometimes I get bananas, sometimes they add strawberries. All good but it sucks when I expect them to be like I ordered last time and they aren't. Their portion sizes are not consistent either. Sometimes I get a lot of hash browns, sometimes only a small amount.My other problem is that I enjoy using Grub Hub to order and sometimes the restaurant says they are still closed even though the website says they are open for delivery.The Chicago skillet is very good!

25.description: Cute breakfast spot. My friend and I went here for breakfast when our usual spot was too busy. They have great food and service. This place is a hidden gem in my neighborhood. My waffles came with fresh raspberry preserves which I enjoyed. They don't rush you while you are there letting you talk and eat without trying to rush you out. I will defiantly be back.

12.description: I have been going there for a while. Great  breakfast. Fantastic juices. Good prices.

37.description: A feel bad cause I like to support local restaurants, the food was nothing special. Maybe if I go into to restaurant the food would be better???? Grilled cheese was nothing special on normal bread way too many pieces of bread. More bread than cheese not good. Menu said two kinds of cheese. There was only one american. Crepes I have had much better. I made them much better myself with honey, cinnamon, yogurt, and blackberries. Grilled cheese is awful and Crepes were better. Delivery was fast. But it just seemed like the food was thrown together.

21.description: Great food, terrible service. Waitress never asked for my order, I had to wait until she served the other people I was with to tell her I wanted to order something. Too bad service sucks, it could be a great place to eat.

16.description: This place is awesome! It's a modest coffee shop that one ups any greasy spoon by offering fresh squeezed juices at the ridiculously affordable price of $4! My friend and I came for breakfast before catching my flight home. I had the eggs plate(perfectly scrambled) with bacon and potatoes AND pancakes all for less than $6 (I upgraded to multigrain pancakes for a buck more and they were so worth it). My friend had the tutti frutti French toast with multigrain bread and topped with tons of fresh fruit. Our grand total (we both got juices) was $22! Plus the service was great and the lady running the place is super sweet! Locals, y'all need to get up in this!

17.description: Very nice place!!! It's nice to have a healthier option out there. The green monster was fantastic!!! The service was great, and everyone was super nice. Highly recommend!!!

10.description: First time here. Very, very good food. The people and service was good. Very friendly.  I had the chipotle chicken sandwich. It was very tasty. My girlfriend had the chilaqules, wow, great taste, and SPICY!! But not just hot, the spice was a good taste and the feta cheese was light and tasty. My mom had the chicken panini with bacon and avocado. She said it was great. But the star of the show was the whip cream and strawberry pancakes. WOW!  These pancakes were amazing. Got to be in the top two pancakes I've ever had.  I would definitely recommend anyone that wants a laid back good experience with good food and nice people for a reasonable price definitely stop in. I know I will again,,,, and soon.

11.description: Good food. Got the Greek salad and it had huge chunks of feta, very tasty pepperoncini and crunchy veggies. Salad was great. Not a huge quantity of gluten free options if that's your bag (Celiac, so it's my bag whether I want to be or not), but a few different salads.The woman behind the counter spoke better English than I do Spanish, but obviously had some problems understanding some of my questions (which probably, to be fair, sounded kind of weird--"Can I get this sandwich that's your special, but without bread?" "No thank you, I don't want the noodle soup you're offering to give me for free with my order."). That said, she gave me the quizzical look one generally gives when one doesn't understand the language someone is speaking. I know, because I give that look often at the Polish deli up the street.Stresses on the health of the food options on the menu and on the signs on the front of the place lead me to believe it was more of a health food joint, which was why I went there--not because I need some trendy vegan/foodie/locavore spot, but more because those places at least know what gluten is, even if they don't know why I, personally, care about it. However, it really is more of a diner with some organic food. Also, as others have noted, this is not a coffee shop in the way that Portage Grounds is a coffee shop. More in the  way that you might think of a spot to get a good cup of joe. There is no coffee bar here (nor, really, a juice "bar" as the menu professes--even though there are a LOT of juice drink options). I saw nary an espresso machine. As I said, it's good food, but its advertising is a bit misleading.Oh. One more thing. Can't remember if I saw this on other reviews, but I didn't see a credit card machine, nor any signs that said they took credit cards. By the time I started my transaction, I didn't have time to go into a rigmarole about whether they took plastic or not, so I just paid in cash.But be warned, they may not take credit cards.

26.description: This was a great place for some home cooking. I had a bite of each meal. Was able to walk in and be seated right away. Great little spot with a good variety.

27.description: I was there this week for breakfast... the owner was very welcoming and gave me a small blurb of their menu items and specials (thought that was pretty cool). I went for their crepes with nutella and banana... they were awesome!! Their was a perfect ratio of banana and nutella that made each bite exquisite. Want to go back and try other menu items soon :)The owner also saw me parking at the front and right away he told me there was parking on the back for free.

35.description: The food was really great! It's nice to know there is a great breakfast spot near by. I loved the fresh squeezed orange juice and  the bacon wrap. I gave it a 4 because we had ordered through Grubhub and were told to pick it up within 30 minutes but still got stuck waiting an additional 30 Minutes

8.description: I was there this week for breakfast... the owner was very welcoming and gave me a small blurb of their menu items and specials (thought that was pretty cool). I went for their crepes with nutella and banana... they were awesome!! Their was a perfect ratio of banana and nutella that made each bite exquisite. Want to go back and try other menu items soon :)The owner also saw me parking at the front and right away he told me there was parking on the back for free.

0.description: I had the chilaquiles and my boyfriend had the breakfast quesadilla, both delicious. The woman who runs the place is extremely nice and helpful.

38.description: I love this place! The food tastes fresh and is not heavy. The service is great. They have only been open for a month as I write this review, but we have been back three times. The menu is simple and well prepared. The chef says they will be continuing to expand it. Here's to their success, as there are not enough places that serve food this good in this neighborhood.

20.description: This is a neighborhood gem!! I was very pleased with the service and my Avocado Chicken Chipotle Sandwich (I added bacon, I guess you can't go wrong with adding delicious bacon) was amazing. I'm sure their lack of exposure on yelp can be their location but I hope they remain in the area. I am definitely going back. Btw they accept cards via Square! (Dont forget to ask to tip if you are taking a credit card)

19.description: Went here with my boyfriend to try something new & the great reviews on yelp is what attracted us to it. This place is great. There's Latin music blasting from the tv & everything on the menu is under $10. The owner & server is an adorable older woman who makes you feel very welcome. I got the chipotle chicken sandwich w/ fries & my boyfriend got the Greek tuna pita sandwich w/ salad. The portion size was perfect for both. The coffee was so smooth you could drink it black. We ended our meal w/ an orange scone- the icing was vibrant w/ the taste of a fresh orange. We both agreed that we'd be coming back :)

33.description: This review is not about the food but about the lady on the phone. I called and asked about the restaurant.com policy there and some lady on the phone who you could hardly understand what she was talking about had this to say. We don't have time to take care of you right now we are really busy. Well me thinks I won't be going here.

2.description: Great food, atmosphere & servers. Our food was delicious ! It is a small cafe I wish I had near my work; I would definitely come back.

34.description: One word = Sllllloooooooowwwwwww. Maybe the food would've been better hot. I may try to dine in next time, apparently delivery or take out is not their specialty.

32.description: The food is fabulous, they are nice to customers, it's a calm environment. Delicious food, great service.

18.description: I been coming here for a few years already place is very friendly good food specially the drinks all natural drinks my favorite the berry one I recommend to come try it out

13.description: I like that they sell smoothies and the crepes are good. Service can be a bit slow but the food is good, hot, and fresh.

4.description: I've never had a bad meal here: breakfast, lunch, and dinner. All ingredients are fresh and nothing tastes like it's out of a box. Staff is really nice too. A real gem in Belmont Cragin.

24.description: This place is so underrated. You need to check this coffee shop out for yourself. The food selection is amazing and the food is delicious. If that ain't enough the owner is so nice and friendly. I totally dig her aura. There's no place like this for miles, believe me I've looked up, down and sideways. Treat yourself and help support her business.

6.description: One of my favorite places to eat when I'm in the area. First off everything is fresh and made to order which I love. The staff is amazing and super friendly. The place is very clean and the food is fantastic. I usually have breakfast which entails a waffle, two eggs, hashbrown, and bacon. But on a whim I tried the breakfast skillet and I'm sold! I had the bacon and sausage skillet and I added green peppers to it. The peppers weren't soggy and had a little crunch to it, the meal was absolutely amazing and filling. They also carry desserts which I love because sugar is my vice. The pastries are sweet but not overpowering. I highly recommend this place.

22.description: Good food. Got the Greek salad and it had huge chunks of feta, very tasty pepperoncini and crunchy veggies. Salad was great. Not a huge quantity of gluten free options if that's your bag (Celiac, so it's my bag whether I want to be or not), but a few different salads.The woman behind the counter spoke better English than I do Spanish, but obviously had some problems understanding some of my questions (which probably, to be fair, sounded kind of weird--"Can I get this sandwich that's your special, but without bread?" "No thank you, I don't want the noodle soup you're offering to give me for free with my order."). That said, she gave me the quizzical look one generally gives when one doesn't understand the language someone is speaking. I know, because I give that look often at the Polish deli up the street.Stresses on the health of the food options on the menu and on the signs on the front of the place lead me to believe it was more of a health food joint, which was why I went there--not because I need some trendy vegan/foodie/locavore spot, but more because those places at least know what gluten is, even if they don't know why I, personally, care about it. However, it really is more of a diner with some organic food. Also, as others have noted, this is not a coffee shop in the way that Portage Grounds is a coffee shop. More in the  way that you might think of a spot to get a good cup of joe. There is no coffee bar here (nor, really, a juice "bar" as the menu professes--even though there are a LOT of juice drink options). I saw nary an espresso machine. As I said, it's good food, but its advertising is a bit misleading.Oh. One more thing. Can't remember if I saw this on other reviews, but I didn't see a credit card machine, nor any signs that said they took credit cards. By the time I started my transaction, I didn't have time to go into a rigmarole about whether they took plastic or not, so I just paid in cash.But be warned, they may not take credit cards.

15.description: This was a great place for some home cooking. I had a bite of each meal. Was able to walk in and be seated right away. Great little spot with a good variety.

7.description: I've been here three times and each time has been great!The food is not only good but fresh as well. The tuna sandwich was house made and done with fresh ingredients. The skillet was also tasty as all hell, and made with fresh veggies. And the price for this great food is more than reasonable.The homemade smoothies are just wonderful as well.

36.description: My husband and I really enjoy this restaurant and come here for brunch usually about once a week.  If you're looking for a polished, corporate test-kitchen kind of experience, this is not the place.  Nothing is pre-processed, they prepare everything they serve (with the exception of cakes & cookies purchased from an outside bakery). The food is definitely not fancy, it's just wholesome and delicious - nothing wrong with that.  It's like home-made but better because you don't have to do the cooking or the dishes!  I've never had the grilled cheese, but to be fair there's really never anything special about a grilled cheese anywhere you have it.

30.description: This is the second time we com here and we are always pleased! We ran into this restaurant through yelp and decided to stop here instead of the Golden Nugget.The one thing that I do want to point out is that the wait time for food is a bit long. The quality of the food, however, is great.The have a great selection of fresh fruit and vegetable juices and I learned they make some jams in-house. They also bring in a baker twice a week for their pastries. This is a small family owned restaurant and coming in here makes you feel at home. I recommend this place over many of the chain breakfast restaurants in the area. They really care about the food they serve and making sure you have a pleasant visit.

3.description: This place is awesome. They have amazing omlettes and pumpkin pancakes! Love love love!

14.description: First time here. Food was delicious. Prices are good. Relaxed environment. I had the breakfast wrap. Enjoyed every bite of it. Included hash browns for $7.95My wife also enjoyed our visit here. Every one at the restaurant is very nice. We will definitely eat here again.

1.description: Food was awesome. Drinks even better!!! Service was ok but the good and drinks make up for it. Will definitely be back next time I visit Chicago.

9.description: Wow! Where do I start? Amazing flavor. Exceptional service. If you are looking for excellent soul seafood, this is the place! The prices are reasonable. The drinks are great great. The best sangria ever....! I'm just smiling.....! I'm glad I discovered this place because I will definitely be back! I suggest that u stop here if you love food with flavor.

23.description: I met some friends at Las Islas Marias on a rainy Sunday night and we were surprised to find out crowded it was.  We opted to sit in the bar because we could order from the menu there, and there were seats available. I was excited about a good margarita, unfortunately there wasn't one... they were served in large goblets (though there is a smaller one available) for a whopping $10, which I don't mind paying if they're made by hand and are delicious.  These however, came from a machine and were sour and boring. My friend ordered a steak which he was told once all of our food arrived, was unavailable. I ordered the small portion of seafood paella and...where do I start... it was pictured in the menu in a paella pan, so I was excited about that idea.  However it arrived in a large terra cotta bowl and looked more like a loose seafood risotto than paella. It was very salty, and while there was loads of seafood in it, the saltiness took over the flavors. I ordered a bottle of Mexican Coke (cane sugar, not corn syrup - it's excellent and hard to find) but it never arrived, a can did instead so I drank that rather than attempt to get another. They brought us some ceveche with chips and very hot green salsa as a complimentary starter (which they do for everyone), which was really great especially with some lime, however the shrimp empanadas were pretty boring.  Overall, I most likely wouldn't go back, but the place was very crowded and I have to believe that means there are good things there - I just didn't have any of them. **also, Yelp has it listed in Humbolt Park, which you can tell by the address is wrong.  It's actually on the north side of Galewood**

12.description: Saturday night Pachanga night!! SO I meet up with My main man Leo and his cousin for some cervezas and a bite. They were already at the bar of this establishment enjoying some Modelo's! and Michelada's! If you dont know what a Modelo or a Michelada is then stop reading now.Ok, See what I did there!?  I put up a hipster Filter mechanism....ha!Drunk Mexicans at the bar blowing of their weeks paycheck on beer and Live table side Mariachis.....check!Awesome Ceviche...checkThe Shrimp empanadas and the sauce accompannying them..DAMN!!Oysters for me and mi compadres...checketie check check check!Go early or really late as it gets crowded.!Shake & bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: -10 Yeap a negative...........Drunk Mexicans loud Mariachi singing and carnivorous seafood  eating West of Pulaski = Skaaarryyyy! Boooooooo!

21.description: I came here for a friend's birthday and boy was it delicious. I'm not sure why the other reviews aren't so hot because I had a great experience. It is important to like mariscos when you go, because that's pretty much all they have, but it's done right. The waitress told us that the first Islas Marias was in LA which makes sense because it has a beachy/California feel somehow. We all got different entrees and shared it family style which was a good way to go. The cocktail was amazing.Overall, it was a wonderful experience.

16.description: I felt like I had to chime in - I would agree that most places that aren't spanish (Spain spanish, not Mexican) don't serve very good paella, and most times, it isn't paella at all but just a mixed rice dish.   Spain is known for great paella, not so much Mexico.  I'd steer clear of any paella, at any restaurant, unless it's known for the dish, and I'm saying this because I've been let down too many times.  Having said that, I think this place has delicious seafood.  They are known for their "langostinos", or langoustines, and they are sooo good.  They have this slightly spicy sauce that you just want to lick off the plate.  My husband got the carne asada, and it was extremely tender with a nice seasoned char.  Shrimp empanadas were fresh and tasted homemade.  And, the portions are huge!  I wouldn't bother with the mixed drinks - my pina colada tasted like a candied milkshake - but I definitely recommend this place for reasonably priced seafood.  Next time I'm ordering the snapper!  I'd also like to check out the other locations.

17.description: On May 1 we went here to celebrate a Birthday thinking it was going to be great like most reviews... I think Not! We called ahead the Monday prior trying to make reservation for Mariachi and a group of 16 . They told me they don't take reservations and to call the morning of and it will be set. I called at 9 since the person who answered the phone said they would be open to find out Ooooo they weren't open .... then we tell them we will be there at 630 and need the Mariachi to be there and we get there to find out the Mariachis left!!!! Was I livid ! They were supposed to sing happy birthday and all and that never happened. I asked to speak with the manager and he tells me I should have made a reservation prior and I was supposed to put a deposit for the Mariachi.. here's a piece of advice make sure when you can talk to someone who understands both Spanish and English because I spoke both and still ruined it all! To top it off the waitress was rude and oh ya she was the only one attending our table..... great job!  NOT! S.N. THANKS FOR THE DRY FAJITAS!

10.description: Excellent Mexican seafood joint with reasonable prices.They have live music so loud you can't hear the person next to you.They feature soccer games playing on a huge projector screen and TV's all around the restaurant.Service is OK. Waitresses are not very attentive.

5.description: I always wanted to try this place but now that I did, I just felt that I throw my money away. When we arrived the place was busy but there was a couple waitresses seating down. We decided to seat ourselfs down to a clean table.Waited for 15 minutes to have somebody come and ask us if we waited to drink anything and also received our menus. What I notice was that this place is not organized and they do not have great nor good service at all but, I decided to try their food since everyone is bragging their food is great.My son had the bacon wrap shrimp, my wife had the breaded shrimp, and I had the oysters appetizer and the octorpus in chili hot sauce.I was disappointed in the food preparation and overall taste, this place is not what it appears. After I had to force myself to eat he food, we waited patiencely to get the bill. After waiting almost 2 1/2 hours just so other waitress to ask us if everything was ok. We did tell her to get our bill. 10 minutes later we received our bill and they started to clear our table. 30 minutes later still nobody came back to pick up our bill and/or thank us for coming in. I just decided to take the bill to the register only to wait another 10 minutes to pay when their is nobody in line.Really bad customer service and the place is dirty too.I would not recommend this place because the food is not that great and they really have terrible customer service.As for the tip I did not leave one because they did not deserve it, and they want $15 an hour. This is what my family and experience and we will definitely not be returning to this restaurant ever.

11.description: Went here for my mother in laws birthday as well as my husbands birthday. People rave about how good this place is. I was not impressed at all. I think this place is just well known for there micheladas! But I do have to say there really good!we kept getting different waitress's. So of course they had no idea what we were getting cause with every waitress we ordered something. And when another waitress came along and we asked for our appetizers she looked at us like we had seven heads.When we ordered the appetizers we ordered our kids meals as well. So they could get a head start. We only got one of our appetizers. By the time we finished it, my daughters shrimp cocktail came out (the juice was to sweet and not very good)After waiting a good 30min for our other appetizers we told the waitress to cancel that and we're ready to order dinner.(Meanwhile, my boys meals were still not given to us)We ordered dinner all at the same time. 30min later 2dinners come out. While the other 3 were not out not including my boys meals. Then after more waiting we finally got the other dinners. BUT STILL NO FOOD FOR MY BOYS!!!!!!!! FCKN IRRITATING!!!! So I kept my cool we asked about the boys meals the waitress looked confused when we placed it with her. Ugh, just typing this is pissing me offOverall you have an idea over my experience!!!! TERRIBLE!!!!!!My husbands fajitas were good but no tortillas were given with them. WTF? My shrimp cocktail was not great either the juice was really sweet. The only thing that kept me calm was my piña colada, :-) michelada and the mariachi! I wont go back and if I do it would be for the micheladas only which will be at the bar! But not anytime in the near future, that's for sure!!!!!!Terrible place!!!!!!!!!!!!

22.description: My husband and I were always curious about this place after driving by the one further over on Grand (near the Brickyard Mall) and decided to give it a try, figuring the crowds must mean the food is good.  We were wrong.I got the seafood paella plate and could barely eat any of it - the rice was nasty - the kind of rice you would see on a "pilaf" offering at your typical family restaurant.  Then, the seafood on top was not "eater-friendly".  We're talking crab in the shell (which when I did get it out, was not very good qulity), scary crawfish with their feelers and eyes and legs.  Not something I am into deconstructing - especially when I had no "discard" plate and table barely fit our meals and drinks.I don't even remember what my husband ordered - I was so distracted  by the aquarium on top of my rice.  I do recall that he thought the food lacked flavor - suprising as we were the only caucasians in the restaurant - this was not like being at Pepe's where the reverse is true and you expect watered-down food.We have not been back and every time we pass one (I've seen more and more) I wonder what it is that packs the people in?

0.description: Ceviche! Ceviche! Ceviche! Treat myself as often as possible.

20.description: This is one of my favorite places for real, true mariscos.  I lived in LA for a year and this food brings me back to the great whole-in-the-wall mariscos restaurants in East LA.  The food comes out on huge platters and the portions are gigantic. I always order the laungestinas (sp) because they are to die for!  My mom always orders the fish soup, and she claims that there is no better place in the city ot get it.Enjoy!

19.description: Go to Chicken Run and Campeche Seafood for good seafood and Mexican food... you won't be disappointed.

2.description: We use to frequent the location on Milwaukee fairly often because we really liked the food and atmosphere but it closed so we decided to try this location and after trying it, we will not go back. I know it was busy but service was really bad. We were a party of four and first two of us were served, than a bit later one more entre was brought out along with the appetizer that should have been served first. The crab legs were completely different than how they normally served  them, a bit disappointing. We also waited a while for our last entre but it did not come until everyone else was done eating. It was just fajitas!! The place is very loud too so don't expect to be able to enjoy any dinner conversation.

18.description: This is one of my favorite places for real, true mariscos.  I lived in LA for a year and this food brings me back to the great whole-in-the-wall mariscos restaurants in East LA.  The food comes out on huge platters and the portions are gigantic. I always order the laungestinas (sp) because they are to die for!  My mom always orders the fish soup, and she claims that there is no better place in the city ot get it.Enjoy!

13.description: OK Place to eat sea food. I have only had a number of things so il only be rating based on what I ate so far. Parilla de 7 mares7 Mares soupShrimp Cocktail ( Not a huge fan, but they are fresh. I think they could do a better mix of their juice for the shrimps, its too light )Fresh lemonade, real goodCeviche that comes as a table side is really fresh and good.Their staff is pretty good about attending in service, its an OK place thats in the middle of Chicago's West side.

4.description: They have the best shrimp soup in the city! I've tried many other places and this spot here is above all. After you try it you will not like any other place.

6.description: Bad waitress. She took our order never brought the tortillas and never came to ask if we needed anything else, my boyfriend had to get up and pay smh! for that we left no tip. Food is ok and drinks

15.description: So far the best of all Islas Marias in Chicago. Try the crawfish "langostinos" this is the dish to die for. I don't really know why some people complained about the food in this place in case they don't know this is not the typical American seafood restaurant in fact is one of many mexican style seafood, Nayarit to be exacts. If you can not deal with spicy or the real look of a fish don't go here keep driving until you find red lobster or something similar.

7.description: Unfortunately used to like this place not anymore, waiter was a mess had no idea what she was doing, took for ever to bring the appetizer, bring napkins, drinks or lemons. We order one kids meal, and three adults plates, they did not bring them all at once. brought one dish then after 10-15 minutes the next one and so. my Shrimp was cold as if they pulled it our of the fridge. And the Kids meal never arrived! until i spoke with manager then they brought it, my poor kid did not enjoy her meal at all because by the time it arrived we had already given our food to share! manager would not attempt to do anything for us, so sad.

8.description: I truthfully enjoy the food here, however the service is utterly horrible. . We live across the street, we would visit every weekend.  The waitresses have forgotten our meals, drinks, and been blatantly RUDE. Even Tho We thouroughly enjoyed , The Food The Service Made US never return.  On our very last trip the waitress was a total witch.. I would ask 4 something, she would respond 2 My husband .. she forgot our child's meal. Never returned w. Our drinks. We never got more tortillas and were rushed out of there.  Nah sorry I'll spend $125.00 elsewhere. If you go with a table of dudes, they will attend and flirt w. You, I'd you go as a family, they judge and think you won't tip well. Now I used to wait tables I always tip well. Skip this place el veneno is better.

3.description: Came in on Tuesday evening so it wasn't very busy which was nice. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. Loved my drink, very tasty!! Just one was enough the margarita I had was huge and it came with two coronitas. My husband had the michelada and he loved it. The food was very good as well. Their ceviche is just perfect. Great place for a family meal.

14.description: Love the LEVANTA MUERTOS, juicy and spicy, the cocktails de camaron deliciosos. Service SUCKS I do not understant of, i people hate their job why they don't quit; pure bad attitude. The food gets must of my stars but service gets ZERO...

12.description: Mama Luna's has the best and cheesiest thin crust pizza around.  The ingredients are also pretty big and piled on, especially the mushrooms which are sliced into big pieces.   I have ordered from here on and off many years.  And they deliver pretty far, I have lived in Chicago my entire life, from Logan Square, Independence Park, Portage Park, Humboldt Park and Lakeview and Mama Luna delivered to all of my residences. The only negative is the dining room, slow service and outdated.

7.description: I ordered pizza because my good friend would always order from Mama Lunas. Im sorry but the PERSON ON THE PHONE IS SUPER RUDE!!!!! She has a terrible attitude and barely allowed me to talk and really needs to calm down or get out. The pizza was descent, good price, but didn't enjoy it; the barely had enough cheese. They really need to do something about the worker on the phone because with this experience I'll think twice about going to eat inside, much less call again. Ill hang up.

19.description: there pizza is soo good! but there service is aweful. the women who answer the phones act like they don't need or want your business. they give you an attitude and they don't try to accomidate you as a customer and to me customer service is very imporant. won't go back.... but pizza is good and resonably priced. so what's more imporant to you?

1.description: Love the food honestly I love the pizza been a customer since I was little. The basic classic thin crust pizza with pepperoni is a stable in my household.  But the part that deters me from actually ordering from this establishment might be worst customer service I have ever experienced. When one calls to have food delivered you expect professionalism, for the past few times my family has tried to order we get employees that just not have a horrible attitude but really make one not want to order anymore. Imagine an hour ago calling to order a football pizza, my mother was called out of her name by the individual that was taken our order. Food amazing but if there was a sense of professionalism perhaps I/ my family wouldn't literally argue for who has to order. Since ordering is what we truly hate sense it never fails to have someone be rude on the other side of the phone.

2.description: Everyone is correct terrible customer service I've been calling over 30 minutes and when I finally got thru the bastard that answered hung up

9.description: I give 1 star for the people on the phone...its been a problem for years...and the delivery drivers that think it ok to honk there horn to tell you their here...most be a neighborhood thing...

6.description: My husband and I just ordered from here for the first time, and the food was pretty good. I had the Alfredo which was yummy. My husband had the chicken sandwhich which was filled with mushrooms (gross) he likes them tho so it wasn't bad for him. That gives them the 3 stars, because the service was worse than the service at the secretary of the state office. The man on the phone was loud and unpleasant, and I understand you work in a restaurant where you probably have 5 people on hold and you're busy, but regardless you're in the business where you have to be friendly to the customer. I've worked in the industry before, so I see no excuse to being rude. Then the driver had the nerve to yell my husbands name out in the street... Ummm hello that's why we gave you our number so you could call when you're outside not holler out for my husband like he's your buddy.

18.description: i so wanted to order from here, because everyone has told me the pizza  is really good, however...natch, the first question the phone operator asks is the phone number, and my phone number starts with an out-of-state area code.  and he said 'we can't accept that area code.'  i was shocked and tried to get an explanation, and he just kept saying the same thing.  so then, i asked him if he wanted me to make up a 312 or 773 number, and he told me to hang on.  then he left me on hold for a couple minutes, and i got frustrated and hung up.  ugh!!!!!

10.description: First off I love their pizza and I would give them a 5 star but they have really rude people who answer the phone. I called back to see why my order was so much and the woman I could tell she wasn't young so she should know better acted like I was a bother and got rude with me. All she had to do was kindly state the price and why it came out that way. If you read this Mama Luna  you really need to have a talk with your employee's. I have heard of this being a problem but never experienced until now.

13.description: To everyone bitching about the service: do you buy pizza in order to be serviced, or because you like to eat delicious, affordable pizza?Sure, they've hassled me for my central Jerz area code, which typically only happens in New York. Borrowing a friend's phone is an effective solution.The only reason I order pizzas? I love to eat pizzas. Sure, i wish the staff was really kind to me, asked me how my back's been feeling, and massaged my shoulders while they melted the 2,678 lbs of cheese they cram into their stuffed pizzas. (Seriously. Each tiny square is a meal.)But you know what? This ain't Oz, and finding a family-owned pizza joint with stuffed slices this good doesn't happen every day. So tuck your ego and realize that sometimes you gotta suffer for that perfect slice.Also, speaking as a pizza expert (as everyone from the northeast believes themselves to be,) I had ZERO respect for the Chicago-style stuffed slice until Mama Luna's schooled me on it.To anyone who thinks this place is sketchy: duh, of course it is! Ask any New Yorker: all the best pizza places are sketchy. Very sketchy. Get out of the kiddy pool and take a dip in the danger zone, or get used to a lifetime of Little Caesar's.

16.description: Delivery here takes a while and I had heard that the phone operator was rude. When I came in for a pick up, the phone operator was very sweet. She kept calling me honey.I love their deep dish pizza. The super thin crust is also great and priced at a bargain. I have been coming here since I was a child. With abodonza no longer across the street this is one of the few remaining old-style family run businesses.

17.description: I love this place.  This is the best pizza, I swear.  Thin crust is amazing.Folks say the operators are rude, but again, bear in mind you're calling a high volume ma and pop business, you're not calling Comcast with a call center.  The folks that answer also are in charge of the pick up area and do a bunch of things at once.  The main reason most folks generally think they're rude is because they get short when you hum and haw over the menu.  To me, that's understandable.  If you don't know what you're ordering, don't call before you figure it out, because THAT'S rude.  But I have to say, I've been eating their food (not just pizza) my whole life, and ordering or dining in, it's awesome.  Note: if your idea of "Chicago pizza" is Pizza Hut, you probably won't like it because Pizza Hut isn't real pizza, and you may not like any independent place for that matter.

15.description: Wait staff was friendly. Pizza was good not extraordinary, bruschetta was way to oily which saturated the toasted bread.  Decent quality food - in line with price.

0.description: Best thin pizza in Chicago. I looked at the other review saying the phone operator were rude but I've never had a rude operator. I usually order a pizza with jalapeños, bacon, pepperoni, and extra sauce. It's the best. I've order the lasagna and raviolis and they weren't that bad. Overall, best pizza and been ordering pizza here since around 2005.

5.description: Mama lunas pizza is good but the people on the phone act like its a privilege to order from there like there the only pizza place in town there sadly mistaken called in my order didnt even finish my order and guy screams itll be bout a hr and hung up called back to finish my order guy hangs up without giving me a total or lettn me tell him im paying with a credit card called back finally finished my order after 3 calls! Pizza was ok but not worth being treated like trash il take my bussiness to la villa or cuchiaros from now on tired of the rudeness hasnt changed one bit youd figure the owner would read these yelps pfft they lost a 25yr customer.

11.description: Mama Luna special, megaball size will easily feed six hungry goons on fight night. Pizza was great. Delivery will take an hour. Worth it for $39

8.description: I used to live a block away 20 years ago and we have gotten pizza from there every Friday. It was delicious!!! Sad to hear about the reviews now because this was home to me. I hope they fix their customer service or they'll lose customers.

3.description: This place has the WORST customer service. I called in an order, the guy on the phone was extremely rude and kept getting my order wrong, then told me someone would call me back to verify and hung up on me. Didn't get a call back so I just cancelled the order. It's too bad really, because their pizza is pretty good and the prices are reasonable. I'm sure they get away with the crappy service because of the type of neighborhood it's in. Won't be getting my money ever again.

14.description: The pizza here is great. Sure the place is in a seedy part of town, but once you get there, the joint is awsome. The waitress's are nice. You have to try this place. If you like thin crust or Chicago style deep dish.... this is the place for you. They have a huge parking lot right next door and they have football pizza. They serve beer and other liquors too. You should go here with your friends or family. The prices are very reasonable and they deliver. The people that your order over the phone are also very nice. Plus, they still give you free pop with your pizza. RC of course.

4.description: Horrible customer service no one working the phones knows what they are doing.  If you have question you'll be put on hold for a good 5 minutes.  I've never got a order in under an hour an half.  If your hungry don't call them!

1.description: Quality wise these clothes aren't as good as lets say Express, but where else can you get a pair of jeans that reveal your perfect a** or an outfit that makes people turn their heads. Sure you may only wear it once before you wash it and it's gone, but if you really take care of it, it can last. Most of the prices are economical! I usually get an outfit with jewelry for aboout $20-$30. They also sell shoes & purses but I like my name brands in that dept so I won't buy it from them.

0.description: I go to this store about twice a week! I am addicted to getting new stuff so I go there since their clothing and shoes are cheap and not bad quality. Love them and their workers are really nice and friendly.

1.description: I like going here since its close to me. The food is pretty good ...always get the meat lovers skillet or the 4 deuces :) the staff is great, they keep the coffee coming which I love! If you come in sunday morning be prepared for a crazy crowd.

9.description: Awful service tonight and the last time  we went, we had the same waitress, an older woman, and she was terrible.  She didn't check on us at all and we were done for 20 minutes before we got fed up and walked to the cashier to pay.  I will never go here again.

23.description: Why g-nugget? Why must you force me to give you 1 star? You are one block away from my house and are open 24 hours (again. They had a horrible system with inconvenient hours for a good two years after they changed management.) Well here are the reasons;1. Your waitresses are bitches. I don't say this as a joke, they are honest to God the worst I've ever experienced. They sit on their ass and flirt with the cooks...that aren't handsome (I've checked). They're rude, they practically have to be begged for a glass of water and syrup for pancakes? Forget it! You'll have better luck wrestling the turd in their forever clogged toilets.2. The food has slowly but surely gone down the same road as the turd but the only difference is that it made it to it's intended destination...DOWN the crapper. It's greasy (and not hole-in-the-wall-amazing diner greasy that tastes great when you eat it but makes you feel like shiite later) Just plain greasy. The eggs or anything fried for that matter make you have a mild heart attack so be prepared to bring the tums.3. Lastly, the price is insane. $10 for an open-face turkey sandwich...FROM A DIVE-Y DINER? Are you kidding me? Not unless I'm hammered or don't wanna change out of my pj's do I visit this place.Five years ago this place would've received rave reviews from me but sadly things have changed for the worse.Oh and to be fair, they have ONE nice lady that takes care of the cash register. I wish she would wait tables 'cause she's a doll. :)

12.description: I love coming here, but they keep getting rid of items on the menu. I wish that I had tried the pot roast while they still had it but, alas, it is no more.

21.description: They last time I dined here, the food was so bland and unappetizing. There were flies and knats everywhere. There was an infestation of knats outside all over the window.It was super cold in there too. I didn't like the atmosphere at all

16.description: My daughter loved her chocolate chip pancakes, my son ordered the fench toast and ate it all (he's a picky eater  so that says alot!). My Hubs loves their pancakes and I had the chorizo eggs Benedict which was DELISH! Portions are huge so we had a ton of left overs for later! YUMMY!I would give it 5 stars but the service was almost non-existent and the decor is a bit outdated.

17.description: $17 breakfast includes: 2eggs, 2 bacon, side order of 2 bacon, hash browns, french toast, and a Pepsi... Now I remember why I stopped going there!!!

10.description: I don't know what it is about this specific location but any time I go I always leave wondering what happen to their food?!..I recently came here with my good friend's younger sister and we came in for obviously Breakfast.  The signs say seat yourself there isn't anyone there at least that Sunday morning.   We sat down at what looked like to be an open table to only have a family snarl at me, people are sitting there yet no utensils and cups of water were on the table. To keep a good mood I just got up and went back to the front door to wait for "some type of direction" . Finally we were seated and ordered some hot chocolate ( that WAS one thing I used to love about this place) they serve it with a nice chocolate chip and whipped cream.  The young "waitress/server" who seemed to be a dear in head lights approached 3 tables with OUR hot chocolate before reaching our table and slamming them and sliding them towards us like ok here u go.  Frankly I was pissed off and had to contain myself from not wanting to have a few words with her.  Our actual waitress came by I've experience her before and sometimes the service with her is a hit or miss.  On Occasion she's questioned my friend if he even know what over easy eggs looked like, instead of changing the meal to his liking she gave him a hard time. BUT I will say this Sunday she was in better spirits.  Now for the food, I usually have high standards for this place because about 5 years ago it was always good!! and My mother and I religiously went every Sunday.    I ordered their eggs Benedict with some kinda of " roasted breakfast potatoes" I literally Picked at a few pieces and left my entire meal to take home. The potatoes had ABSOLUTELY NO FLAVOR AND WERE BURNT. The eggs Benedict just were bland just a complete disappointment the only thing I enjoyed was my toast with butter that got there after my food.  I ordered Chocolate chip pancakes for her and they were just WAY too chocolatey and frankly kinda burnt and she did not enjoy them at all. Idk what's going on with this place but they need to step it up and maybe work on their customer service skills!

5.description: Wonderful costumer service. My family and I have been coming to this location since we moved into the area in 1994. The servers are extremely sweet. The cooks in the kitchen do such a fantastic job. I love their fried liver and onions. It's so good!!

11.description: Service was great, my waitress was not only patient but courteous.  I had the liver and onions were on point.Location was very clean.  Def will maue this my spot.

22.description: I've been going to this establishment for about 16 years.The food is yummy and Ali our waitress for those 16yrs  is wonderful.If you go there, make sure to sit at the booths to the right, Ali will take good care of you.The cream of chicken rice soup is da bomb... They serve that on Sundays.I enjoy eating here and look forward to it every other weekend.*Thumbs Up*

0.description: Had a fantastic breakfast here at Golden Nugget Pancake House.Pancakes and waffles are great. I always to have these kind of breakfast those not so good food on my area.Love this place and its food.

20.description: I really would like to give this restaurant 3 1/2 stars, but since that's not an option my gut tells me to round down in this particular case.  It's not that I have anything bad to say about the restaurant, food, portion size or service, but on the filp side I can't see myself telling company from out of state to come with me for a really special breakfast.  I only go to this restaurant for breakfast and I do that once a month so I can only speak to my breakfast experiences.When I click the 3 star rating it says "A-OK" and I think that really sums up the food quality, service, portion size, and cleanliness of the establishment.  To me the 3 star rating is a good rating and I will continue to frequent this restaurant on a regular monthly basis, it's just not someplace that I would take anybody that I wanted to have a really memorable experience.  I saw a previous review mentioning the servers in not to flattering of terminology.  While I can't speak to their experience I can without reservation say that I've always found my servers to be friendly and attentive to my needs.

19.description: They last time I dined here, the food was so bland and unappetizing. There were flies and knats everywhere. There was an infestation of knats outside all over the window.It was super cold in there too. I didn't like the atmosphere at all

2.description: The place is dirty and the service rude,  to get coffe is a mission..  Never again the worst Golden Nugget restaurant.

18.description: I give it 5 stars for the yummy pancakes and French toast, but mainly because of Allie, our waitress. We love her! As soon as we sit, she always has our drinks ready and has our meals memorized. If you're ever there on a weekend morning, sit in the right section near the door and she'll take care if the rest!

13.description: This place is so close to where I live, but unfortunately I don't eat here as often as i should.  The plates are very expensive for the quality and the place itself is depressing. It needs a total rehab as the one on Clark street. What a difference it can make.

4.description: I moved out of state where they don't have Golden Nugget and recently came back to visit. Everything from the service to the food was horrible (besides the pancakes). The same waitress that has been there for years waited our table and she was plain rude. I don't think I've ever seen her smile. I literally dreaded the second I saw her walking towards our table. It's never a good experience with her and every person I talk to about it, has the same one. One of the orders was wrong, the food was not warm at all, and the sausage was half cooked.Definitely will not be coming back to this Golden Nugget when I'm in the area again.

6.description: I've been to several of these chain restaurants, this is the best golden nugget in Chicago. Service, food, music is all very relaxed and comforting

15.description: In yet another "adventures with the husband" I found out he had never been to a Golden Nugget!!  So, Sunday morning after mass, I drove on over to this one (closest to our house) to have him try it out.  I don't think I have ever ordered anything but the Little Boy Blue, so I was happy to see it was still on the menu (blueberry pancakes with whipped cream, two eggs and two pieces of bacon).  He went with the four deuces (pancakes, eggs, sausage and bacon).  We sat in a two seater booth and realized quickly that we were going to be really tight for space with all the plates!!  The blueberries were oddly sour, which is really strange since I know the stuff is just pie filling and canned to begin with...The waitress was really good - and even gave me ice in a separate glass for my juice to make sure I got the full amount!  Hopefully the husband will be back - only $26 for all of this, which might seem high, but the sheer volume of food is insane!

7.description: 2 eggs 2 bacon's 2 sausage's 2 Pancakes and a side order of Hash Browns1 Taco Salad2 cokes= $30.Is it me or does this seem pricey? Bacon and Sausage seemed like it was from a budget store Taco Salad had very little Lettuce Cokes were $2.50I'd give it one star but the Waitress was friendly Gave her 20% so now it was a $36. meal

8.description: Omg this place brings back memories of when I'd go partying nearby. .. you know last week just kidding.  I liked that I  weekends there are opened 24 hours and have offer more than just breakfast.  Throughout the years,  I've tried everything from the pancakes to the pasta plates.  I've never been dissatisfied once.  I also have always received great service from the servers.  I'm a picky eater and they always find a way to convenience me and my special eating needs. Where else can you get a mashed potatoes with turkey gravy.

3.description: This is a solid breakfast place.The wait staff is great and the food is...typically diner quality.The problem though is that the Golden Nugget on Irving, near 90/94 is much better than this location. That includes food and clientele (when I say clientele, I mean rambunctious and just not fun to eat while there).  If we can, we usually drive to that location, otherwise for a quick bite, this location is pretty solid.Obviously they have standard fare pancakes, but I like their Chicken Club, and their Chicken Parm sandwich is much better than you'd imagine!

14.description: I really would like to give this restaurant 3 1/2 stars, but since that's not an option my gut tells me to round down in this particular case.  It's not that I have anything bad to say about the restaurant, food, portion size or service, but on the filp side I can't see myself telling company from out of state to come with me for a really special breakfast.  I only go to this restaurant for breakfast and I do that once a month so I can only speak to my breakfast experiences.When I click the 3 star rating it says "A-OK" and I think that really sums up the food quality, service, portion size, and cleanliness of the establishment.  To me the 3 star rating is a good rating and I will continue to frequent this restaurant on a regular monthly basis, it's just not someplace that I would take anybody that I wanted to have a really memorable experience.  I saw a previous review mentioning the servers in not to flattering of terminology.  While I can't speak to their experience I can without reservation say that I've always found my servers to be friendly and attentive to my needs.

3.description: You would never know it but this small Mexican restaurant hiding on Laramie has the best pizza in Belmont Cragin. After D'Gigios went downhill we were forced to look for another fix and Durangos absolutely met that requirement. The thin crust is their specialty (and my recommendation). The crust is full of flavor, and when it's cooked perfectly, it is moist and crispy: the delicious  pizza-paradox®. The sauce isn't too sweet and all of the ingredients are fresh.  The cheese is the right amount of chewy. A super bonus is that they have shrimp and spinach--the true test of a good pizza place. The price is awesome for a freshly made pie. Highly recommended.

1.description: Great pizza  and great Mexican food and Mexican style pizza if you like.and the staff is very friendly  .quick delivery

2.description: First time ordering from Durango's. We got a menu on our door and thought we would take a chance and try them. Tacos were good. Pizza was good. We will order from them again.

9.description: Just no. Ate here a few times while visiting a friend absolutely disgusted every single time.

10.description: Hay caramba! We finally tried the pizza from this place!.............wait!?!?! A pizza place that also sells Tacos and burritos!?!?!?!?!! OH OH.....( you must remember us Mexicans make the best cooks)......OK with that being said I can go on...anyway we order a xtra large cheese mushroom and sausage! Thin crust and it was AWESOME!!!!! Nice crispy extra thin crust!!!!!!This crust lovers will like this! good sauce. definitely a place to grab a pie if you are out here on the NW side. There is seating inside and of course univision is on the television!AND if you stop by tell  the awesome pair of brother and sister that run the joint that Pedro Infante sent ya!!!!Shake & Bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: ZERO! Those bike riding skeletors wont wander in this hood(at least for now)..too much culture and ethnic zest for them to handle!

4.description: I used to come here as a young kid often and perhaps my nostalgia betrayed me but I was not impressed with my recent visit. Was not impressed with the quality of the food nor the customer service. There are better options in the neighborhood.

6.description: I've been eating here for years, they have delicious authentic Mexican food and also offer classic options like pizza, burgers, wings etc. Attentive, quick service and delivery in an authentic family owned atmosphere. Can't beat Durango's in Belmont Cragin

12.description: This place is awesome for there food they have great steak burritos tacos I been ordering from this place for years try there pizza I recommend there the best Mexican place I have had

5.description: I hadn't heard of this place until someone left a couple flyers on our complex door. We decided to give it a shot one night, because their weeknight specials are pretty decent. Really good pizza, I really loved their crust. They also have a real range of food to choose from - gives me an my boyfriend variety all in one place. And unlike a lot of other places with larger menus, the food quality didn't seem to suffer from it. I'd definitely order again.

13.description: I love the Italian beef pizza, it's great! I regularly have the steak burrito special which comes with rice and avocado on the side, delicious! The beefs are good too! I recommend this restaurant to locals or passerby's...

11.description: The pizza is not bad, theres definitely better pizza out there. One thing I really do like is their crust in the pizza though. Other than that the food in here is pretty bad..The tacos are really cheap, I decided to try them one day.. Horrible idea, the tacos were so plain and nasty. The Horchata is not very good also, and also they should try improving their customer service. The people always are so serious and the owner I believe, he is always giving an attitude.

8.description: I came here once to grab a quick bite because I was in the area and noticed their sign that advertised $1 slices of pizza. The service was phenomenal. The restaurant itself was very clean and nice. The woman who handled me was very nice and accommodating. I ordered 2 slices of pizza and even though they were supposed to be one dollar per slice they ended up being two dollars a slice which isn't that big of a deal to be honest. I didn't mention the sign outside advertised a different price because I would've felt petty. When the slices of pizza were brought to me, they were piping hot...Which isn't a bad thing at all, but in this case the piping hot slices were on styrofoam plates that were melting and turning black. I didn't say anything about this to the waitress because I didn't want to be rude and I was also in a hurry. Styrofoam aside, the pizza was horrible. Worst slice of pizza I have ever had, hands down. It was very bland even with crushed red peppers and parmesan added. There might be other items they serve that might be delicious but never order single slices of cheese pizza from this place. Little Caesar is better hands down. It's a shame because everything else about the experience was on par. I won't be coming back unfortunately.

0.description: If you didn't know it you'd drive right by. Durango pizza is delicious. This is our to go place when ordering pizza at my mom. I no longer live in Belmont cragin but if I'm in the neighborhood were ordering from here. Crust is thin and crispy. Sauce is great.

7.description: 1 star for the idiot pictured in the photos. Not really interested in a restaurant with customers as stupid as that.

0.description: really one of the best cakes i ever had ,and i really not a big cake person but the cakes here a so good that i fall in live with them ... i been ordering my cakes here for 8 years in a row and the quality is always been the same ,u may pay a few extra bucs but is worth it  because u can't put price on quality......!!!!!!!!!!!

12.description: This place also has great pizza. They add a different kind of spice to their pizza that just takes your breath away. I'm not sure what it is but it's good. They always have fast service and the food is always hot. The prices are reasonable.

7.description: The pizza here is fantastic. Very cheesy and huge amount for the price. Only second to Lonnie's a bit further northwest. Still, I prefer this pizza to any of the big Chicago names.

20.description: Out of all the pizza places in Chicago, this place is my fav.  I LOVE pizza and with the great selection of meats, etc you could never get tired of it.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a cheap, good pizza joint.  Everyone that I tell about it, Love it just as much as I do!!!!  My fav., chicken and mushrooms (easy cheese, extra sauce)!!!

19.description: This is the frist pizza place I really like since I've moved here. I always get it to go because inside is not really a sit down area. It's very small. They're quick, and the pizza is awesome and cheap! $12 for a large with a liter of pepsi.

1.description: Very impressed. Was looking for a cheap local place and came across this place. Great pizza for a great price.

2.description: Been making me fat since I was 10. Love their pizza, fast delivery, and consistent.  Very affordable too.  I mean come on, it's pretty hard to mess up pizza; and these guys do not mess up pizza.  Order from this place.  Forget Little Cesar!  Unless you're ballin on a budget, then I get that.

9.description: I was in the area running errands and I noticed this place and had the hankering for a pizza.  Since I was waiting at a spot to be seen down the street I ran in to chow down a slice of pizza...which of course was JUST coming out of the oven...so I couldn't just inhale it in my rush.  And I am so glad I didn't.It was sooo good.  The sauce was a tomato zesty taste with sausage and cheese melting into my mouth.  Was pretty awesome.  I chatted briefly with the owner, Khan, to tell him how awesome the place was, and he himself at first was alittle shy I guess?  (Maybe he wasn't expecting praise or anything?)  But he opened up alittle, saying he had bought this from a Italian gentleman and just tried to keep up the standard.  He even pointed to a picture on the wall (there are a few pictures of Italy on the wall that came with the place) and said that was the last owners uncle.So after I finished with my appointment I came back for a second slice.  Still good after an hour too, and decided to eat there.  The place itself was small, so I assume take out is more the business there, as a few school kids were haning out there.  (He seems to have a good rapport with them too I notice.)  Khan is a pretty friendly guy...I even said there are only a couple of places that have good pizza by me and I wish this was one of them.Sadly I don't venture into this area much, but if you all do, check this place out.

6.description: Best pizza and staff in Chicago

18.description: Woohoo! Delicious pizza for cheap (not like Little Caesar's but like a good neighborhood pizzeria). I usually only get pepperoni. I've gotten fresh tomato and spinach. It's good!
