Ordered jalapenos once... they were pickled. I prefer fresh better.Haven't tried anything else... don't need to.If you call an order in, it is normally ready within 20 minutes. Meter parking on Diversey.

10.description: The people are very friendly! It's not much of a sitdown place, and the seats need new upholstery.The pizza is great! Always fresh and tastes a little more herby, the fried chicken is crunchy and they have a decent amount of desserts. My family and I have been going here for years, no harm in trying!

13.description: Is this Chicago!? A city known for great pizza?! WHY WHY WHY is is that when I move to the city from the 'burbs, the pizza turns to crap?! I ordered a half bacon with sausage all over pizza, an order of chicken alfredo and cheese sticks. The pizza sauce - SUCKED. Just a bad taste over all. Chicken alfredo - bland. Why would you offer this on your menu if your employees obviously can't make it well. They didn't even try on this one... Cheese sticks - good but again, the marinara sauce was just all wrong. I've noticed this at a few places lately. The sauce is just either under seasoned completely and bland.  or completely over seasoned and disgusting. I totally didn't realize I had ordered here before. I'm mad at myself for ordering their same shitty pasta, twice. On a good note, the pizza tasted really good the next day for lunch. How subpar pizza turns into good pizza by magic of fridge and microwave works, I have no idea.The delivery driver also went to the wrong apartment building twice and was rude. Coluta's, no thank you.

16.description: Decent thin crust pizza. Pretty run of the meal as far as sauce and cheese ratios. The crust was a little dry, but a nice thickness for thin crust. The price is very good and the delivery was on time. This wasn't a mind blowing pizza experience, but it was good and I would order again.

17.description: I tried the baked mostaccioli and my boyfriend tried the rib eye sandwich. The pasta was really good--very fresh and homemade tasting. The pasta was enough for 2 servings and super cheap. My bf said the rib eye sandwich was pretty good. I will be trying more in the future from here!

15.description: Inedible deep dish, crust was hard as cement. Ordered toppings & showed up without (1.5 hours later). Delivery guy was incredibly rude & seemed mystified by the idea of knocking on my door, instead of calling (the wrong number) repeatedly from the doorstep. But hey, I did get a free piping hot liter of pepsi!

0.description: Oh Colutas. everyone knows this is my spot. Cheese fries, mozzarella sticks & a pizza puff is my usual order. I'm not a fan of their ribs, pastas, or burgers, but the BBQ chicken was always a go to. They probably have the best pizza I've ever had. It's whatever they season it with that does the job. I give 4 stars because I wouldn't say everything here is top notch, they just have bomb ass appetizers. Been ordering from here for 10+ years, as long as they don't change my favorite munchie foods, I'll be here as long as they are

5.description: This place has alright food if you are hungry, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  First, they false advertise the prices.  The chicken fingers went up from $5 to $6.60. What??? For 5 little tiny chicken fingers? I think not.  Then, the pasta was on special for a $1 off. Did I get the discounted price. Nope.  I had to remind her of the discount. So make sure you double check your total when you order here, because they don't tell you when they change prices and they don't give you a receipt unless you pay with a credit card and even that receipt doesn't itemize the food. So my review, food is edible but service and honesty is questionable.  When you change prices it should be advertised somewhere, but it was not. The worse part was they could care less what you think about there questionable policies.  When I asked about the prices they just said they changed them.  When I asked where that is advertised the girl said I just found out about it today, but she could not point out anywhere the new price was advertised.  So, I payed for it and what I got was small small little pieces of chicken and a big bill. Never again.  I used this place to buy pizzas for my last school event, but my next event in April  I think I will pass on this place due to their questionable prices.  This place is off my dining list.

11.description: I always get the same thing from here: pizza and the jalapeno cheese popper. Both are the bomb! I have nvr ordered anything except this, but when I do order from here that's all I want.If you've nvr had the jalapeno poppers (and u like that sort of thing) u def gotta order them! They use a fresh jalapeno stuff it full of cheesy goodness, batter and fry. They serve them with a side of sour cream which pairs perfectly. They are so addicting!The pizza is also good Chicago style pizza. Way better than a lot of other pizza joints I've tried on the Northside. And way less expensive than most other pizza places.

8.description: This place sucks, had coupon from entertainment magazine, would not accept it!!!! There pizza isn't the greatest in the world either, and I was gonna throw them a bone because I had a coupon, but then they denied it. Don't eat here this place sucks, owners am asshole, they can stick their pizza up their ass

3.description: If I could give no stars I would. This was by far the worst delivery experience! I see why they offer so many deals I knew I should've canceled when the person taking the order over the phone couldn't understand me and put the wrong numbers in for my card. The food was just plain nasty and cold as if it was frozen pizza and they premade and warmed it depending on order. The so called hot wings looked and tasted like the chicken you buy hot outta food 4 less or jewel by the bakery dept. The only thing good was the fries and Pepsi lol not to mention it took over an hour just for me to pay for cold ass food smh NEVER AGAIN!

14.description: Pizza is pretty good. They also have a good eggplant Parmesan :) good prices for good food.

4.description: Me and my family have been ordering from here for a few years. We stopped going to Giordano's and La Villa. Colutas pizza is the best we've ever had and is always hot and the sauce is so good. They've switched our orders like twice but they've always been happy to help and fix our order. The staff and food is wonderful. Five stars :)

0.description: Half pizzaria... Half grill joint... Half mini mart...  150% cheap and greasy and tasty.On Fridays $3.04 will score you a slice of steak & potato pizza and a soda pop.  Fries on a pizza!  I thought that only existed in the dreams of fat kids.  It's the true lunch of champions...if the sport was eating quickly and being gluttonous.This place is no frills with little to no decor.  If you've ever dreamed of dining inside of a convenience store then this place is definitely for you!

1.description: I'm gonna be honest - I think this place is discriminatory. After reading all of these reviews, and hearing everyone saying they buy"diamonds" here, I believe Adam's jewelry was discriminating against people of color, (me being probably one of the rare persons of color that has walked into the European owned/European clientele jewelry store in a predominant Polish neighborhood). I walked in there looking for a diamond ring as a gift, and the ladies behind the counter literally watched me and my boyfriend at the time, walk in there with out greeting us. Our presence became very awkward in the small jewelry shop as no one acknowledged us and the ladies that were there glanced at us and chatted very loudly with each other in another language. When a woman finally decided to see what we were looking around for, I told her "Hi, I'd like to see all the diamond rings in a size 7 please", before she told me there are NO real diamonds in the store. Everything, and I mean every part of the store I pointed out, she insisted was "cubic zirconia". It was the weirdest thing. I had a hunch something wasn't right when she insisted that.. Reading the reviews that came after mine was posted a couple years ago confirms my suspicion. I didn't jump to conclusions about the store, or the people that worked in it. I was simply being lied to about their entire inventory by the people that work there. Why? Probably to discourage people of color from shopping there.

2.description: Adam K You are full of S**T !!!!Stop lying ! I get my money back only because Department of Business Affairs pay you a visit !!!! I'm very surprised that your store is still in business !!! You are the one who is stating false facts ! None of those happened.You just trying to look nice by writing bunch of bull s**t under my review! So you thing you are a smart*ss ?!I'' going to post all over the internet letter that i got from City Of Chicago Department of Business Affairs !

0.description: Decent prices, compared to chain jewelry stores like Zales & Jared.  Their customer service is non-existent!!  Staff is snobby and rude, the customer is never "right" at this store, forget your refund.

12.description: I don't think I would ever recommend anyone to go here to buy a wedding dress; however from the looks of things, I think they would be great at getting a prom dress but I would never trust them with my wedding gown...It's disorganized and chaotic and it appears as though they have no real inventory system and that is not a good sign especially when you're buying a gown of such great importance.

3.description: This was the only shop that had the prom dress my daughter was looking for.  Unfortunately the only size left is 2 sizes too big.  They offered to alter it at no charge which is very nice.  Mohammad and Sarah are both very nice, TO THE POINT and NO NONSENSE. This is their personality due to culture and shouldn't be taken offensively.  If you take it offensive then the problem is with you.  Laughter is better than tears and I hope the previous person who reviewed is able to laugh at their situation some day!

1.description: I just ordered my wedding dress from this place and im giving 5 stars because in today's world there is a huge deficit of manners and customer service . They are so sweet and very knowledgable about dresses , color hues and different designers. I agree with the other reviews that you may be a little overwhelmed by all the dresses all over but it is a "discount " bridal store .

2.description: I read some of the reviews on here before I went to the shop itself, so I was bracing myself for disorganization and chiffon chaos. I thought I might be able to cheat the system, however, by planning ahead. But first, let me back up. I was on the hunt for three particular styles of bridesmaid dresses from one particular designer for my friend's wedding. I had called around a handful of bridal shops in the area and Discount Sarah's Bridal was the only one that had all three. I called in ahead of time to confirm this and let them know I was planning on coming in a couple of hours. The gentleman on the phone told me they'd locate and set them aside so I could try on all three when I arrived. However, when I got there, only one of the dresses had been found. To be fair, it was a Saturday, and there were probably about five other individuals (plus their friends) perusing the shop for dresses, and only two workers. While I didn't expect them to dote on me, I was surprised when, after trying on the one dress, I was told to just search the rest of the store, dress by dress, for the remaining two, on my own (kind of defeating the purpose of calling in ahead of time). It wouldn't have been so bad if there were any kind of system or order for how the dresses were stored and organized, such as by designer or dress style (strapless over here, one-shouldered here, V-neck over there, etc.). It was like trying to find a needle in a haystack. When I asked if I could get a little assistance in even beginning to know where to look, I was told I *was* being helped--as the only two employees were conspicuously tending to other customers. Like I said, I didn't expect to be doted on, and I wouldn't have even minded having to look on my own if 1) I hadn't gone in with the expectation that the dresses were going to be found for me in the hours between when I called and inquired about them and when I arrived, and/or 2) one of the workers would have been upfront in saying, when I arrived, the other dresses hadn't been found yet, that they were going to try to help when they could, but I may need to do some searching on my own while they were helping other people. Instead, I show up, try on one dress, then feel immediately abandoned as a customer when the woman points to an aisle of dresses and tells me to start looking.

9.description: Agh! So frustrated with this place. I went wedding dress shopping in late April/early May for an August wedding in Colorado. When I found a great dress at Sarah's Bridal, I was very excited to get it at what I believed is well below market price. So I happily paid the deposit, and asked when my dress would arrive. The assistant told me they typically ship dresses at least a month prior to the wedding date (Aug 5th), and I told her since the wedding is not in Chicago, they should subtract a week from that. She said no problem, she'd let the distributor know and they'd adjust the shipping date.In mid May, I called to verify that the dress would be shipping in June/July. She said she didn't have a ship date yet, but to call back in a few weeks. So I did. June 8, June 11, June 25, July 9. Still the same response - they don't have a ship date yet, and I should keep calling back.It's the week of July 19th (2.5 weeks out) , and I'm starting to panic a bit. I call, and the owner (a gentleman) states the shipping date is now July 25th (a Sunday?). I tell him that's not acceptable, as I leave for Colorado on the 31st. He promises it only takes 4 days to arrive. I say 'but that puts arrival on Friday, and I leave on Saturday'. He claims 'no problem, you come in on Friday and we can do alterations in the same day'. Wonderful, except I have to work on Friday having saved my days off for my actual wedding (silly me!). Also, same day alterations make me a bit nervous about the quality they're providing.He then gives me the option to pay an extra $70+ to ship it overnight. After considering it over the weekend, I call on July 26 to say yes please, ship it overnight. The assistant tells me she'll call at noon with a tracking number, and confirm the dresses expected arrival date today, July 27. I wait and then call at 1pm, and the owner says he can't give me a tracking number, but the dress is arriving today he promises, '100%'. I ask why no tracking number, and his response is that UPS will put him on hold for too long and he knows the dress is coming anyway. I even volunteer to call UPS to save him the trouble (seriously) but he says no, they won't give it to me. He does promise to call when my dress gets in, thank you very much. Talk about going above and beyond for your customer.If the dress does arrive today as promised, I will faint with relief, and then run as fast as I can away from this place. While getting a good deal on a dress is great, they aren't worth the hassle.UPDATE: The dress arrived, as promised. They even took $35 off the $70 overnight charge, which was appreciated. And the dress was beautiful, as expected. Still, the hassle and stress encourages me to leave my one star rating as-is, and caution those brides who like to plan and feel secure about their purchase to shop elsewhere. Oh, and you do have to pay the final payment in cash, no check or credit cards. Not a big issue, but still leaves me feeling a bit sketchy about this place.

10.description: When you first walk in this place, you are just completely inundated with dresses.  Prom and bridesmaid dresses in the middle and wedding dresses on the outside racks.  They are all lined up by size from two on up to 32.  So if you are plus size, there are actually quite a few dresses to try on, which is nice.  The store is VERY self serve.  Pick out your own dresses and then the staff will open a room for you.  I recommend bringing a bridesmaid to help lace you into the dresses.  I also went on a weekday (Friday) because they do not make appointments.So while this place isn't going to win any awards for aesthetics, it gets the job done especially if you want to try on a variety of dresses in your size as opposed to just trying to visualize what a dress will look like when its stuffed into a sample size.Price wise the dresses are fairly inexpensive.  All the ones I tried on were under $1000.  Also, unlike a lot of salons all the dresses I tried on had tags intact.I think I am willing to go there again as I continue my quest for a wedding dress.

4.description: Great experience. I don't know anything about suits and I needed one quick for a wedding 4 days away. Mohammed guided me through the options very efficiently and gave suggestions while staying open to my requests. The whole experience was super fast and simple for someone who wouldn't normally enjoy shopping experiences. If you call their phone they answer. I came in at 7:30 p.m. on Tuesday and walked out with my tux around 7:30 p.m. on Thursday. Very quick turnaround. It Looks excellent! Mohammed's guidance and recommendation were spot on! When I told him I was traveling, he even let me borrow a bag to hold the tuxedo! We also stayed open a little bit late on the Thursday for me. Very friendly service willing to meet my needs! Support a small business!

6.description: Let me just preface with: I like this place. I would come here again for alterations.I came here to get a dress altered that I bought somewhere else. They gave me a fair estimate for the amount of work that needed to be done ($60- $10 cheaper than anywhere else I found).The place in general is kinda disorganized. I had to wait about 15 minutes while someone else was trying on dresses to even talk to someone. Once the worker (who turned out to be the owner) was done, she gave me undivided attention. It took about 20 minutes more for the dress to be pinned where it needed to be.They told me the dress would be done in 3 days. Sweet! They would call me. A week later they still hadn't called, but when I called the dress was ready. Okie dokie. I went in that day. Waited another 20 minutes for the owner to acknowledge me (I should have expected that...) and finally got my dress.I get the dress back and it fits like a glove! She even added in some little bra-strap-fasteners for no charge. I was very happy with the work done. Absolutely no complaints.The place is cash only. Keep that in mind when you go. They let you pay with a credit card if it's something like 2 weeks before you pick up the dress, but I didn't do that, so I had to run across the street to a bank. That was a hassle.Overall, like I said, I would come back. Not the best customer service skills, but they did a good job for what I paid.

0.description: I love Sarah's bridal.  They were reasonably priced and easy people to deal with.  Annabellas tried to charge me 3 times the price for the same exact dress.  I ordered a Mori lee dress from the book and it was exactly what I expected.  Gorgeous! Beautiful! and Fabulous!  I even ordered it in less than 3 months from my wedding date and it still arrived a month earlier.  They even did all of my alterations over the course of 3 fittings and added on some applique that I purchased online with no problems for only $179.  They also sewed my bra into the dress and gave me some extra padding to increase my cup size.  They altered my petticoat as well so that it wasn't too long for my dress.  Additionally, they ordered the dresses for all of my bridesmaids as well and they arrived just in time before the wedding.  Even though most of my bridesmaids did not come in time to make their deposits on their dresses, Sarahs bridal still tried to save a few of them a little money on their dresses by cutting it close, and some of my girls were still able to be in the wedding by paying a rush fee with less than 8 weeks left before the wedding.  Thus if you are in a hurry with little time before your big event, Sarah's Bridal will still do their best to accomodate your bridal party and make you guys look flawless at the same time.  I will be referring all my friends and family to them and I look forward to working with them for all of my up and coming special events.  Sincerely,Bridget HarrisSeptember 25th, 2015

5.description: This shop fills a niche that needs to be filled among all of the high-end, designer bridal boutiques in downtown Chicago.  It has dresses at a significantly lower cost, a huge selection in an enormous variety of colors.  I came here because I wanted bridesmaid dresses in a very specific color which I was having trouble finding-- and to be fair, they had a large number of dresses which fit that bill.BUT their hours said they opened at noon on Friday.  They didn't actually open until 12:05 at least.  The woman who was there was really friendly and helpful, but previous reviews had it spot on in describing the level of disorganization in the store.  Dresses are not organized by material, color, designer, or size... Which makes it nigh on impossible to determine which dresses come in which colors.  And they tend to carry the less expensive and trendy styles-- along with styles only from last season (they didn't have anything from this fall's lines).We definitely didn't find any bridesmaid dresses that would work for my wedding here, but the woman working here did everything she could to make that a possibility.  She did somehow magically know their inventory really well, which allowed me to give up on hopelessly sifting through the three overcrowded racks of dresses.One thing they absolutely do need to change, though, is that door chime.  Eegads!

13.description: We were honored to be asked to be in a wedding. The tux, shoes, shirt, and the whole shebang was about $75 less than Men's Warehouse. Not only did Sarah's Bridal find the exact same tuxedo style right down to the shoes, vest and tie but the sizing recommendations were exactly right. My chickadee was also able to obtain her designer bridesmaid's dress here with significant savings over the larger chains. Alterations were spot on, professional and hassle free. Our garments were provided in beautiful shape and more importantly, without delay. For the cost conscious ladies out there, I would advise you to do your research and check out the dresses at the major bridal chains. Once you have locked in on a dress, make your way to Sarah's and you'll be able to save some nice coin. My last tidbit of unsolicited advice, fellow Yelpers, is to afford ample advance time for your tux/dress needs and to let Sarah and her team do the rest. You will not regret it.

11.description: Last year I ordered 4 bridesmaids dresses with only 6 weeks out til the wedding and all arrived as promised and was the best price around.  Alterations fit perfect and at a reasonable price w/in a couple days.  Also had another bridesmaid dress altered here and it was fine, just need to call ahead to make sure when it was ready.  Not the best place to go w/ the entire wedding party b/c it's fairly small and a little chaotic inside, but if you know what you want already, this is the place to go!

8.description: This was probably one of the most negative experiences I've ever encountered in my life. I initially came here once with my mom first to see if the place was worth a shot. Walking in, the amount of dresses on the racks is extremely intimidating. We basically weren't even acknowledged, so after about 10 minutes of browsing on our own we walked to the back of the store where we found someone there (I think the owner). We were pressed on time as it was our last stop shop for the day, so I figured I would come back with all of my bridesmaids.Now the mess begins. When we arrived, we were told to browse around by ourselves and pick out some dresses we liked. She just stood there not really asking any questions or being helpful at all. We finally found a few beginning styles of what we would like the dresses to look like, so all she did was stick the girls in a room and walk away. There were little pin needles all over the floor of the dressing room that one of my bridesmaids almost stepped on until she saw (um how is that even safe?) Anyways, when my bridesmaids walked out and were talking about the dresses and what they liked or didn't like I had a question. (HERE IS THE PART YOU NEED TO READ) The woman finally came around and I decided to ask how the alterations would work considering one of my bridesmaids was determined to lose weight before my wedding. She even made a b***** comment prior to fetching the dresses for the girls saying "Don't worry we have a bigger size in that style to fit her too" as she was pointing out my friend. Then, when she looked at my friend when she stepped out in the dress she proceeded to ask "Well how many months pregnant is she?" asking all of us...... UMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM mind everyone reading this, my friend is A. not pregnant and B. not even close to looking like she is!!!!! Rude, disrespectful, ignorant, and just extremely messed up for a BUSINESS OWNER to assume something like that of someone who is a potential buyer in their store. WTF was she thinking!?!?!? Wait, clearly she wasn't thinking before she spoke. I felt really terrible as my bridesmaid locked the door to the fitting room and started crying. Seeing my friend cry over an extremely uncalled for insult by a woman working a business was enough to convince me to never step foot in there again. She clearly felt really STUPID and walked away and then came back trying to show us a different dress. I confronted her telling her we were going to leave and that she owed an apology. She apologized to me as I cut her off telling her NO, you need to apologize to the person who you made the remark to, that was really mean! And she said "I'm sorry" as quickly as she possibly could, NOT EVEN MEANING IT, not being genuine, just because she had to. What an ugly person. The fact that I had to confront her about apologizing just goes to show what kind of ignorant person she is. I will never go back here again.I will never recommend this place to anyone.I will never wish this type of negative experience upon even my worst enemy.I will NEVER tolerate someone treating people I care about in this type of way.I just wanted to point out that a bride shopping with her bridesmaids for dresses should be a positive, fun, exciting experience. I feel like owners of bridal shops should encourage this. The fact that she had the nerve to insult my best friend just like that PISSED me off more than anything as I walked out of there dealing with a racing heart, shocked mood, and upset friend. F that. No one should ever feel like this.If I could, I would give this place ZERO STARS!!!! This place does not deserve business because the owners behind the place or at least one of them is a cruel person.

14.description: I went into this store and Sara was a great help! She was very nice and made shopping for my dress very pleasant.  She has a ton of really nice dresses at amazing prices.  My only complaint is the store is a little overwhelming because of so many dresses and they are not in order.  But there is plenty to choose from.

7.description: Thieves! Thought we were getting a good price for bridesmaids dresses, turns out size chart is fixed to make it seem like everyone is larger than they appear, the owners then rack up on alterations if the dresses are to big once they get them back.  I am so pissed off and now to top it off the order was placed a month ago, so this leaves no other choice but to stick with this fool.

3.description: Me and the wife had lunch there and we where expecting some great Puerto Rican food and it was just that we where very satisfied. We would plan another lunch there in the future.

1.description: Awesome !! Just awesome .. I didn't expect the quality of food that came out of that kitchen , but wow is all I have to say!!

2.description: So right of the bat I'll start by saying that the great music is way too loud for a relaxed dinning experience. Kids are having much fun with the wobbly tables. The waitress was pleasant and served us a nice portion of french bread. Some cold water would be nice. The food we ordered was great, definitely recommend the "mofongo".

5.description: If you are looking for an authentic Puerto Rican restaurant give this place a shot.  The service is a little slower than usual, but definitely worth the wait. Food is inexpensive and full of flavor.

6.description: So last night had a craving for Puerto rican food , and since we move up north it so hard to really get that especially authentic Puerto Rican food don't get me wrong I'm sure it probably good but ,not great like some ones who's from Puerto rican decent that there abuela taught them. So after searching yelp and making some calls came across La Delicia , Omg we went  here for dinner and it was soooooo good  not greasy or blah,not super salty or made wrong,like some place do. It was on the money just like , if I had drove all the way to humble park ,the portion were huge and the Jibaritos ,were awesome  with fresh mojo. The food was nice and hot  the spot fill up fast with family's and it will be my to go place will be visiting again definitely .

0.description: Rumor was that the cook from another favorite Puerto Rican restaurant opened up this place.  We decided to give it a try. ... food was excellent! !!!!!We ordered pollo guisado, sandwich de steak, sandwich de lechon , pork chops and a bunch of appetizers. .. awesome! Portions are a good size! Can't wait to go back.

4.description: You don't go there for the scenery or a 5 five star service you go there to eat authentic and delicious food!! Love it.. Try there weekend menu

1.description: Every time I stop to get my coffee I would say this time it would be better than last time. However, they let me down each time!! Not sure what is the exact problem, but as an ex-Dunkin donuts worker I can tell that there is something wrong with the coffee machine they have there. Also, the coffee must be discard after 18 minutes however I guess there they would not throw it and instead it give it to customers.

2.description: Pizza Party Pooper- The drive thru employee pocketed my change.  She took advantage of the fact I was rushing, she messed up my order and I was distracted to keep about $16 that was meant for school children.  Let me explain: The drive thru line is long on Fridays so of course, you want to get your coffee and move asap so other people can be serviced.  I noticed I did not have my change and went inside. When I confronted the employee- she was like why would you drive off without a receipt and change-, well because it took forever, they handed me the wrong bag and I am NOT expecting to get ROBBED by a business I frequent. I go there EVERY week, sometimes a couple times per week, and its always the same routine, put my change and food on the passenger seat. Someone checks the register, at which point I am late and she says its correct, which means the change is in her pocket along with my receipt. The reason I needed to break the $20 was because today is the last day of school and I needed change to buy my first graders the pizza they earned for their end of the year party.  So enjoy my change, dunkin donuts drive thru thief, hope it was worth it, taking money from a class of 6 year olds.  I emailed a complaint, I hope she doesn't do this to anyone else.

0.description: Warning! If you want a cup of good tasting Dunkin' Donuts coffee, don't go to this store! I'm convinced they water down their dark roast. I took my lousy tasting dark roast iced coffee back and exchanged it for a cup of hot dark roast only to find the same watered-down nasty tasting coffee.  I won't be stopping there again even though it's convenient to where I work.

3.description: So...I'm sittin' on the couch starvin' like Marvin the Martian and I figure I'll order Mexican delivery. The food tastes AWESOME! I'm vegan, and ordered the veggie burrito minus the cheese and sour cream and it came fully loaded with veggies----most places do beans, rice, & tomatoes only. The fries were crinkle fries and they are quite tasty as well---and the HUGE horchata for $2.95 was GREAT!Why the one star you wonder? Because the second time I ordered I was suppose to get a free order of guacamole with my order of $30----and I didn't get it.When I tried to call the restaurant, no answer. When I tried to call the delivery guy---twice---no answer. When I contacted Grubhub.com customer service she said that the hostess at the restaurant was very sure she put the guac in my bag and REFUSED to re-deliver. ??????HUH??????? A customer says they didn't get something and you basically just say 'SCREW YOU'. O_O. So I definitely could have called the restaurant back and went all Chuck Norris times infinity on their answering machine, but Grubhub.com gave me a ten dollar discount code to make up for it. *puts down tazer set to kill* Lucky THEM.But I can guarantee this restaurant will not see another order from me again, EVER.

1.description: I love this Mexican restaurant. I ordered tacos de lengua and tacos of carne asada and they were delicious. Their servers are very sweet and are always courteous. The one time I came (Saturday), their chiles rellenos needed to be heated a little more. They were a bit cold.

2.description: This place is GREAT! I went into this place after hiking in the woods for several hours, so I probably could have eaten an entire horse, but I really loved what I ordered. Lady Z also ordered some great food. There is a nice vegetarian section, not tons in it, but nicely stacked. I had some fried items stuffed with potato and cheese, they were delightful and were partnered with some pleasant beans and rice, very pleasant. I ordered a Michelada that pretty much converted my entire mouth into a palace of erotic pleasures. The slasa is great, red and green come out right away with a basket of pleasant chips, for FREE. This is a great family business, vegetarian friendly and meat eater friendly, good for everyone except for people that hate Mexican food, but who cares what those people think, right?

5.description: When I lived by six corners I would order from here. I discovered them on grub hub. First order I placed was screwed up. I like my tacos simple. Only lettuce cilantro and onions. Nothing else. They sent me tacos with the total opposite. Cheese, tomatoes and sour cream. I ordered like 8 of them so when I called they told me to keep those and sent me the correct order. So I got 16 tacos for the price of 8. Mom had the first batch. But future orders were no problem except one other time when they did it again. But for my friend this time. He doesn't like cheese or onions and they sent them with cheese and onions. But I give this place 4 stars for a reason and that reason is they are the best tacos in Chicago. I really miss this place because they won't deliver to the Norwood Park area even though I told them I have been a long time customer. They really didn't care. I would give an extra tip but they still said no. Guess they really don't care.

6.description: This used to be Zacatecas and i think they just changed the name--the food tastes the same. It is very affordable and one of the better Mexican restaurants in the area. We typically get takeout and can eat lunch for about $5 each. The burritos are very good and comparable to El Cid (my favorite).

7.description: Quick delivery, very tasty, hot and fresh! I love the tilapia tacos, lengua is awesome too. Typical Mexican food, exactly what you expect and want. There are tons of Mexican places in Logan square but until now I hadn't had any good delivery. Recommended!

0.description: So my gal and I decided to try El Jerenzano because we were craving Mexican food and I had some credits on Restaurant.com to burn... we were not dissapointed. We ordered the fajitas, shrimp for her, carne asada for me. Both were served piping hot and it huge portions, even the shrimp, which some places tend to skimp on. Often times the carne asada steak at the cheap-to-moderately priced Mexican joints can be tough and gristly, but not at El Jerenzo. The asada was tender and delicious and very flavorful. The homemade salsa was also very good.Over all I'd say El Jerezano is a well above-average, affordable Mexican joint that is well worth a visit!

4.description: I was craving chilaquiles the other day. Ordered from here through grubhub and they were delicious. Exactly what I wanted.

28.description: First time eating here. Can from Los Angeles...we loved the breakfast, from biscuits and gravy to steak and eggs and pancakes. Everything was very tasty and freshly made. Would def come back on my next trip here. And the service was excellent!!!

1.description: What can say, Best veggie omelette in town!the staff is awesome,the owner nick is like a  grandfather I never have.....love this place

39.description: The owner is a complete doll which explains why this place is usually packed with regulars he knows by name.  This place has the best steak and eggs the city has to offer and he brings in fresh meat and produce regularly.  It is a family owned place so skip the Ihop and opt for some real cooking from Nick.

9.description: Came in had a wonderful time. Waitress was very friendly and always checking on us. Food was so delicious that I was salivating more than usual.

29.description: Come here often Great food never had any issues. Get the skirt steak n eggs delicious!

23.description: We love Nick's and go for breakfast at least every other week. Perhaps we will go tomorrow.

5.description: Great cozy neighborhood restaurant. Service was warm and friendly. Had the skirt steak skillet and was amazingly good.

31.description: I come here almost every weekend and never thought to give it a review, so here it is, the pancakes are awesome, the steak and eggs are great, steak is always cooked to perfection, not a fancy place but it's clean with a friendly staff, good food cooked how you order it, oh and I almost forgot, a great burger!!

25.description: I live around the corner and my boyfriend said he liked the place but he usually came to eat in the mornings so from his experience, he had a different waitress and possibly a different cook. We both went for lunch. For starters, we were given menus after our drinks came which didn't bother me much but that prolonged the process. I was a little upset with how long it took the waitress to provide service because my boyfriend was going to work soon and we were trying to have lunch and good conversation before he had to leave. I ordered the fruit crepes and the hashbrowns  (which are both amazing at Golden Nugget on Diversey). I also had the strawberry milkshake which was actually tasty but the crepes were too thick and greasy (which is not how they are supposed to be) and the hash browns were burnt and not very tasteful. It might be that I'm used to a mouth full of flavor and spices and the food here was very bland. The service was very slow while I also noticed that the only people in the place were my boyfriend and I and an older man with his father. I was unsatisfied, unfortunately and probably will not go back unless my boyfriend really wants to go in the morning when there is a different cook and waitress.

12.description: I was so excited when I heard this place delivered breakfast, being new to the city and always asking for recommendations on food, this place was always highly spoken of. My ordered was placed a hour and 15 minutes prior to me getting it. The driver delivering my food was not in fact a worker of the establishment but just a customer they "begged" to make the delivery. I ordered drinks that never made it. Food was cold, and didn't look appealing at all. The food was smushed to one side of the containers like it had fallen over. I was really let down by this place for not putting more care into making sure I got the best experience. To top it off, the driver came back after leaving to tell us he gave us too much change back, and I know how much I handed him and how much I got back but was in no mood to argue, and when I told him about the mistakes I was told it wasn't his problem, he is only a customer. I'm very sorry to say I will not ever be returning or ordering from this place ever again.

37.description: Solid neighborhood cafe. A great place for breakfast. Service can be a little slow when there is only one server,and they forgot a few items like toast and more coffee and cheese on my mother-in-law's omelet but they were very apologetic and fixed everything. I would definitely go back!The breakfast sandwiches are worth a try.

21.description: I just had the best BLT sandwich I've had in a long time. The bacon was fresh and the lettuce was crisp and the combination of all three flavors and crispness made it delicious. I love going to Nicks Hi Ho Cafe. The warm welcome of the owner to all his customers make this place like home.

16.description: I've been coming here for years and I must say the food is always great from their breakfast skillet to thier daily lunch specials.they make everything fresh. They have great soups daily.every Sunday they have my favorite cream  of chicken rice soup.service is excellent. You must give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

17.description: Wow! Just great!  We used to go to the Hi-Ho at Addison and Pulaski where in the back was their lovely Starlite Room.  We so enjoyed it back in the day (especially the organist they had). Well, more great dining here on Cicero!!!

10.description: Nick's Hi-Ho is mighty scrumptious.  After moving to the neighborhood almost a year ago, figured I would check out this place.  Sure, any place can make halfway decent breakfast and lunch food, but Nick nails it.  Not only does Nick do a great job cooking up food, but Margie is the sweetest, serving up food with a smile.  If you're looking for mimosas and organic applewood bacon, this isn't your place, but if you're looking for a solid restaurant serving up homemade breakfast, soup, sandwiches in a friendly place that time seemed to have forgotten, this is for you.

11.description: We just love it here. We live down the street, we come here every two weeks and the staff and food is just great. If you like diners, make sure you check out this spot.

26.description: Nicks hiho cafe is the best place for breakfast tasty food there steaks and omlets are delicious stop in asap and check it out you won't be disappointed

27.description: Great neighborhood diner!! The food was great and very friendly service! I loved the french fries here, my son loved the Thin French Toast breakfast special ! Can't wait to come here again

35.description: This place *rocks*.  I had strawberry chocolate chip pancakes (so yummy!) there this morning, and I'm still happy from them an hour later.  They have very reasonable prices and friendly service. I know my husband and I will be going there for breakfast often.

8.description: We went to Nick's based on the yelp reviews as we are always looking for a neighborhood gem. Family diner with its typical old Chicago 1970's charm. I can appreciate that atmosphere since I'm a Chicagoan myself, but... When we sat at our table, we had our choice of where, it had two dirty coffee cups and the table should have been cleaned again. Waitress was very nice, so no complaints there. Then the food. So many reviews raved about it, I was excited to enjoy my meal. French toast with bacon for me and 3 Dueces for my hubs. Mediocre at best, sorry Nick, my bacon was crispy like I like it, but flat burnt crispy, French toast was very eggy and not cooked all the way through in some parts. My hubs was ok with his, but he claims average at best, bland even.  If it wasn't for the dirty cups and table they might get a 3 star review from me because they were really nice people. The food needs a makeover.

0.description: Good for a cheap & friendly meal. I personally don't like the type of potatoes they have for hash browns but that's an opinion, not a review on the food or service. Half the price of most breakfast places and I've never had to wait for a table like other places.

38.description: Clean, simple, inexpensive family restaurant/diner.  Great comfort food.  Friendly staff.  I wondered how the place got its name, but then I realized that this is the customary greeting in Portage Park.

20.description: Looking for a place to set a buddy-cop movie in Chicago? This is the joint. Old school diner with solid diner food, and super friendly staff.

19.description: Great old school Greek Style diner. Excellent omelets, very good steak and eggs, obviously handmade grandma style "kefte"  hamburgers that were fresh and delicious. The owner is almost always there, often cooking, the other cooks are just as good. My favorite is the hungry man's corn beef hash skillet, a hangover cure if ever there was one. Makes you feel like you've stepped back in time to the 70's at a Greek joint during the 6 am breakfast rush somewhere on Madison or Halsted Street. Price is reasonable, portions are big, place is clean, great value for the money.

33.description: Good little old school diner in the Craigen neighborhood. Food is good, service is excellent, but place still has some residue of the smoking days.

2.description: I love this place!!!! It's a hidden gem that everyone needs to go to. Everyone is super nice and service is great. Nick is very friendly!!! Just a great stop.

34.description: Walked in and immediately was greeted by a lovely elderly waitress that made me feel like i was part of her family. After we sat down, the owner with a warm smile, welcomed us to his restaurant. I ordered a mexican skillet that was really good, but my son ordered a greek omelet with gyro meat,spinach and feta that was to die for.  I feel like its a hidden gem. I think I found a my new breakfast place!

32.description: I loved this place! If I lived in Chicago, I would go here all the time. It's my kind of diner. There are tons of regulars who seem to come in every day and know the waitress and cook well. All of the dishes were cheap, delicious and hearty. You get a lot of good for the price. I'm not saying that this is the best breakfast food I've ever had but it was good, it was affordable and it felt like home.

18.description: Love this place coffee is freshly grounded food is made to order staff is awsome and the owner nick what can i say wrong very pleasant every time we come here

13.description: Love this place - walking distance from our house - reasonably priced and great food and staff!

4.description: Service is  slow. Food is good. Owner is  okay.   The employers usually is owner don and a cook The soups out good

24.description: This place stole my heart last year when i got the skirt steak. Thaaat is goooooood eatin.Is it the most inviting place from the outside? No. But once you go inside and sit down the waitstaff are all oncredibly friendly and attentive. The food comes fast and its always good.  I am a sucker for steak and eggs for breakfast and this is without a doubt the place to go for that.Afforable and super tasty. I always leave in a happy mood.

6.description: Just moved around The neighborhood and figured we would give this mom and pop shop a chance . We enjoyed our breakfast very much.  Fresh ground coffee which was delicious  definitely will be back for breakfast

22.description: Nicks Hi Ho is a gem and a breath of fresh air.  The home style cooking and the being treated like family is unparalleled in the city of Chicago. The Greek chicken wrap and cream of chicken rice soup is out of this world.  Do yourself a favor and get to Nicks Hi Ho as soon as you can.

15.description: Found Nick's restaurant on Yelp and gave it a try on Saturday. We were in the neighborhood and wanted to find a local diner for breakfast. We fell in love with this place and can understand why it gets such good reviews. Everyone was friendly, and the food was delicious. Our waitress Margie was genuinely kind and had a great sense of humor. We met Nick, the owner, and he made us want to come back again just to see him. I had the veggie skillet and I would definitely get it again next time. We were treated like family at Nick's Hi-Lo Restaurant and I would go out of my way to go there again.

40.description: Biggest and best omelets in Chicago, guaranteed. Best  restaurant in the city. Nick will treat you with the greatest respect and serve you beautiful comfort food. Go eat there now. Nick will even cater your party. Right now.

7.description: Nicks hi hoe cafe is amazing!!!! Great food great conversation! Nick knows many of his customers I. A first name basis which only shows how much he cares ! Ole school just like going to grandmas house. And the place is very cozy no screams no shots just good ole people looking for a good ole plate to eat !!!  I wish businesses would remember how it is to cater to there customers.  Stop by and be the judge I'm sure your going to love Nick and the staff!!! A+

36.description: Stopped in for some breakfast the day after Christmas. Small "Mom & Pop" style diner. Immediately greeted with open arms by Nick (owner) and a great server. Meat Lover's skillet I had was great and the Biscuits & Gravy my girlfriend had were even better. Very attentive server throughout the entire meal. It also was nice of the server to occupy our 1yr old lol. As we were paying the bill, we traded a few stories about "how did you find us?" "live nearby?" and of other restaurant experiences. Nick asked us to wait a second. He went into the back and came out with a Christmas present (Greek style) welcoming us to his restaurant. AWESOME. That's a first for me. Felt like part of the family. I will most definitely be back.

30.description: good food as a neighborhood joint goes.

3.description: First time here today around 10:30am and boy, was there a rush. It was a pretty busy place but the service was friendly and just great overall. The ladies there were relatable and super nice!! The food was good for the price. It was great to support a local business. I'll be sure to be back again seeing all the regulars here. Everyone seemed to know eachother by names and asked about one another's family and friends which is so nice to see.

14.description: I saw a great review and decided to check it out. The space is old and run down. The family that ran it seemed overworked and barely had the energy to clean tables between guests. I refused to sit down until they cleaned the table again. The omelet I had was o.k. I live in walking distance to this place and I will never go there again.

1.description: We used Robert for our wedding last Friday and the flowers were absolutely stunning!!!  I could not have been any happier with how they turned out!  He also set up our ceremony and reception spaces which both looked amazing.  Robert was able to work within my budget and gave some great ideas.  My husband and I keep saying we were so glad we worked with him.  I highly recommended Robert for any event!

2.description: Robert has been in the business for quite a long time, & does very nice work. He also shares his knowledge with the community by teaching Adult continuing ed classes @ Wright Junior College

0.description: Best florist out there!  Absolutely beautiful arrangements and love suggestions from him and Patrick.

28.description: Daniel & MK are amazing.After getting several estimates, MK had the best price and best turnaround time for getting a Viper remote start, full window tint & enabling bluetooth on my '09 Audi. It was very convenient to get my tints and electronics all done in one shop.  The other places that I called gave inflated prices and were not as professional. When I called MK, Daniel took the time to explain everything thoroughly without making me feel pressured. The install was fast, clean & everything works perfectly. MK's staff was very knowledgeable and trustworthy throughout the whole process. The price alone was enough to sell me, but I found the service and convenience to be unmatchable in the Chicagoland area. I highly recommend MK.*From the looks of the other cars in the shop, this seems to be where the Chicagoland gearheads go.

1.description: Ok I've been to this place since they opened, So far so good, but of course I referred a co-worker to this place for a remote starter he had the worst experience it took a total of 3 days and at the end they made him pay for something that when the car went in was working when it left their shop wasn't working so they made him pay for it. I'm giving them 3 stars because I've been going to this place for many years, but if it was my first visit I don't think I would of gave them 3 stars maybe 1.

9.description: Great place. Competitive price. Quality work done fast. Got double din audio installed and tint all the way around and they charged me $280, down from the $300 they quoted me on the phone. I checked-in and got $20 Yelp coupon to bring it down to $260 and he wasn't happy about that because he thought he already gave me $20 off but he honored it. The place is well-managed. Big garage. Super knowledgeable when I called for quote. And the work was done fast and efficiently. Great job MK!

29.description: Great shop. I had to have my tints redone and I needed new sounds for my WRX. They did a great job on both. I would definately recommend them to a friend

23.description: Fantastic family business! Great customer service! Unbeatable prices!! I love this place and would recommend it to anyone! I had no idea what I was doing (had a stereo, needed it installed but didn't want to buy the extra special fancy GM kit) and had called around to a few other places in the area. Every other place I called was WAY more expensive and very rude and didn't want to sell me anything other than the $200 GM kit which I didn't want!! I was almost going to give up and then I found MK!I believe it was Sam? (the son) and the father that helped me out. They were both very nice, very informative and answered every little question I had. Not only did the whole process take only an hour (and they were able to get a regular kit to fit!), but Sam recommended a great Mexican food place up the street for us to get some lunch while we waited...and even called us to let us know the car would be ready in 20 minutes.The best part? They had quoted me a very reasonable price - and even though there ended up being a small complication with my particular model, they still honored the original price even though it should have cost me $25 more!These guys are super nice and you should check them out! You won't be disappointed and you'll feel great for helping out a small family business! These guys are real pros!

5.description: Got my remote starter and security system installed today.  Every place I called quoted me $1200 for my Audi, I called and spoke to Dan and he explained to me what needed to be done and how much.  I asked if I could come in on Monday to talk about the detail with him.  I walked out today with everything I wanted for half the price.  Over all great quality work!  Good job MK and thank you Dan and Sam!

31.description: I was recommended here by a buddy and it's a great shop! the service and prices were great, i got a radio, tints, and automatic starter which wound up being one of the best purchases i've made especially these past couple of days, no lie my car was buried under the snow and the remote starter came to my rescue hahaHonestly I was shocked at the deal  they gave me and customer service was great, I'm really nit picky when people work on my car but from my detailed inspection they did a excellent job especially the tints! i definitely recommend  MK electronics to anybody looking for a stereo system, tints or any other toys for their car.

25.description: These guys are terrific. Great prices. Fast, friendly service. A locally-owned business that really delivers the goods.

12.description: Very Honest..  I had a car alarm put in and they did great work.  The car alarm model I asked for had been upgraded and they were like "good for you" never any mention of more money.   I told them I thought my stereo sounded ok but wondered if throwing speakers in would improve.  After a listen, he said "No, this sounds great for stock.. leave it alone".  Great guys good advice and fair!

21.description: Came here to get an overhead DVD player installer.  Neighborhood was a bit shady but that's where you find most of these shops. They quoted the lowest price but I got a good vibe from their sales guy. Didn't seem so shady like Mobile Audio down the street on Milwaukee. So far, the unit looks great and functions like it should. Happy overall with the price and service.

16.description: FRIENDLY AND GREAT SERVICE!!!I was looking for window tinting service for my girlfriend's '11 Camry. Check out several places on yelp and this place has the best review so we decided to bring her car in last Friday. The location was easy to find. We walked in and they have a nice display of different types of alarm and car stereo available. We met Sam first and he was nice and friendly. Right away he told us Danny is the owner and he'll be right out. Then Danny came out and greet us. We told him what we were looking for and what he would suggest. He just got done finishing up another vehicle. He took his time explaining to us about different shades and how it would look on the car. We were going to go with medium tint but after seeing the finished car which is also black color with light tint on the front and medium tint on the back we decided to go with lighter tint which was what Danny suggest. This doesn't make the car too dark and is legal. Last thing we want is be worrying about getting tickets. The price was great and cheaper than couple places I had called so we left the car there and Danny told us to come back in 3 hours. When we came back to pick up the car we were really happy with the work. Light tint came out perfectly with black car. We were very satisfied with the work that I brought my car in today to get it tinted also. I highly recommend MK Electronics if you want honest, friendly, and great service.  My car came out nice and clean. Also there's no materials left behind.

17.description: These guys are fantastic - if I could I would give them SIX stars!     They are knowledgeable, competent, efficient, fast and friendly.       When my cheap car speakers went out, Dan didn't try to upsell me.  He got me replacements that were actually better quality and at the best price I found in the Chicago area.  The installation was super fast and Mike even fixed some loose door parts. You can't do better than that!     I went to MK because of their excellent Yelp reviews - and now I'm adding another five stars to the list.

10.description: Got my remote start and tints done here, both top quality. Dan and everyone I encountered was very nice,  I can't imagine anyone having anything negative to say.  The only thing they could work on is communication,  like let people know when you've started their car or maybe when they'll be done in 30/60 minutes. Other than that,  I'd say they're the best in Chicago, ive referred a handful of friends already.

11.description: Yelpers,I ended up going back to Dan at MK for some tint on my Suburban.  Again, it was nothing short of an excellent experience over there.  It was so good that I ended up coming back about 30 minutes later for Dan to install tint on my wife's car.  There is nothing better than dealing with someone who is not only extremely personable and knowledgeable, but someone who also wants to make sure you are 110% satisfied.  That being said, every product he sells there has a lifetime guarantee because that is how much he stands behind his products and his professional installations.  Of course he ended up giving me a discount for doing 2 vehicles, but I would gladly spend my money at his shop any day of the week based on my experiences with him.  I would recommend this company for anything related to an automobile that they install because you will only be dealing with the best!  Stop shopping prices and ending up with mediocre garbage when you can get the same price or damn close for PROFESSIONAL grade products and extremely PROFESSIONAL workmanship.  The extra $20 you may spend there is well worth the quality and the lifetime guarantee on their products, which means a lot considering they are a family owned operation in business for over 30 years now.  Hope this helps push you all over the fence to know you need not look any further because this place is the BEST of the BEST hands down. Thanks again Dan and MK!

26.description: I haven't had my service done just yet, but I spoke with Sam about some questions and concerns I had today. He was extremely informative, answered all my questions and most of all was very nice! Their website looks great and by the sounds of it, they guarantee all of their work. I can't wait to experience my new remote starter for my car and doing business with such a customer conscious company!

27.description: I was extremely lucky to find MK Electronics on yelp hoping to buy my wife's surprise birthday gift. I made several calls based on the reviews. Not only was the price on a remote starter competitive but the clincher was Daniel's service. Go ahead and call every location and I assure you that this location will treat you as if you are their most coveted sale. On top of the remote starter I happened to check out the various other bell and whistles they provide. It was like a kid in a candy store. So to add on my wife's gifts I decided to add an iPod adapter into her console. She was sways listening to pandora through a gadget purchased through amazon and all you would get is static. I can't tell you enough how great it sounds now!!!! Very happy with both products and especially the amazing service.  To top things off, I was sure this would be a long day knowing I had to wait around till my wife's car was done. Well good thing they had a comfortable lobby with cable and very clean restroom.  Time flew by as if I were at home. I absolutely rate this place 5 stars and you'd be making a mistake not taking your service here. Always ask for Daniel!!!!

0.description: So I'm moving back to San Diego and California state law only allows 70% tint on drivers and passengers side windows - I had Indiana regulation tint of 35% so it definitely had to be removed if I didn't want the $300 tint ticket in Cali. I found MK on yelp and am so happy I called them! I spoke with Sam on the phone who was really friendly and set me up with an appointment for the following week with Dan - I could have gotten in sooner but just couldn't find the time.  Went in and was greeted with a big smile and firm handshake from Dan - talk about great first impression! He listened as I explained to him that the passenger and driver's side window tint needed removed and replaced with 70% tint.  My back windows were limo black so I was a little concerned with how it would look but he assured me he thought it would look great considering my car is only a 2 door so the back window wouldn't be so obvious.Much to my surprise, the new tint looked awesome! Talk about an adjustment to go from 35% to 70% but it's not nearly as bad as I thought it would be.  Dan even finished earlier than I had anticipated and charged me $20 less than what he and Sam initially quoted me.  The tint was absolutely perfect and flawless.  I couldn't be happier with the results and having tint removed and replaced for only $75 makes me a very happy girl! Thanks again Dan!

20.description: EXCELLENT! FRIENDLY! FAST! I was initially going to have the dealership install a remote starter but their service center could care less about their customers. I ended up saving $150 by going to MK, which happened to be half a mile from home. Plus, their remote start (Viper) has a 5-year warranty with it. They went above and beyond today -- even drove my husband back to our house while the installation was being done. We plan to take our cars here in the future. Support this neighborhood business!

19.description: Daniel & MK are amazing.After getting several estimates, MK had the best price and best turnaround time for getting a Viper remote start, full window tint & enabling bluetooth on my '09 Audi. It was very convenient to get my tints and electronics all done in one shop.  The other places that I called gave inflated prices and were not as professional. When I called MK, Daniel took the time to explain everything thoroughly without making me feel pressured. The install was fast, clean & everything works perfectly. MK's staff was very knowledgeable and trustworthy throughout the whole process. The price alone was enough to sell me, but I found the service and convenience to be unmatchable in the Chicagoland area. I highly recommend MK.*From the looks of the other cars in the shop, this seems to be where the Chicagoland gearheads go.

33.description: I did my research before coming here and I found that this was the best place I found in the Chicagoland area and drove 30 minutes to get here from the suburbs. Friendly people, honest and great service.  Daniel was very helpful. They have been around for 25 years and it shows that they know what they are doing and what they are talking about.  Not only are their prices reasonable but the service is great and they make sure that it is installed right.  I will definitely come here again.

2.description: RIP OFFS!!!They put in my remote start so when my xm radio started acting up I asked them if they could look at it and tell me what was wrong. I had to pay them up front $40.00 which I wasn't too happy about but was told they would definitively tell me what was wrong and I could take that $40.00 to use towards repairing the unit. After over an hour in the shop they told me definitively it was the unit receiver. Not the wiring or the antenna. Then they offered me some device for over $100.00 they said would make it work. I ordered a new receiver and dock which did nothing to fix the problem. I went back to them and they back peddled saying they only said it might be the unit. Really? For $40.00 I could have guessed that too! I paid to know - not guess - what the problem was. So far no refund. Not happy having paid out good money for NO SERVICE! Will never use or recommend them again! Rip offs!!!

34.description: Awesome shop.  These guys know their stuff.  These guys banged out a remote start, new headunit and an ipod kit  witgh a super clean intall for way less than every other place we checked out.  Ask for Daniel and you'll be in good hands, he runs the place and knows his stuff.  Remote start, car stereo, alarms, mobile video, these guys do an awesome job.  I saw a SICK custom Impala in the install area when I was waiting for my ride and I was blown away by the custom speaker box they did in that ride.  Wow.

32.description: Before I owned my BMW, I had a 2000 black Honda Civic sedan.  I had M&K install the remote start and alarm once I started working.  As a nurse working the night shift, I was able to remote start my car from inside the hospital before I walked out to the freezing cold.  By the time I got to my car, it was already warmed up and I was ready to go!I now plan of having them install the Viper Smart Start on my BMW using my Iphone to start the car.   They have done a great job in the past, and I know I will be pleased once I get it for my new car.

18.description: I actually got my windows tinted here probably about two years ago..and let me tell you... they still look amazing..there's no bubbles & I got a really good dealand it looks really nice on my BMWThey also gave me a warranty for the tints but i mean.. he did such a great job that i dont even know if i actually need the warranty.

13.description: Fantastic family business! Great customer service! Unbeatable prices!! I love this place and would recommend it to anyone! I had no idea what I was doing (had a stereo, needed it installed but didn't want to buy the extra special fancy GM kit) and had called around to a few other places in the area. Every other place I called was WAY more expensive and very rude and didn't want to sell me anything other than the $200 GM kit which I didn't want!! I was almost going to give up and then I found MK!I believe it was Sam? (the son) and the father that helped me out. They were both very nice, very informative and answered every little question I had. Not only did the whole process take only an hour (and they were able to get a regular kit to fit!), but Sam recommended a great Mexican food place up the street for us to get some lunch while we waited...and even called us to let us know the car would be ready in 20 minutes.The best part? They had quoted me a very reasonable price - and even though there ended up being a small complication with my particular model, they still honored the original price even though it should have cost me $25 more!These guys are super nice and you should check them out! You won't be disappointed and you'll feel great for helping out a small family business! These guys are real pros!

4.description: Bad phone manners  when I call.  asked for an audio jack input in my car.  he doesn't answer the phone in a businesslike manner.  I've called twice he doesn't know what I'm talking about "what do I want to do...." doesn't sound like he speaks English very well. Talks like he Has food in his mouth or something.  not very professional phone manners. I would've liked to have done business with them

24.description: I actually got my windows tinted here probably about two years ago..and let me tell you... they still look amazing..there's no bubbles & I got a really good dealand it looks really nice on my BMWThey also gave me a warranty for the tints but i mean.. he did such a great job that i dont even know if i actually need the warranty.

6.description: Dan did a great job tinting my 2013 Ford Taurus. :-) Fair prices, very easy to work with. Waiting room has free wifi.

22.description: FRIENDLY AND GREAT SERVICE!!!I was looking for window tinting service for my girlfriend's '11 Camry. Check out several places on yelp and this place has the best review so we decided to bring her car in last Friday. The location was easy to find. We walked in and they have a nice display of different types of alarm and car stereo available. We met Sam first and he was nice and friendly. Right away he told us Danny is the owner and he'll be right out. Then Danny came out and greet us. We told him what we were looking for and what he would suggest. He just got done finishing up another vehicle. He took his time explaining to us about different shades and how it would look on the car. We were going to go with medium tint but after seeing the finished car which is also black color with light tint on the front and medium tint on the back we decided to go with lighter tint which was what Danny suggest. This doesn't make the car too dark and is legal. Last thing we want is be worrying about getting tickets. The price was great and cheaper than couple places I had called so we left the car there and Danny told us to come back in 3 hours. When we came back to pick up the car we were really happy with the work. Light tint came out perfectly with black car. We were very satisfied with the work that I brought my car in today to get it tinted also. I highly recommend MK Electronics if you want honest, friendly, and great service.  My car came out nice and clean. Also there's no materials left behind.

15.description: They upgraded the head unit in my Toyota for a very great price and in only 30 minutes. It works perfectly and was done professionally. Everyone is very friendly.I'd highly recommend them, fantastic service.

7.description: I needed a couple of speakers installed in my car. I happened upon this place and frankly I was a bit aprehensive. I'm glad I decided to inquire. I was met by Mr. Mun ( owner I think ) who immediatly called his tech, Mike ( he tells me he's been working there for 25 years) to asses. Within 30 minutes I'm done. Yes, they are friendly and reasonable. And yes, I'd recommend this place!

8.description: Got my Honda Accord tinted at MK's and my car looks dope, yo!!  Went with a 50% on a black on black car and never looked back.  Took my car in at around 1p on a Thursday, and the service was completed 3 hours later.  Few bubbles remained after the installation, but eventually disappeared a few days later.  Very happy with the results and will definitely hook up with Dan (principal / installer) in the future.  MK uses Sungard films and are backed with a lifetime warranty.  Their prices are far more superior than most establishments and accepts Yelp coupons to boot.  Dan will also take the time to explain all your questions regarding legality / overall aesthetics. Highly recommended!!

30.description: I went to MK for an alarm/remote starter to be installed in my car.  I, not too car electronic savvy, wasn't too sure what kind to purchase or where to start.  With the knowledgeable reps guiding me through the products they offer, I was able to narrow it down to my Autopage 915.  I was impressed with how friendly, timely, and detailed they were.  The guy that installed it in my car was detailed and showed me how to use all of the features it came with.  I'm really happy with the service and with my remote starter (it's been great to use when it's cold outside).  I'll definitely be back if I need anything installed in the future.

3.description: Had tint put on my 2013 Honda Civic. Really well done and affordable ($200). We noticed a huge hair in the back window tint about an hour after the tint was done. We called, they told us to bring the  car back and they re-did the entire back window for free. Great service.Honestly, we're picky about everything, and the hair in the window may have been something many vendors would have been upset about fixing. This guy was awesome, he fixed it on the spot and was genuine and polite the entire time. If you need tint, this place is great.

14.description: Just got my alpine double din installed in my lincoln ls and they did a  very professional and great job great price as well I will definitely recommend them and return for future car audio  thanks Mk and Daniel for great service

28.description: What a great store this is!I used to live in this neighborhood some years ago and this newWalmart Supercenter is in the Hall Plaza, all the way to the back whereMenards used to be, and many of you probably don't remember a storenamed Phar-Mor but that was there before Menards!I wish this Walmart Supercenter had been around back then becauseI really do love shopping at Walmart, their prices pretty much can't be beat!,This store is humongous, with everything that a Supercenter should have,A full grocery department, plus all of the other Walmart Departments.And the shelves were fully stocked and everything was merchandised really nicely, nice visuals!I tried to take notice of many of the departments and for what I could seethings were looking good even though it was mad,crazy,busy in there today.However, me deciding to venture inside this place that was packedwith shoppers/customers is all on me..Sometimes I just don't think!But anyway, just be warned you have to walk through this Huge Parkinglot before you get to the doors of this place and by then you may be exhaustedbut once you get inside it really is quite nice.Lots of associates walking around on the floor today too..So, I was impressed by this new and great Walmart, even though mycashier was kind of crabby..That's okay.. we all have our days.So, if you would like to see this sparkling new Walmart you should checkit out!And if you don't mind massive crowds by all means, go on Saturday!However, my next visit will definitely be on a weekday..

1.description: Wow I always forget I hate going to Walmarts. The employees are horrible!  Sometimes I wonder how the younger generation is sooooo stupid now a days.

9.description: Horrible!!!! Went to write a check for my purchase and wanted cash back my local Walmart allows you to do more than $20 with management approval so have some of the others but at this store the manager was so rude! (Celia) was very rude and snotty and would not approve the purchase even after I explained the policy (why should the customer have to explain the policy to a manager) then she passes me off to another manager and didn't explain the situation which caused her to make a mistake. I will be calling corporate to complain as well as the store manager never coming back! It took a whole hour to check out!!!!

29.description: Great new Supercenter. Very busy on grand opening day but nicely zoned.

23.description: Boo!! Sorry to say, it was a pi$$-poor experience for us over the weekend. . . . I'll cut right to the chase, we needed some formula, baby stuff..We go to return 4 boxes of 8-2oz bottles for a box of 4-8oz bottles that we had mistakenly bought and I noticed the price difference due to such a high bill. So the smaller sized formulas were 10+ dollars while the bigger more economic bottles were only 6+ dollars (+ means some change) so obviously we wanted to exchange them, so we went to customer (dis)ervice and we get the super friendly and totally hygienic Shanay... Now really, I was a peach, a real kinda friendly happy, let's exchange these and get on with our weekend attitude.... When Shanay made the mistake of only exchanging 1 box  instead of the 4 we had bought.... No big deal, my husband looks over the receipt and says, "we wanted to do all of the boxes not just one" as to which Shanay replies, "you said just one." Husband: Actually, I did say all of them, that's why I put all of them on the counter and explained the price difference and why we wanted to return them all.Shanay: OK, but you said just oneHusband: No, I didn'tShanay: You said oneMe: Either way, we'd really like to return them all.I mean Heavens to Betsy! She was a beast.Not to mention I also stated when we arrived, we want to "return all of these for this..." I could not believe how poorly we were treated, esp after buying almost 300 dollars worth of household items. Place needs a serious adjustment.

5.description: This Wal-Mart did not surprise me at all . Horrible staff ! Always on the phone , talking , closed registers and lines that make it all the way to the jewelry section . Watch out though ! If you begin to complain the manager Ms Corn will curse you out and resort to violence instead of helping the situation. Then security stands behind you .... Ha Ha ! Hilarious ! Of course this compliant goes overlooked and she's still there .... Like the Queen of Hearts . Ha Ha ! Bullshit !

25.description: Normally, I'm embarrassed to admit this but yes I sometimes shop at Walmart. I used to even disguise myself hoping no one I knew saw me, but this has all changed when I visited this Walmart. I mean when do you guys read about someone giving a Walmart 5 stars?!
