I know, I am just as shocked as those of you that are reading this review are. Now this store is brand spanking new, so it is still clean and the employees are so friendly. I could not believe how helpful and welcoming the employees were towards us. They are not ghetto or rude as the employees I've dealt with at the other locations like the Chicago (@North Ave/Cicero area), Northlake, or Niles stores.  For a moment, I felt like I was shopping at Target lol.Now it's located in the Hall Plaza so the parking can be challenging especially when you have to go against the WIC recipients and the shoppers for Big Lots, Discovery clothing, etc. But I went on the weekend very early in the morning (like before 10am) and found plenty of parking. Overall, I recommend coming to this location if your looking for great prices and customer service. Just try getting here really early to avoid the crowd.

12.description: I actually like this store. The clientele are usually polite neighborhood people and the employees I've come across have been real helpful. The grocery is real well stocked and i usually find what i need here. I like it much more than the Skokie and Lincolnwood stores.

21.description: I can pretty much walk here...so when when this new Walmart opened I was pretty excited. But after having more than 20 visits since Grand Opening...ugh. The cashiers appear to have run out of or never acquired any 'fucks'. Here's the summation of the average interaction. No Greeting of hello and no thank you. Plain face and simply depressed, maybe I would be too.  I've worked retail most of my life, but this is surely a lowly place. They'll have a huge line, yet one 'closed' line where the young girl takes what would appear to be only Walmart employees, talks up a storm and takes no one else. Do it in the back, I don't need to see ya'll Holla Holla Holla. During the first few weeks of store opening the self checkouts were typically up. Now, I never see them open.  What a waste. They never seem to have enough cashiers and I always get stuck waiting, I typically visit 7-10pm. Man I hate this place. But...it's Wal-Mart....and to be expected, right?

16.description: I can pretty much walk here...so when when this new Walmart opened I was pretty excited. But after having more than 20 visits since Grand Opening...ugh. The cashiers appear to have run out of or never acquired any 'fucks'. Here's the summation of the average interaction. No Greeting of hello and no thank you. Plain face and simply depressed, maybe I would be too.  I've worked retail most of my life, but this is surely a lowly place. They'll have a huge line, yet one 'closed' line where the young girl takes what would appear to be only Walmart employees, talks up a storm and takes no one else. Do it in the back, I don't need to see ya'll Holla Holla Holla. During the first few weeks of store opening the self checkouts were typically up. Now, I never see them open.  What a waste. They never seem to have enough cashiers and I always get stuck waiting, I typically visit 7-10pm. Man I hate this place. But...it's Wal-Mart....and to be expected, right?

17.description: Why would you put yourself in that situation unless you like going to go see weird people and people watch it's worth paying a dollar or two more not to deal with all the nuts in this place

10.description: I use the one in Niles because it's closer to my work Plus you save on tax if you purchase outside of city of Chicago but they do have best prices and now you can buy everything fruit wine battery for your car

11.description: So tired of going to Walmart and always getting crappy service. For the most part I try to do self check out just because the cashiers aren't happy to be there. Today I walked in and people were hard at work and when I got to the register since they were closing down self checkout the girl at the register was very pleasant from beginning to end she even said "thank you for shopping at Walmart have a good night." This girl just made up for the last couple of times I've stopped in.I didn't get her name since she had a jacket on but I wish I did. Way to go.

26.description: I really think this is the perfect location for a Walmart. Very clean, friendly employees so far. Prices are great

27.description: I noticed this store as I was passing by and had to stop in and see how it compares to their other store down near Grand and Cicero.  Thankfully there's no comparison!  This store is neatly organized and feels like a Walmart Super Center should.  A couple of the major differences between the 2 stores I mentioned above are that this store appears neat and tidy where the other one looks like it just went through the Christmas rush with not nearly enough people working to keep the merchandise in it's place (it is always a mess regardless of the time of year at the other store).  The other thing I like about this store is that it's set  up to have enough space where you can easily manuever a shopping cart through the aisles with ease.  Their other store has aisles so narrow you sometimes have to take detours to get to where you need to be.My only complaint was that I was most interested in picking up some fishing supplies (hooks and sinkers) and a large percentage of that section was completely out of stock.  I don't know if it's because they just recently opened and maybe have not recieved all of their stock yet or if maybe they'd recently had a big sale and had not resupplied yet.Next time I'm passing by I will stop in again see if they've restocked the fishing supplies yet.  Overall a good shopping experience and it should be a welcome addition to this neighborhood.

0.description: Prefer heading to this Wal Mart than the one on North AVE. The selection is good and usually find what I am looking for. The only issue is there are never nearly enough open registers. Takes me a while to get out of here.

20.description: Lets just say I've never went into a walmart and walked out happy. It's honestly disgusting in there. the place is so big with so many employees yet I'm walking past them and they are either on their phones behind a desk, looking at themselves in the mirror, or just trying to avoid helping their customers. This is the only store I've ever walked into and don't see anyone ask me if I need help or am I finding everything okay. They hire people who look like they hate their job, like seriously... people like this shouldn't even be given the opportunity to work. Its very disappointing.  I've been to the walmart in melrose, the one on North ave, and now this one.... NEVER AGAIN! I'll stick to target!

19.description: 2 reasons why I love this place.*Cleaner & more organized than the one on grand. *Gluten free food! No more driving to whole foods in Lakeview for my pasta :)

2.description: I had the best experience ever . I was tying to return a TV  and the customer service associate didn't want to help me. I had to talk to Co Steve who was helpful and very polite . Walmart needs more managers like him. 5617 is very lucky to have such a good manager. I'll keep shopping at this store as long as Steve is there

18.description: WARNING: Do not use credit/debit cards at this location. Someone at this establishment attempted to use $500 from our debit card. Use cash!!!

13.description: I noticed this store as I was passing by and had to stop in and see how it compares to their other store down near Grand and Cicero.  Thankfully there's no comparison!  This store is neatly organized and feels like a Walmart Super Center should.  A couple of the major differences between the 2 stores I mentioned above are that this store appears neat and tidy where the other one looks like it just went through the Christmas rush with not nearly enough people working to keep the merchandise in it's place (it is always a mess regardless of the time of year at the other store).  The other thing I like about this store is that it's set  up to have enough space where you can easily manuever a shopping cart through the aisles with ease.  Their other store has aisles so narrow you sometimes have to take detours to get to where you need to be.My only complaint was that I was most interested in picking up some fishing supplies (hooks and sinkers) and a large percentage of that section was completely out of stock.  I don't know if it's because they just recently opened and maybe have not recieved all of their stock yet or if maybe they'd recently had a big sale and had not resupplied yet.Next time I'm passing by I will stop in again see if they've restocked the fishing supplies yet.  Overall a good shopping experience and it should be a welcome addition to this neighborhood.

4.description: I went to buy school supplies and I bought 5 of the same notebooks. One was not ringing up and i was told I couldn't purchase it. I asked to speak with a manager and I was told " it won't make a difference I still can't sell it " . I was given an attitude and just told my total. The employee completely ignored my request . Also I was trying to purchase some nose piercings from the jewelery department and I asked kindly for help. The employee said " I'm on lunch ask someone else" . I waited over 40 minutes to be assisted in the jewelry department. I was very disappointed . I live 2 minutes away from this Wal-Mart and its very convenient to go to this one but I will be forced to go to the niles one after this incident.

24.description: Well - it was definitely nice to see another one opening since the closest one is always packed and looks like a stampede went through it (Grand and North Ave.). First off, I like the diverse staff. People were actually willing to help and didn't make you feel like you were bothering them. The aisles are clean and people are actually working and not horsing around--refreshing! I've seen actual managers on a couple occasions giving staff and supervisors direction and that was definitely pleasing. I stopped shopping at the Grand/North Ave. Walmart because it was a mess and a chore to shop at ALL times of the day (midnight, 7 am, 3 pm, for example). Now that this store is open, I'll be shopping more often and it's a bonus that it's nearby.

6.description: What a great store this is!I used to live in this neighborhood some years ago and this newWalmart Supercenter is in the Hall Plaza, all the way to the back whereMenards used to be, and many of you probably don't remember a storenamed Phar-Mor but that was there before Menards!I wish this Walmart Supercenter had been around back then becauseI really do love shopping at Walmart, their prices pretty much can't be beat!,This store is humongous, with everything that a Supercenter should have,A full grocery department, plus all of the other Walmart Departments.And the shelves were fully stocked and everything was merchandised really nicely, nice visuals!I tried to take notice of many of the departments and for what I could seethings were looking good even though it was mad,crazy,busy in there today.However, me deciding to venture inside this place that was packedwith shoppers/customers is all on me..Sometimes I just don't think!But anyway, just be warned you have to walk through this Huge Parkinglot before you get to the doors of this place and by then you may be exhaustedbut once you get inside it really is quite nice.Lots of associates walking around on the floor today too..So, I was impressed by this new and great Walmart, even though mycashier was kind of crabby..That's okay.. we all have our days.So, if you would like to see this sparkling new Walmart you should checkit out!And if you don't mind massive crowds by all means, go on Saturday!However, my next visit will definitely be on a weekday..

22.description: 2 reasons why I love this place.*Cleaner & more organized than the one on grand. *Gluten free food! No more driving to whole foods in Lakeview for my pasta :)

15.description: I didn't know this one was around me until recently which is good since I was getting tired of the beggars outside the Walmart on North Ave. always trying to harass me and other people.       This one is nicer is nicer overall and has lower taxes on items than other Walmarts in the area. Whenever I go the cashiers try to strike up a conversation with me and we get along well. Although I do notice the sneaky staff pretending to be restocking things when they're obviously just lollygagging around especially when they're gossiping in a loud manner or have been restocking the same shelf for 20 minutes.     That being said, its Walmart, they have good deals on name brand items, which is ironic since they're across the street from Aldi's which has even better deals on generic food.       The type of people that come here seem to think its a "family" event. You'll see lots and lots of kids sometimes while being annoyed at the fact that this "pack" decides to block entire aisles. Sometimes I'd leave and comeback 10 minutes later to see they're still there because the whole family can barely read the English on the labels.     Its still better than your typical Walmart crowd though. Customers are a bit nicer, random women tend to chat with me while I'm looking at something. So, come in with a good mindset and you'll have yourself a decent time. My theory on why others seem to be getting treated like crap is that they have attitudes themselves and/or think they're above other people somehow. Nobody likes undeserved arrogance.Oh and a lot of the stock they say they have online is not available at this store.

7.description: This Walmart doesn't close at midnight they close at 11pm. Just had a manager get in my teenagers personal space telling them about how they don't get paid for people to take too long when the store is closed. Very rude. Very poor service. Should've left the cart and walked out.

8.description: Walmart is probably famous for all the bad experiences people have but it's time someone posts a review about how good someone's experience is! I did something today i am not proud of, i returned a $100 bike after using it for a month. I hate doing that since i know the store is losing money. Nevertheless, the the supervisor and the cashier were helper and accommodated me with the exchange. The bike i purchased now is 10x better and hopefully it will last more than just a month. Overall this Walmart is better than most and i will be happy to shop there again. Thank you!

3.description: Last customer service experience was horrible.  My mom sent my dad and I to return an online order.  There was only one representative who seemed new, and the line took over 30 minutes.  We split up, and he didn't notice that the return was processed for half of the amount on the invoice.  I went back immediately and spoke to a supervisor who corrected it, but said there was a glitch where taxes could not be returned.  I was told to call Walmart.com, where there was another 30 minute estimated wait time.  Very poor treatment of customers!

14.description: This Walmart is disgusting! I went there a few days ago and was appalled. One of their bathrooms literally had feces all over the toilet and wall! The other one had no toilet paper and urine all over the floor. On top of that, the lady at the register was so rude! I always thought this was a decent Walmart but  I will be going to the one on Touhy from now on!

0.description: Clean and cute place with very sweet and helpful staff. Pick up a tray and tongs and start piling on your yummy treats. Great place to pick up your morning concha!

3.description: My favorite tacos, hands down...too bad they close at 8 tho.  This forces me to go to comales (meh), Pasadita (but they just closed my favorite one) or TBK when I get a late night craving.  These guanajuato taco places are inside a Mexican supermarket so they are pretty small....but you will not be disappointed :)

1.description: Hidden taco joint in a grocery store, very generous portions, but a hidden gem.Cheap and well worth it ,they close early (8pm) so take it to go.

2.description: Now visited nearly fifty occasions.  Mellow, even at peak times, unlike its California brother.  Carnitas, carnitas, carnitas, all day, every day.  Massive portions.  Free roasted jalapeno chile.  $1.39 tacos, sometimes lomo encebollado, sometimes al pastor.  No trompo in sight, however.  The construction of the burritos tends to be loose, but don't have a cow, just grab some utensils!

5.description: Good fruit - but IMHO the best tacos in the city (torta y taqueria in the back).  If there are tacos in Chicago that approach the quality you'll find in San Francisco's Mission District, Guanajuato makes 'em.

0.description: This is a true hidden gem inside the grocery store! Not only are their steak tacos the best around here but they are also cheap! You see the cooks grilling the meat there in front of you. Their steak tacos are awesome and usually what I order here.

4.description: The helpings are great on their always fresh traditionally topped cilantro and onion tacos! Other than avocado, I wouldnt dare add any other toppings...this is the first for me. Their service is great and the wait is always minimal.  The biggest plus is that they are always consistent with taste & have never let me down! The only downside to their establishment is that they're part of a grocery store, so they close early and I can't enjoy holding a family gathering to brag about their food, thank you guys!

3.description: I absolutely love this place! I get my eye brows done here and my no chip mani, prices are affordable and everyone there is nice.  Lin is the one to go to but get there early cuz they get packed.

1.description: Long review...be warned!I came in here for the first time last Thursday evening because it was on my way home. I had a no-chip mani with a regular pedicure. I called at 6:30 to ask if I could come in for those services since their hours said they closed at 7:30. They actually close at 7 everyday but the lady who answered said yes as long as I got there before 7. Was at their door at 6:45 and was sat at the pedicure chair right away. I picked my no chip color first then she matched my toe polish for me.  Well everything was going great until she started giving me my mani while I was getting my pedi by someone else. I didn't feel like either technician took care of my hands or feet. Don't take in clients before closing if you're going to rush through them!!! The technician who did my feet ended up doing my no chip but there was trouble with the polish that wouldn't dry..had to redo my hands. I paid $45 which is cheaper than I've paid before but I can see why...They said my toes were ready to go so I put on my shoes and when I got home there was a chunk of polish that came off from my right big toe. Then I noticed that the edges of my mani (along the cuticles) didn't have any top coat, so it looked as the top coat (shiny) was only along the center of my nails. I went in the following Monday (after calling the next day to tell them what was wrong) to get my hands and toe fixed. Well all would have been fine since they fixed my mani. But the technician fought me on my toe color. I knew I picked the right one but he ended up giving me a darker color on my toe than the rest of my feet. I regret leaving a great tip during my first visit. Easy to say I won't be back here and maybe you should go somewhere else too.

2.description: I have been coming here for 6 months.. at first they seem very nice.. as time passed by they have become rude..the place is very clean they do a great job with nails specially Kelly ..the parking sucks it very small and it is shared with other stores....I love the place I drive far to come here since they do a great job with the nails.. but their attitudes are really really bad!!

9.description: Very affordable and very clean! Just make sure to get here as soon as they open because they fill up quickly!

10.description: I have been going to this place since I was pregnant and I absolutely love it!! They always treat me so good and they all do good nails. I go every 2/3 weeks for no-chip manicure and pedicures and I have no complaints.Their prices are awesome too which is an added bonus.They are very clean and professional.

4.description: Horrible horrible service!!!  I wanted a French manicure and the tips came out pink. When I spoke to the manager she just smirked and said come back. If you can't do a simple French the right color why would I come back!!!!  Will never come back to this place. There are many around so run the other way!!!!

6.description: This is my go to spot the only place I get my eyebrows wax at Len does such a wonderful Job every time never fails I always leave with a smile on my face. The staff is friendly I would strong recommend this nail salon to anyone they also does great nail aswell......

12.description: This place has a nice No Chip Color selection.. The service is good and price is very reasonable. Most Importantly, I see the employees constantly cleaning the nail tools and their stations as well as the pedicure stations!!

5.description: They do a decent job, I don't know if it's me but everytime I've gotten my acrylics here, they stArt to chip as they grow out. And they're not open Sunday's! I do like their polish selection

11.description: I first tried this shop not long after they opened just over two years ago, after being set adrift when my regular nail technician up & moved to California.  I had moved to a new neighborhood several years earlier, so I was very lucky when I stumbled upon this shop.  It is very clean and relatively spacious.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  They are usually very busy in the evenings,  so get there well before closing time.

8.description: I just recently started coming here. It's my 3rd time here now and I absolutely Iove it. Tan is the guy I go to. He does a fantastic job. I'm pregnant and treats me very nice and is extremely polite. He absolutely takes pride in his job and does everything to make sure you're feeling comfortable and relaxed! I greatly appreciate the exceptional customer service!

0.description: I like this salon. Prices are decent and the staff for the most part take care of your hands and feet nicely. The only reason I won't give five stars is because whenever you do ask them about something they answer you a short answer,  then say something in their language to another worker and laugh. I swear they're talking about me ! :-)

7.description: I have been trying different places. So far I like this place the most, nice people, great service and most importantly it's pretty clean, will be coming back.

0.description: Well I've been frequenting this establishment for about a year and a half now on a somewhat regular basis and generally find it to serve very good pizzas.  The business itself is a combination pizza joint and Mexican bakery which to me sounds like a weird combination, however they do excel quite a bit over the Italian restaurant just about a hundred feet away on the other side of the street.  I love the fact that their crust is a thin crust with a really nice garlicky butter flavor on the crust.  Normally I throw away the crust on pizzas since I don't care for dried out bread, but this tastes so good I always eat it all! If you're a fan of deep dish pizzas then this place may disappoint you since as far as I know they do not offer a pan pizza.  I can't honestly say this is the best pizza I've had in my almost 2 years of living here in The Windy City, but I can say without hesitation that they do make one of the best pizzas I've had the pleasure of eating here.  As far as the bakery products go I'm not really that thrilled, but in all fairness to them their bakery products are the same as other Mexican bakeries I've tried and none of them really thrill me.  I think it's just that I'm an old white guy who grew up in an all white small town with no exposure to ethnic foods so don't give my opinion on their bakery products too much weight in your decision to try their products.  There is however one bakery product that they do make that I do love.  Hopefully I'll get the name correct.  I believe it's called "bolillos con queso y jalapenos".  Basically it's a large roll that has cream cheese and jalapeno slices inside it.  As you can probably guess I am not into spicy foods, but I love those rolls since for some reason the jalapenos have a little heat to them, but not enough to make me sweat much.  I suspect the reason the jalapenos in them are bearable to me and I can actually taste the flavor is that they have been seeded before being used in these rolls.  Even if you're like me and can't stand much heat I'd encourage everybody who likes jalapeno flavor but doesn't like the usual intense burning to try these awesome rolls.They do also have a small but fairly diverse selection of other meal items and also offer hot wings (I've tried their barbecue wings and they were a touch to spicy for me, but like I say I don't tolerate heat well) so you may want to consider some of their other meal options also.  As far as dine in facilities go they do have around 10 tables and the place is clean and adequate, but it is not someplace you'd take a lady to impress her with the ambiance.  It's very clean and the cashiers are all friendly (fluent in both English and Spanish).  You'll need to go to the cashier to place your order since there is not table service with a menu like in most restaurants.  The furniture is booths that are not padded, but they are in very good condition and well cleaned so it's a perfectly fine place to eat, it's just not a first date kind of place.If you enjoy a good thin crust pizza with an excellent tasting crust then I'd strongly encourage you to try this establishment over Mama Luna's which is the Italian restaurant nearby since I think this place definitely outdoes them.  If you live in this area they do deliver so that's another plus for this place. Ask about their daily pizza specials.

3.description: Clean, Friendly and Fast!

1.description: Now that I have gone more often it have noticed they really don't do all that of a great job painting  nails .Nails not filed and shaped properly.Nail polish clean up was a joke.

2.description: I came her not too long ago. I went to get a pedicure and manicure and when I was dipping my feet in the water . I seen something running by my chair. Once I looked down I seen it was a mouse !!!! The lady didn't say anything and she saw it . I do t think il be visiting this place any longer .

0.description: I love this place! I have been a regular for the past 2 1/2 years. I come here every 3 weeks for a pedicure!  $20 pedicure every day! They are all friendly, great job and I love  how quickly they get it done! I def recommend this place!

1.description: Really nice people!  I would recommend anyone in there just depends on what you are looking for they each have their own style. You will find just what you are looking for. I made an appointment just to be on the safe side. I described to to the artist what I wanted over the phone and he had it all drawn out perfectly by the date of my appointment.  They are really big on detail there too.  I am definitely going back for more!!!!

2.description: Friendly! No crappy attitudes! Talented as hell...you want something to look like it was air brushed on you? You really like traditional? New school? Gray work? Tribal? Plugs? Streching?  Seriously these guys can do everything and do it well.There pirecer is really good too. He's stretched two of my friend's ears. Very clean and very precise. I had my septum done by him, he's room was comfortable and clean. He gave me good advice to take care of it and offered me to stop by for any questions or worries.The Two tattoo artists I've worked with were Nick and P. both very talented and fitted my tattoo needs(I'm pretty picky). P did my gray work. Nick has done my tradtional...which I totally love! He's well rounded too, but he's my fav for tradtional. I'm looking to have the owner Miro do my ribs, he's does great realstic work and I want "real" animals crawling on my ribs.Everyone is so friendly and knowledgable there. You can't help but enjoy your time when you are there.I have 17 tattoos and 10 of them were from this shop, I plan on getting more from here....I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THESE GUYS!

0.description: Why this shop hasn't been more talked about is beyond me. The space is small, but it looks as if they can fit upwards of five or six artists in there at a time. I was introduced to Trevor by a friend and he immediately got stoked on my ideas to do a fruit and vegetable produce based sleeve. Within a week, we had booked the first session and he had come up with the most brilliant design (extra props - he stayed up all night working on it - THAT'S dedication!).The session was relaxed and quiet with Trevor being conversational throughout as I watched him flesh out the line work. Eight hours later and my arm is now outlined with a cornucopia of brilliant foodstuffs. The next session begins coloring and I'm quite excited!For quality tattoos (and especially stuff in the old school vein), Trevor's yr guy! You won't find a friendlier and more accommodating tattoo artist in the entire city. I can bet on it!

3.description: I feel like we mark every great occasion in our lives with Garland.  10 years ago Garland did my wedding flowers and we have used them for everything ever since.  This year we gave my mother a bouquet from Garland every month.  I was stunned each month at how long these lasted and how special each arrangement was. I get my Poinsettias from her every year too and love how long they last.  Wonderful!

1.description: We could not have made a better choice than Garland for our wedding flowers. Although out budget was smaller than average for the area, Therese made great suggestions that sounded beautiful during out consultation. My bridal bouquet was stunning, as were all the other bouquets, corsages, and bouts. Our simple centerpieces were elegant and just beautiful. We ended up with flowers that matched exactly the spirit we wanted and were more beautiful than we had imagined they would be. As a bonus, the flowers were also long-lasting and Therese was very easy to work with.

2.description: Super nice and very helpful.  We had a great experience.  They do close early on Saturday (3 pm) which is something to keep in mind. We used them for homecoming flowers.

5.description: This is a great little shop.  I have used it several times and will continue to purchase here.  I have seen quite a few area flower shops, and this one has very reasonable pricing.  They have a nice selection of cut flowers--some that you don't see every day, and they have a HUGE selection of flowering and green plants.  The flowers are very fresh--I've had bouquets last nearly 2 weeks.  The staff is super nice, knowledgeable, and eager to make your order just right.  All in all, a good place.

6.description: Sometimes you want more than just a bouquet from a grocery store. That's what lead me to Garland Flowers. I pictured an arrangement of a variety of white flowers and my budget was only $30. The man ahead of me was paying $100 for his purchase, so I was doubtful that they'd be able to gvie me what I wanted. Well, they did! I walked out with exactly what I wanted - a beautiful bouquet that included a nice mix of white flowers - even roses - for $30.

7.description: Another good little flower shop, this one is a little more traditional than Kabloom, but around here, there's room for a couple flower shops that sort of fill slightly different niches.

8.description: This is such a cute little flower shop.  They've got a wide variety of plants in different shapes, colors, and arrangements.  Its a great place to go to get a gift for someone because its prety reasonanly priced.

0.description: We used Garland Flowers for my son's wedding May 19,2012.  Therese was very easy to work with and met with us as needed. Since we weren't quite sure what we wanted, she took the time to show us photos from other weddings.  We picked a few we liked and she immediately walked around her shop and created a "sample" bouquet.My future daughter-in-law worked to Therese, discussing flowers and colors she liked, using the bouquet as inspiration. We then discussed the budget - and believe me our budget was very small. But with all that, we were done.  Not sure exactly what we were getting,  we still felt confident Therese would give us something spectacular. On the day of the wedding, Nato and all, our flowers were delived at the scheduled time. When we opened the box and saw the bouquets we were "WOWED".  She totally got what the bride wanted. The flowers were fresh and the colors so vibrant. We loved them!!  We highly recommend Garland Flowers. Therese worked within our budget and did a spectacular job!

4.description: I have had too many bad things happen here. I have gone so far as to tell the people here that there is a problem with customer service,  but then today, well, maybe theres been a change of face?!  I called today to let the team know that my flowers from valentines day died the next day, and the manager said, come by and get new flowers! I am so sorry!!  Seriously, I was expecting some pull back, but she told me to come in and get new flowers... wow!problem is- they close at 5p. I work until 6p. I'll never get those flowers....

1.description: I stopped by this Walgreens to use the Chase ATM.I put my card in.It said, "Sorry this machine is out of cash.  Would you like to proceed?"Would I like to proceed? Um...no Mission Get Cash FAILED

2.description: Not great

0.description: Despite previous reviewers short scripted anger, this place is not the worst part of my day. It's a Walgreens. Not many frills, they have a private parking lot, are open late and have a pharmacy. Lines are usually short and although cashiers don't seem excited to be working they also are not downright rude. If you want a typical Walgreens experience then come here.

58.description: Elizabeth did the flowers for my wedding, and I am very happy with how everything turned out. She started with my vague descriptions of some flowers, shapes, and colors I liked, and produced some fantastic arrangements that were just what I wanted. She can add some deliciously subversive touches too, like fiddlehead ferns.My only complaint is that my husband's boutonniere fell apart after a couple of hugs. The little stems broke off one by one.

56.description: This was the only place we went for flowers for our wedding. We ordered from Elizabeth as soon as we got the pricing proposal. She came in early to meet with us and was very good about finding out what would be best for us, since neither my husband nor I know anything about flowers.We were also on a super-tight budget and that was no problem....she didn't push us in any direction, just gave us the best of what we could afford.The flowers were gorgeous, my only complaint was that they wilted rather qucikly - but it was August in Chicago and we were in an un-air conditioned venue - so obviously no fault of hers! They still photographed beautifully.

29.description: I chose Asrai Garden to do my wedding flowers and the bottom line is this. The flowers were gorgeous and fresh. The people (I worked with Natalie) were great to work with. The delivery came off without a hitch. The people at Asrai are artists who care about their creation AND making their customers happy.

42.description: During our wedding planning, my husband and I decided that flowers were one of the least important aspects of our wedding. So, I was planning on doing the flowers myself...until I thought of the countless downsides of DIY flowers (When will I have the time? Will they look like a grade school art project? Are they going to wilt in July and just look sad?).Thankfully, I met with Elizabeth and I was completely reassured that it was totally worth hiring Asrai Garden for our wedding day flowers. Elizabeth is down-to-earth and so talented! She took the time to look at various inspiration pictures and listen to all of the details of the wedding in order to choose the perfect flowers. Elizabeth completely understood my vision for wedding decor and even loved the idea of using baby's breath. I got the most compliments and comments from wedding guests on the beautiful baby's breath/lily centerpieces and baby's breath bridesmaid bouquets! Oh, and she even had the idea for a pretty, little wreath for my Italian Greyhound ringbearer! While planning our wedding, Elizabeth was always on top of everything and delivery/set-up the day of went so smoothly.Asrai Garden did a beautiful job and I am so grateful that I chose their professional flower arrangements instead of my DIY flowers!

23.description: I ordered bridal bouquet for my friend and was very disgraced. In the morning when I gave to her my present, itlooked well. but at noon  flowers  began to wilted. I felt myself uncomfortable, because every guest looked at her bouquet and knew it was my present. I am very unhappy and don't recommend this place.

47.description: Asrai Garden did our Bouquets & Boutonnieres for our wedding last week and they were beautiful!!! They really captured the look I was going for -  they were much more reasonable than other Chicago florists - and extremely flexible with they quantity and type of flowers we ordered. Elizabeth & Kristen - thank you for being so wonderful to work with!!!

8.description: Can we talk for just a minute about the awesomeness that is Natalie Lauzon?! My husband found Asrai Garden on a whim after we had researched multiple florists and found that our budget was just too tight. Natalie was awesome from the start. She gave us tips on the best ways to work with our budget while still preserving the look and type of flowers we wanted. I must have emailed her at least 50 times before the wedding with questions about the size of the vases we were ordering and what kind of ribbon I should choose for the bouquets - among other random things. She was so patient and so kind! She even hand delivered the bouquets the day of my wedding (I actually feel terrible about this because I don't think I was able to express how beautiful and spot on they were with what I wanted - wedding stress was distracting me!). She also managed to slip a congratulatory card into our  bird cage card holder at the venue. One of my bridesmaids is getting married in October and per our recommendation she is using Natalie too!  Basically, Natalie is amazing and Asrai Garden is an awesome shop, a pleasure to work with, and very professional.  You should get all of your future flowers from them.

31.description: My boyfriend buys me flowers from here sometimes, and those days are certainly some of the best days :)Gorgeous flowers, creative bouquets, love it!

34.description: Asrai Garden totally rocked the flowers for our wedding at Salvage One last week! Elizabeth, Natalie, and Kristen were great! The table arrangements were soft, sweet, and exactly what I had in mind when Natalie and I were planning the initial proposal. Delivery was on time and set up seemed smooth!My breathe was taken when I saw the bouquets - totally gorgeous. Email communication was always returned promptly and comprehensively - I never worried. The flowers were my favorite part of the wedding - so many thanks to the Asrai Garden team! They even included a sweet note the day-of!

16.description: I can't say enough about Elizabeth and Kristen.  When we set out to plan our big day, I was terrified that I wouldn't be able to afford flowers-- so many florists quoted us minimums larger than our entire budget!  Luckily, I stumbled across Asrai Garden here on yelp and scheduled a meeting with Elizabeth about 5 months before our wedding.  I was encouraged by their website, where their "wedding rant" says it all-- a $1000 wedding deserves the same attention as a $40000 one.Elizabeth was fantastic from the moment we walked in.  She worked with our small budget and produced the most gorgeous bouquets for our November wedding.  Emails were returned within 2 days, even during the busy summer months, by either Elizabeth or Kristen.  They flexed with our budget and allowed me to make changes with no fuss, even allowing us to supply some feathers and to pick up the flowers ourselves to save money.On our wedding day, I received tons of compliments from our guests and the hotel staff.  I don't think anyone would believe me if I told them how little we paid for the quality we got.  I am so grateful that people like this exist in the otherwise money-hungry, scheming wedding industry.  Asrai is A+ !

13.description: Have some interesting gifts. Have been back twice for horse tail jewelry. They are very helpful. I didn't buy any flowers but watched them build some beautiful bouquets.

11.description: This is the best hidden gem in Wicker Park...if not all of Chicago. It's a truly unique place, nowhere like it in the city. The flowers are beautiful, their arrangements are truly like art. Their assortment of gifts and jewelry are very well curated by the owner Elizabeth and she goes out of her way to keep her store stocked with local artists and everything is handcrafted, I really love her eye for detail. Be aware that many of the items are at a bit of a higher price point  but I have no complaints because I know it's going to the artists who are handcrafting these items and as an artist myself I totally understand the need to charge for your time and work, after all we only have 2 hands. With that being said there are many items at impulse-buy prices if you need to find a unique gift for a friend...or yourself for that matter. I highly recommend stopping into this dark wonderland. You'll be happy you did.

39.description: Really baffled by the one negative review of this place -- I think of all the vendors I hired for my wedding, Elizabeth was far and away my favorite in all ways, and let me also say that when I started planning my wedding I was least excited about doing the flowers.I'm really not a flower person -- I love the way flowers look but I know nothing about taking care of them and I kill plants instantly when they are under my care. I am the person who thought she didn't really even want many flowers at her wedding because "they won't last, and its wasteful." Lucky for me my mother is the exact opposite and intervened enough for me to find Elizabeth and meet with her.I brought pictures of things I liked (which I think is any client's responsibility), and Elizabeth perfectly understood my aesthetic right away. She didn't create anything exactly like any of the pictures I showed her, but instead formulated something that had aspects of everything that I loved and at the same time was completely unique and beautiful and not at all what I would have thought of on my own or expected to walk out of there planning on doing.On the day of the wedding, everything went extremely smoothly and all the flowers were amazing. Out of a wedding of 150 people, I think 1/3 must have come up to me and asked me where the flowers came from so they could look up the florist. I was happy to tell them where to find her, and I really can't recommend her enough.

37.description: My wife said "It's my fantasy of a floral bouquet."  And isn't that what it's all about? I can't be specific about I'm looking for, but I tried to describe a mood and an attitude, and Asrai got it right away. Thank you.

0.description: I was looking for a florists that would kill a dozen roses for my wifes and mine 30 year anniversary Valentine's Day getaway. When the wife (at the time my girlfriend) and I went away for the first time, I put the dozen roses in the trunk of my car, to hid them from her. Since it was in Feb it was 1000 degrees below 0. And yes the flowers froz.... So when i went to give them to her.... There they were all black and frozen.  So in order to celebrate the right way... I had to do it again... They were the only florists that would kill the flowers and then sent them to our hotel... It was every thing i expected... They were AWESOME... If you are looking for the unusual... They are the Ones to do it... Thank you the flowers were perfict.

38.description: Loved, loved loved the flowers Asrai did for my wedding in 2011.  Late review, but haven't forgotten!!  Elizabeth was SO easy and nice to work with and is just a really cool person.  I definitely did not want to spend any money on flowers for our wedding, I thought one, they die really fast and two, cant I just do these myself?  Well time won this internal battle and I soon realized I needed professional help.  I searched a few places and was initially drawn to Asrai due to no required minimum, even for a Saturday evening wedding in the city.  I met with Elizabeth twice, and she was very quick to understand the things I liked and didn't like.  She was quick to brainstorm cost effective flower arrangements for 20 reception tables and all the personal flowers.  I felt confident in Elizabeth and Asrai during the entire planning process and didn't worry about their delivery once.  They were organized, timely and knew their stuff.  At the last minute, I decided I wanted to add some flowers to the church, which I wasn't originally planning on, in order to save some money.  I called Elizabeth gave her a budget and let her take care of the rest.  On to the wedding day...  Words cant describe walking down the aisle and smelling the beautiful flower arrangements Asrai had put together on the pews!  I had no idea!!  It really made it a full sensory unforgettable experience.  And the experience didn't end there, the bouquets, table arrangements, guys flowers, everything was more than I could have even dreamed of.  Elizabeth really uses color and texture in the flower arrangements which makes her designs truly unique and memorable.  This has made me a full flower lover convert.  I cant stop buying flowers now for my home, I truly think they make the difference and Asrai has made me a believer!

51.description: I have lived in the hood for 10 years and walked past this shop admiring the store front many times over the past decade never stopping in... well that was dumb. It's not just a flower shop, it's so much more. Taxidermy on the walls (both real and fake), hand made mittens, scrimshaw, hand sewn sea creature tree ornaments, candles, and cool ass topiaries (did I get that right?) scenes complete with different ceramic characters to tell a story. There are far to many interesting items to list, pop in and browse through plenty of options for unique gifts for any occasion. Don't forget the flowers.

27.description: I am really torn on this review. I would like to be able to give a 3.5 star review. I used Asrai Garden for my recent wedding. We did the centerpieces ourselves, but we used them for bouquets, boutonnieres, and corsages. The bouquets were beautiful and exceeded my expectations. They were expensive but no more so than other florists. They were really beautiful. The boutonnieres, however, all fell apart. We kept them refrigerated as instructed until they were pinned. My dad's barely made it through the ceremony -- half of it had fallen off. My husbands made it through the ceremony but fell apart soon thereafter. I would still recommend this shop to anyone getting married because the bouquets were really beautiful.

32.description: I walked in to Asrai the day before Mother's Day, looking to buy flowers for my boyfriend's mom and expecting insanity. Instead the store was bustling with energy, and I was asked in a nice and non-pushy way if I needed any help or had questions. I did need help, and an affordable bouquet (most of theirs are $50 or more)--so one of the women working there put together a pretty arrangement of lilacs and roses for under $30). The vibe overall was really friendly--lots of conversations about flowers and first dates at the register, and another woman (maybe the owner) giving out little shortbread cookies her mom had made, in cute yellow striped packages. When I came home I hinted (ok told) my boyfriend to get me flowers from Asrai sometime...

54.description: I should start out by saying this place is AWESOME! Elizabeth was so nice and accommodating! She met with me early on a Wednesday morning to discuss wedding flowers. I am getting married in Chicago but currently reside in LA. She normally doesn't meet with people on Wed am but made an exception as it was the only time that would work with my schedule. She was very friendly and she understood my theme/vision for the flowers right away. She totally worked with my budget and had a proposal to me within a week. I immediately put down a deposit to secure the day. I can't wait to see how the flowers turn out. I know they are going to be beautiful!Her shop is so cute! If you are ever in WP you must stop and take a look. There are gorgeous flowers and all kinds of other treasures. With just a glance you can tell how much love and care is put into the place. If the flowers arrangements are given half as much care as the shop itself I know they will be absolutely amazing.UPDATE***We had our wedding last weekend and the flowers were UNBELIEVABLE! Elizabeth understood my vision and exceeded every expectation! If you want truly beautiful flowers for your wedding or any event Asrai Garden is the place to go!

48.description: This place has the aesthetic that I like.  Curiously, in spite of it, they put too much emphasis in non-florist things.Bucktown or Wicker Park, there is no other or better place for flowers.

44.description: When my husband and I decided on our wedding venue and reception location, we knew not many floral arrangements wouldn't be necessary to make our day special.  Regardless of our budget size, Asrai Garden treated us just as if we were spending $8,000 instead of the $800 we did.  Upon my initial meeting with Natalie, I had a few ideas of what I liked...but Natalie really stepped it up and brought some innovative ideas to our  meeting.  She was able to see a few of my favorites and really craft our whole bridal party into arrangement masterpieces.On top of it, they allowed me to bring in a sentimental wrap to put on the stems of my bouquet.  When I was in the shop dropping this of, I also found a charming one of a kind card to give to my husband on "the big day!"Overall, they were wonderful!

24.description: Top notch!  I was planning a very laid back wedding and decided not to special order any flowers.  But about 3 weeks before the date, I changed my mind and wanted a floral garland to hang on an arch so I'd have a good backdrop for photos.  I found Asrai online, and we stopped by the shop to see if they'd be able to help us.  Despite the very short notice, Natalie was able to put it together for us.  We spent less than a half hour talking about it, but from the photos on the website, the reviews online, and the beautiful in-store offerings, I knew we were in good hands.  Natalie explained that a full floral garland might be too heavy for our arch, so she suggested an ornamental greens garland with flower bundles tied on the sides.  She asked if I wanted a bouquet too, which I hadn't planned on but decided it would be a nice touch if I had one that matched the floral bundles.  She threw in a boutonniere for my groom as well.  I told her what colors I wanted and then let her take it from there.The finished products were so beautiful!  So glad we went to Asrai and that they fit in our order, even with such short notice.  Great customer service and exceptional flowers.  Thanks Asrai!

7.description: Love, love, love Asrai Garden.  This is my go to spot for flowers and gifts for the wife.  The staff is super helpful and they always have beautiful flowers available.  You will find all sort of things here.  This is not your run of the mills flower shop.

49.description: Beautiful shop, like one you would find in Paris- great staff, and amazing products.  I love this place.

40.description: Flowers are a tricky wedding expense. For us, we wanted enough that they complemented the rest of our wedding decorations, but not enough that they overshadowed the rest of the beautiful decor that we had (and were within our pretty strict budget).Asrai Gardens was a florist we had seen over and over in wedding photos on various blogs and we really liked their unique and modern take on wedding flowers. Elizabeth was great to work with as she listened to what we wanted and helped us to stay within our budget. The bouquets and boutonierres were gorgeous and photographed really well and the flowers for our venue were exactly the pop of color that our venue needed without being too much.  She was also flexible in letting us bring our own vases in (we had collected vintage bottles for months!) and we really appreciated her commitment to helping execute our vision even better than we could have imagined!We would highly recommend Asrai Gardens who were professional and reliable throughout.

53.description: We worked with Elizabeth Cronin (the proprietor of Asrai) for our wedding flowers, and we couldn't be happier with the outcome. Our wedding took place in my parents' exquisite garden, so we wanted flowers that would accent that in an understated way, rather than be the center of attention.  Our budget for flowers was also very low for a wedding of our size. So we didn't give Elizabeth much to work with, yet she somehow concocted the most beautiful, unique and creative flower arrangements. Bottom line, Elizabeth is really an artist. Equally important, she was so accommodating when it came to our budget. She didn't pressure us to spend more than we wanted to. At one point I think I asked whether she thought we should spend a little more to make the flower arrangements on the larger tables a bit bigger. Surprisingly, she said that wasn't necessary and suggested other, cheaper ways to add abundance to the larger tables. Anyone who's been working with wedding vendors will understand that this response does not happen. Like, ever. She also offered incredible value above-and-beyond simply creating a beautiful flower plan. We had a lot of do-it-yourself decor ideas, and Elizabeth was a fantastic sounding board. She came back with lots of other ideas to elaborate and had lots of website and store suggestions up her sleeve for the cheapest supplies, etc. We'll be going here for our next project: a nice container garden for our terrace!

30.description: This place is a hidden gem. It is not your average floral store. I love everything about it.The only place in Chicago you can buy Santa Maria Novella products. Adore.

46.description: Brillant, truly deserves a 5 Star. Excellent selection of flowers, brilliant staff, well displayed and carefully selected range of candles, smellies and other beautiful presents for your loved ones. Most merchandise is also independent artist/organic. Above all that- their staff are rather friendly and very well informed. Creativity all over- you'll be taken somewhere else!

1.description: So incredibly disappointed. Came home this evening to an early Valentine's Day bouquet from my bf & after a total of no more than 4 hours after he had picked them up to me viewing them, the flowers were wilting & the ones in the center are literally on the verge of death. I'm partially to blame for telling him about Asrai garden, especially since I'm trying to hide the dead flowers so he doesn't feel bad. He actually had better luck with a jewel florist before. Poor guy, now I think I owe him a better gift to make up for the $ he lost in hopes of quality & a happy girl.

55.description: I've never purchased huge bouquets or anything like that from here, but I have bought a small plant for my then-new apartment and individual stems for various wall vases I have at home. The flowers here are VERY fresh and super beautiful. Each stem is decently priced. They also have an amazing store design/layout, and i love all the terrariums and hanging plants they have in the store for sale. They also have other items, like candles, soaps, little ceramic knick-knacks. This place isn't cheap, but it's absolutely gorgeous.The small plant I bought died within a month, which was sad. The service is here OK - not the most comfortable place  (no one is exactly cheery or super pleasant to talk to, but they're not rude or anything like that) but the flowers and plants can speak for themselves.

9.description: This place is a hidden gem. It is not your average floral store. I love everything about it.The only place in Chicago you can buy Santa Maria Novella products. Adore.

26.description: I chose Asrai to provide the flowers for my wedding this past October based on the prior reviews as well as their location.  I live in the neighborhood and wanted accessibility to vendors (my cake came from down the street).  I am so glad that I went with them - my flowers were amazing!  The bridesmaids loved their bouquets and I may be biased but I thought my bouquet was the most beautiful thing I've even seen.  I want a replica for each anniversary (hope my DH is reading this!).  Natalie was great to work with and she did an amazing job of making my vision a reality.  I just found out that a friend who is getting married this week is getting her flowers from Asrai as well - I can't wait to see more of their work!On a side note, I cannot speak to longevity of the bouquets for the actual wedding, as we left on our honeymoon a day after the wedding, but my sample bouquet lasted longer than any flowers I have ever gotten elsewhere.Go with them - you won't regret it.

25.description: I had the most wonderful experience with Asrai Garden.  I ordered flowers for a friend and wanted them to be perfect.  Clara patiently listened to my many requests and made me confident she would arrange the perfect bouquet.  She even emailed me a picture when it was ready.  Thank you very much.

12.description: Asrai Garden's bridal bouquets and table centerpieces for our wedding were absolutely stunning, gorgeous, elegant, creative, and expertly arranged.  They captured the aesthetic perfectly.  However, the flowers for church were very simple for the price and wilted during the ceremony.  It was embarrassing to carry dying roses to the Virgin Mary.  I was mostly pleased with the arrangements (which get 4.5 stars), but I found it difficult to work with Natalie.  The cost did not break the bank but definitely was not a deal, and therefore not worth it for the lack of collaboration.  There are many good florists in this city and I would not personally recommend this place although I'm sure other brides have had a better experience.

59.description: Crawling out of the doghouse just got a lot easier. We won't go into the details of why or how someone gets themselves into the doghouse, but I will share a secret ... Asrai Garden. I personally haven't visited this shop, but I have walked past and admired through the window on numerous occasions. My husband stopped in yesterday and we are both very glad he did. He arrived home with an exotically beautiful bouquet of flowers. No matter how hard I tried - I couldn't fight the immediate smile that the flowers brought to my face. It was apparent - the flowers did the trick or should I say Asrai Garden did the trick! My husband was grinning from ear to ear as he gave them to me, because he knew that he had done well. The orchids in the arrangement are phenomenal. The other tropical flowers that were selected to accompany the orchids are equally as beautiful. Thank you Asrai Garden for the fabulous flower selection that you helped my husband with. And he thanks you to - for helping him remove the uncomfortable silence that had started to fill our home!

21.description: Asrai Garden's bridal bouquets and table centerpieces for our wedding were absolutely stunning, gorgeous, elegant, creative, and expertly arranged.  They captured the aesthetic perfectly.  However, the flowers for church were very simple for the price and wilted during the ceremony.  It was embarrassing to carry dying roses to the Virgin Mary.  I was mostly pleased with the arrangements (which get 4.5 stars), but I found it difficult to work with Natalie.  The cost did not break the bank but definitely was not a deal, and therefore not worth it for the lack of collaboration.  There are many good florists in this city and I would not personally recommend this place although I'm sure other brides have had a better experience.

17.description: I went to Asrai for our wedding flowers because I love the style oozing from this boutique! I follow their arrangements on Instagram and Facebook and love them for their wildflower, hand gathered feel. I was pleasantly surprised that Asrai was willing to help me stay within my budget and create the bohemian look I wanted for my centerpieces, bouquets, and boutonnieres. Elizabeth was a pleasure to work with. She was responsive and breathed so much life into my ideas. Her creations, especially my bridal bouquet, far exceeded anything I imagined (or pinned on Pinterest!). She was willing to order olive branch and sell it to me in bulk to arrange myself for my bouquets in an attempt to save some money. She also set up an in store pick up (since I live in the neighborhood) to help me alleviate the delivery costs. She tracked down hard to find flowers in specific colors and exceeded all of my expectations with her designs. Asrai also created a lovely flower crown for me to wear at my rehearsal dinner! I can't recommend Asrai enough if you are looking for a wedding florist. I knew whatever they created was going to be lovely, personal, and spirited. I was right! This is also my first stop for thoughtful birthday and hostess gifts or a treat for myself! It's a treasure in the neighborhood!

10.description: This is one of my favorite places. I work in the neighborhood and sometimes come here on my break because it smells so good and there's so much to look at. I have bought some plants that were very hearty, plus the people working gave me great advice of how to care for them. Such a great store, happy to support them!

5.description: Cute store with beautiful gifts. Definitely worth stopping in. However, I would not buy flowers here again. The arrangement I purchased was wilting before I even arrived at my event... A bit embarrassing to bring flowers in that condition.

3.description: I had a great experience working with Natalie at Asrai Garden.  She and her team created a bridal bouquet, boutonniere, and bud vase centerpieces for my small wedding.  We never actually met in person and truth be told, I've never been inside their shop, but the result was fantastic.  Our job was too "small" for an in-person meeting, so our correspondences were all by quick phone calls and emails.  Natalie designed the bouquet and bud vases based on photos I sent of ideas that I liked and photos of my dress, and described it them to me in detail in an email.   She gave us a chance to give feedback on the original designs and estimate so that we could make any changes before finalizing the order (which we did). They delivered the bouquet to my home the morning of the wedding, and they delivered the bud vases to our reception venue.  Everything was on time and flowers were more beautiful than I could have imagined.  The arrangement was spot-on to what I had envisioned, maybe even more so.  It was beautiful, fresh, and the flowers lasted for days after the event.  The combination of flowers was unique and contained things you won't be able to find at a regular store.  My husband and I, and all of our guests gave us many compliments.  We paid around $500 total including all flowers, taxes, and delivery to two locations ($400 before tax and delivery).  I think the high quality of what we got was well worth the cost.

35.description: Last week my husband bought a birthday bouquet and spent close to 100.00 for it. He made the purchase on Friday and gave them to me Saturday morning. They were very lovely and quite fragrant at first glance. When I opened the flowers I saw there were several flowers already drooped completely over and dead. Needless to say I was disappointed, as was he, especially upon finding out how much they cost.I told him we could take me back and probably get them replaced. When we got to the shop I explained the situation and showed the gal working that day that there were already dead flowers and others that weren't so healthy. I had a bunch of tulips from the previous week that looked healthier than the ones in the bouquet. I get flower at least 2-3 times a month so have an idea of what healthy flowers look like. She insisted the flowers were healthy and said she could replace the dead ones. When I pointed at the ones that were dying, she was adamant about them being healthy and a little argumentive about it. I was getting a little upset about the situation and told her to replace what she could and left.I'm sorry but isn't the customer the reason why you are there and changing out a few flowers would have not been that difficult and to do it without attitude?Well here we are a week later and most the flowers look like crap. Live bought much cheaper flowers at Dominick's or Olivia's market for that matter that didn't even cost as  much and lasted twice as long.Save you money and go to Daffodil's right up the street on Armitage and Winchester.

19.description: Natalie is amazing!  My now husband and I came in for an initial consultation and had a fantastic time just spit balling ideas.  Natalie is creative, passionate, friendly and very, very talented.When we walked in for the first time we were instantly enamored with how beautiful the store looked and smelled.  (Seriously, if I could get that in a perfume I would wear it everyday.)  Our wedding was very retro, nostalgic and fun and we wanted flowers that expressed that.  While I love flowers, I must admit I have no clue what many cut flowers are called, especially with how many exotic options are available these days.  Natalie made the whole process so much fun and her excitement was very genuine.My bouquet was gorgeous, and I cried (hysterically) when I had to say goodbye to the flowers I didn't save to dry.  The girl's bouquets were orange parrot tulips and popped so beautifully with their teal and turquoise dresses.  We used a lot of teal and turquoise in the linens and the orange, peach and yellow flowers used for the centerpieces looked AMAZING!(She also comped my stand-in for the bouquet toss and arrangements for the bathrooms which was so generous of her.)I would recommend Asrai Garden to any non-traditional bride who isn't looking for cookie cutter arrangements and cliché centerpieces.  Natalie makes the whole process fun and exciting.  Her and her staff at Asrai are phenomenal.

28.description: My husband and I were married Sept 14, 2013 and hired Asrai Garden to do our flowers.  We would absolutely recommend them to anyone and everyone.  Below I have copied my husband's thoughts on their work, and I think he has said it all:"We just got back in to town and I wanted to take the opportunity to thank Asrai Garden  for their IMPECCABLE work. I cannot even express how impressed I am with you, you truly made our day so special to us. And you had my mom beaming...BEAMING. You guys killed it in ways I didn't know it could be killed. From the ceremony venue, which you transformed into what everyone described as a 'secret garden', to the flawless and MINDBLOWING arrangements throughout the reception, to the amazing bouquets and bouttoniers, you both took our ideas and amped them up more than we possibly could have hoped for. Your work tied our whole  visual story together, and validated all of the non traditional choices we made. Everyone was raving about your work, but most of all, you made Elena and me so very happy.It has been a real pleasure getting to know you and your business. We are so grateful that we chose you and that you brought the thunder"So book these ladies for your wedding, seriously, you should book them now.

45.description: Absolutely my favorite flower shop in the city!  I walk in and ask for an arrangement with a price range and it is always perfect.  Fresh flowers that last and smell fantastic.The staff is always friendly and helpful - never snobby like some shops.

33.description: What a hidden gem! This little shop has so much more to offer than just flowers! They have some really wonderful, clean candles that are to die for. They also have many soaps and skin care products that I've never seen anywhere else and that are very unique. I'd say this is a perfect place to find a unique gift as well! Dishes, jewelry, flowers, skin care, what more do you need?

43.description: Elizabeth Cronin, and her business Asrai Gardens, did a phenomenal job executing the florals for my wedding ceremony and reception. I was really looking for something different than your typical wedding flowers and Elizabeth knocked it out the universe with her creative eclectic designs. It was like she read my mind in order to deliver exactly what I wanted. My bouquet included ferns, herbs, succulents, and beautiful bold purple flowers. For the tables, she included a hodgepodge of apothecary vases, terrariums, driftwood, mosses, thistles, billy balls, ferns and succulents. It all looked amazingly beautiful and meshed well with the eclectic-ness of our venue, Salvage One.I was also very impressed to see Elizabeth there the day of, setting it up personally. She is truly a master at what she does and takes her work very personally.I would highly recommend Asrai Gardens, and Elizabeth Cronin, to anyone who is looking for wedding/reception flowers that are a little different from the norm. She will do a great job executing your vision!

2.description: This place cannot get any better! The aroma when you walk by down North Ave. is enough to drag you in. Perfect little shop with everything a nature lover, florist, & witch needs! I buy my sage from here once a month as well as gifts and flowers that smell oh so good! They have so many interesting and beautiful things to choose from. Stones, jewelry, not to mention a staff with friendly smiles! You won't be disappointed entering! Thanks Asrai Garden, I LOVE working in the neighborhood with you!

18.description: I just love this flower shop! I am so thankful for Elizabeth and her team. They are so gracious, creative, and helpful! Although, they don't like the be known for this, the ladies at Asrai have bailed me out of the "dog house" at least a half dozen times over the last few years. I basically owe my marriage to them. And speaking of marriage, they did a lovely job with my wife's floral head band for our rehearsal dinner for our wedding. The reason I am writing this review though is because for my most recent experience. I was looking for a bouquet for my wife for our one year anniversary. Unfortunately, I did not have time to get to the actual storefront before dinner, so I called and asked what they could do to accommodate and it turns out that they also DELIVER!! I live right down the street, so this feature doesn't always necessarily apply to me, but on this occasion it was a life saver! My wife was so happy when her beautiful bouquet showed up! I love Asrai, but more importantly, so does my wife!

41.description: Amazing, simply amazing. I was married August 18th 2012, and up until the last week of July I had been having a difficult time finding a florist that had time for me, maybe because I had such a small request (we only needed to have the bride's bouquet and the groom's boutonniere made as the bridal party all had paper flowers). Anyway, even though it as only a few weeks before the wedding Natalie at Asrai was more than helpful pulling something together for us. She took down some notes, emailed me some flower options, and really worked for the style I wanted within the price range I wanted to spend. For the bouquet I wanted lambs ear (something grey) in the mix and my wedding colors were red, white and black. To keep it from looking Christmas-y she mixed in some peaches and oranges that kept it in the summer feel. The boutonniere was made with some pieces from the bouquet and was that perfect blend of masculine and colorful. The bouquet was perfect. The boutonniere was perfect. Everything we could have wanted. And, their shop is incredible. Can't recco this place enough!

52.description: My sister and mother live in Minnesota and have insane wild flower gardens -- not having my own is the ONE thing I regret about living in the city.  Well, they may have their flower beds, but they DON'T have Asrai Garden.  I ain't a rich gal, so I only purchase flowers a handful of times per year, usually for a dinner party (my own or to bring as a guest if I'm sick of dragging a bottle of wine with me to those things).  Based on my experiences in other flower shops, their selection is gorgeous, and it seems like they curate their selection of flowers to be much more earthy, exotic and unusual than other (more run of the mill) shops.I usually walk in and name a pretty ridiculously low price ($10 or $15) and they meet me there or within $5 (plus they sometimes throw in an extra flower or two a gratis to make it look even better!) And contrary to what one might expect in a trendy Wicker Park shop that caters to the yuppy set, they don't make me feel like a bum for not dropping mad cash. Best of all, I am always beyond impressed with my simple, elegant and unexpected arrangement-- all for only a few dollars more than what I would spend at a grocery store on crappy carnations.

50.description: Asrai Garden is the most amazing store & flower shop. Love the creations that this shop produces.

4.description: I would not recommend Asrai Garden's for your floral needs. I ordered a bright, colorful, uplifting $150 arrangement for my sister-in-law who had a mastectomy last Thursday. Jackie specifically told me that my price point would produce a "Spectacular" arrangement.  After the arrangement arrived at the hospital, my sister-in-law requested that it be placed behind the bed so that she didn't have to view it because it reminded her of a Weeping Willow. It was a small, lovely arrangement with 13 flowers (yellow, peachy, and a couple of red). I called the flower shop to see if I could exchange the flowers for something more colorful and uplifting ASAP so that my sister-in-law could enjoy. I waited 2 days for a phone call from Elizabeth, the owner. She left me a voice message telling me that she and her staff were very pleased with how the bouquet turned out and how she received 500+ likes on Instagram. She also proceeded to tell me that they do not sell cheap flowers (such as Gerbers);  perhaps, insinuating that I much rather prefer those over hers for the price.  I left messages which were not returned....I'm pleased that she and her staff are pleased and that they are a success on Instagram.  However, you would think it be most important to please the paying client and to brighten up the day of someone who just had a mastectomy.  I am disappointed in their need to be "right" instead of their need for customer satisfaction.In response to Asrai's yelp response, the picture posted on my review was taken 1 hour after the flowers were delivered. It's as accurate as it gets. No trick photography or alterations in any way. Just a snapshot of the bouquet as they were delivered. I think the picture speaks for itself. In fact, I texted the same exact picture to Asrai the day after the flowers were delivered per their request.  They responded by telling me via voice message that the picture indeed verifies their quality work and is indeed stunning and beautiful.

6.description: These guys are great! They had to chase me down on my birthday and were so accommodating. Plus, the arrangement was gorgeous.

22.description: Natalie is amazing!  My now husband and I came in for an initial consultation and had a fantastic time just spit balling ideas.  Natalie is creative, passionate, friendly and very, very talented.When we walked in for the first time we were instantly enamored with how beautiful the store looked and smelled.  (Seriously, if I could get that in a perfume I would wear it everyday.)  Our wedding was very retro, nostalgic and fun and we wanted flowers that expressed that.  While I love flowers, I must admit I have no clue what many cut flowers are called, especially with how many exotic options are available these days.  Natalie made the whole process so much fun and her excitement was very genuine.My bouquet was gorgeous, and I cried (hysterically) when I had to say goodbye to the flowers I didn't save to dry.  The girl's bouquets were orange parrot tulips and popped so beautifully with their teal and turquoise dresses.  We used a lot of teal and turquoise in the linens and the orange, peach and yellow flowers used for the centerpieces looked AMAZING!(She also comped my stand-in for the bouquet toss and arrangements for the bathrooms which was so generous of her.)I would recommend Asrai Garden to any non-traditional bride who isn't looking for cookie cutter arrangements and cliché centerpieces.  Natalie makes the whole process fun and exciting.  Her and her staff at Asrai are phenomenal.

15.description: I ordered bridal bouquet for my friend and was very disgraced. In the morning when I gave to her my present, itlooked well. but at noon  flowers  began to wilted. I felt myself uncomfortable, because every guest looked at her bouquet and knew it was my present. I am very unhappy and don't recommend this place.

57.description: Honestly, I have nothing negative to say about Asrai.  They've never ever steered me wrong.  I've been going semi-regularly for the last 4 years for flowers, and they've always delivered exactly what I wanted, including the times when I say "surprise me!"They are a bit pricey so know that going in, but what you get will wow your girlfriend.

20.description: Have some interesting gifts. Have been back twice for horse tail jewelry. They are very helpful. I didn't buy any flowers but watched them build some beautiful bouquets.

36.description: I can't say enough about Elizabeth and Kristen.  When we set out to plan our big day, I was terrified that I wouldn't be able to afford flowers-- so many florists quoted us minimums larger than our entire budget!  Luckily, I stumbled across Asrai Garden here on yelp and scheduled a meeting with Elizabeth about 5 months before our wedding.  I was encouraged by their website, where their "wedding rant" says it all-- a $1000 wedding deserves the same attention as a $40000 one.Elizabeth was fantastic from the moment we walked in.  She worked with our small budget and produced the most gorgeous bouquets for our November wedding.  Emails were returned within 2 days, even during the busy summer months, by either Elizabeth or Kristen.  They flexed with our budget and allowed me to make changes with no fuss, even allowing us to supply some feathers and to pick up the flowers ourselves to save money.On our wedding day, I received tons of compliments from our guests and the hotel staff.  I don't think anyone would believe me if I told them how little we paid for the quality we got.  I am so grateful that people like this exist in the otherwise money-hungry, scheming wedding industry.  Asrai is A+ !
