14.description: I needed ten miniature bouquets for an event, and after following Asrai on Instagram and Facebook for ages and falling in love with their work, I timidly sent them an email with a laughable proposed budget of $150, a description of what I needed, and a list of flowers I hoped could be included. When Taylor and I connected by phone, she advised that they could definitely help me, and took the time to walk through my list, sharing the per-stem prices of each of my desired blooms. Many of them were about $10 each, and as such, she explained that even increasing my budget to $200, would allow them to do a great deal more, giving them $20 per bouquet. This turned out to be doable for me, and I really appreciated that she was very straight forward, but kind. She didn't pressure me, and gave me the impression that she really wanted to stay true to what I wanted, but supply the highest quality flowers possible for what I could spend. She assured me that it wouldn't be a problem for me to provide my own vessels (assorted jam jars) and pick up the flowers myself, the morning of the event. A family member picked up the bouquets, and brought them to the event venue the day of the party, and when they were unpacked, I was absolutely blown away by their inventive, creative beauty. They were interesting, balanced, and stunning, and quite a bit larger than I anticipated. Throughout the event, I received compliment after compliment on the flowers, and at a follow-up event the next day, I set them out again, as they still looked gorgeous. I ended up sending some of them away with loved ones, since flowers that lovely are too wonderful not to share. Still now, a month later, folks are remarking on the wonder of the flowers, and how they were some of the most exquisite bouquets they'd ever seen. Thank you for your dedication to excellent service and quality, Asrai Garden! I can't wait to work with you again in the future.

1.description: My Steamer came to the spa with a dent. called them and they said talk to the Ups about it.  The steamer lasted 2 months then smoked and died.  Called them and they are very rude and unprofessional.  never use them again!

0.description: I purchased 3 barber chairs for my hubby's shop. The customer service was beyond superb!! AK and CJ were super salesmen. I felt like I've been coming there for years. The prices will wow you. moreover, I didn't feel pressured. I  certainly be back to buy additional chairs and much more!!! If you are looking for any beauty or barber equipment/ supplies this is your place. Tell everybody that I sent you

28.description: Gotta LOVE Mr. Cake... I always get my cakes there..Customer Service is GREAT!!!! And cakes are DELICIOUS!!!! I have never had a complain about any of the cakes I've gotten there! By all means the BEST!!!

1.description: My family had been getting cakes from here for YEARS. My uncle is a good friend of one of the workers here. My cousin had ordered a cake: chocolate, half strawberry, half banana with Ariel on one side and hello kitty on the other. The cake came out to 52 dollars!!! None of us have never paid that much EVER. When we asked my cousin about it, he said that the girl on the phone was giving him all types of trouble, telling him if he got a picture on the cake, he couldn't get lettering..... When we've actually done BOTH for years. (He got both in the cake coz he told her this.) Obviously, someone decided to up charge us. Most of us will not be coming back. At least not without my uncle being the one to order. 3 stars just because I have never left a review before and their cakes are good quality. Good luck!

9.description: We ordered a few cakes from here. They were all good, in terms of decor and taste. They had very little variety when ir came to the fillings. Also the decorations were all very nice. I stopped because it was rather far..

29.description: I love this bakery.  Mr. Escobar is a humble man that really works to please his clients.  His employees are all friendly and focus on making sure the customers are always happy!  Mr. Cake has affordable prices and AMAZING cakes!  They are soo delicious!

23.description: My family and I have been coming here since we moved to Chicago about 14 years ago.  We get all of our cakes here!!! From a small family dinner to huge parties of 100 people. And no matter the size of our cake it always always taste delicious, moist and awesome. Throughout the years we have suggested crazy design ideas. From Lala Loopsy to The Blues Brothers to Beach theme. No matter what we throw at them they always pull through!!! So far through the hundreds of cakes we have gotten the beach theme has to be my favorite. It was just gorgeous and extremely detailed. And my little flip flops were magnets!! The owner is very nice and knows what he is doing. All the other workers are just the same no matter who I have gotten over the years my cake always turns out yummy and pretty. I always feel that if I have to get a cake some where else... (only because they close for a month some time during February)... I feel like I am cheating on Mr. CAKE! I always recommend this place to all of my friends and coworkers!! The only problem is that I noticed within the past year they have been using a different dye for the frosting ... so if your cake is blue so will your mouth! Ha... but it's just a minor detail. I love Mr. Cake ... oh now they have cupcakes!!! Try their carrot cake! It's (dare I say it again) yummy!!!

5.description: Wonderful place and so talented!  I brought in a picture of what I wanted the cake to look like and they created it beautifully. The cake tastes great too!

31.description: Custom cake maker specializing in airbrushing.  Cakes start at $15, more if you have a picture or doo-dad put on top, and the variety of cake and fillings seem rather endless.  The shop itself is very small, just a counter and a small cooler of drinks, nothing is premade and ready to go.  There is also no book showing previous work, only a generic idea book.  The folks working in there were very nice and helpful though.

25.description: This is my first yelp review!  I was asked to help plan a baby shower, a kind of last minute thing.  I have been known to be very particular and rather picky... so when it came time to order a cake, and because of the time frame involved I asked around and was referred to Mr Cake.  I called and spoke to owner (Mario) and asked for some pictures of his previous work.  He was nice enough to email me some pictures of his previous work so I decided to order from him.  The day I picked up the cake, I was very impressed with the way the cake looked... very cute!!  When it came time to serve the cake, there was not a single person that didnt LOVE it, including myself.  Everyone loved the cake, the prices were very affordable, but more importantly the customer service was awesome.  The owner (Mario) knew this was my first time ordering from him and he was so gracious to call me the following Monday to ask me how my experience was.   You just dont see customer service like that anymore.. so I will definitely go back, and recommend to everyone.

12.description: I ordered a birthday cake for my husband at the Crystal Lake location and asked for traditional buttercream frosting and filling. As far as decorations, I requested balloons and confetti. When my son brought it home, it was totally sprayed blue with glazed strawberries on top which were oozing all over the buttercream frosting. Absolutely horrible looking. I called to complain and was told that "it's not my fault, that's how we decorate a man's cake". I then spoke to "Mario" and was told I will get my money back; that doesn't help me tonight with guests coming over. So very upset and disappointed.

21.description: I picked up a cake for our office from here.  I don't know how easy it is to order and how many choices there are, but I can say that they make good tasting, beautiful cakes for decent prices.We had a photo on the cake, and the cake was airbrushed.  The colors were great, it was a very pretty cake.  It had fresh strawberries inside, and it tasted great.The other cakes in the display also looked nice.They even had chocolate covered strawberries.  My coworker and I each had one (only $1.25 each), and they were perfect.

16.description: This place is awesome!  After trying delicious cakes with my in laws from Mr. Cake,  I decided to order one for my son's baptism it turned out absolutely amazing!!! I loved the decor of the bible shape and his beautiful picture on one side.  Besides being very pleased with the design the cake itself was really good with fresh fruit and the flavors were excellent. I will definitely be ordering my cakes from here for every special event. The person I spoke to over the phone took really good care of me and the prices are reasonable!  I'm glad I gave this place a try!

17.description: I've been getting my cakes from Mr Cake for years! Always very good!  I tried getting a  cake from  somewhere else one year and paid more for less quality and taste!  The prices here at Mr Cake are very reasonable!  For any occasion, go here, you will not be disappointed!

10.description: The cake was absolutely gorgeous.  However, it was dry. I've ordered 2 other cakes from Mr. Cake within the last year and both of the other cakes tasted really good. Therefore, I am a bit disappointed. I also gave 3 stars this time because none of the graphics were edible. Not sure what happened but in the past all graphics have been edible.  We had to actually remove the graphics from the cake which was a little inconvenient & made the cake unappealing. Also, when I originally ordered the cake, a woman assisted me. I showed her a few cakes & she stated that none of the cakes I showed could be made without fondant icing ($150). I asked if anything could be done with whipped cream she was hesitant but finally said they could do the simplest one with whip cream but wouldn't be able to add the props. I called back to change the cake and spoke to Mario who was very helpful & explained that although they couldn't make the cake identical to the picture because they weren't using fondant, they make it as close as possible to the picture.

11.description: So disappointed with the Crystal Lake location. Tried for several different occasions to order a cake and the shop was closed! Actually everytime I've tried going there they've been closed except once. Why even have a second location?

26.description: I was a bit skeptic about going elsewhere for my daughters bday cake. I have been going to a different bakery for many years, however they did not have a "Justin Bieber" cake that I approved of. I gave Mr. Cakes a try because a friend made a great comment about them on FB... Well I am absolutely glad I went with Mr. Cakes, not only because it tasted GREAT but because I saved $40 and the cake was HUGE!!! It did not fit in our fridge, everyone was having seconds AND thirds. I had soooo many compliments, I was still cutting slices and could not wait to try it myself. I was impressed and believe me, I am VERY anal and always complain about something... this time speechless. I will definitely be going again.THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR MAKING MY DAUGHTERS DAY COME TOGETHER.

27.description: This is my first yelp review. That should show you how compelled to tell you that I love this cake. My boyfriend got me a cake from here for my birthday, and it BLEW ME AWAY! It was a picture from a movie that was perfectly copied onto the cake with some text. The cake looked great. The cake tasted great. The cake was affordable, which is not easy to find at most bakeries and the service was excellent. Everyone there was friendly and accommodating and helpful. The next cake I need is coming from Mr. Cake.

0.description: If I could give this place 10 stars I would I love there cakes and how fresh they are I always get my cakes from mr cake from baby shower cakes to birthday cakes they also are great about last min orders I called them this morning around 10 am to place an order for my sons 3rd bday and told them what I wanted on the cake and how I wanted it to look and when I went around 5 to pick it up I must say I was so pleased with how it came out my son loves ninja turtles that was the theme of his cake and it was amazing and taste amazing as well same thing last year for his 2nd showed up same day order as well and they took there time to make sure it was perfect love how friendly they are and    How affordable there prices are will deff keep going back and also will deff be recommending this place to friends and family. Mario the owner was the one who decorated the cake and he does an amazing job keep doing what you guys do  my son was a happy camper today thanks Mario and staff.....Second cake this month from mr. Cake and I must say my sister was amazed by how Mario did her cake for her baby shower she came in with an idea and he fulfilled it he made the cake exactly how she asked and can i tell you the cake was amazing soft and just right thanks Mario and the staff at mr. Cake you guys are truly amazing will be back soon

20.description: This would of had a 5 STAR RATING if only, They were organize! Mr.Cake has amazing and delicious cakes BUT they need to be more Organize with their time and orders. I ordered a cake for a Birthday, They said it was going to be ready at 6:30pm. I come rushing in to pick it up and it was not even ready or decorated!! As soon as I asked if my cake was ready? They rushed and started decorating it right in front of me. I was very upset. They take their orders in a plain yellow notepad and have to guess which one is your cake by you describing the decorations you asked for. SMH.Another thing, My sister ordered a cake for her wedding and guess what?, They forgot to make her cake! My sister was furious! On her wedding day?! They claimed that they had lost her order. Well, of course they did, they have teenagers running the place and no actual order sheets with order numbers or anything, Like I said, they use a plain yellow notepad to take orders. My sister was upset that she didn't had a wedding cake on her special Day. They refunded her the money she paid for but her day was a little ruined since every bakery was booked to make wedding cakes at the last minute. Great Cakes, Bad Service. They have 2 strikes with me, 1 more and they lose me as a customer. Advice: If you need a cake by 3pm, say you need it by noon, because most likely it will be ready 3 hours late.Also, if you order a cake in advance, keep calling them to check on your cake order before they forget.

19.description: Love Mr. Cake!  They are so good and reasonable.  You give them a theme and they run with it.  I had someone at work who was retiring to Colorado to become a ski instructor.  I asked for a ski theme cake and they made one.  It had snowboarders and they built a mini hill.  I also had someone who wanted a Hot Dog Cake, they made a large Hot Dog ontop of a sheet cake with all the toppings of  a Chicago Dog.  They also have cakes that are plain white and ready to decorate if you are in a pinch.  Their Tres Leches Cake is awesome.

2.description: I have been a customer at Mr. Cakes for 13 Years ... Best b day cakes ever. Mario whom is the owner always has a reccomendation. He even made a small wedding cake for our vow renewal ceromony and we had no idea what to write on it....He came up with "Our Story Continues" It was simply beautiful. Have not strayed andits that time again and I know I will be   happy with whatever the outcome.

18.description: I picked up a cake for our office from here.  I don't know how easy it is to order and how many choices there are, but I can say that they make good tasting, beautiful cakes for decent prices.We had a photo on the cake, and the cake was airbrushed.  The colors were great, it was a very pretty cake.  It had fresh strawberries inside, and it tasted great.The other cakes in the display also looked nice.They even had chocolate covered strawberries.  My coworker and I each had one (only $1.25 each), and they were perfect.

13.description: I attended a bday party for my cousin over the weekend and we had a blast watching little kids (including our own) run around the house like a bunch of wild maniacs!!! And thanks to Mr. Cake, there was plenty of fuel (sugar) to keep the kids going!!!I wish I would have taken a picture of the cake but it was already delved into by the time we got there. Personally, I don't even like cake all that much, as I'm more of a savory guy opting for 2nd portions of the main course instead :) But Mr. Cake makes a mean cake, no doubt. I asked my wife's aunt about Mr. Cake, she says they are super nice, you can order a cake to your specific customization and the prices are very reasonable. It's too bad I don't live close to this area anymore, but I recommend anyone who lives in the area and has a kids bday or special occasion and is in need of a customized cake to try this place out for sure!!

4.description: Best cakes always recommending to friends and family. Mario is the BEST always makes the cakes I envision and never tells me No. If your ever looking for a place to do something unique this is the placeDefinitely will continue coming here

24.description: They do some rally nice work at an affordable price very friendly and helpful. They did my cake on short notice when others wouldnt.The head Pastry Chef is from Crystal Lake and a Pastry chef Graduate Fulfilling her dream...Give em a try you will be glad you did... They are Now Open in Crystal Lake On Rte 14 in the Newly Renovated Crystal Lake Plaza in the Cove by the Currency exchange...

6.description: The Frozen Cake....was fluffy...the fruit was great... the kids loved it.. The cake was ready on time... my daughter love the cake.. they did a great job with the decorations and the details were Great... we will definely go back for my son's birthday cake...  I was very impressed with the staff that Mr.Cake has... and was super happy to find out.. that if I bring a picture from another cake that I like...they will try to do it as similar or better than the one I want.. looking forward to it.

22.description: Luck was totally on my side when I found Mr. Cake - thank you, fellow yelpers.  Based on reviews and my gut feeling, I went to Mr. Cake with a completely last minute order and still had the nerve to be ridiculously nit-picky about what I wanted.  Shameless, I know.  I came to them on a Saturday NEEDing a cake for the following Sunday for my daughter's baptism.  I had a very specific look I wanted, but kept getting ridiculous prices that I just couldn't stomache. This is why I came to them so late - I just couldn't spend an arm and a leg on a cake, but I couldn't settle for amediocre design either - whats a girl to do?? Enter Mr. Cake.  I spoke to them on the phone on Thursday and told them what I wanted and they gave me a price point that I was totally digging.  But of course, since I'm me, I had to go in the store myself and see what they were all about and they said I had until Saturday to place my order.  The day before I needed it - without an extra rush fee or anything - amazing.  So i went in there with pictures, instructions and all sorts of annoying specifics of how I wanted the cake to look.  And they were totally cool about working with me - even made suggestions that made my look even better!!  They were honest about what they could do and couldn't do (only b/c of short notice) and with pricing.  They made sure I knew what I was getting and showed examples - basically, they catered to my pickiness w/o showing annoyance - so awesome!And i must say, I was more than pleased with the outcome!  It exceeded my expectations and my bible cake was an absolute hit at the reception!! And it tasted soooo goood!!  My only gripe is that I didn['t know one side was strawberry and one side was banana - i assumed the whole cake would have both flavors, but no big deal!!  The owner emailing me with a follow-up to see how I liked the cake more than makes up for that minor detail.  Both sides of the cake tasted great, but banana was prob the better of the two!! It wasn't too sweet - just right!  I highly recommend Mr. Cake and will definitely be using their talented services again!!  A big thank you to the whole staff who dealt with my Momzilla arse!! :)

15.description: Idk why I haven't written a review yet for mr.cakesAll I have to say is keep on the good job mr. Cakes your cakes never disappoint me they always are very tasty and a master piece. This last cake I order from them was for my goddaughters 5th birthday and I showed the picture to the guy. And he said I'll make it look nice when I came to pick it up. I did not expect my the cake to look so beautiful it had all these details.. my goddaughter and all the friends and family loved it! I recommend mr. Cakes you will not be disappointed!

7.description: Very professional and well done cake for an incredibly low price.  I ordered my daughter's first birthday cake here and asked if they had a "Frozen" theme (the Disney movie).  They already had a "Frozen" cake layout that was ready to be made and picked up whenever I wanted.  I asked for yellow cake with banana filling and asked for the smallest size (6-8 people) which came out to $20.  I couldn't believe it when I saw it!  The cake was beautiful and definitely fit the "Frozen" theme perfectly.  It looked amazing with her birthday pictures.  And not only that, the cake was absolutely delicious. Not too sweet (which I like) and the cake was moist and the bananas were fresh.  I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone wanting to find a professional birthday cake for their child's party at an extremely affordable price - especially if the party has a theme!I'll admit it's a bit of a trek to get over here, but it was more than worth it. :)

8.description: Mr. Cake has the best cakes ever... The cakes are not frozen and the fillings are actual the fruit you order not sweet fillers. Plus the decoration you pick out really stands out and very talented...

30.description: Very clean place, almost...too clean (insert Horatio pause here).Too many years of crime TV has me thinking this place is a front for something bigger :)No but the guy working today was really cool and listened to what I wanted before nicely telling me that they don't really work with fondant. Damn you Cake Boss and Ace of Cakes for making me fondant happy! He did suggest a place that he thought would be able to meet my needs. I appreciated the gesture but already had a few places in mind.As far as cakes, they work mostly with whipped cream frosting but they do have some nice designs BUT beware of the old school looking wedding cakes complete with staircase...yeah, no.

3.description: I attended my nieces bday party this past weekend which she was very happy about it.she was talking about her party for weeks Everything was good until she cut the cake,she had to be rushed to the hospital after been smashed into the cake and poked/cut open  her eyelid with a wooden stick that was inside the cake. You would think they will let you know if there's a sharp item inside the cake knowing that most of the times people bite or get smashed into the cakes and how are we suppose to know that's how you hold up a cake we ARE NOT THE BAKERS. Fine if that's how you hold a 2 tier cake up but give your customers the heads up Thank god nothing major happened to her eye,she is doing good.She was so upset that she had to miss her own party bc of this incident.so be careful people when you bite into the cake.I'll be posting her pictures up.

14.description: Where do I start Mr. cake by far is the best!  when I say best I mean best!!!! . Thank you for all you do and for being a part of our kids birthdays. I will continue to do business with you for years to come. Again,thank you for the beautiful pokemon cake

3.description: The BEST tacos AL PASTOR I've ever had. A little pricier after the time has passed by.. I believe management changed also, but tacos are still as good & AUTHENTIC! I highly recommend it if your in the area :)

1.description: Our 1st choice for Mexican take out. We recently moved into the area and found this place. Their tacos al pastor are AMAZING! we eat here at least once a week. No other taco alPastor can compare to this. Orchata is good too we ate inside once and it wasn't the most comfortable but definitely take out anytime.

2.description: The best Mexican food in town! LOVE the steak tacos and burritos. The flavor of the meat is so tasty. Rice & beans are good too. I work in town and order from here at least twice a month. Highly recommend!

5.description: This place is definitely one of my favorites. Fair prices, good food. The reason I don't give it five stars is that this place is usually not clean. One of the reasons is that it's always full.

6.description: I love this place, I am a truly a loyal customer i refuse to eat at any other taco places. They are well known for their alpastor. The tortillas are dbl dipped in olive oil and the meat is done to perfection with chard on the sides. The price has gone up a bit but still affordable you save money if you order the taco dinner (dont worry the rice and beans are good too). Over all i have really no words to describe you how good this place is, its been open for more than 15 years and still going strong. Every other weekend i see the same people ordering from here. They hold up their name and sometimes they are over looked bc its a small joint but real people know the best food come from small family owned restaurant like these guys. I have invited a lot of people to this restaurant and they end up in love with their food. I will hire them for my family parties.

7.description: No frills and a small counter top dining area,  but wow! - the food!- The refried beans are authentic (most likely with the secret ingredient ala my uncle Amado, a heaping spoon of lard :P) The rice is also tasty - and the rice and beans sides are plentiful. They go well with the picked jalapenos and carrots that are placed on the counter top in bowls as a free condiment. Dinners will set u back between $5 - $7 and are plentiful enough to serve as dinner -and a snack. On the weekends, they have menudo in both the traditional red variety and a white variety-which is chicken broth based. Both are great and ring in at $5 and change for a large and $4 and change for a small. They include tortillas and onions, lime and pepper to toss in.  Try the carne asada or pastor if u want a well seasoned treat :) Heck try their whole menu; the prices cant be beat and u cant go wrong with quality and quantity.

8.description: Don't get me wrong.  I love Rick Bayless, but the carne asada tacos at this totally nondescript taqueria in Cragin are just as good as anything he's turning out at any of his restaurants.  It's not a knock on Rick.  These tacos are just that good.  The flank steaks are marinated in typical carne asada fashion, seasoned, and grilled over open flame.  The meat is always cooked to a perfect medium-rare with a bit of char on the outside.  They do a pretty brisk business during lunch, so there are some days when the smell of grilled steak fills the neighborhood for hours on end.  The tacos are served in the traditional style - double corn tortillas, raw onion, cilantro, lime and salsa verde.  Words can't even do it justice.  I can completely relate to the earlier reviewer who said he nearly hyperventilated the first time he had them.The other thing that's great about this place is the people that eat here.  There's a CTA bus depot next door, the El Milagro tortilla factory across the street, a handful of small warehouses nearby, and that's about it for a couple block radius.  Most of the clientele are usually covered in paint, dirt or grease and look tired and happy.  I just can't say enough about this place.

9.description: A bit out of the way but I like what this place has to offer. The quality of the food is excellent, the meat is cooked perfectly and every bite is full of flavor. Probably the best tacos to get here is the Al Pastor with some of the red hot sauce and you have satisfying meal. To wash it all down grab a joya or some Horchata or Jamaica. Down side, parking in the area is horrible and you the wait time seems a little long. All in all to be expected, so just relax and sip on your drink until your food gets there.

0.description: This place is definitely on my top 5 taco places in Chicago! Prices are great and the meat is delicious !!!

4.description: This is a small hidden place in a non congested area. Their tacos of lengua, carne asada, and al pastor are 2nd to none. If your with a group of people I warn you that their dining area is small so I suggest taking them to go. Believe me when I say your tastebuds will thank you later after eating from here......

3.description: Without a doubt a bargain in a box. .. They have a lot of things found at your local Costco but at a close out price.  I'm not sure how that happens but I don't mind.  This store is neat and organized enough to make looking easier.  This is definitely the best place for spaving... spending while you save.

1.description: Funky store that is 95% crap but 5% cheap treasures. They have a bunch of closeouts or damage boxes at tremendous prices as well add other items that they got a good deal on. You have to experience this place at least once! Some of the "shopping carts" are boxes with strings that you drag on the ground!

2.description: Absolutely love these stores.  We make a weekly visit to at least one of them.  It is basically a Costco, Sam's Club outlet.

5.description: I kinda don't want to review this place for fear it will become as paled as it should be. But this place is amazing. Each time I've walked out I've felt guilty like I stole something. There you have it you have the key is your choice if you unlock anything with it.

6.description: Normally, my experience at this store is in the 3-star range. The employees do a lot of talking amongst each other (which is totally fine unless there is a bunch of cussing going on and inappropriate convo). However, when my boyfriend and I went in earlier this week to purchase a TV, we had the great pleasure of dealing with Raul, the district manager. The first TV we got had a faint dead pixel line so he allowed us to return it for a different TV of which he knocked down the price due to the hassle. The TV is awesome (like seriously awesome as hell and we got it at an amazing price just because it was missing a Qwerty remote that isn't really necessary because the thing works with iPhones - keyboard problem solved!) and since we live so close by Raul WALKED the TV over to our house with my boyfriend because the box wouldn't fit in our car. There is no such thing as better customer service. Raul deserves a post-Christmas bonus or two.

0.description: This store is amazing! No more dollar trees or family dollars for me! I find something new here all the time. Brand name items for a lot less than most places!

4.description: Ever wanted to find a store that was a third each flea market, dollar store and Big Lots? Did you imagine it would be laid out roughly by room of the home sort of like a thrift store with shocking disorganization to match? Did you picture it would be primarily huge shipping boxes piled high with items that you have to sift through like a $5 DVD bin? Well it's real and it's AWESOME! Shaving cream, cereal, area rugs, coffee pots, spray cleaners, water pistols, never seen before brands of candy bars, luggage, spatulas, televisions, razors, scrubbing pads, ant poison, roasting pans, water filters... I could literally go on another dozen lines but I think you get the idea.  Unlike dollar stores, they have many name brand items.I spent about a half an hour skimming the surface of the boxes and walked with a few killer deals. Best in Show went to a "lot" of individually packaged 3M Scotch-Brite scrub sponges for $8. It was packaged in a way that I couldn't get an exact count but when I got home and realized there were 14 of them I was ecstatic. They often go for $3 a piece at Target. Runner-up went to a spray bottle of Pledge Multi-Surface (I love that stuff) for $2... that's less that half price.  Btw, it's easy to assume that the name of the store comes from the boxes piled high with bargains. It doesn't. Rather than a shopping cart, you pull a card board box with a nylon rope as a handle. I've never seen anything like it and I love it. It's like a thrift store except everything is new and there isn't any smelly clothing. Captain Coupon two thumbs up!

3.description: The worst place I have ever eat . We stop by there on the way back home, we were soo hungry. When we get inside there was nobody there- nobody at the lunch time, even waitress wasn't there. We were sitting at the table at least 15 min - still nobody. I decide to call for service, looking around ...finally I knocked the kitchen door and there was a not so nice girl who said - give me a minute- okWe ordered 2 red borsch with dumplings and 2 pancakes with goulash . In another 15 min we got our soups which was a disaster!!! The soup was pink! And cold - I think they freeze borsch with dumplings together and when it defrost in microwave dumplings take apart . Anyway it was nasty ! My husband took only a sip . For pancakes we wait another 30 min - after 20 min waiting I knocked the kitchen door again , waitress was there for the whole time . When I opened the door, she  didn't hear my knocking , I saw the waitress COOKING or maybe DEFROSTING ! she looked at me with anger and said " I will be back soon" When she finally appear with the pancakes my husband just get up and left that place after first taste of the meal. Pancake was soaking wet of the oil and goulash meat was frozen inside . At least she apologize and explained that the cook didn't show up at the work that day !!!!Zero stars. Plus for waitress for trying

1.description: I ordered food for delivery from this place. And two hours later find out that they cancelled my order without any explanation. And now I have to wait 7 days to get my money back. You should hire some kind customer service person who would call to the customers and notify them that you are cancelling an order.  This restaurant just waisted my time and left me hungry.  Horrible! You will loose all your business if you going to keep threat your customers like this!

2.description: Ordered potato and cheese pierogies and two bottles of white wine via grubhub. Shouldn't be a difficult order, right?The order was only five minutes late, but the pierogies weren't even lukewarm - there was no foil or anything attempting to keep them hot, and it looked like the delivery girl hadn't even brought them up in an insulated bag of some kind.Plus, they sent me red wine instead of white wine!I immediately called the restaurant to try to remedy the mistake, and it was during their open hours, so I thought it would be no problem... But they didn't pick up and their voicemail box was full. I tried multiple times and never got anyone.Stay away!

5.description: Me?  I like to eat like cholesterol and heart disease are but myths so, obviously, I love Polish food.  Driving by Anastazja Restaurant on repeated trips to Century Tile down the street, I couldn't resist and had to stop in. I was surprised by what a pretty (and spotless, I've never seen such a clean restaurant) room it was as in the Polish joints I typically frequent, atmosphere is a desultory afterthought.  On an late weekday afternoon, the husband and I were the only patrons, and were taken care of quickly.  Fun side note - this is clearly a family operation, our waitress was sitting with her mother and sleeping son in a quiet corner of the restaurant when we walked in. Mom seems to double as the cook, a positive sign under any circumstances.I had mushroom soup and pirogi, the husband had chicken soup and goulash.  Fresh bread and drinks were brought out promptly.  Although they do not have liquor, this is a BYOB, and the waitress said no corkage fees, so yay on that!  My soup was incredible, rich, creamy, full of noodles & mushrooms and clearly homemade.  I'm going to have dreams about that soup, it was that good. The husband's chicken soup was fine, but just couldn't stand up to my mushroom soup.Pirogis (you can get a mix of two flavors and they have about 8 on the menu) were very good, but were oddly served without sour cream.  What?  No extra fat on my plate?  For reals? Sigh. In any case, there was a dark sauce (Maggi?) on the table for dipping them in, so that worked out.  Made from scratch, the dumpling part was great but the fillings were a tad on the bland side.  Still, pretty damned tasty.  The husband's goulash (served with a choice of two types of dumplings or rice) was incredible - dumplings were fresh and from scratch, meat was tender, sauce was rich, and the fresh dill over the top was quite nice.A bit pricey for a Polish restaurant ($2.00 per soda, average entree about $12.00) but a beautiful room, BYOB, good food, and a family run operation.  Even if I have to bring my own sour cream next time, I'll be back.  I think I might be that mushroom soup's bitch.

6.description: Ordered delivery through Grubhub. Great food will for sure order again.

7.description: I would highly recommend this delightful restaurant to anyone living or working in close proximity.  I went there for lunch on the last Tuesday of last June only because I happened to be in the area.  What a treat!The place was clean and attractive enough.  All tables were covered with nice linen.  A flat-screen blared a Polish soap opera. An ethnic Chicago atmosphere.  A young, sweet waitress greeted me and I ordered the salmon.  She offered a choice of salad.  I selected some sort of 'slaw plate' which had 3 different Polish slaws, each as good as the other.When she served my filet of salmon, I could see that it was in fact a swordfish steak (gotta lose a star), but it looked good.  It was delicious!  As to sauces, they only had BBQ sauce, so I asked for butter.  I was amazed at how something as simple as melted butter on parsley potatoes and fish could taste so good.  It was about $15 with tax and tip for a delectable, authentic meal.  Will definitely go back!

8.description: Went here with another couple after reading a couple of Yelp reviews and thought we would try it.  Wow, this place is definitely a keeper!  We were there on a Sunday evening and the only people in the place, but I don't know why because the food was wonderful; the service delightful.  We brought a couple of bottles of wine and a few beers for the boys (BYOB!) and even after eating food for about 3 hours straight, we still brought home enough for plenty of seconds.  The mushroom soup was amazing, the pierogi (mixed plate) were about the best ever, and the goulash with potato pancake was not only an entire platter of delectable meat and the best (and largest!) two potato pancakes I ever had, but my husband's pork shank with spinach and cheese was great.  Then we had Anastazja cake - whoa!  And for the four of us, the bill amounted to about $17 each - I felt almost guilty eating that much wonderful food for so little money ... but we did leave a good tip for our oh-so-sweet waitress.  Definitely coming back!

9.description: Great food, but some fatty, I always do lunch there if I'm the area.

0.description: A solid polish restaurant. It's pretty far away from my apartment, but they deliver. The food arrived on time, but the delivery driver snipped at me about not having our numbers on the building. He said "this is a problem" to me in a thick Polish accent.Their pierogies are great. Their beef stroganaw was delicious. Solid food, and how can you argue with a place that's open until 2AM on weekdays? The prices are great, and the portions are large.

4.description: I was in the mood for some simple home cooked food.  Ordered Pork chops and potatoes, and decided to try the herring in oil.  The pork chops and potatoes ain't bad, and the herring was ok.  I would order and try some other stuff from here tho.  We shall see.

1.description: Fresh food and nice atmosphere. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Now let's get to the food! I've ordered the: Shrimp taco salad- amazing, fresh shrimp, plenty of shrimp, tasty shrimp. Yes it was packed and the shell stayed crispy.Chorizo (tacos, sopes, burrito and tostada)- the chorizo was not greasy, but tasty. It's not spicy at all.Lengua (beef tongue)-  tender and tasty (shredded not in cubes like a so called #1 taco place)I am currently working my way through the menu. Pictures coming soon!!

9.description: The BEST horchatas! Everything else is amazing too. I've pretty much tried everything on the menu since I live down the street from this place and it's been around for over 10 years and although it's changed it's name, The food stays the same; simple but delicious. The tostadas are piled high and the Chile rellenos are full of flavor (these happen to be two of my favorite things on the menu) but anything you choose will leave you satisfied.

23.description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood Mexican restraunts.They have good prices and a good selection.They are very nice to me every time I come in. And patient with me when my Polish self tries to pronounce the names of the dishes. I love the enchiladas, torta de milanesa, and the breakfasts.If you ever in the area I recommend this restraunt.

12.description: Great local place. After seeing this spot on my daily work route I decided to check it out. The decoration is colorful and traditional Mexican. The service was fast and very friendly. We ordered some pastor tacos, a torta and a sope all of which were tasteful and reasonably priced. A clean place was seen all throughout as well. Will definitely come back here in the future.

21.description: I haven't been here in a couple of months but I used to frequent this place. This used to be my go to place for Huevos Al a Mexicana.. It's was ridiculously cheap and great to split with someone be it when running late for class or after a particularly late night out.The staff here is really friendly and the food is pretty consistent and good across the board.Nothing is better than some chile rellenos and a good milkshake from here!

16.description: This is a great place for dinner!  It is a small place with nice decor.  There are a few TVs with Telemundo on, but never loud enough to distract from conversation.   Prices are very reasonable.  I like to bring my friends in to share the experience.You walk in and they give you a cup of soup with salsa and chips.  The food has always been great.  Service from the friendly staff is always great.  To top it all off they even offer complimentary flan!

17.description: Love this place to order. I ordered some food yesterday and the delivery was quick! My boyfriend was amazed when he saw his food. It was delicious and he told me if to write a review and give El Azteca 10 stars. Lol. The food I ordered was delicious as well. The price is fair and the delivery fee is fair as well. Good job El Azteca I guess we will be visiting the restaurant soon.

10.description: Ordered food for 5 people and cost $35. Great food. Althought, I would have liked full condiments on my tacos not just the offered lettuce tomatoes. And the reason for not 5 star, no delivery. This place is small, but clean and the food is great. The chairs are artful and they also made a chimichanga even though it was not on the menu. I recommend this place.

5.description: It's a nice small place. The food is amazing there's usually one server it's a small place. They have many option and accommodate any substitutions on your meals.Only one small thing there is no liquor sold here although they do say byob is accepted

11.description: The servers are so nice & humble.Try to explain the menu & options FOOD IS DELICIOUS. Fresh veggies & the Horchata is Bomb!And very Decent prices, very Affordable I'd Say. Deffinitely Recommend it & Its BYOB & don't charge for it, which other places do ... I don't know why, but El Azteca is the Best.

22.description: I've been eating at this place and ordering carryout for about three years. I usually get the burritos or steak tacos. The chiles rellenos are great. They have a juicer so they can make fresh orange juice right in front of you which is very delicious. The tacos de lengua (beef tongue) are very good.

0.description: Delicious food. Tacos piled high with meat!! The seasoning is amazing in all dishes. Have tried the chicken tacos, steak tacos, grilled chicken breast and green enchiladas. They were all amazing and I left a happy customer. The staff is also super sweet and accommodating. They checked with us to make sure everything was good and when a friend called to say he was joining we put in his order since it was ready so quickly they came over and covered it in aluminum and kept it warm for him. It's the little things... Will be back for sure!

20.description: great decor inside, everything here is good, nothing really to let you down.

19.description: Their shrimp cocktail is amazing!!  I ordered the small and was surprised at how much shrimp came in it.  Their portions are very generous.  The beef, chicken and shrimp parrillada (menu item #22) was delicious also.  They serve all their parrilladas with rice, beans, avocado, salad and tortillas.  Great prices also.  I loved how friendly the staff was and just when I finished telling my boyfriend how amazing the place was they gave us a complimentary flan desert!  Will definitely be going back.

2.description: Wow!! The food is delicious and plentiful. Make sure you bring a hearty appetite. Friendly staff, excellent service, and beautiful decor. We will definitely be back, can't wait to try other menu items.

18.description: This is my ultimate favorite Mexican restaurant - hands down.  Their food is absolutely delicious and authentic.  My favorite guilty pleasure is their salsa and chips... its honestly an addiction.  I always order the largest size available of salsa and a bag of chips for to go   A definite must try!

13.description: Went today. ... decor was nice service was super fast and nice.  Chips and salsa was fresh... the rest of the food was avg. I will give it another try and order something else.

4.description: Came here for breakfast. Good huevos a la mexicana. Good portion size, great price. The coffee was good especially with the side treats.

6.description: Best guacamole yummy I wish I had some now .Looks clean . Nice people . It is a little annoying that it's cash only but nothing else I can do . I mean it's 2015 credit cards are what's in .. So please get one thank you . Lol

15.description: Their food has always been pretty good. The prices are decent. I that you get a cup of soup while you wait for your food. Check it out people!!

7.description: I love this place. The food is delicious and the people who work there are super nice. The place is very clean and they are fast ! Prices are incredibly reasonable . I've been here a million times and will continue to do so. :)

8.description: Came here for breakfast. One of the best chilaquiles in the city. (Con carne, red hot sauce) wonderful service--but we were the only ones here at 8:30am.  The coffee was great. My hubby had the huevos a la Mexicana--he loved it! We will be back here to try the lunch and dinner menus. Yum!

3.description: Place is nice. It's a casual restaurant. I ordered the tostada with chicken breast and a chicken gordita. The tostada would have been enough. Its a very well packed tostada! The chicken was seasoned right and the condiments were plenty. The gordita was also a good size and that alone would be satisfying. I would come back and recomend others to give it a try.

14.description: I can't say enough nice things about this place!  1)  It's super cute inside.  You'll spend half of your first visit checking out the pretty chairs.  (And the ceiling is very HGTV).2)  Service is always friendly and patient.  There are very ritzy places downtown that should send their waitstaff here for lessons.3)  I saved the best for last!  THE FOOD!  Just for sitting down at dinnertime they will bring you chips with salsa and little cups of soup.  After your scrumptious meal they usually bring you a small complimentary serving of flan.  I don't know about you but that's just plain hospitable in my book.  Definitely try to go in for a sit down meal, take out orders miss out on the yummy extras.

58.description: Excllent food and cheap! I ordered the chicken pesto penne. The plate was HUGE and only $6.50 or so. The pasta was good and the manager working the counter was funny and personable. Looking at all the tables around me, I could see that everyone had a giant amount of food, and at an extremely reasonable price, too! This restaurant stands out more than any other business in the neighborhood and I'm so glad it caught my eye. Definitely going back if I'm nearby again.

56.description: My husband and I were driving, when seriously had to stop and turn around because this place we passed smelled so good!We stopped in and as if we hadn't eatten in weeks ordered our meal. Low cost, great portions, and great food!Today is my second time stopping in and it was as great as the first time!

29.description: Checking out this new place for lunch!So, I was gallivanting all over the city today, running various errandsand I found myself in the Belmont- Cragin Area, now I know this areaquite well, I actually went to Foreman High School in this area.. ah, thosewere the days.. cutting class and getting caught by the Principal..Okay enough about that..So, anyway, I was hungry from all that gallivanting around and I found thisfairly new great little spot called Bread Basket.Now, since I had never been there before I was hoping I picked a winnerand the luck of the irish must have been with me today cause It was Da Bomb!Actually for the record I am Scottish, but I am pretending to be Irish today..:)Okay, so I perused the menu and couldn't believe how much variety thisplace was offering me, seriously, they are open Monday through Sunday 8am-9pm,they serve all sorts of Breakfasts, hand made Burgers and hand cut fries, pastas,sandwiches galore, salads, soups, chili, pizza, and they have a kids menuwhere the munchkins will eat free on Tuesdays, Dine In Only..I swear, Munchkins get all the breaks...Okay, so I ordered these mozzarella sticks that for some reason my camera won'tupload for me.. see, there goes my luck of the irish..But, they were Da Bomb, truly..Served to me on a lovely Glass Plate with a Rose Design, No paper/Styrofoam herefolks, if you dine in you eat on China..:)And I had a Bacon Cheddar Burger with this Chipotle Mayo Sauce, so good!They also have up at the counter fresh baked muffins and I saw some loavesof bread, and they say their bread comes from Red Hen, Nice!The staff I saw today all were working hard, constantly cleaning and makingsure everything was running smoothly..So, gotta say, I'm glad I came across this place, it's definitely a keeper inmy book..This place is just cool, they play great music, have great food options,and menu prices are more than reasonable..So, if you're ever in the Belmont-Cragin area you should go and visitBread Basket..I'm glad I did..:)

42.description: Mmmm, okay I'm a regular here. It's right around my corner, we all have a place like that, right?I've tried different sandwiches, soups, salads, etc.,  and they're all very good at reasonable prices too. Yes I know, their coffee machine never works, and they never have things for the smoothies and shakes.But their Chicken Caesar Wrap! Ahhhhhh so so tasy. I wish I could eat it every day. Seriously though, try it sometime, and you won't regret it.:)

23.description: My husband and I decided to give this place a try. We ordered, jalapeño poppers, chicken tenders, onion rings, grilled cheese and soup. The food took about 10-15 minutes but came out Very hot and fresh. The food quality was above what I expected and The prices are also very reasonable with proportions larger then I expected. We'll be back for sure!

47.description: I love this place! It's three blocks from my house, I go there about once a week and I have yet to experience a bad day there. I love the price that you get for the portions (which are generous). They are well rounded with almost everything. Their Chicken Caesar salad is uhh-mazing! I really like their pastas, sandwiches and soups. Everything tastes really fresh, and like it was made at home from scratch. As a bonus they have a small free parking lot! The only complaint I would have is that I ordered my salad for delivery one day and it took quite a while but then again, it was a friday evening. It is not as bad as everyone makes it seem. It's a cozy little neighborhood place, not a pricey downtown bakery shop. They have a little of everything, with a friendly atmosphere. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

8.description: Absolutely Not Edible. I just ordered this through grubhub and for the first time ever (despite the fact I buy cheap, greasy food a lot) I had to file a complaint. I ordered a bacon double cheeseburger that was so poorly cooked they cooked bacon into the patty (it was disgusting). Also I ordered the chicken wings which were obviously frozen and undercooked - they tasted awful (the ones I could eat). The bun on the burger was stale and just putrid (This is called the Bread Basket?). Wow, just wow. Food is in its proper location - the garbage.

31.description: This place made me sick once but decided to give it a second try. My boyfriend and I decided to eat there. The place was closing in 25 minutes. We decided to hurry and order but apparently the staff didn't want to deal with us since they were closing soon because they pretty much said they ran out of everything. Really? We asked for a hot dog, "sorry, were out of hot dog buns". I asked for a burger, "sorry were out of burger meat". Once the cashier guy made some suggestions on what we should order, we politely said, No but thank you anyway, he rolled his eyes. Really? Youre going to tell us what to order and then roll your eyes? fuck this place.

34.description: This place is wonderful. The perfect place to come with a group of friends since they have a large variety of food- something for everyone. Prices are reasonable. Portions are great & atmosphere is pleasant.

16.description: Their Bacon Cheeseburger dinner plate is a great deal for your money..the Brioche bun was crispy the taste of the burger itself was a definition of comfort food & the lady who took our order & waited on us (Jasmine) a true professional & very accommodating! I highly recommend this place!!!

13.description: This was my first time coming here and it was on a Sunday there wasn't a lot of people and the restaurant was clean, and the cashiers were friendly and the service was pretty fast. The food was really good also.

11.description: Wanted to update my review since this restaurant has refused the courtesy of a response to me. A few hours after the sandwich I decided to have the chicken noodle soup. I was sick and it's a comfort food. Well, unfortunately it was almost as bad as the sandwich. Bland and flavorless. I'd also ordered the Tres Leches cake. I thought well  how can this be bad right? WRONG, it was sour! I couldn't believe it.  Since this was a 25 dollar meal I didn't want to let this slide. I mean, one bad item, maybe, but all three??? So I've since called the store twice and was told the manager, Demetrius, would call me back. To date I have not received a call. I was hoping I could change this review at some point to give them the benefit of the doubt. However, their lack of response has left me no doubt. I will never order from them again. Bad food AND poor customer service.

39.description: My girlfriend, her parents and I decided to give this place a try since the place looked very appealing from the outside.  Once inside, we palced our orders, 1 Grecian Chicken Plate, 2 Gyros Plates and   NOT SOO GOOD...I should have really read the reviews on yelp before actually dining here.

37.description: Great food for such a little place. I had he Cajun tilapia sandwich with fries and the fish was a bit over seasoned but that's about it. They have a HUGE menu for such a small place. I will go back again to try out something else

0.description: There's not one item on the menu that I dislike! I'm a frequent customer from 3-7 times a month.

38.description: Don't order from here. I ordered a bunch of food to be delivered. The food was 45 minutes late, and cold--not even room temperature. It was actively cold. I had to put the food in the oven to warm it up. The delivery guy was extremely rude, and when I called to complain they didn't do anything about it or apologize. Terrible service, and a terrible restaurant.

51.description: Bread Basket has huge portions and reasonable prices. The Chicken Parm is a fav of mine and the home made fries are great..

27.description: This place has gone down really quick! They use to have good food now everything taste microwaved and poor quality. They mess up orders and they know it's messed up and instead of fixing it, they give you your food the way the cooked it instead of the way you asked for it. It's a shame the place is nice and great brownies and awesome music. But not enough to have me coming back.

32.description: They have an amazing chicken caesar salad, their chicken noodle soup is great. They always have fresh cut French fries, and their bacon cheeseburgers is always cook just right. My kids love going here because they also have a small selection of slices of cake. Their lunch specials are not bad at all. I truly enjoy that the kitchen is always clean and tidy, and you can always see the cooks cooking your food!

54.description: We have been by this restaurant at least 20 times and have said often enough, "we should try that place", well today we finally did. We were not disappointed at all. Fresh, not frozen french fries, chicken breast that was not pre-frozen, a juicy burger that was cooked decently, and fresh buns, that were not old. The girls behind the counter were super friendly, and extremely accommodating when we needed something extra. We will definitely be back when we are in the neighborhood, because their menu looked great.

48.description: I came in here expecting a lot more than I got. Still, the food was good. Nothing special. I had a cheeseburger with fries, and a drink, which ended up being around eight dollars. The food is mildly over-priced for what you get. A lot of fries, a decent burger, should've been more around six dollars. The dining area was nice, and the staff was friendly and attentive. I just wish there was more of a passion to their work.

44.description: Decent food, quick and cheap! cant beat it for whats around my neighborhood! i always get delivery though!

24.description: I probably eat here once or twice a week seeing as how I live a block away. Love this place. Huge selection of food and great service. Not to mention the fact that you get a lot of food for a very good price. I recommended the gyro combo. Either that or the Italian beef sandwich.

7.description: I've been coming here for a couple of years and tonight I found out the guy doesn't even have wifi so I can work and eat. Told that "the guy doesn't want it" for "security". What!  No clue.

49.description: Given the fact that there aren't many "healthy" food options around this neck of the woods, this place is A-Okay. I've been here a couple of times, and have been pretty underwhelmed and unimpressed with the quality of food and service. Just because it's take out, it doesn't mean that I wouldn't want to start sipping on my drinking while I wait for my food, as I could be pretty hungry or thirsty as hell. The fries are pretty gross - soggy and greasy, just because they're fresh it doesn't mean that they're any good, I'd rather have over processed fries from Burger King at any given day than taste these "fresh" soggy greasy ass fries, ever heard of the term Crispy and savory? All the food was soggy reallly, specially that awfully dark green, old looking lettuce in my burger. I was also expecting more bacon on my double bacon and cheddar burger, nevertheless the meat was actually pretty good and medium-well, the way I like it. This has become a last resort place to get food, if I had more time on my hands, I'd go the extra mile, west on Belmont and get a few steak tacos from Taco Burrito King instead, and I'd probably spend less money and the food will be delicious.

40.description: Walked in with my girlfriend and 1yr old daughter. Was not greeted AT ALL. Come on! That is restaurant 101. They even say "welcome" at McDonalds.  If they were packed, I would have more sympathy but, we were the ONLY customers there. There is something that resembles a host station and no menu board behind the register. We stood awkwardly staring at the cashier for a few moments before I had to ask "do we just sit anywhere?" Her reply is "yea." Not in a rude way but, at this point I would figure she would offer a tad bit of assistance. I'm carrying my baby looking around for a high chair......no assistance from staff or even a "hey, high chairs are over there." We grab a seat and wait.........and wait........and wait.........STILL THE ONLY CUSTOMERS in the place. I get up and go to the cashier girl who has been doing nothing but, leaning behind the counter the entire time. I ask if there are menus. She points and replies " there."  Been in the place for quite some time now, have had 2 words spoken to me and still don't know if we will have a server or not. I browse the menu but, at this point I'm already fed up. Lost my business. We got up, left and went to a "mom and pop" diner down the street and had a 5 star experience. The items and place looked intriguing but the staff killed any hope I had. I wish I didn't even have to give Bread Basket a single star. My apologies to the owner because your staff on duty that day is horrible.

53.description: Food was good, clean eating area, and nice environment. Didnt like the french fries :(

30.description: They have the BEST pesto pizza comes w basil, tomatoes, romano, parmesan, feta on a nice thin crust. Always super yummy! Vanilla milkshakes  :-)Make sure to ask for it extra thin. Their pesto is homemade and Amazing!!!!! Sometimes they are out or do not have enough to make the pizza, if that is the case ask for the pasta w pesto :-)They should sell their pesto sauce it is that good!!!!!sTheir pesto pizza is da bomb! This place has the best pest pizza! I crave it!!! This is my secret place for that, vanilla shakes and their house salad is a really good value(super fresh). Chocolate chop cheese cake nothing special. Will not be ordering that again.

46.description: This place fills a nice niche in my book.  All the comfort foods you could hope for - pizza, burgers, sandwiches, bread, desserts, salads, etc - but with an atmosphere that rises above greasy spoon diner.  I appreciated the attention to detail and the fact that the food was made to order.  Not quite as cheap, but worth a little extra for what you get.  Still a good value.

1.description: I ordered a salad from here for lunch today!!! Salad never came!!! I kept calling!!!! And they kept saying they were trying to get in contact with the driver!!!!The driver called me 10 and said he was outside!!! No one ever showed up with my damn food!!!!  And the manager was really rude!!! Getting my money refunded and will never order from this place again!!! They aren't even worth the 1 star I gave them!!!!

55.description: The food is ok. I think it's great that they brought a place like this into the area. My only complaint is that the food takes forever to come out. At least it did when I went my 3 times. Even when I ordered in advance, I'd have to wait another 20 minutes for the food. Like I said, good food, just slow service. Their salads are actually what I go for.

9.description: Checking out this new place for lunch!So, I was gallivanting all over the city today, running various errandsand I found myself in the Belmont- Cragin Area, now I know this areaquite well, I actually went to Foreman High School in this area.. ah, thosewere the days.. cutting class and getting caught by the Principal..Okay enough about that..So, anyway, I was hungry from all that gallivanting around and I found thisfairly new great little spot called Bread Basket.Now, since I had never been there before I was hoping I picked a winnerand the luck of the irish must have been with me today cause It was Da Bomb!Actually for the record I am Scottish, but I am pretending to be Irish today..:)Okay, so I perused the menu and couldn't believe how much variety thisplace was offering me, seriously, they are open Monday through Sunday 8am-9pm,they serve all sorts of Breakfasts, hand made Burgers and hand cut fries, pastas,sandwiches galore, salads, soups, chili, pizza, and they have a kids menuwhere the munchkins will eat free on Tuesdays, Dine In Only..I swear, Munchkins get all the breaks...Okay, so I ordered these mozzarella sticks that for some reason my camera won'tupload for me.. see, there goes my luck of the irish..But, they were Da Bomb, truly..Served to me on a lovely Glass Plate with a Rose Design, No paper/Styrofoam herefolks, if you dine in you eat on China..:)And I had a Bacon Cheddar Burger with this Chipotle Mayo Sauce, so good!They also have up at the counter fresh baked muffins and I saw some loavesof bread, and they say their bread comes from Red Hen, Nice!The staff I saw today all were working hard, constantly cleaning and makingsure everything was running smoothly..So, gotta say, I'm glad I came across this place, it's definitely a keeper inmy book..This place is just cool, they play great music, have great food options,and menu prices are more than reasonable..So, if you're ever in the Belmont-Cragin area you should go and visitBread Basket..I'm glad I did..:)

26.description: Ordered mots sticks, onion rings and two burgers. Maybe because we had it delivered but the onion rings were kinda soggy and the burgers dry. The only good thing was the mozzarella sticks. Burgers looked great but just had a bland dry taste to them. Won't order burgers here. Might try something else if ever feeling pasta bowls.

25.description: I freaking LOVE this place! Best salad in the city! The delivery is quick, the prices are great, and man do you get bang for your buck! I get two meals out of their salads! Looking forward to trying their burgers and breakfast!Mmmmmmmmm... Thanks for the yummiest lunches, Bread Basket!

12.description: Food was good but when I went back to the cashier to order a dessert separate from my initial order, she said I couldn't use my debit card for purchases under $5.  The cake was $3 so she turned down a sale to save on a few cents her credit processor would have charged?  Plus, aren't those fees considered write-offs? I don't know but if it were my business I would have made the sale.    Seems petty.

59.description: I wouldn't serve that garbage to my DOG......Maybe Alpo taste better

21.description: Everything I've had so far is good. I really like their salads and the place is always clean. The food is ready fast and it's made to order. They also deliver if you live in the area and their hours are pretty decent. Recommendable place.

17.description: Alright I've been here several times and have always been pretty happy.  But the last time I went I ordered Chicken Alfredo Pasta and it tasted like hospital food. Stick to the soups salads sandwiches and deserts you'll be ok.

10.description: My past experiences have been lukewarm..Service is super slow all the time..Would not recommend this place...I only come on my day off....I was here todah because I was on the bus going to the post office...I managed restaurants back in the 80's and 70's...I took pride in my service...which is lacking in The Bread Basket... I will be back in a blue moon..for my last meal it won't be from here, I might be dead by the time I get my gyros sandwich..tootleoooo for know..this is Chicago Joe signing off.

5.description: I've visited this place so many times with family and love it more and more. I like their salad. My family love their burgers and pasta. The prices are affordable, the atmosphere feels like home, and the amount of food given is just right

3.description: We ordered the gyros sandwich and it was delicious. The service was attentive and the prices good. Nice place to have in the neighborhood!

35.description: I'll preface this by saying I'm a rather picky eater so take this for what it's worth. Stopped in this past weekend as it's a place I've been curious about trying for a while now. The interior is very nice, clean, staff was friendly. Ordered the cheddar bacon burger and some mozz sticks. I'm not sure exactly what they put in the burger for flavor, but it certainly was nothing I was expecting and I thought it was rather disappointing.  All I could tell was there were some tiny chopped up bits of something green, but god only knows what it was because it didn't taste like anything I'm used to eating.  It also was a bit overcooked, and the bacon could have been a bit more crispy. Fries were pretty good, definitely not as soggy/greasy as some others have experienced. Maybe I got lucky that day. Mozz sticks were the best part of the meal. Also grabbed a loaf of bread they had at the register, which was only $2 and much better than I expected.Portions were worth the cost, though not exactly worth the quality. I'd be willing to go back and try some other menu options, but I'll definitely pass on the burgers from now on.

19.description: If you don't know what in the hell you want to eat, bring yourself into the bread basket. This place has it all, chili, meatball subs, I'll bet they have turkey, salads and dessert. Reasonably priced and fast, I'm a fan. You can be in the mood for basically any kind of American food and your needs will be covered like a warm meat blanket

28.description: Great food, close to home and never disappoints.

45.description: This used to be one of my favorite places for lunch--HOWEVER, something has really changed here.  Perhaps they are having financial problems or something, but the menu is different than it used to be--even though the old menu still hangs so proudly above the area where you order.  They used to offer some really great dishes and pizza by the slice, which they no longer do.  Their fries are a total disappointment, they are always so brown and yummy looking--but, they are actually, ALWAYS, really soggy and gross.  Which is a shame, as so many of their items come with fries--so you may like the sandwich, but you are stuck with the fries?  So, the other day, after not being there for a good four months, we decided to give it another try as we had been so disappointed the last time we were there--and, nothing has changed, we were still disappointed.  I had the chopped salad--they should just call this chopped lettuce as there was very little bacon, I had to really dig to find a small little piece of blue cheese--the dressing was awesome, but had to ask for more.  The roast beef sandwich which my sidekick had was really good--but, then you had to be stuck with the soggy fries.  So, really, as much as I have tried to really getting back to liking this place, I, more than likely will never go in again.  They also used to have very friendly staff at the counter--the other day, not so much--anyway, a real disappointment.  So, why the three stars you ask?  Well, the dressing was really good for the chopped salad and the sandwich was really good.  And, some of that third star may just be some old loyalty from when I used to LOVE this place.  Would I recommend--NO.

33.description: Not worth going! One of the girls was in the washroom throwing up and then handling the food. The service was horrible, my order was incomplete and the girls were rude. This place can be better if the staff is replace with people that actually want to work!

43.description: I remember the first time I walked into this place, the first thing I noticed was the warm & inviting decor: flowers on the table, warm colors, friendly service.  At the start of the line there's a chalkboard with the daily specials & soups of the day.  Really the reason I love this place is because of the huge portions.Some of my favorites here include the chopped salad (although if you're getting it delivered make sure to ask for the chicken on the side unless you enjoy soggy salad) as well as any of their soups or sandwiches.  I particularly like the triple decker club.  I've had some of the pastas which are decent if you're craving pasta, but can be a little on the unseasoned side sometimes.  Pizza was so-so, even if it was humogenous.  Some of my friends highly recommend the gyros plate, which can easily be turned into 2 meals.Overall it's a clean, decent diner with consistently fresh food.

2.description: Had the gyro from here and it was great. Gyro sandwiches come with fries and soda. My brother had the chicken wrap very tasty too. Our first time eating there so I'm not too familiar with the rest of the menu but the Gyro and wrap delish!

18.description: It's okay, not great but it's okaaaay.... I don't really have exact words to describe it. Fast delivery though, that's always a plus!

41.description: good cheap eats.  hidden gem.  awesome fries.

52.description: We have lived in the area for over a year and today was the first time we made it into this place. We were a little apprehensive because we were kind of in the mood for something that would clog our arteries and this placed looked like a healthy cold sandwich shop. Turns out it has  plenty of items that will drive your cholesterol up pretty good.  I had a burger and it was seasoned pretty well. It also has a ton of different options. If you live in walking distance definitely give this place a try.

50.description: Finding a remotely healthy food option in this neighborhood is a valiant quest, only for the brave. I'm not sure why, but I decided to give Bread Basket another chance. Luckily, they've improved upon their formerly poor form.I tend to stick to the salads seeing as they require a less precise attention to cooking detail and I've yet to be punished. They have a few decent combos that have satisfied my need for the green.

4.description: So... I notice that a lot of people have some sort sour experience and just complain about the food. I've been here 2 times and decided to not go back because of, yes, the food but I want to give  feedback and mention that the menu is way too complicated. The amount of items ready to ordered are overwhelming  and by looking at it I know that they aren't particularly good at one thing. If I may suggest, narrow down the menu to the best selling items and most profitable for you. You'll master the dishes faster and probably waste less food in ingredients or maybe move to fresh ingredients

6.description: Burgers, salads and wraps are good. However, the gyros meat has a weird sour taste to it.

22.description: It's hard to write a review about a place that wasn't good but wasn't horrific.In short I ate the food because I paid for it, but it wasn't tasty.  I ordered the Caesar chicken wrap and the chicken was bland and it was more lettuce than anything.  Maybe the cakes, brownies, etc. are better.I live in the neighborhood and I won't be back.

15.description: They have the BEST pesto pizza comes w basil, tomatoes, romano, parmesan, feta on a nice thin crust. Always super yummy! Vanilla milkshakes  :-)Make sure to ask for it extra thin. Their pesto is homemade and Amazing!!!!! Sometimes they are out or do not have enough to make the pizza, if that is the case ask for the pasta w pesto :-)They should sell their pesto sauce it is that good!!!!!sTheir pesto pizza is da bomb! This place has the best pest pizza! I crave it!!! This is my secret place for that, vanilla shakes and their house salad is a really good value(super fresh). Chocolate chop cheese cake nothing special. Will not be ordering that again.

57.description: So far I've been pleased with the quality of food served here. I enjoy the comfort food as well as ambiance. I like that it's relaxed and quiet but also friendly and cool. It is close to where I have just moved and usually go there to get food and also unwind and be alone. I'm actually vegetarian/ vegan and still go there even though they don't serve much vegetarian food. Veggie burger and a few other things. But I like it enough anyway.

20.description: Alright I've been here several times and have always been pretty happy.  But the last time I went I ordered Chicken Alfredo Pasta and it tasted like hospital food. Stick to the soups salads sandwiches and deserts you'll be ok.

36.description: This place is ok. The prices are pretty low, but don't let the fun name and hip location fool you, this is a greasy spoon. If you want some decent fries and a greasy sandwich, this is the place for you. If you're looking for good quality, try elsewhere. I had a corned beef sandwich; the meat was dry and not assembled on the bread very well.

14.description: Back at Bread Basket. I'm ordering a chop salad My order was taken at 7:30 PM on May 8, 2015.I get my chopped salad at 8:06 PM. There's only three people in here. Their burgers though taste like cheap beef.       Food overall is pretty good, prices are average for the neighborhood, but I'm giving them only two stars because of the slow service.New update today, July 29th in the evening. Service is a little faster.Cashier doesn't seem to friendly, no manners.Doesn't say hello, or thank you. I asked for water twice,  so I just said forget it. She's too busy talking to her girlfriends.

1.description: Hey I like high quality groceries too! Why can't we all eat well? Aldi quoted Captain Piccard of Star Trek TNG by saying "make it so!" Aldi give the to the people high quality eats for low prices. Got no cash on you? Well, you won't be able to unlock a shopping cart, bummer! Grab a cardboard box and go to town bro, go right the hell to Savings Town, bra, cause you about to save your freaking brains out.

0.description: 99 CENTS BUT ALDI GOT ONEI was driving the down the street and saw this Aldi. I had no idea it was here and it looks like new construction. It only had one review and no photos, so I decided to change that. I actually needed corn tortillas and Aldi has the best corn tortillas from Chicago's local tortilla maker El Milagro. They are always fresh and typically will last a while in the fridge. The store is laid out like a typical Aldi. It's kind of like a mouse trap where you are forced to walk down that main aisle that is full of cookies and chips. I kind of close my eyes and walk through without getting sucked into junk food hell. As I searched for my tortillas, I went by the fresh veggies and fruit to see what they had on sale. Our house is very stocked up right now, so I didn't need to grab anything. I eventually found my tortillas and went to jump in line.
