Aldi does not have an express lane, so you just have to get in line and wait. The nice family in front of me took pity on me and let me cut in front of them. I thought that was so nice. I can not remember the last time someone let me do that. I told them thank you and it put me in a great mood. As we all know Aldi only takes cash, unfortunately my tortillas rang up with tax for $1.01. All I could think about was walking around with 99 cents in my pocket all day. The cashier took pity on me and covered me with a penny. I really like this Aldi. The cashier is super cool and the families shopping here are all really nice. I'm going to drive out of my way to shop here. Our world would be so much nicer if we all stopped and cared for someone else, instead of the "Me First" attitude that most people display. Thanks to this Aldi I'm having a great day today. I just wish that experiences like this were the norm. So I will enjoy this moment and hope for more in the future.

1.description: bunch of sexist jerks. if you're a woman, do not enter. wait outside.

0.description: I've been to every barbershop on the North side of Chicago on a quest to find the best barbershop that really knows what they're doing. And finally! after my 10 years of searching I found the place I've been looking for. I can honestly promise you that Shawn's Hair Salon & Spa WILL be the one and only barbershop you go to. Everyone there is great, on point and the prices are very reasonable. Big ups to Fernando, Scott, Shawn, and Mo.

I like this Cricket Store.. Low key and not as busy as most other locations. All the employees are well trained and pretty knowledgeable when it comes to their products. The manager who works there is also a pretty cool guy. actually this is the first store that told me about Cricket merging with at&t.

3.description: Mmmm!  I think I might have a new favorite flavor here: Mamey.  Kind of like a fruit halfway between papaya and mango, it's sooo good in a paleta.

1.description: MEXICAN ICES. mango and cherry, made fresh everyday. Don't miss it!!I eat less on nights I want these Mexican Ices. As I said, fresh , with real fruit. Amazing!!

2.description: Great ice cream selection with generous serving sizes. Friendly workers as well. Looks like they have lots of interesting things here I will have to try over time.

5.description: This place is great! I was coming home from church and i decided to stop by here because i've always been curious about it and it was DELICIOUS!! I loved it because i got so much italian ice for the price i paid. I got a small and got what most places would call a large or JUMBO! It was great, and delicious, i have some left from the small i got yesterday and I have to go back tomorrow to get some more, make sure you try out their italian ice and make sure to try their tamarind and strawberry! :)

6.description: This is the hidden gem of Rogers Park. I had a hibiscus and pineapple ice sorbet. My husband got a lemon with fruit chunks. They were all so good and better than expected, really one of the best I had. Their small starts out at 12oz($2.59) and it a big heaping cup. It's equivalent to medium or large downtown. My husband got a medium which was more like a large/xlarge($3.19) and I think it was 16oz. It's a full ice cream shop and then some. Ice cream prices are very reasonable. I'm so excited that I should have started going last summer.

7.description: You can hunt down one of the bike-cart guys for a paleta or two (which is still the way to go if you're at the beach), or you can drive down Clark Street and stuff your freezer with an assortment. They always taste fresh (I'm assuming they're made pretty much with real fruit or fruit juice, maybe some sugar and not a whole lot more), and you can find bunches of familiar and more exotic tropical flavors. The coconut is like a suntan on a stick. Also your choice of water- or milk-based.  As others have pointed out, they have other frozen treats and snacks as well. They seem to be closed in winter.

8.description: I have to admit that I've only been here once and went in only because I was missing the taste of paletas (Mexican ice pops) from San Antonio.I was pleasantly surprised to find that they served much more than paletas at La Monarca.  There is a whole ice cream shop plus some snacks like nachos or fries. I will definitely go back the next time I'm craving a paleta (any flavor you can imagine) or a scoop of ice cream/ frozen yogurt.   I will update again when I taste the other items, but the paletas are definitely ok.

9.description: They have several types of paletas (both with and without milk). I tried one and we bought a few to take home. They make them on site which is a nice perk. My wife got a sunday which was great as well. Prices are very reasonable!Check it out you wont be dissapointed.

0.description: This place has the best Mexican ice palentas (ice cream pops). Mexican ice cream is one of the things I often miss about Mexico since American ice cream is just too superficial tasting and sweet for me. Monarca makes ice cream using real ingredients and you can taste it. Some of my favorites are: Nuez/Walnut (leche/milk), Arroz con leche/ mexican rice pudding (leche), Piña Colada (leche), Mamey (leche), Tamarindo (water). I like the milk paletas a little more because they have a very rich delicious flavor and the water paletas taste a little more simple.

4.description: Have loved these for years.  Flagged one of the bike cart vendor guys for my first Monarch of the year today--strawberry milk.  These are so, so good.  Yay summer!

12.description: I bumped up my rating to five stars! They had my cuero this last time I ordered out! Good rice, good pernil, and awesome pasteles once again!

7.description: I love love love their Jibaritos and Arroz con Gandules! The Jibaritos are big, and juicy! I go here any time I am craving a jibarito. I haven't had any of their other food so I can't comment on it but coming here for Jibaritos alone is worth it.

3.description: Located in the strip mall. If you're driving too fast you may miss it. From the looks outside you may think its a little burger joint. Don't judge a book by its cover. Food is fresh & reasonably priced. Will you find better? Absolutely, but this is a true mom & pop.

1.description: The place is small n food doesn't have much flavor ...plus the food out on the heating glass case is not hot at all....I Would not come here again. Instead I would recommend the outside cars st Humbolt Park on Sacramento by California ave..All the condiment bottles are dirty as u grab them( they have dust and are greasy) from each table, which I think in the  restaurant business its unacceptable. ...

2.description: My best friend and I decided to try a new Restaurant so we went to cousins grill and had a jibarito. I have to say it was one of the best I had and customer service was good.The second time I went in It was about 30 min to close and they said I couldn't dine in... i had to order and take out. Didn't enjoy it as much to be honest.

9.description: Had lunch here a few days ago and wasn't really impressed. Steak was not flavorful the rice and beans were ok and service was fine I guess since we were the only ones there. Won't be eating here again, I'll be sticking to Ponce Restaurant on North ave. & Central Park.

10.description: I decided to give cousins a try after reading so many good reviews on here. I was sooo disappointed though. I ordered a pastille and steak jibarito w/arroz con gandules. I drove almost an hr and 15 mins round trip for this food and can't believe how bland it was. The pastille was good, but it tasted like canned chicken was used. The jibarito smelled like such garlicky goodness, but when I bit into it there was garlicky goodness. It was extremely bland tasting I'll def be sticking to borinquen for my PR fixes. Also the arroz con gandules lacked flavor too. They probably used Goya not sure tho since I've only ever had home made arroz con gandules. Skip this joint n head right to borinquen where they're serious about garlic just like I like it!

13.description: Mixed feelings. I remember going to this spot about 12 years ago. I remember the pork chops being thicker and juicier. The porkchop entree was ok. Generous portion of rice (which my 2 year old loved). lettuce and tomatoe on the side. And plantains w/garlic. Which was great. The pastele on the other hand, not so great. And that is reason I went there. Had a craving. There was a generous portion of meat inside, and again my baby loved it, but the taste was off and I've had better homemade pasteles. Also had a mango goya drink. Total was 13.80. ok place for lunch

16.description: This is a cute little neighborhood joint. When you walk in it feels like you're in Puerto Rico. The menu has lots of yummy stuff like jibaritos and jibaritas. The arroz con habichuelas was sooo good! Definitely the best I've had. If you're looking to eat some authentic Puerto Rican food then you should come here. At least you won't leave out smelling like garlic (shout out to Borinquen!)

17.description: Food was good but they must have changed cooks.  Food is now tasteless and stingy with the portion.

15.description: I was craving some rice today so I had to make the drive over to this small place. I have been coming to this place off and on for a few years now. Just about everything on the menu ranges from average to good. Not bad if you have a craving for arroz con gandules and don't have time to make the drive to the Humboldt Park area. Stay away from the pork chops if you don't like salt. You will hate them. I, on the other hand, love them.The restaurant is in a strip mall that shares a parking lot with Menards so parking is ample.It irks me that they won't have some things I go there for. Today I wanted some Rellenos de Papas (stuffed potato balls) but they didn't have any. Sad.

0.description: Not to bad. Place is small service is a little slow but the food is good. So are the prices. I would recomend.

5.description: Delicious and super cheap Puerto Rican food.  Service is great and the owner is a sweetheart. I had a steak Jibarito and the steak could have used additional seasoning.  The PR rice was well seasoned and tasty.  My jibarito was prepared very fast! Will come again

11.description: My first experience with Puerto Rican food.Tried several appetizers, as well as their steak and onions and had a few bites of their chicken stew. (ate a meal there, and was impressed so took more to go for another meal another day,  and sampled/shared with the gf)The steak was VERY tender and tasty, though mild in flavor.The Arroz con gandules really stood out as quite the flavorfull rice.Alcapurrias are incredible.  Flavor is somewhat subtle,  but soooo good!!!Pastelillo was deliciousMaduros were great.Great food, great value.  I will go there again,  though it's a LONG trek for me... so I won't be able to go as often as I'd like.

8.description: You better like garlic. That's all I have to say.Okay I lied, that's not all I have to say. This is a great little find in an otherwise obscure strip mall. This place is pretty tiny, but even early on this Sunday afternoon, you wouldn't have a problem dining in. There was one big family having lunch, and a few customers such as myself ordering carry-out. I could literally smell the garlic as I approached the door. It's no secret that PRs cook with plenty of garlic, so if you haven't been to many Puerto Rican restaurants, parties or homes, don't be alarmed. The food is great.Also great are the prices. Jibaritos are just $5.25, and for a dollar more, you get arroz con gandules on the side. I ordered two steak Jibaritos with rice for less than $15. And it was great stuff. An awesome garlicy, greasy sammich with some pretty phenomenal rice made for an excellent Sunday "lunner." I'm actually glad I don't live super close to Cousin's. I'd be inclined to eat here too often, thus making it boring. Not to mention that health problems may ensue. Also, me and everything I own would smell like garlic, making my already clingy girlfriend want me even more. Just kidding baby. Muah. Props to Cousin's for accepting credit/debit tambien.I will be coming here again and again.

4.description: Oh Cousin's Grill, I love you and you're delicious affordable Puerto Rican food, you definitely get a "WEPA" out of me. This is why I love Cousins Grill:#1. The food. The Arroz con gandules. Just the thought is making me drool *must compose myself* the fact that it's porkless, yet, it's still flavorful and my fave rice. Definitely a vegetarian friendly option to those of you that are. The jibaritos are delicious, less greasy, and affordable. I especially love the steak, no way the lechon, no, no, no, it's the chicken breast steak. Actually they're all really good!  Trust me no matter which meat you want, it's going to be delicious!Oh and let's talk about those pastelillos. Omg! I love those seasoned ground meat with potatoes filling deep fried pastries. They hit the spot  I can eat 2-3 of those bad boys as a meal itself. They are also pretty cheap, I think like $1.75 each. The chuletas are seasoned and fried just right. Reminds me of my comadres family recipe. The sorullitos (Puerto Rican hush puppies) are awesome, normally their available on the weekend only.And for dessert, the buddin is freakin amazing, hands off because its all mine  :-) I have yet to find someone who makes it as good.#2. Great customer service.Now this really determines whether I'll even consider giving a place my business. Unlike Borinquen Restaurant (yep your being called out by name), Cousins Grill's customer service is friendly, like they're happy that I'm giving them business *gasp*. Yes they greet me with a smile, not act ghetto/or use profanity while I'm waiting for my order, and I feel pretty confident that they won't shank me if I want to add something to my order after they just charged me.#3. Free ample parking since it's in that plaza. That's pretty self explanatory. Now that you know, go out and get your fix. But remember, the buddin is mine lol.

14.description: Found a MAGET in my gandules rice!!!!! Nuf Said. Will not be go back to this place unless it is on fear factor and I'm eating the food to win a $100,000! I am so grossed out.

6.description: I have no idea what their food tastes like because they had zero food.  I went with a group of 8 friends on a Sunday afternoon.  As we were about to begin ordering, the waitress warned us that they were out of beans.  That made a few people sad, but we decided we were already seated, let's just order.  I went first.  I ordered an alcapurria.  She said, "I'm sorry, we're out of those as well."  At that point, someone else at our table said half jokingly but seriously, "Man, I hope you guys have chicken" to which the waitress nervously replied, "Um...give me a second."  She quickly returned to inform us of the chicken outage.We left.  Sad day :-(

0.description: I loved this store it was nice and the workers were very helpful helping you find what u needed. What images me that it really doesn't look like a resale store it looks more like a boutique store very affordable. I would definitely go back.

3.description: This is the tanning salon I frequent the most since it's near my casa. Most of the girls that work there are Polish so don't mind their accents. I've never had a problem here. The tanning rooms and beds are clean. There are just a couple of problems. The music in the beds either doesn't work or is too low. I need some music if I'm standing there for 10 minutes! Some of the bulbs are out in the beds. They should replace those a lot faster. There's meter parking on the street and they are open til 10pm on weekdays.

1.description: Place looking good and seems to be clean , but im givin 3 stars coz i think in each room they should have a mirror , towel paper and there are not even a hangers on the door , so i have to put my clothes on the chair and they falling down especially in winter time when i wear a coat . Girls are nice and helpfull, looks like they changing girls there like a socks , but good thing is that a polish girl with long black hair probably not workin there anymore , she acted like a boss (maybe she was) but she wasnt nice to girls .

2.description: This place is okay. It seemed pretty clean. The girls here weren't rude (although their accents might make it seem so, they aren't). When signing up for a club I was kind of clueless on what equipment I could use, or just about anything (I was a beginner :]). The girl who signed me up didnt really explain anything to me at all. I also wasnt aware on how to cancel and had tried once previously with no success. upon my return I got to speak with the manager who knocked down my balance a great deal, and was VERY HELPFUL and nice. Everything was taken care of with no problemo. ONLY COMPLAINT:They have an extremely old, wrinkled, orange and overly tan woman who doesnt seem to speak a bit of english always sitting around sluggishly in the salon. she made me not want to tan, it was very..weird. like who the hell keeps bringing their grandma to work? Leave her home, geez. scarin' clients away and shizz..3 stars though because the manager was so nice and helpful, and because i never really had a BAD experience. Just the awkward stares from an 80 yr. old snooki.

0.description: I always have a great experience when coming to this L.A. Tan.I myself have worked in a couple tanning salons so I always feel a bit reluctant to spend money on tanning when I'm use to it being comped. With that said, I typically go in on Tuesdays where it's $5 to tan on any level at any of the L.A. Tan locations. The blonde girl who usually works this day is awesome! She's so sweet and friendly and extremely accommodating. I love the hassle free tanning experience when I stop into this salon. I usually hear a lot of complaints when it comes to L.A. Tan tanning beds as far as cleanliness, I personally don't find them to be a problem. I prefer the stand-ups where I can get in and get out quickly. All of level I through level III are extremely powerful and give me great color. I can't complain! I highly recommend this location over some of the others.

3.description: Really good Filet a la plancha, naranjada (iced orange juice) the frozen lemonade is on point

1.description: Last resort kind of place. Food was bland, tasteless.Not worth a star but can't put 0 out of 5.

2.description: Things started coming up Milhouse when -- no kidding -- the chips and salsa arrived. Both green and red were among the best I've ever tasted. Generic recipes were clearly avoided.Our appetizer was three little pizzas. (They have a name; I just can't remember it.) Two with green sauce (very good), one with red (outstanding).We had tamales nejos (apparently a weekends-only option) as the main course. I liked the red mole a bit better than the green, but both were above average.Highly recommended ...

5.description: I would of never stopped in this place as it is just a plain place. But the food was amazing!!! The homemade tortillas and the owner Margarito make you feel at home.

0.description: First time i had some tacos, and i really like them, tortilla was hand made. Then i went there and i get  a tampiqueña and was really good. I like it. :-)

4.description: The food is really good but sometimes nobody working there speaks English, so that makes it impossible to order if you want your food made a certain way.

3.description: Great customer service. Michael gave me a great deal for some jewelry I wanted to trade in, and it was honestly the best value around because I researched beforehand and also visited a few shops before his. Would go to again!

1.description: Michael, the owner of Hollywood Pawners, is truly one of the friendliest, most professional pawnbrokers you will ever run into. Unlike other pawn brokers who will try to rip you off by overcharging you or not giving you a fair value on your merchandise, Michael actually believes that the best way to conduct business is by treating his customers fairly giving them a square deal on all transactions, be they buying or selling. It's quite a refreshing change of pace from other pawnbrokers I have dealt with in the past.Look, nobody likes to be in the situation where they need emergency cash, but it happens, especially in this economy. And when it does happen, you want to deal with someone who is a fundamentally decent human being. Michael is that kind of person. Yes, he's a business owner and it's no secret he's here to make a profit, but rather than burn you on a deal, he'd much rather treat you fairly and have you as a repeat customer. I highly recommend giving him a visit if you need some quick cash or just to check out his supply of merchandise.

2.description: I came here on a whim, Mike is helpful and honest about what you have and will either make a loan or you can sell to him. Yes the area is weird but if you do business with him he will take good care of you and if your looking for something specific he will help you out. Cheers

5.description: Went and saw Michael at Hollywood Pawn. Turned in a bunch of gold I had sitting around for a few years as times are tough. He gave me such great deal on my gold I was able to buy my girl a really nice gift over there and it cost me half of what i would have paid at a jewelery store. Thanks Hollywood!

6.description: This place was great.  I needed a loan just for a few weeks to get some of my bills paid for.  The guy Mike who works there gave me 90 days and offered me more money on my chain then all the other shops I went to.  When I went to pick up my chain he cleaned it for free.  Made it look brand new!  This place is awesome and I highly recommend it if you need some quick cash!

0.description: I brought in an unused Sony Action Cam (HDR-AS30V).It was a gift.  I no longer had the box, never had the sd card--sold separately.I provided the unused usb cable, sealed mounting support components, and the original battery.  Instead of listing it on Amazon, or auctioning it at ebay I decided to try and sell it at a pawn shop.I spent some time investigating its current market value.  Amazon & Ebay both listed the item; selling for a little over a hundred (on average).I asked for $80.  Mike (the owner) said he could only do half that, $40.  I puked, I mean, rebutted "$45?"   He couldn't budge.He mentioned he saw it selling for $70 and needed a 20% profit margin.  I know $14 is 20% of $70.  I know $14 minus $70 is $56, but his shop appeared to sell most of its items online... More vault surreal, little retail appeal.   It the shop you go to pawn your watches, jewelry and sell your gold.  That being said, selling items online comes with more overhead, so I was fine selling it to him for $40.If anyone ever feels like Mike's offer isn't a fair one, (not a comment like this exists in the Yelper verse) his shop shares a block with three or four pawnshops, so they may be able to find a better deal without getting back into their car.  I didn't have to do that.I felt like Mike was straight up with me, just like everyone else reviewing Hollywood Pawners did.  I've been to a few other Pawnshops in the City and Hollywood is at the top of the list.Hollywood Pawners is a professionally ran operation, with no-games staff, straight up offers, and staff that doesn't waste time, not theirs or yours.  I'll be going there again.

4.description: I took some old gold I had laying around the house to Hollywood pawners. When I arrived there was parking right on front of the store which is always nice when visiting a pawn shop. I walked in and was greeted by a very friendly man behind the counter Mike Kaplan who helped me sell my old gold for a GREAT DEAL.  Before visiting Hollywood I went to see what  a Gold max store and a cash for gold store would offer and it was much lower than Hollywood pawners gave me. I would highly recommend this store. As I was there I also purchased my son a Xbox 360 and nintendo wii witch was sold to me much under the retail price. My son is still enjoying the games very much. Thanks again !!

12.description: I am from Chicago, and this is the only Pawn shop I go to!!! My wife loves her diamond rolex!!! Better prices than downtown! I sold my iphone for a good price too!!! They are always willing to work on the price.

3.description: I love coming here for my pawn loans and electronic purchases!  Everyone is very nice here and always give you a deal!  Wouldn't dream of going anywhere else!

1.description: I sold my diamond ring after shopping around chicago including a couple places in Jewelers row the guys at Fullerton Pawners paid me the most and were the friendliest.If you want to sell anything check these guys out.

2.description: This place is a complete joke and rip off. Came in to sell a Dewalt machine, and a few other working power tools that were all worth around $600. Was offered a $100, with a snobby attitude.

9.description: Joe is a real good guy and knows his stuff.  I sold a few old electronics and he gave me a really fair deal.  There's also cool stuff for sale in the shop I was browsing while I waited.  Be sure to come here if you're looking for a great pawn shop run by a great guy

10.description: If you need it, Joe has it. Can't beat his prices

4.description: My first time in a pawnshop..and wow..excellent customer service.I was shopping for a laptop and the gentlemen were very professional and knowledgeable in their extensive line of electronics. They helped me select the right laptop for my needs and at a fair price. I highly recommend Fullerton Pawners for anyone looking for quality merchandise at a good value.

6.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been coming here for years and always get amazing service! Keep up the good work Joe :-) You really are an asset to the city!

15.description: I brought in a ring to sell and they gave me a really good price. All the guys were really nice. Best pawn shop in Chicago!

0.description: Had a great experience here a couple of weeks back :)I had a couple of rings to sell and I wasn't sure what to expect, but Stuart made the whole experience painless for me. In fact, he made my Holiday! Thank you.Great place, amazing customer service and more than fair offers. Will definitely be back!

5.description: I just moved to Chicago and I was in need of a ton of electronics. I was referred to Fullerton Pawners by a friend; I was hesitant at first to go to a pawn shop but I went anyways. I was pleasantly surprised. The 2 guys working there were extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  I was worried because I was a young female and that I might get taken advantage of but, BOY WAS I WRONG. They helped me with what I came in for and did not pressure me to buy things that I didn't need or items that were not in my budget. The merchandise selection was great. I bought a TV and DVD player for a great price. The staff was knowledgeable in all the products and was able to answer all the questions I had without getting frustrated.  I would return in a heartbeat!

13.description: Joe hooked me up with some great deals!  I highly recommend Fullerton Pawners.  This was my first time visiting and I'll definitely be back.

11.description: Main thing is Joe. He is straight forward, willing to bargain an has plenty to offer. Give the guy some time and have a conversation with him... I'm sure you'll walk away with a good deal.

8.description: Unbeatable price, quality and merchandise. Joe can get anything you need (if he doesn't have it already). Can't go wrong with Joe and Fullerton Pawners. They just moved 2 doors down to have more space.I recommend Joe to anyone who is looking for anything period!

14.description: I would highly recommend this pawn shop.  Joe was able to get me a great deal for my Tiffany jewelry.  The customer service is outstanding!

7.description: I walked in and was greeted by the owner, Joe. He was very nice and paid me top dollar for my gold, more than other places I went to in the past! He recently moved locations from a few doors over and the new store is very nice, clean. He also has a lot very cool products for sale!

0.description: My son is very into pro wrestling and wanted a lucha libre mask-this place has it and more!!  Very cool place and they make the masks in house.  Kids masks from $10-adult masks start at $18.  One of a kind stuff and it is locally made-perfect!!! They also sell t-shirts, book bags and hats etc.  Nice people as well!!!

3.description: The owners gave me a sample of tamarind with chile: I opted for a mangonada with earthy, spicy red chile and tangy sweet chamoy sauce.  My friends got paletas of fresh fruit.  I love La Plaza and visit every time I go up to City Newsstand for magazines.

1.description: Go here for some of the best ice cream, Mexican style. You will find good variety of flavors and nice variety on the menu. Be sure to try their Mangonada and Chamoyada desserts. They are made with their version of sorbets w/ chamoy sauce (I believe) and chilli powder. They are outstanding. I love this place. I have to try more items here. 4.5 stars.Went here after a couple of friends recommended it. Loved it. Had Mamey and Cajeta flavored ice cream. They were excellent in taste. Rich in flavor, smooth and dense in texture. Their scoop portions are huge. Price is good too. Inexpensive. Menu has good variety. Seems like one of the items called, 'Mangonada,' is really popular and looked really delicious. I will have to try it sometime. Go here. Highly recommended. It blows Alaska Paleteria y Neveria out of the water. 4 stars.

2.description: Stopped in to try the Oreo ice cream on a stick and boy was it delicious! The place was clean and the cashier was friendly :) I'll definitely be back to try the other selections!

5.description: Yum! For sure better than the paletero man. I believe everything is homemade and you can definately tell.

6.description: New ice cream shop, that is catching on like wildfire! This is a family owned homemade ice cream shoppe. Nice assortment of scoopable flavors as well as a ton more on a stick!Although Ice cream is their specialty, they also offer elotes in a cup, chicarones, as well as sundaes, floats etc.... and also make sandwiches. The owners happily offer tastes of any of the ice creams you are curious about. Which just makes you want to order all of them!  I do wish they had a few more "common" flavors like mint chocolate or cheesecake. However, the more and more I go in here, I realize that they do offer new kinds but it's kinda like a "special of the week".  Also, (and the owner said he was working on it) labels for the many many MANY ice cream flavors that he has would be helpful when trying to decide what to eat. Other than that I'm hooked.Prices are pretty good. You get a lot for your money. It's not super cheap, but definetly well worth it once you have a taste and see how much they scoop into a cup. Some highlights:1)Try the chili lime popsicle...amazing! My fellow mexicans would love this! They also have tamarindo.2) Mango smoothies...yum. (also have had the caramel cappucino smoothie also good)3) Their oreo icecream is probably the best I've ever had. They offer it on a stick with a whole oreo frozen in the middle as well as scooped.4) Pistachio ice cream has tons of REAL pistachios in it. Unlike Baskin Robbins that use almonds in their pistachio ice cream. 5) I haven't tried an ice cream I didn't like here. Their Dulce de Leche, Pecan, Pistachio, French Vanilla, Oreo, Vanilla/chocolate, and strawberry are among my favorites so far. Haven't tried them all yet. I'm sure I'll have more favorites.6) They have lots of ice creams on a stick. More than what is offered scoopable. Water and Milk based popsicles and scoopables make this place great.Definetly a must try when your in the mood for some great, homemade type of ice cream!!

7.description: First time here. The place was empty so service was quick. The people who attended us where really friendly. An older man and then a lady. We had mangonadas, it was delicious! We also had nachos, they were good to but you can't mess up nachos lol. Thank god they accept credit! It's just an $11 minimum. So if your going to just get something small make sure you take cash! Definitely coming back to try their paletas and yogurts with fruit! :)  oh and of coarse it's pay street parking. I didn't see a parking lot. Hope this helps!

8.description: Pretty good, oreo ice cream is so delicious, also had the banana split, was good just wish it was bigger... give it a try!

0.description: Good spot for ice cream! They have an array of treats such as mangoniadas, chamoyadas, chicharron con cueritos, fruit water (aguas frescas), fresh fruit yogurt and many more options. Their paletas come in a huge variety which will not disappoint anyone.The place itself looks clean and the staff are very friendly. They have a small section for people to sit down and enjoy their ice cream. There is an $11 minimum for credit card purchases so plan to bring cash just incase.

4.description: La Plaza is a relatively new ice cream shop that offers an array of treats, ranging from your traditional sundae to 'cueritos' (a snack based on pickled pig skin topped with a few vegetables and served on rinds of flour). Only four stars are earned as it seems that this shop offers treats found in other ice cream shops without anything really standing out. I have tried their corn and strawberries and cream, along with a few 'paletas de nuez.' On the things that I have tried, I can say that I have had better, both in other ice cream shops and from street vendors. I did notice that their strawberries and cream are made from frozen strawberries, which I disliked since you have to wait a bit for them to thaw. What they have going for them is their location. Maybe I am not looking hard enough, but there is a scarcity of Mexican/Hispanic ice cream shops in the north side of Chicago, making this shop a treasure in this area. Keeps this in mind when you visit, as the demand for this shop does tend to create a bit of a wait, especially on hotter days, but then again this should be expected from any establishment offering refreshing treats. This is not your run of the mill ice cream shop where everything is made like clock-work. Other than the 'paletas,' everything is made to order, be sure to also take this into consideration before complaining about waiting in line. Overall, it's a nice shop offering delicious treats to a neighborhood otherwise having to rely on going to the southside or having to settle for Dunkin' Donuts/Baskin' Robbins in order to satisfy their cravings for these sorts of treats.

3.description: I'm really picky about filipino food because I always compare it to the home cooking of my father and grandmother.  With that being said, Tatay's take out food which is located in the back of the store, is very good.  I think they have the best Menudo, Kilawing and Kaldereta to go in chicago.  The workers are very friendly and the store is very clean.  The parking is street but easy to find.

1.description: Went in on a Saturday afternoon and the place looked like it had been raided. Few shelves and fewer products. Their turo turo area was all the way in the back and did not look fresh. So I was hoping just to get the staples (Swan's soy sauce, oscar's tocino, frozen lumpia etc.) They did have tocino but a different brand, no frozen lumpia and when I asked about soy sauce in general they said they were out. How does a filipino store allow themselves to become out of stock of soy sauce? I was highly disappointed in this store. The staff (I'm assuming the owners were very nice and polite). The highly rated reviews, I feel are outdated. This place may have been great once but not today (Aug 2015)

2.description: I didn't try any of the food so this review is more for the store. This is just a little Sari-Sari store. My parents were in town and they needed Bagoong (Shrimp Paste) for the Kare-Kare they were cooking. I walked in and there were only a few shelves with products but I got what I needed. They have some baked goods from a bakery that I imagine delivers to them throughout the week. I was in and out and I got what I needed.

0.description: The best, dude. These people know my dad and me, we're pretty frequent customers. The food here is pretty authentic Filipino food, and its delicious. It's not expensive either. Its kinda awkward to eat in there, and I'll give it 4 stars because of that. The store is clean, and everything is good. They have a bunch of other stuff because its an Oriental 'Food Mart'. They have like Filipino-esque drinks, snacks, different kinds of spices, corned beef, etc., etc. The Longanisa is so pro. mmm.

4.description: This is a small Filipino market as well as a mini restaurant. There's prepared food in the back and you can take it to go. The food is authentic Filipino food and is delicious! I have gone here many times when I didn't feel like cooking dinner or when I had a craving for some Flip food! The market part is pretty small so you may not find everything you're looking for, but they have some goodies. If you've never had Flip food before, come here to try it cuz it's not too expensive and there's a few choices of entrees to choose from.

58.description: Wow!!!! I've died and gone to heaven sweet donut heaven!!!! Very nice people and great selection!!!

56.description: I've heard that they were featured in the recent episode of Chicago's Best.  But did Somethin' Sweet Donuts (SSD) make it to Rosa J.'s best?  I certainly thought so, without a doubt!  The owner lady has one of the greatest hospitality skills.  We were greeted warmly and offered some donut samples.  Other than the regular drink menu, they have some seasonal iced tea items that look so attractive and tempting for someone who is too excited for the spring in Chicago.I'm not so sure if the winter has indeed come to the end (don't bounce back like a mad woman, Miss Winter), yet I welcome great Thai iced tea and donuts at anytime of the day.  We had some delicious Thai iced tea; it had just the right amount of sweetness and ice.  Without any hesitation, we went with the one (1)-dozen donut option.  For $8.95 for twelve (12) donuts?  I think it's a nice deal.  Those donuts looked like they could go to a donut pageant competition!  They were made in a perfect shape and size, and they were beautifully-decorated and dazzled like a dream.  It's kind of ironic that the D*nk*n D*nuts was diagonally across the street from SSD.  Well, have a quality life by coming to SSD and trust Yelp.  They were many regulars stopping by, and the owner lady knew their names and what they wanted...very cool.  From now on, they will remember my name as well.  I don't live close by at all, but should I make a point coming here?  I think the answer is affirmative.

29.description: WOW! I'm a crazy donut lover! I know everyone says that....but no seriously....my life revolves around donuts. I came here for the first time on national donut day wearing a donut dress. I hadn't come here sooner bc it wasn't really close to me but now I know to make the extra drive!! Not only were the donut so good but it was clean and the staff was sooooo nice and friendly!!! The lemon cake was my fav (even tho I'm usually a chocolate donut type of girl) We got the bismark and the lady told me they add the filling when you order. GENIUS! the twists were great. Red velvet was great!! You won't be disappointed!!SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESS! Better than any chain donut shops! So yummy

42.description: BEST DONUTS I HAVE EVER TASTED!I'm actually eating a blueberry donut as I write this review hahaMy aunt told my family and I about this place last year and it has since been a family favorite. My sister even had donuts from Somethin' Sweet instead of a cake for her birthday because they are just that good. The owners (nicest people ever) also made her a heart shaped donut with filling just for her special day. Besides the customer service being stupendous, the donuts are just as great...they are so soft and simply delicious. If you don't eat them the day of purchase, they will still be uber soft the next day! It's such a quaint little spot with a lot to offer and at a great price!

23.description: Awesome cake donuts!!! but disappointing cronuts give 4 stars.  Would definitely go back again!

47.description: Love this place! I often drive from Peoria just to get some donuts to take home! The owners are very friendly and actually take the time to have a conversation with you which is nice. I commend them for being such hard workers too. I'm pretty sure it's just the two of them that work there and they do everything themselves everyday. Why wouldn't you want to support a great local small business like this?!I absolutely love the blueberry crumb donut. It has the perfect consistency for a donut and tastes amazing! But I honestly haven't had a donut I didn't like here. I highly recommend this place!

8.description: I am not one for trying to one-up someone about what is the best restaurant, coffee house, cafe, diner, doughnut shop, etc. But what I will have to break down and say is that Somethin's Sweet Donuts is "the best" that I've had in Chicago.Glazed. Chocolate glazed. Chocolate bowtie. Chocolate crueller. Apple fritter. Old fashioned. Cinnamon swirl.Having gotten there a few hours before closing, the doughnuts were as fresh as I've gotten at any doughnut shop when they opened for morning business. Go to a doughnut shop close to closing and you get something akin to a hockey puck or a chewable dog treat. Not here. And add to it all the friendly shop staff, I'm glad this gem is a short drive from Logan Square.

31.description: We showed up a day too late. My foodie boyfriend and I went to this wonderland the day after Chicagos Best. Luckily, the owners nice and he gave us samples of his lemon donuts. Yum. But we went for the Cronuts. I just had to try one and Dunkin Donuts should stop trying. We purchased three different kinds each filled with somethin' different... creme, lemon, and raspberries. I would be lying if I said I had a favorite. The cronuts were soft as a cloud in the middle with a slight crunchy exterior. And it wasnt super sweet. They were dreamy.

34.description: Great customer service and good donuts for a decent price.

16.description: Amazing caked donuts! Love all the variety. So far this place is my favorite for donuts. Fire cakes is 2nd. Wish they were closer to the burbs

13.description: I heard about this place before but I did not look in the map to see where exactly it was. I was driving to West on Fullerton in my car to make it to an appointment. In less than 30sec, I saw three cop cars randomly touring around this place. I was like I must be really in the hood, but then I realized the reason was something else. got it?I pulled over. The store is right on Fullerton and easy to stop in front of it. It may not catch your eye but you can not miss the asian restaurant next to it. So, just mark it in your heads.Im not surprised to see asian families in the donut business anymore. They are pretty good at this. The donuts were successful and delicious. I tried multiple flavors.   Now, besides the good donuts there were few things that disappointed me. The Cronut! I had the original cronut before and the cronut here was not even a slight imitation of it. It had nothing to do with a cronut and it was simply a donut that I paid 4$ for. I kinda felt ripped off at that moment. Either sell it at the donut price or do not claim that you are making a cronut there. I did not feel like arguing with the older lady.I still think the best glazed and the bavarian cream filled donut are made at Old Fashioned donuts in the south side, so that is why I can not say this was the best.Congratulations to the business for bringing a different taste to the area. It was something needed and I believe that they will be around for a long time. The prices are really good btw, a dozen was about 10$ which I think is the regular and fair price of a donut.

11.description: This place is so amazing! I wish i was kirby so i could consume infinity amounts of their donuts, because they're so freaking delicous!

39.description: These are little nuggets of deliciousness.  We saw this spot on TV, and shockingly, we passed it the next day!   What a treat for us!  The doughnuts here are fantastic.  We picked three and all were marvelous!

37.description: Had a birthday party last weekend and didn't have time to order a cake, so instead I decided to order donuts from here instead. (donut delivery on grubhub=AMAZING) Quite possibly the best decision ever!?? The donuts are so reasonably priced (I got around 30 and they were around $40 or so) and they were so delicious!! Very soft and fresh and not too overly greasy or sweet. My house was full of teenagers with bellies about to burst from eating one too many donuts. There were only about 12 of us that night, and not a single donut was leftover. Gotta stop in to the actual store one of these days.

0.description: I love love love their donuts! They are scrumptious and often just out of the oven warm and toasty. I really enjoy the caked donuts more than glazed but both are great here. This is a small family operated donut shop and they are super friendly. Haven't tried there other goods like smoothies and teas or coffees. Will check that out next time!

38.description: I'm so upset I've never been here before! Good thing is I will be returning.The man behind the counter was super nice and gave us samples.I took home red velvet and glazed donuts and they are delicious!Their prices are great and the donuts are filling. Cannot wait to go back!

51.description: Jimmy has very good doughnuts and an awesome personality! We left there feeling really happy and with a box full of doughnuts, and yeah those doughnuts were for only 2 people. But they're amazing and priced inexpensively.

27.description: Red velvet crumbs & Blueberry crumb donuts are among the best donuts I have had.. Skip the routine donuts like chocolate, glazed etc as they are treated as second class citizens. You are better off choosing donuts on the top shelves which is their USP

32.description: MUST try lemon doughnuts. Never tasted anything close to these. Jimmy the owner VERY nice man came out and greeted me with a huge smile and INCREDIBLE attitude. Only complaint is there is a city ordinance which does NOT allow him to advertise on the street in front of HIS store. But STILL does not deter Jimmys mojo. A dozen doughnuts is cheaper here than at DD and there FRESH!!!

54.description: Their red velvet doughnuts are the best! Love this place. Everything is always so fresh and the owners are so nice.

48.description: Better than Krispy creams. These donuts are a real treat. They also serve fruit smoothies! A nice clean friendly environment to take the kids for a great snack. They were on channel 9 for chicago's best donuts.

44.description: The people were very friendly and greeted you when you walked in. The service was great. The coffee and hot chocolate weren't the best. The donuts were good but not great.

24.description: Cake donuts fresh, light, moist.Cronuts subpar.Staff friendly.

7.description: I'm in love! Great variety of donuts with speciality flavors and their bubble teas are made with fresh fruit! I got the glazed donut coated with crumble and the apple fritter. So light and fluffy, deliciously crispy. If you love donuts and don't want them served with a side of hipster, this is Your Place.

49.description: Best donuts in the Midwest. The owners are very friendly and welcoming i can't wait to come again

40.description: I just checked out this place a few days after it aired on Chicago's Best. I live all the way in Uptown, but didn't mind stopping by before work since their CB clip and reviews were excellent! I ordered a dozen of their regular donuts and could not believe how cheap they were! A little over $9 for a dozen of these delicious donuts. I brought them into work and they were mostly devoured within a few minutes. I would say that my favorite had to be the red velvet, followed by the apple and blueberry donuts. I would definitely stop by to try other donuts, especially their fancier ones. If you live in the area, forget about Dunkin Donuts, this is the place to satisfy your sweet morning cravings.

53.description: Did you know that they will fill your doughnut just for you?? That is super dope.

30.description: I'm not really into doughnuts. If given the choice, I'll pick a cupcake before a doughnut.I just so happen to be 5 minutes from this place when I opened up the Yelp app. Two yelp friends wrote about this place and I thought it would be cool to try it out.I came in 20 minutes before closing, walked in and instead of smelling doughnut I smelled Chinese food.... An employee was eating at one of the tables as she said hello to me. she got up and hit the bell and set back down eating her Chinese food.  (It's a Chinese Restaurant I believe that's connected as it's one right next door.)The person that got my selection of doughnut had a great smile and I'm sure If I had gotten there earlier I probably would have gotten samples to try to help speed my selection along. I thought the doughnut were good and fresh (I'm sure they were made in the last 24 hours) had a mix of flavors that I think you're only going to find here. I can honestly say despite the reviews I really didn't have much expectation about this place so can't say I was "let down" (on the other hand seeing how many doughnuts were still at the front counter at almost 10 p.m. I doubt they throw them all away.) The glaze is not Hard but it seems to do a good job locking in the freshness (most of the one's I had gotten were glazed.)If I'm in the area, I could see myself coming back.

46.description: Delicious and fresh donuts ! I live a block away and I'm excited such place exists in this area.... friendly service as well ...

1.description: Solid doughnuts, for the most part.  I came mostly to try the apple fritter, and it was very disappointing.  It lacked flavor and sweetness as well as heft.  Not to mention apples.  Really, it was just a flattish disc of bland fried dough.I'm not sure how that happened, because their other goods pleased me much better.  I figure that I should always try at least one cake and at least one yeast-raised variety when I visit a new doughnut shop.  SSD's lemon cake was close to perfect, with a lightness both in texture and fresh lemon flavor.  The chocolate iced was fairly standard, which is a-okay because this is one classic variety that needs no embellishment.The ladies in this shop are super sweet, too.  Besides being just generally nice, they also fished out my driver's license from between the counter and display case, after I clumsily dropped it down there while putting my money away.  Butterfingers!

55.description: mannnnnnnn I cant stop eating these Freakin donuts Oh my goodness way better then dukin donuts byi far! my 1 year old son  wont stop pointing to the box. Today was my first time there after seeing it on chicagos best last night and its only 10 blocks away I will try not to be back back but man their so F*&kin good once you try I Promise you will be back !!!!

9.description: Delicious!!!!! Tried the red velvet donut, and the apple crisp donut; both were two of the best donuts I've ever tasted. I also tried the pina colada smoothie which was made with real fruit and it was heavenly!! Jimmy provided excellent customer service, and I'll definitely be back to try the beignets...

26.description: Local donut spot that has a unique selection of treats. Try the maple bacon donut!They also offer smoothies and coffee as well. And if I'm reading this correctly, they deliver! This completes my life.

25.description: My wife and I are new to the Belmont Central neighborhood. We were living in Wicker Park the past two years and were sad to leave all the great food spots, to our amazement, Somethin' Sweet Donuts was a great spot to crave our sweet tooth. They're affordable and have a great selection. If you're in the Craigin area, defintely worth stopping by.

12.description: These were easily some of the best donuts I've had. After a couple of disappointing experiences with the hipster donut shops of Wicker Park, I extended my Yelp search area and found this gem a bit further west. The store is bright and clean with a HUGE variety of donuts - so many flavors, some of the same flavor in cake and yeast versions, and both with and without crumb topping so you can get exactly what you're looking for. As soon as I walked in the owner gave me a sample - a cherry donut hole (wow, even the donut holes come in a variety of flavors!) Cherry donuts are one of my favorites, so I got one of those, plus a blueberry, a chocolate frosted, glazed chocolate cake, cruller, and deluxe red velvet. Took them home for my family to sample, and everyone agreed these were top notch.All the varieties were light and melt-in-your mouth. The blueberry actually tasted like a blueberry muffin shaped into a donut. The chocolate donuts had a good chocolate taste, and the red velvet was amazing. I've never had a yeast version of red velvet before, or one that was glazed instead of being smothered with cream cheese frosting. The glaze instead of frosting really let the flavor shine through.This shop is a bit off the beaten path, but worth the drive. Actually, it would be worth taking the CTA. The basic donuts here reasonably priced at 85 cents each ("fancy" ones are 1.29-1.59). The bus fare over here is cheaper than what it costs to buy one an artisan donut at a trendy hipster donut place. And the donuts here are ten times better. Definitely worth the trip.

59.description: Oh Something Sweet, you feed my donut addiction. I live in the area, was driving past and their sign caught my attention. Since then it was love. From their blueberry cake donuts to their cronuts, Something Sweet is the food of the gods. Don't even get me started on their cinnamon crumble. My god I cannot get enough. I love Something Sweet and its even better being five minutes from my house. Keep up the awesome work!

21.description: Best homemade donuts outside of the loop area.  Every once in a while I have had a donut that has been out for a while but other than that it's our goto place.

17.description: We come here every time we have donuts cravings. The crounuts are a crowd pleaser, so light and airy. By now I have tried the red velvet, coconut, glazed, french curlers, maple bacon, boston creme. The service is great and it taste so fresh.

10.description: WOW! I'm a crazy donut lover! I know everyone says that....but no seriously....my life revolves around donuts. I came here for the first time on national donut day wearing a donut dress. I hadn't come here sooner bc it wasn't really close to me but now I know to make the extra drive!! Not only were the donut so good but it was clean and the staff was sooooo nice and friendly!!! The lemon cake was my fav (even tho I'm usually a chocolate donut type of girl) We got the bismark and the lady told me they add the filling when you order. GENIUS! the twists were great. Red velvet was great!! You won't be disappointed!!SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESS! Better than any chain donut shops! So yummy

5.description: Love Something Sweet donuts!! My go to for office sweets... And my go to for any occasion.. The variety was awesome, taste of the raised and cake donuts have been consistently awesome each time! Will def go back again and again...

3.description: The lady at the front was very nice. The place was clean and I liked the donuts. Coffee was made fresh, but if you go i suggest getting the dozen for $9 instead of paying $2 to $3 for just one.they also have breakfast sandwiches and hot dogs among other things. I will be back.

35.description: Donuts are delicious, FRESH, and reasonably priced! A wonderful family-owned shop with friendly service. Also, the strawberry-banana smoothie tasted incredible (fresh fruit). I will come back and I recommend to anyone!

19.description: After watching their great reviews on TV, I decided to give them a try. This is a small place and had an ok variety of donuts. The staff was friendly and attended us immediately . I had the cake vanilla sprinkled donut and it was nice and moist. I was just expecting something amazing as this place has been so hyped. Their donuts beat Dunkin Donuts any day. If you're in the neighborhood stop by and satisfy the sweet tooth.

28.description: Love this place! The people who work here are so friendly and their prices are reasonable. Plus the donuts are great--the Devil's Food cake donuts rock. Definitely better than Dunkin Fails-at-Donuts.

45.description: Great donuts. Reminds me of an LA donut shop. Very pricey though. They don't list prices so when you order it's a gamble as to what you will pay at the register. $2.50 for a simple donut is ridiculous. My advice ask how much the donut you are ordering will be.

33.description: So glad my donut go-to is NOT my local Dunkin Donuts! How did I not know about this place?! (AND they've expanded to the Hermosa Neighborhood!) Amazingly fresh baked goods and such friendly staff.  Try it! Beats processed and franchised donuts ;)

43.description: 1st visit last week and I was impressed. Great service and the donuts where delicious. If your a donut lover, you must stop by this place.

2.description: Have only been here twice but each time the owner was super cool and nice.  He would offer samples of the popular choices, and it would force to cave in and buy them.  The standard donuts are priced really well.A little hard to find since its blends in with all the other small stores in the area. PS: Not in the best of areas.

18.description: Local donut spot that has a unique selection of treats. Try the maple bacon donut!They also offer smoothies and coffee as well. And if I'm reading this correctly, they deliver! This completes my life.

41.description: 2 minutes from my home HOW DID I NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS PLACE????? These donuts were delicious, the family and I purchased a dozen and each one was wonderful, the lemon donut was great. The donuts are moist and full of flavor and the service was wonderful. At 8.95 a dozen this is a steal.

52.description: Not really a sweet tooth but even I have to admit the doughnuts were DELICIOUS! Not only that Jimmy has got to be one of the most genuinely sweet and happy people I've ever met. I'd go back just to support him and his family...doesn't hurt they also have awesome treats!

50.description: Delicious donuts!  I can't pick a favorite. We tried the lemon, blueberry, old fashioned, chocolate, red velvet and glazed. Donuts are fresh and you can't beat the prices when you compare it to the other popular places out there. Will definitely go back!

4.description: I'm not really into doughnuts. If given the choice, I'll pick a cupcake before a doughnut.I just so happen to be 5 minutes from this place when I opened up the Yelp app. Two yelp friends wrote about this place and I thought it would be cool to try it out.I came in 20 minutes before closing, walked in and instead of smelling doughnut I smelled Chinese food.... An employee was eating at one of the tables as she said hello to me. she got up and hit the bell and set back down eating her Chinese food.  (It's a Chinese Restaurant I believe that's connected as it's one right next door.)The person that got my selection of doughnut had a great smile and I'm sure If I had gotten there earlier I probably would have gotten samples to try to help speed my selection along. I thought the doughnut were good and fresh (I'm sure they were made in the last 24 hours) had a mix of flavors that I think you're only going to find here. I can honestly say despite the reviews I really didn't have much expectation about this place so can't say I was "let down" (on the other hand seeing how many doughnuts were still at the front counter at almost 10 p.m. I doubt they throw them all away.) The glaze is not Hard but it seems to do a good job locking in the freshness (most of the one's I had gotten were glazed.)If I'm in the area, I could see myself coming back.

6.description: I've heard that they were featured in the recent episode of Chicago's Best.  But did Somethin' Sweet Donuts (SSD) make it to Rosa J.'s best?  I certainly thought so, without a doubt!  The owner lady has one of the greatest hospitality skills.  We were greeted warmly and offered some donut samples.  Other than the regular drink menu, they have some seasonal iced tea items that look so attractive and tempting for someone who is too excited for the spring in Chicago.I'm not so sure if the winter has indeed come to the end (don't bounce back like a mad woman, Miss Winter), yet I welcome great Thai iced tea and donuts at anytime of the day.  We had some delicious Thai iced tea; it had just the right amount of sweetness and ice.  Without any hesitation, we went with the one (1)-dozen donut option.  For $8.95 for twelve (12) donuts?  I think it's a nice deal.  Those donuts looked like they could go to a donut pageant competition!  They were made in a perfect shape and size, and they were beautifully-decorated and dazzled like a dream.  It's kind of ironic that the D*nk*n D*nuts was diagonally across the street from SSD.  Well, have a quality life by coming to SSD and trust Yelp.  They were many regulars stopping by, and the owner lady knew their names and what they wanted...very cool.  From now on, they will remember my name as well.  I don't live close by at all, but should I make a point coming here?  I think the answer is affirmative.

22.description: Love this place! Very nice people. Clean place and reasonably priced. Love the fresh smoothies and donuts. Never had the ice cream but I heard it is very good as well.

15.description: We love Something Sweet, especially Lemon cake and glazed. Great selection!  My husband is on his way there now for some desserts as we ring in the new year. The owners are super sweet as well :)

57.description: Okay, doughnut people: when is the last time someone at Dunkin' Donuts handed you a free Munchkin? What about two free Munchkins? Never happened, did it? On my first visit to Somethin' Sweet, I bagged a couple of doughnuts, an old-fashioned buttermilk thing and a football-shaped something or other. But I found it hard to leave without trying a red velvet doughnut so I headed for the land of compromise: a doughnut hole instead of a full-sized third doughnut. He handed it to me and said it was his treat. I scarfed it right there and pronounced it excellent so he picked out another variety and suggested I try that, too, so of course I did. And yes, it was great. There were lots of very pretty and extravagant doughnuts from which to select but I cleave more toward tradition in this regard. Was very happy with my choices--tender, not greasy, nicely glazed--everything you want a doughnut to be. But here's the kicker--he was so nice and gracious, a genuinely nice person who deserves to find success. Whenever my travels take me to this part of the city, I'll put it on on my list and maybe even spring for a whole bag of doughnut holes, bought and paid for.

20.description: I must say, these donuts ARE indeed a cut above the rest. Really tasty, good donuts. My only complaint is that they need to be a bit larger. Specifically the round donuts because they're kinda on the small side. And the glazed yeast donuts are VERY small, in my opinion. I definitely couldn't see myself paying $10 for a dozen of them. The long johns are pretty standard in size. I'd just prefer a little more bang for my buck, ya know? But definitely no taste complaints here. It WOULD be nice if a dozen costed less than the $9.95 they charge, but hey, it is what it is. This will probably be a once a month treat for me.

36.description: Since we moved around the area almost a year ago I have been coming to this place since I discovered it on Yelp! Doughnuts of all kinds are made fresh everyday and taste so good. I just bought a dozen at 7pm and it taste like it was made just an hour ago!

14.description: So I was on a mission last year to find a decent apple fritter in the city.  I stopped by many of those hipster donut shops that charge $3+ dollars a donut but the fritter was elusive, as they were always out by the time I got to the store.Finally I took to Yelp to find a coffee place near work and what do you know Somethin's Sweet came up.  When I walked in for the first time there were about half a dozen cops standing and sitting around.  At first I thought I might have happened across a crime scene of some sort, but was immediately put at ease by the owner who offered me a donut hole.I was pretty amazed at the assortment of donuts that they carry here, cherry, blueberry, maple bacon long johns, cake, raised, chocolate, red velvet, their version of the cronut, muffins, and so much more.  Their flavors are not quite as inventive as some of those hipster donut places, but it is definitely better than most donut chains with very reasonable prices to match (last I was there, $0.89 for a regular donut, $1.29 for the filled or specialty donuts).I have bought donuts for the office several times now (mostly because I want to try all of them without eating a whole one of each), and each time has been a hit.  Each time I get the same smiling service from the owner, Jimmy.  And each time I get a free donut hole.  Once I was asking about a particular flavor and he just happened to have that flavor as a donut hole and gave it to me to try.I can't rave enough about this place.  Half a dozen cops can't be wrong when it comes to donuts, right?

3.description: RUDE PEOPLE !!WORST FRUIT SALAD EVER !! Churritos were hard , best believe didn't work !!! Chamoy tasted disgusting !!

1.description: The customer service was horrible.They messed up two of my orders , didn't even apologize for screwing it up.I've had better at other locations with better pricing most definitely First and last time stepping into that shop.

2.description: Yes, Rosa J. is addicted to mangoneada, and she cannot lie!  After visiting the nearby Unique Thrift Store, I needed to cool down and "wake up" with a medium cup of mangoneada since that UTS was a hot mass.  Yes, Rosa J. was expectedly "enlisted" and fought a Great War...with fellow thrifters.  Well, my treat was worth the fight at the end.  Initially, I thought the young man gave my mangoneada too much chili sauce.  I invalidated my hypothesis as I discovered chucks and chucks of mango "in" the mango ice cream.  Most Neveria have mango ice cream without the actual pieces of fruit, but the one I had this afternoon was "fruity."  Therefore, the chili sauce came in handy to the end because the chili sauce accompanies well with the mango fruit, but it tends to dilute the mango ice cream to make the entire mix "mushy."  Yes, food science is my kind of science.  Thank you every much for attending my lecture.  Hubby made the last-minute decision on one of the Aguas frescas.  The young man suggested the maranon (a Guatemalan fruit).  It seemingly taste like bananas with a mild "nutty" kick.  It was refreshing and delicious.  Based on the taste, that was definitely right in my alley as well.  For some reason, I felt this place was just slightly pricer than what I remembered on other Neveria I've visited in the city and the suburb.  The total came to $9 and some change.  I didn't carry much cash, but they do accept credit cards.  I've been coming to the Hermosa/Cragin/Belmont Central neighborhoods quite frequently lately due to the proximities to a couple of Unique Thrift Stores.  This place is located on the southwest corner of Cicero and Diversey.  See ya then!

5.description: Stopped by Cermak Produce across the street and noticed this ice cream shop... they have more than ice cream.... lots of delicious junk food.  Definitely stopping by again to try their different flavors.

6.description: I recently found this place in the city!!! I was so excited because all my friends rave about it in the burbs.  It's great ice cream and the yogurt is sooo good!  Try the almond with mixed fruit...Yum!  My parents love it too.  They are taken back to their Mexican childhood.  There are flavors here you won't find in other places.

0.description: Yelp now gives an interpretation for what each star means..and apparently 5 = "whoo-hoo, as good as it gets".  Well folks, I'm no expert on paleterias, but I do believe that this IS as good as it gets.  The fruit ice cream is absolutely amazing, rich, and flavorful.  They offer so many flavors it makes you dizzy at first.  I recommend the cucumber...it's unlike anything I've ever had.  And I've been to almost every ice cream place in town.  There's also mango- which tastes like they took the fruit, waved a magic wand, and bam..turned it into ice cream.  It's extremely cheap considering the quality.  What else is on the menu?  Chicharon, elotes, spicy cheetos with cheese... and other amazing things I've yet to try.  The service is top quality (and I say that even with the language barrier).  The vendors there take time, and are really polite.  They only accept cash but each time I got more change then was really required.  They're down to earth people!  It's a clean, bright, cheery establishment.  It's not one's definition of chic, but the place is excellent at what it does: delivering high quality amazingness.  Parking is hard, but definitely worth it.

4.description: Small quaint shop. This is my first time at a mexican sweets shop and I feel like a kid entering a candy shop. My first question to the vendor was, "Do you have elotes?!"..and as I heard a YES, I just jumped for joy. "7 elotes to go please!" and with that I have no regrets, good tasty elotes and at an affordable price. Definitely coming back to try the others. Had my elotes fix here (and by the way I shared all these with a friend, hehe) & paletas, yum!!!

1.description: The people that work here give amazing costumer service!  They also seemed pretty flexible on the prices which was very awesome!

0.description: I must say everyone at Chicago Pawn was very professional and nice. This Pawn store wasn't your typical pawn shop. It was clean and organized, the employees and store manager made some great recommendations on a watch I wanted to purchase for my boyfriend. I was pleasantly surprised with how helpful the employees were and how they were more then willing to answer any questions I had. Pawn Chicago has definitely changed my mind about pawn stores and I will definitely be back!!!PROS:Friendly staffOrganized shopGreat selection of laptops, watches, jewelry, and action figures!

I do understand that number one this is a Mexican grocery store and that number two being on the small side there are limits to how much variety they can carry.  My main complaint though is that I went in looking for a very common baking item (I forget what it was but something very common like baking soda or something) and they did not carry it.  That's not all that terrible I guess except for the fact that I counted something like 7 different varieties of hot chocolate powder.  Surely they could have had one less variety of that and carried a very common baking ingredient like what I needed.  I don't know maybe Hispanics don't use the same ingredients that we caucasians do for baking which might explain why it was not carried (I did ask and a manager who spoke English confirmed it was not an item they sell).  When I moved into that neighborhood 2 1/2 years ago I was one of the few white people living there.  Nowdays though more whites are moving into the area. I don't suggest they abandon the majority of their customers who are Hispanic, but they may want to start carrying more of the basics that us caucasian Americans need and desire.On the positive side I've always found their employees to be very nice and easy to deal with so that is why I've given this store a 4 star rating.  Since it is a Mexican store in a Hispanic neighborhood there is a good chance that the employees you interact with may have limited English speaking skills, but hey it's part the total experience that I enjoyed living in a Hispanic neighborhood so I don't consider that to be a negative.  I only mention that so others who may not speak Spanish won't be too surprised.I found the prices at this store to be reasonable for a small grocery store.  Not as cheap generally speaking as say Walmart or Jewel Osco but sometimes it's worth it to pay a little a little more to have the convenience of walking to a neighborhood store instead of fighting traffic to get to a large store.  If you buy the sale items then they are pretty comparable to larger chain grocery stores.Stop in and check this store out.  It's a nice convenience for those that live in this neighborhood.  I never got around to trying the grill there, but after reading the other review I may have to go back there just to try that out.  If I do I'll update the review with my take on that.
